84j6KKmnYt72M29dOS8sNA.text: If you're an omelet lover like me, order THE BIRD!!!! I swear they use 6 eggs because it is SO large! This fluffy egg goodness is jam packed with turkey, avocado, mushrooms & Boursin cheese {this is the secret that makes it perfect}. Their Potatoes O'Brien will rock your socks! For beverages, the BC Iced Coffee is a must; their secret concoction of sweetness will send your tastebuds wild and give you the best energy buzz to kick off your day! {Both locations //Old Town Scottsdale & CityScape// are wonderful!} This is my favorite place to bring out of town guests for breakfast when they're visiting. Don't be surprised if your massive breakfast from BC fills you up until dinner time!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Bloody Mary in town!!

NLmszQJJfs4jiX0eosSFBA.text: Amazing food!!!! I got the breakfast burrito - monster style and my boyfriend did the border bowl. We both left feeling like that was one of the best breakfasts we had!   Mimosas were great and staff was attentive & thorough.

yJIwwQoH_Oj99LLDln34LQ.text: I really enjoyed the food here and the company I had with me but the service was horrible. We went in we were just greeted by a rude hostess who told us it would be a 20 minute wait. We then needed up waiting less than 5 minutes. We were sat and the waitress could not have been more unhappy.   She was complaining when we asked her for mugs for our coffee because we thought we were waiting 20 minutes so we all had to go cups from their cafe. She dropped the money on the floor without noticing and when we brought it to her attention she didn't even say a word or even look at us for that matter. She never came for refills such an ugly experience at such a nice restaurant!   The food was good but nothing out of the ordinary! I ordered a wrap which was tasty but the turkey was just piled in there so it was a little much but the food wasn't anything to complain about!

yrt3Dxtfje55StOHm_lEgA.text: From out of town and went base on recommendation of local.  Definitely did not disappoint.  Standard cup of joe and omelette was perfectly cooked.  Side of sliced fruit was nice added touch.  We would certainly come back.

SToUPivHCcNfsEyJJcTRdA.text: My brother recommended this place from his visit to Baylor's Fiesta Bowl. I had the four cheese omlette, which was absolutely amazing. Service was quick, friendly, and attentive.   I took a star away for the average side dishes and decor.  Excellent find!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Four cheese omlette

HfxsKKb4pxqVL8NmbZkrlw.text: This is a top-notch place to stop for breakfast or lunch. Their breakfast menu is huge and their food is absolutely great. The wait staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is great and has the option for outdoor seating. Prices here are very reasonable. They even use real maple syrup instead of fake stuff. That was awesome.

dmRalLPq5E_69Rddu04XRQ.text: Since I wrote my original review, there seems to have been a change in the way that management schedules their regular staff.  We go to the Breakfast Club regularly and know the established staff very well.  It seems that now the staff (that has been there for a long time) are there very infrequently and there is a constantly revolving staff.  We are seeing the regulars stop coming and the (always) new staff don't seem to care as much.   The food is still wonderful, prices are reasonable; but the owner and manager need to take a closer look at how the wait staff is scheduled.  Please understand that your long-time servers care about their customers!   You need to care about them as well!!  No one can make a living working a couple of days a week.

9Ylb1iimgq1Q-tHCK95qMA.text: My husband and I spend most weekend mornings in Scottsdale having breakfast. We have our usual spots, but felt like trying something new. We passed our tried and True spot and saw a bunch of open tables on the patio, but had already committed to doing something new so we kept driving and put in our name at Breakfast Club which had a 30-35 minute wait at 1130.   After waiting for 40 minutes we were seated at a table that was way too high for the chairs on the patio. I'm 5'10 and my husband is 6'5 so I don't even know how normal sized people eat comfortably at those tables as my back was killing me then and is still sore at the end of the day.  The food tasted great and came out quick, but the menu was so boring! My rule when I eat at a restaurant is that I never order something that I could make myself in an hour or less. I broke my rule today. Like I stated, the food was great don't get me wrong, but its kind of hard to mess up an omelette or BLT.   I won't be going back any time soon, but I wouldn't refuse to go if a friend wanted to which is why I give it a 3 star rating. Its not terrible, but it is also not something that I truly enjoyed given the long wait, uncomfortable seating, and the lack of exciting menu options.  I'll be fair and tell you what I did like about it though. What their food lacks their juice bar makes up for, they've got just about any juice you might want with breakfast. Also the food comes out really quick and is very well priced.

FRIygqZjQWbQChiLS-EN3Q.text: It was a good breakfast. I had steak and eggs. Did some work with a colleague and the staff was accommodating.

1Gx3SNBC2mcGNdltJFsIfA.text: Grabbed the kids for a late breakfast at 10a on a Friday, late March. 1 hour wait, with a bustling atmosphere, outside waiting area, Scottsdale friendly, ordered orange juices, milk and Mexican coke. Order of chocolate chip French toast, chocolate chip pancakes, waffle and breakfast burrito with Pork verde. Short wait for food, kids happy at arrival. Burrito was large and not overly spicy. Potatoes were pretty good with precooked peppers on the soggy side and not crisp. The burrito was average taste and nothing extraordinary. Kids enjoyed their meals, decent price point for quality. Second time eating here with about the same experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate chips for breakfast!

-FpHJPj0zBPmbR1u71N-Hg.text: It was so delicious!!! I got the lean and green and substituted the feta for swiss!! The potatoes o'brien were tasty as well. There was a small side of fresh fruit which complimented the breakfast. My friend got the burrito bowl which was amazing!!! It was enormous and she took more than half of it home with her. We will be back to sample some more of the menu to report back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burrito Bowl!!!!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lean and Green!!! So yummy:) My girlfriend got the burrito bowl which was amazing as well

HjfVB58GDO11_U16QRSeFw.text: I loved the breakfast bowl, it was awesome. The service was great and fast. The patio seating was pretty nice too.

nAy0i1N8-vSnL89_WPEv7w.text: Oh my gosh the Best breakfast ever sat at the bar two days got to know the staff wonderful people happy to be there working and the food was great thank you breakfast club

oLVEpWUkwXz4rl-7mRQWfA.text: This place was amazing! Theresa was the best!!! The food was delicious and the entire staff was so sweet.  I highly recommend coming here for a quick bite to eat.  I had the BLT on sourdough with sweet potato fries.  Made our bachelorette experience so great!

-Tq-NIqw3AErqYmtOFPIsg.text: Service was not great.  They had several tables available, but still would not let me sit until my friend arrived.  (she was on her way).  There were 4 people standing at the check in counter (not sure why they needed so many people up there since they were not doing anything but playing on their cell phones and chatting with each other).  When she did arrive and we had put in our reservation, we were told we would still have to wait.  Again, there was table available and I had been there for 15 minutes.  Other people came in and got seated immediately without waiting.  We ended up at the counter and was told they did not have any soda except bottled regular coke.  I ended up with water (I don't drink coffee and there were no other decent options).  The server took her time getting to us and I had to ask twice for water.    The food portion came out a little too quickly (about 2 minutes). This made me wonder if it was pre-made rather than fresh.  The order had to be cooked and there was no way it could have been fresh.  It was not very hot which also made me question whether or not it was pre-made.  Overall, I have had much better service and food.  Considering we were at the counter, it took forever to get the bill and the never received any refills on the water.  I would not go back again.  Very dissappointed.

LZH2xCSnhrF0ZRLJAsoR5Q.text: When I worked in Scottsdale ate here all the time. Orange Juice is a little pricey but food was great and not expensive. If you wait and go later in the day it does get packed, but that is the sign of a good restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Caught in monsoon.

TtZTlH_LXF45X8eXviFrWg.text: Called in at 10 am to get in the waitlist for a table of 10 that we would using at 11 am. We were told we would be able to get a table by then. We got here at 10:45 am to make sure we would not lose our table. We've been waiting for an 1 hr plus now and barely getting a table at 12. I do not recommend this restaurant for big parties at all. Food is great but service can be hit or miss and it takes way too long to get seated even if you join the waitlist.

TJU6NDcctenhYs-NLxcNiA.text: Excellent location!  I have been to this establishment a few times and would recommend sitting outside, because the interior gets a little noisy.  If you experience high wait times, just walk around the neighborhood!  There is a nice bakery nearby, as well as a little coffee shop.  While I'm not a fan of their biscuits and gravy, the pancakes keep bringing me back.  Their pancakes are infused with a lot of flavors and the portions will fill you up fast.  Prices are somewhat affordable, but a family of 4-5 can easily rack up a $60 bill.  Don't hesitate to visit.  This is one of the best breakfast joints in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs benedict
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeno biscuits and gravy
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chocolate chip pancakes

ROKDFjgbxZlLHpsGT_e_Qg.text: Lox & Bagel are always a favorite here and I love the fruit they give you too

jr9j7j0EOTw3jYpGbYxkYw.text: The one thing that brings this place down in my ratings is their stupid policy that everyone in your group has to be present in order to seat you.  We arrived for breakfast on a Friday morning. The place wasn't too busy and they were seating people within 2 mins.  Our third person in our party was running late.  They called us up but wouldn't seat us because of that. So we said seat us as 2 we won't wait for them.  Our third decided not to come because of this. They sat us at a community table with 3 open seats around us.  So our third person easily could have sat with us when they arrived.  How stupid is this policy?!  Food wasn't bad, service was good but this policy will keep me from coming back.

oL4K-yxssDzTqxgUViKc1g.text: The food was very good. I had bacon, eggs, toast and fruit. My mother had an omelette. We both enjoyed the dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start breakfast plate

IK_l5JYYjduU-sfZkAv1ZQ.text: Three stars for service and atmosphere: can't go higher because of the food.  Mediocre plating and nothing spectacular in terms of flavors, even for breakfast food.  I can see how it could be amazing for hangover cure, especially with the bar available at 6am, but there has to be better spots for those who are looking for a real good breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Marys of course

2YsCxVFoIC8Yfd5aWbzNow.text: This place was delicious!! Huge portions. The staff was very nice and friendly. Would definitely go again.

3Jdptwt8gPKcXaS6nJ1A2A.text: This is an excellent breakfast place.  I was in town for business, and I came here three days in a row.  The first day I had Huevos Con Masa, the second day was Huevos Rancheros, and the third day was a Quick Start of eggs and bacon.  I was always surprised at how quickly my food came out (about ten minutes).  They were all excellent.  The servers are all pretty and cheerful.  The only small complaints I have are the exhaust from cars on Scottsdale Road I smelled sitting outside (not the restaurant's fault), and the fact that a server short-changed me the fraction of a dollar on my bill.  I'm a 20% tipper, but when she did that, I reduced her tip accordingly.  All in all, a great place for brekkie in Scottsdale.

irGx0FokNnug9zhcdoAfmw.text: As soon as I walked in the door, I felt a little unwelcome. The hostess, I felt was a little lazy. She asked me to choose my own table, maybe because it was a little slow, that part I understand. But I feel like you should put more enthusiasm when greeting customers walking to the door.   The food was ok. I got the turkey and eggs. A lil bland for me. The waitress was a lil stern but I guess that's just how she is because she checked on me periodically like she was supposed to. Idk, I might give this another chance.

lrtaaAc5wq2icx2l3eCZtw.text: My wife & I came here based upon a recommendation from a friend. I ordered the biscuits & gravy and my wife ordered the regular French toast. The flavors from the jalapeno cheddar biscuit with gravy were incredible. My wife said the French toast was excellent but that the side of bacon she ordered was the best she's ever had. Her exact words were: "I would've traded the 3rd piece of my French toast for another piece of bacon." Highly recommend grabbing breakfast here if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great environment
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The biscuits &amp; gravy

WFC95fTR7P0l0rNAMhVWlw.text: I was excited to try the food here due to the mixed reviews! Recommended by my Inlaws and well worth it! Apparently in the summer months no one is busy in Scottsdale so we came in about 9:30am and were quickly seated by a cheerful server. I ordered the grilled cheese breakfast sandwich which was absolutely amazing. No complaints at all! I ordered the mimosa which tasted like only oj, meh. I ordered a side of fresh fruit and it was delicious and ripe slices of watermelon, honey dew, cantaloupe and pineapple, mmmm! I had a great experience here, I hope you do too!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmmm, I loved every bite of the grilled cheese breakfast sandwich!

Sj-eePM9edbEv-Dav7VXxw.text: The food was fantastic!!! I had the burrito with chorizo and my fried had "the bird". Adrianna was our server, and she was awesome. I will definitely be back.

ow9irIeYGJ6sRNI8oFaPpg.text: My coworkers and me chose this place for breakfast 3 morning while we were in town for work. At first it seems like a nice place with a good vibe.  FOOD: Decent, nothing out of the ordinary. Good breakfast, fresh, nothing fancy or authentic. Deserves 3.5 stars.  STAFF: mixed feelings. Waiters were all nice and fast. But I truly hope management is reading this about the greeting staff: the girls at checkin are rude and very inconsistent. Day 1: First of all they told us 20 minutes, we said that's too long for us, so she said "ok first available I could seat you know"....ok what did she think we want? 2nd or 3rd available? Day2: 20 minute wait (first available lol), we waited 40, complained and got a very rude reply, a very dishonest apology, no smile, telling us about their policies.  Day3: 30 minute wait, ok, we wait 45, ask what's going on, again rude reply, no apology. She said 15 more minutes, 1 minute later we got seated.   I do get its hard to manage the flow in a restaurant accurate. A bit more friendliness would go a very very long way.  I'd rate this place a bit higher, not much wrong with it, but who wants to start his morning like this? Fails the purpose. A smile and a sincere apology would've been nice.

pawIaCdVtR_28d_aFCykbQ.text: I had a cup of coffee, the side oder of  Biscuits and Gravy, and the Turkey Eggs Benedict.  The coffee is ok. A little bland. Both meals were tasty. The biscuits are home made with cheddar and jalapenos. The gravy is perfectly seasoned. It came out not hot, so that was a bummer. The Turkey Eggs Benedict wasn't the best I ever had. But it was yummy. The Turkey was stiff. I like turkey that kinda melts in your mouth. The dish was under sauced.  I gave this place 4 stars because my girlfriend really likes this place. She ate a bacon, egg sandwich on sour dough bread.

P9J0B13knwxZaMiBP-9PBA.text: Staff at our hotel recommended the BC.  Great staff, menus.  Can wait to get a table but demonstrates great place to eat.

ZiFZdWJNKVUyQlSKsoX88Q.text: We were pleasantly surprised to only have to wait 10 minutes for a seat here, as there seems to always be a wait (as there is with every breakfast place in Old Town).  The food is good, and there are lots of options (even super healthy options, which I was impressed with! The Health Conscious breakfast was delish!) The reason it gets 3 stars has to do with the service: We were seated at the bar, which was totally fine, except that upon ordering Mimosas we asked for grapefruit juice instead of orange juice and were told "no".  Kind of odd, but whatever, we ordered regular mimosas instead and were "automatically" given the large size (ie: also automatically charged for the large size).  When we asked the waitress about this, as we had wanted the regular size, she said that when you sit at the bar you are automatically given the large size unless you tell them otherwise.  Also kind of odd.  Overall, good food and not too bad of prices for Old Town, but I wasn't terribly impressed and certainly wouldn't want to wait over 45 minutes for it.

3I4DgLOwmeKgjpk_CumT-g.text: Pompous owner/manager, this guy thinks he might be starting a new innovative trend for breakfast. What is really happening is distance and separation from valued customers. A member of a party can not join mid meal. People will be ignored and feel disowned if the  party is incomplete ( you will not be seated, and will feel punished for it).  I feel nepotism is being used here; we were not spoken to once seated. I'm entitled to a nice welcome but was embarrassed by the lack of communication.  The manager reminded us that we needed to finish up and start leaving, so he can seat more people; fuck you! I want to eat comfortably, I didn't order no food to go. If you wanted things to be like this you should throw the food in a blender and turn the whole place into a quick drive through.!  Couldn't see past the rudeness to actually taste what could have been a painless enjoying meal.

OWpvSMaoG3kYwkRm5aR-mQ.text: Went here for brunch, ordered a breakfast grilled cheese, mixed berry pancakes and an iced tea. The breakfast grilled cheese was amazing! Wish that the waitress's mentioned that the pancakes are each the size of a normal dinner plate because you have the option to order one pancake as opposed to a full order which is three. They were good though, however the berries are just thrown on top of the pancake and not mixed into the batter. Iced tea wasn't good, had an orange slice in it and tasted old. Atmosphere is very loud hard to hear the people you are with.  Service could have been better. Waitress seemed like she didn't have time to take our order or provide proper customer service, it wasn't overly busy so unsure why that was. I would consider going here again, as the food wasn't bad but probably wouldn't do this for an outing with family or friends as you can't really have good conversation here l.

rICfYyvLW4lznwOhgZW9Yg.text: We both had the pancakes which were very good in size and flavor, very filling. Nice little place with good presentation. The service was fine. A little expensive, little over $30 for two people.

YYHiahn-5iLZDPyRqiWcwA.text: Seeing that my last Breakfast Club review was in February 2009, it's definitely time for an update... since then, I've dined at this restaurant (both for breakfast and lunch) quite a few times.  I have one friend that eats here several times a week and swears by it.  They recently did a renovation and have a ton more space, hence less wait time on busy mornings.  It looks awesome - they have a great counter space, juice bar, brick wall, comfy booths and tables, and bigger bathrooms too.  You still get the same variety and quality of menu items since the renovation, but I'm pretty sure their prices went up a bit.  I find almost everything to be moderately priced, but I ordered a large grapefruit juice today without looking at prices and my friend told me that they charged $7 for it.  $7 for a large juice?  Are you kidding?  That's a bit much... even if it was freshly squeezed!  A few of my faves on the menu: the fresh start conscious, the oatmeal, the turkey wrap sandwich, and the berry/goat cheese salad.  Servings are large, service is always pretty attentive, and they are fine with substitutions... another perk for me is the location; it's super close to both my home and office making it extremely convenient for breakfast (and lunch) meetings.  Just watch out for the juice prices if you go!

n_O9hjECY01Ms232Sl_aMQ.text: If you come on the weekend, you might accidentally think that you've stepped into Scottsdale Urgent Care with all the hip 20 somethings recovering from the previous night's rage at Axis Radius.   This place is busy, be prepared to wait 30 minutes if you want breakfast on the weekend. And when it's busy, be prepared to not find your waiter/waitress. They'll be running around and then you'll have to waive them down without making yourself look like a pretentious beezy. REFILL MY WATER.  I had the Wild Mushroom omlette which was made with something called fontina cheese. I love mushrooms and when I got my omelette there were plenty of mushrooms in this entree to make me happy. Simple omlette with plenty of mushrooms but not a whole lot of taste - I really was expecting more. I think this place may be a tad overpriced, but the portions are pretty large - so that may be the reason.   The girlfriend had Huevos Rancheros because she was in the mood for green chile and she said she loved it. It hit her spot like I never have and she was pleasantly full afterwards. However, I have recently found out that they serve pork green chile and that detail was not specifically on the menu when she ordered - so if you don't eat pork or have any dietary restrictions just be made aware of that.   I didn't leave this place saying, "omg, i have to come back" or even saying, "their food was really good." It was an average food experience in a Scottsdale breakfast joint.

4fc9nBJPIdaBHNTemvTazQ.text: alot of food. not a bad breakfast burrito but don't eat it while driving. Messy!

a6RAwAAjG-Q0ahTumUYe6w.text: Delicious food! Our waitress was a little preoccupied but it was quite busy. The amount of food we received was huge! We couldn't finish it all and the apple juice...amazing. If we're ever in Scottsdale again, I want to go back and try more!

CreJd_qFGE0hkAXt8EzdmQ.text: Very crowded on a Saturday morning, but we were seated relatively quickly.  The food was awesome and the staff attentive without being overbearing.  Much recommended.

u67mCwopjJw7bfsVWZGOrg.text: We ended up at this place when we tried to hit Over Easy at 11:45 on a Sunday morning and were told they were closed. Bummer!   Didn't want to wait in line at Matt's and had been wanting to try this place for awhile. Took the trip down Camelback Rd. to The Breakfast Club.   The wait was pretty decent for a Sunday morning in the middle of old town Scottsdale. The host was friendly and helpful and seated us at a communal table with plenty of room between us and the other couple that was seated there.  I started off with a cup of coffee and my girlfriend went with a glass of fresh pineapple juice. Our drinks came quickly. The coffee was pretty great at this place. Hit the spot nicely. My girlfriend's pineapple juice was perfectly chilled and crisp.   She came back to take our order. I went with the Mignon Benedict and my girlfriend went with the roasted turkey benedict. The food arrived pretty quickly, and my glass of coffee was refilled a few times in the meantime. Atmosphere was nice and relaxing, despite the expected ridiculousness of some of the people that hang out in Old Town.   My food was fantastic. The steak was still red in the center. At $13 for the sandwich, I wasn't expecting the quality of steak I got. My girlfriend's dish was actually even better than mine. Our waitress was fantastic. Definitely hitting this spot again.

qAvVmOxi1T33O7Rwzq2Gig.text: Love the french toast!!  Overall food is very good, service patchy.  Lovely ambiance, on a nice day it is wonderful to sit on the patio.  Plates come with extras such as fruit, potato sides and a little pizzazz for presentation.  Be careful to avoid busy times, the wait can be prohibitive and parking is difficult.  I only go during the off times since I can't take two hours for breakfast!

kiQ6Qw4QzE9M2fI8rqoryw.text: I admit that I am not a big fan of waiting... and if it's a wkend or especially if it's spring-training time of the year... the line to get a table can be rediculously long w/ all the baseball fanatic tourists.  But my friends live here and definitely know how to work it so it's not so painful. Since they do not take reservations, we give our name to the hostess and knowingly are told the wait time to be ~45 min which we tack on another 30 on top of that. So we then get our nails done next door or walk over to the boutique across the street.  I have to say the line for a latte can be a bit of  a wait as well, but so worth it. Their coffee is truly yummy. I've eaten breakfast here.... their omelettes, breakfast burrito or taco are always good, but my most recent visit I was not in the mood for breakfast.  I had the tuna sandwich which was exactly what I was craving for... absolutely delicious without too much mayonaise. I hate when other places makes a tuna salad sandwich taste like there's no tuna but  gobs of more mayo oozing out.. gross!  Anyway their tuna here is perfect.  Although the wait is long, once seated the service is prompt and friendly.

WdUS42WRyrWuVWSA84PFsw.text: Typical Scottsdale!   It felt a bit pricy, long wait to get a table, and just did not come through on the expectations.  The ambiance was nice and cozy for a breakfast nook but after the long wait in line my pancakes were not up to par and the coffee was burnt.  Although, I would recommend it for tourist because of the location. It's good, just not great.

A3oMVT2J1cKMIaAMb-2DJQ.text: very popular, that can lead to waits for table  very local:  sitting at the 4-seat  breakfast bar (if you can snag a seat) you'll notice that all the patrons know the server very well  fine breakfast (tho a lilttle expensive for area) like excellent bacon and toast.

dxvR45x7hTW0b6Hx2LoeDA.text: Really, I just don't know what's so great about the Breakfast Club. It seems like a place that belongs much more in Mesa than in Scottsdale. There's nothing wrong or terrible about the B.C., but there's nothing great about it, either. I can make a breakfast dish, or a sandwich, that's just as good -- or probably better -- at my own home. And then I wouldn't have to put up with the annoying patrons at this place.

mLR4sdbltHFJs3db1V6-5A.text: Nothing special.  Has the usual variety of egg dishes, pancakes, omelets, etc.  The wait can be long for weekend brunch.  If it gets longer than 20 minutes, I would just go somewhere else.  It's obviously very popular, but not in a trendy/hip way - more of a classic way.  It's a good place for families.

XnnbCKvJNGQefCdAWqiWCw.text: We were pleased that we arrived before the big crowd and got shown to a table right away. We had driven by hundreds of times and we always wanted to at least try it once.   Service was fast and the staff was friendly. I had a delicious smoothie. One of the best I've had so far! My hubby ordered the blueberry pancakes and I got the Cinnamon French Challah bread. I thought everything was pretty good but when we got the bill I was amazed how expensive the meal was! The food was good but not THAT good. I understand they use fresh ingredients and everything but it still seemed a bit overpriced.

QUGqbN3Lqf8ysyu-co3MFw.text: We went a few weeks ago when we were in the area on an errand. The food was ok, but the server did not return our credit card (shame on us for not realizing this). However, when we did realize this the next day, we stopped in and were told that the server remembered returning it. They checked the cash register drawer also and said definitely it was not there. After we went through the hassle of canceling the card and requesting replacement, they called again the next day and oops! They did have it after all, tucked away in some obscure spot of the register. I requested that the ass't manager comp us for something due to the resulting bother, but she said that she didn't "have the authority", and would have e manager call us. He never did. A minor bit of graciousness on the part of the management would have made us repeat customers. As it it, we'll never go there again.

RIwBFCQsMLOTfE7jy-24gQ.text: The place so nice we went there twice. First went on a Sunday. Place was packed yet wait was only about 15 minutes. The great Scottsdale weather helped make the wait more enjoyable. We ended up with an inside table and the hostess was helpful with making room for our baby jogger. Food was all great. Fresh squeezed OJ is awesome there. We went back the next day (monday) and the place was much less busy. Was able to sit outside. Food was excellent again. We both had different things and were not disappointed.

kuSlfHw6K9sYwv1ik3fBbw.text: If you are one of those people that says, "I could eat breakfast for every meal", then you cannot miss this place in Scottsdale... coffee, eggs, french toast, and their bacon.. all amazing... so get their early and try to remember why in the world you would do the things you did last night... if you dont remember, order another coffee... its good.

wx6Cmn857DLHTlDgg3xb6A.text: Really good breakfast but overrun by Scottsdale hipsters.  Cute cafe with well prepared plates.  This is not a greasy spoon.  Beware of long lines on the weekend. Go early or be prepared to wait.

GU2WOpYtXGla8ZiMsDD30A.text: Came here while on vacation, based on the reviews. Overall the food was great, but we developed a few words of wisdom on what to order -   The whole wheat pancakes and the challah french toast were incredible. The pancakes nearly floated off the plate, and the challah and candied nuts on the french toast made it taste like the perfect middle ground between brunch and desert.   I didn't eat the omelet with salmon or the honeydew (omelets come with fruit) but was told they were great too.   The only downside were the wild mushroom omelets and the potatoes it came with - they lacked seasoning. If they had any, we would be giving the restaurant 5 stars. The salmon omelet came with the same potatoes, but she opted for the hashbrowns which were awesome (I wish I had such foresight...)!

MJMlEJzbH9jZ6fvX544CcQ.text: The food was very good, eggs as ordered, bacon was thick cut and large,rye toast was good. The food was a bit slow coming out. My wife's food was hot, mine was warm. Coffee was OK but not exceptional in any way. Fresh fruit was very good and nicely portioned. The potatoes were good but covered in bell peppers, I "picked through" as I'm allergic to bell peppers (wish the menu had warned me-or if it was there, that I had seen it). If my food had been 'hot' I would have given 4 stars in spite of the long time in arriving. I would echo some of the other reviewers when they say the place seems a little short staffed.

UjSqmxw4Ft8n018VAUAJDw.text: I'm really picky about breakfast.  This place was ok, not the best food in the world but not that either.  Fruit cup was large and flavorful.  The atmosphier is nice,  busy and upbeat.  However I did pay too much for a crappy cup of coffee.  Tasted very burnt.

4oDyWPCu-Qmc9opEFMG0MQ.text: The place to be if you are in your 20's and continuing your all nighter from the previous evening.  Extremely loud and energetic but not if you are looking for a more intimate relaxing breakfast.  First, the positive aspects of our visit was the service at our table.  The waitress attentive and friendly and provided quick service.    Our fresh squeezed juice was excellent, my 7 year old, who is an expert on pancakes, said that they were too gummy and did not taste good.  They remained uneaten on her plate.  My 12 year old's omelet was runny and had to be sent back to the kitchen for further cooking.   The counter service where we ordered smoothies before being seated at our table was the worst I have seen in years.  The girl handling the walk up/carry out counter continually took phone orders and ignored the line waiting patiently.  When I pointed this out I was shushed and received a "talk to the hand".  Extremely rude.  This girl should not be in the customer service industry and has lot to learn.  Not sure why she is in this role when she obviously does not enjoy what she is doing.   We will not be back.  Plenty of other excellent breakfast places in the Phoenix area with friendly staff.

qBXyItEWBBCE-WauIupfLA.text: It is no big deal. The coffee is better than most places. The food is standard. Nothing unique. The juice comes right out of a bottle - how boring, buy a juicer! Be creative! Way too crowded, even on weekday mornings. Not worth the wait.

RzZBFgNI2CRp9GAyc49GwQ.text: I love both the food and atmosphere of the breakfast club in old town Scottsdale. I usually order pancakes, bacon and eggs with fresh OJ. This place is always super busy since its pretty small (and popular) - so be prepared to wait at least 30-45 minutes (which is sometimes a pain). Delicious breakfast.

5faAL4r9M0W8ehxq9SmwEw.text: Love this place the juice/coffee bar is my favorite!!!!

_91SH2SLQ_12M25RgrI_FQ.text: A delicious, affordable place to go for breakfast...and my favorite part: your pooch can enjoy the patio with you!  Breakfast was very straightforward, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.  I chose a short stack of whole wheat pancakes and a side of hashbrowns, while my date chose the cinnamon challah french toast.  My order was perfection simply because of the portion size...the pancakes were much smaller than those in the full order, and came with three.  I was actually able to eat them all instead of wasting a lot, as I normally do with a small appetite...and for $3.50, it was fantastic.  The hashbrowns were also crisp and well seasoned.  As for the french toast, other reviewers have described it, and I agree with them:  a little dry, but nothing a dousing of syrup can't cure.  The crunchy almonds and fresh berries on top are a great touch.  My iced vanilla latte was delicious, and my pup enjoyed the misters on the patio.  Definitely recommended.

KJWLEGuiAPNeGABgJXOQSg.text: This place is awesome, I've been here a few time and everything I've tried was outstanding. Just place just location especially if going to a ballgame. In the heart or Old Town, great outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VPV9w_C93xfHFCYZjQWfjQ.text: There's a reason why this place is called the Breakfast Club! After eating here it's going to be hard to try other breakfast places in the area. Our server was very outgoing and provided some great recommendations and the staff did a wonderful job getting our food out quickly. I got the iced coffee and the bird omelette, which I highly recommend getting and adding some hot sauce for added flavor. Needless to say the Breakfast Club will be one my go to places whenever I come to Scottsdale!

O4Z6WFcoOb_qbvN3bfvWRw.text: This place is the best. They listen to you when you asked them to not use oils and butters if you'd like. They have so many healthy choices. Their coffee is amazing. All the fresh squeeze juice us. There's so many options. They make you feel wonderful about any special ways you want to order. It's a very healthy atmosphere and just all around perfect

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7rKbQgzYpFirjAQMe78rTg.text: Wonderful place. Great atmosphere. Got seated (for two) immediately. Very very friendly waitstaff.  Breakfast choices (breakfast grilled cheese) was great. We will return for sure. The beautiful morning and open air dining was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MkkCa30wf6Wb7QwipGbw0g.text: Extremely disappointed with this place today, the hostess took our phone number stated a 40-45 minute wait.   But she obviously had her VIPs and buddy's seated first. We watched as groups that came in after us got seated and they put tables together for them.  NEVER AGAIN AT THIS LOCATION.

5hNCIhHZz1W8HbCWk6MNJw.text: Best breakfast place ever.  My Friend Young polished off the French toast.  He's now ready to gamble away all his money at the talking stick.

da8X8Uo1a4j8aAbdOnBHwg.text: This was a fabulous little breakfast spot. Everyone we met recommended the place. The portions were the perfect amount and the food was delicious. It was very crowded but I can see why

9Na2U0o8rccDphqFxivY9A.text: Came here both mornings of my stay in Scottsdale. When you visit Scottsdale and want to grab a great breakfast with great staff, this is the place to go. The environment is very relaxed, the staff is very professional and very friendly. Great vibe and even better food! You should come here at least once and try anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

G6NsxzlvGADNxmlHVpThlw.text: Reading the reviews on here, I realized we must have lucked out! We didn't have to wait more than a couple minutes to be seated on the patio for breakfast.  We basked in the sun while we waited for our food, which honestly was a treat for us. Having breakfast al fresco in February is not an option back home in Canada lol  Our eggs benny and breakfast grilled cheese sandwiches arrived not long after we ordered and we dug in. For $10, you get A LOT of food! My traditional benny came with a side of potatoes o'brian and a stack of fruit. The ham was thicker than I'd prefer. Had it been shaved down to thinner slices, it would have gone better with the delicate poached eggs and fluffy english muffin. It did have a great smokey & sweet flavour to it though.  Knowing I wouldn't be able to finish my meal, it was nice to know packing it up meant I could enjoy a second round of it later on :)  A breakfast place that takes resos (even though we didn't need to make any), has delish breakfast and a patio wins a spot in my good books!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast grilled cheese sandwich
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Traditional eggs benny

4kqkpmecQJcBQR5C-83Abg.text: Great place for any breakfast occasion. Staff is attentive and has a great attitude. Portions are substantial so come hungry!!

q7nEQszHpotzmTpoZOw_AA.text: This place is a great lil brunch spot. It's busy as per usual Scottsdale resteraunts, but had the ability to make a reservation via yelp... which is a win. We still had a wait upon our arrival, but it was worth it. We sat outside and watched all  the fancy cars drive around. Ordered a Tigers Milk it was strong... LOL this is a good thing FYI... and I think it was a caprese omlet... pesto, fresh miss, the tomatoes were amazing... yum

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. CAPRESE Omlet
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tigers milk

dUnuu66MX_FrN5j9M0uUPQ.text: Breakfast Club is a trendy but casual brunch spot in a great location near Oldtown Scottsdale.  Our Uber driver informed us this place is great and almost always has a wait, but we used the Yelp Waitlist function and wandered around this gorgeous area of town for about 25 minutes after checking in, and then were seated promptly.  Their "BK" iced coffee with hazelnut and a combination of other flavors and cream is excellent. I had the signature French toast, which was essentially a slightly elevated and well-executed standard French toast with berries and candied nuts.  My husband loved the Border Bowl, which was a generous portion of eggs, hash browns, sausage, bacon, ham, pork, cheese, and green chili and hot sauces. Prices seemed reasonable for the portion sizes and this area of town. Overall, this was definitely my favorite brunch of our short vacation in the area.

BFmBATh8TdQ9Gukhxh_CsQ.text: Fresh squeezed OJ is the bomb.  Biscuits and gravy,  blueberry corn cakes and huevos ramcheros masa!  All excellent and with a twist

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Td3DCnO5NCMhVg_gVatKSg.text: Damn good huevos rancheros.  Must've perfect amount of heat and not toned down. Wonder pulled pork with it.. So yummy. Not just a scottsdale touristy place,it's good food.

tY2A3gzZVB2INRg9Qqwaag.text: All round great experience! Our waitress was really friendly and attentive. Food came out quick and hot, just like I like my men.

NVuoBBsKHoc0lHxiDu2M5g.text: Let's just say that this should be one of your top choices when in the Scottsdale area. Their starter breakfast for 6.95 FN rocks!   Service is really goods and all of the components are fresh. The patio runs along Scottsdale's main drag. Awesome when the weather is nice. A very clean and well maintained establishment.   So grab your paper, laptop, or just sit with friends and absorb your surroundings. Two thumbs up for this restaurant.  #vino2 #vinosquared #vino2ultimate

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uNDkS7kpu71vBMjsWnm3JQ.text: Stopped here after for breakfast last week. (Used Yelp to get on waiting list. Worked great as we were seated almost immediately after we arrived.)  Service was very attentive. I had the Signature French toast: excellent. Had decaf coffee, which was from a press. (Service person said requests for decaf were so few, they found the press was better quality.). Coffee was excellent and had over 3 cups from the press.! Highly recommend.

BlR33Rauq2CT6vlrepfhpg.text: Regardless of what day of the week, this place gets BUSY.  We came here for some post-hike nourishment and the restaurant was already packed at 830AM on a Friday. The good news is that you can head to the counter and order lattes, juices, tea, etc to hold you over before you actually sit down to eat. That helped control the slight hanger pangs that were starting to come up.  After perusing tons of great options, I ultimately ended up with the breakfast grilled cheese. Two of my favorite things served as one combo, there was no way I was going to pass this one up. This cheesy concoction was loaded two kinds of ooey gooey goodness and included eggs, bacon and hash browns into the mix as well. I'd recommend it and would most definitely eat it again. Best choice after a big hike? Probably not - but I don't regret my gluttonous decision.  Service was prompt, and water glasses were refilled quickly. I can see why this is such a popping spot in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Grilled Cheese

g5DZJpJ3C5fHuN7UVKd2Mw.text: I went to the Breakfast Club with high expectations and it did not disappoint. It was early on a Sunday so there was no wait but I was dining solo anyways so I went to the bar.    The breakfast bartender was the consumate host.  He greeted everyone with a verbal high five & a fist bump.  The TVs were showing every sport anyone cared about. I ordered an Iced Coffee & he gave me a 30 ounce cup to-go.  Nice.    I had the spinach egg-white omelette and it was an all-star pick.  To my left and right were other single diners eating huevos rancheros and oatmeal bowls.  I felt instantly healthier just sitting there eating with the locals.  I felt like I was in the heart of Scottsdale and pumping thru my veins was Iced coffee.  I felt like I would leave this place thinner, tanner and with less wrinkles around my eyes.   When I was finished, the breakfast bartender offered to top off my Iced coffee in the to-go cup.  I though that was mighty generous but I didn't need 60 oz of caffeinated beverage on a Sunday.  Because I now needed a nap.

YLv5ijTn7AQy-iJUpwF5Hw.text: Loved this place for a hearty brunch after hiking Camelback! We did a call ahead situation and still had to wait on a Friday morning - dang. Luckily, the wait was not long and we were seated shortly after we all grabbed a coffee for the wait.   I love that they serve fresh squeezed juice to order, and promptly ordered a grapefruit juice, which came in a gigantic glass. I also ordered an omelet with tons of veggies. It came with a small mountain of homefries. I added avocado on the side. This was a ton of food but I killed the plate and was satiated for hours.   My only gripe is that the check was placed on our table when we were just about halfway done our meals. The standard "no rush!" was directed our way, but I definitely felt a little rushed nonetheless. Our meal was paid for before I was even done eating! Aside from that, great spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Create your own omelet yes yes yes yes

434aBsPtxX5P-9agsQKlcQ.text: Delicious food and great atmosphere! Gathered with friends and family who also have never been, and we had a blast. Hardly had to wait to be seated and food came out hot! Will certainly be back. Thanks to our amazing server. Can't remember her name but she was tall and with brown hair, you were great!!! (:

K0JttQ1gZWgN7PLHhVTfxg.text: Nicole is hands down the best server we have ever had here! She was polite, prompt yet not pushy, and extremely helpful. The food was delicious as always too. But, excellent service makes it all better!

ZxP2IfLMkuc9xyWJHlcZUA.text: This was my first not so good of an experience at Breakfast Club where we have frequently since moving to AZ. First my Bloody Mary was weak and the flavor was not there as usual. We ordered two omelettes, The Bird and Whole Hog. The Bird had no flavor and the Whole hog (our regular) just was not the same. Also had an order of French Toast and our friend requested to throw in a skillet to make it crispy, waitress said no problem. It did not come out crispy, and then she said that's the way it's served, but would see what she could do. Took it away and brought it back with no change. Ended up speaking to the manager to remove it from the bill. This has been a required stop when our friends visit, but has now been removed from our list. Seems their quality has gone down hill!

3d6cxlaKBhQREfvoX1HIGQ.text: Great place in downtown Scottsdale at reasonable prices. Outside seating is awesome and the green chili was fantastic. Would definitely go back next time we are in town.

snfPC0VKHMyreBKHDZKQFw.text: So we get here at 9:30am and there's a 30-45 minute wait.   I figured being from out of state (SoCal OC) I would be impressed with a really original menu and what all the fuss was about with this place.   Well, I haven't got my food yet and I want to warn the non locals to not be quick to think the breakfast club is anything special.   Overpriced drinks. Mediocre food. Cute servers. But that's the extent of it.   Should have tried Almo Cafe which is more in line with a real breakfast joint.   And the Bloody Mary was all show and no taste. Thanks for the chewy celery stick. Such a major disappointment.   And the food was "eh". What a waste of our morning. Denny's would have done the job, cost half as much and not taken 2 hours.   But hey, they have the young, cute, college co-ed girls dressed in tights if that's what you're looking for.   Shake my head how I ended up here.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Celery sticks shouldn&#39;t be chewy and when you pay $10 for a Bloody Mary you should get something that&#39;s memorable and tasty.

I4ubWobQPDZRYtKD3zW8Cg.text: Have been in Arizona for a day and have probably heard of this place 10 times already. So worth coming because the food was amazing. And so was the coffee & I can be pretty picky with that. Sat at the bar and still had great service. Jamie was our server, she was very sweet & attentive. If I'm ever in Arizona again I will 100% be coming back.

XMo-ptiMORrdAbmxFEbuLQ.text: This is a go-to for me when visiting Scottsdale. Cannot beat the food quality and the friendly service, always.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QnSd5tbSSDA5B5eMtGgRlA.text: LOVE THE FOOD, staff are super friendly! Parking is a little difficult. You also could wait for up to two hours for a seat, but most of the time, it's worth it.

HDY2gcZ0caWFnol0_xezMw.text: Our server was excellent.   She spoke clearly and was very efficient. I believe she got all our orders correct including a substitution.  2 pm "brunch" for our party of 8 after a hike up Camelback Mountain was awesome. All the food was hot, tasty, and arrived at the table around the same time.   I'm really glad I tried their V-18 veggie juice mix. I'm drinking a bottled V-8 spicy juice mix right now at home and it's making me sad. V-8 is watery & weak. BC's V-18 juice is spicy, flavorful, and very fresh tasting.   The eggs benedict with filet worth it. The steak was tender and perfectly seasoned. The server was really nice when I asked if the regular melon fruit cup could be replaced with other fruit due to a melon allergy. Pancakes were pretty solid for restaurant pancakes.  Overall, it was about $20 per person.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs benedict with filet

MDIbV2E7xRz1NpMrqYtjfg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, fantastic service , location can't be beat and outdoor seating.

6U_NwcfWF6I5mloXqkPbGw.text: I've been to this one several times and have never had an issue along with the downtown Phoenix one. Until this time. I had brought a friend who has never been and apparently if your shorts are short they don't let you in after waiting for over an hour. If this was the case they should have told us that as we check in and waited over an hour. The excuse the manager gave us was that they had family's and children in there. Fashion is fashion and the fact that they saw us before and then choose not to seat is. Is it cause we aren't white?!?!

oiRaqHNZAJc3rFXA3N4KnQ.text: I love this place! A vibrant, cool vibe in the best location, this place is usually hopping. I did not know about the waitlist app, so we did have a bit of a wait. We were told the wait was about 50 minutes but in reality it was only 20 minutes.   So rare to have delicious coffee at a busy restaurant. I assume this was because of how fresh the coffee was since the restaurant was so full.  A really large and diverse menu with much appreciated customizable size portions (many items offer 1, 2, or 3 pieces, for example, for French Toast) with really tasty add-ons such as real whipped cream (for only .25), a warm fruit compote, and nuts. My breakfast was definitely memorable!  My husband loves spicy so he ordered something with chorrizo and pepper jack cheese. He said it is the best he has ever had from a restaurant. He's a tough one to please!  For what this place offers, they excel at their niche - breakfast. A very good value for the excellent service, choices, taste, portion size, and atmosphere. We are new regulars here.

dTJrM_7gXvpoltr5kLYukQ.text: I was in town for a wedding and the day after....let's just say we were starving. While in town we kept hearing great things about the Breakfast Club. We called to see how long the wait would be and were quoted 45 minutes. It was only .05 miles away so we decided to walk in the sweltering heat there. Upon arrival the time wait was now 55 minutes, but bar was open seating.  We were lucky enough to get 3 open seats at the bar. The place was really crowded. I ordered the Huevos Con Masa and just thought it was okay. The corn bread was pretty good, but I wasn't a fan of the poach egg and the potatoes that come on the side lacked flavor. The Chili dish it came with help spice it up a little bit, but I have had better. I'm a huge brunch fan so it was a little disappointing. I also had the breakfast soda mixed with pineapple juice. Again nothing to write home about. The staff was really nice and it was definitely pack! I would probably give this place another try and order something different if I was back in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos con Masa

Th9HT6m8lnjLGHWruCqMWA.text: Update 2/23/18 - so, our usual awesome service and great food was back. Adding back my 5 stars that I took away after one visit that didn't meet expectations for service. Food never disappoints and this time Stephanie made the experience so great. I had the bird omelette with turkey and avocado - so delicious! Coffee is the best and Stephanie gave me one to go. This has been our go to breakfast place since we began our winter retreats to Scottsdale four years ago. I'm happy we came back this trip!

WulbY20tWYZaUHLwK68vCg.text: Loved it!  Food was great, service was super friendly!  Love coming here, every time I'm in Scottsdale!

bcDTQc24NmT4hjlZYjNIEg.text: Really great service, very good breakfast, very busy atmosphere... Well worth the wait if you have to wait. My waitress Stephanie was awesome! :-) I didn't have to worry about anything she was always there before I needed it So professional so nice & very caring I was going to give a four-star but because Stephanie was so awesome I'm giving you guys a 5 star!   Whoever said employees don't matter? Keep up the great service Stephanie, you're awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice breakfast bar that you can catch up on news in sports several wide screen TVs on a circular bar cool!

tRGJmW4Xfho7tbkgL44u-Q.text: Looking for a new place for breakfast, opened yelp and found places nearby. Had to smile at the name. Loved the fact that you could get on the waitlist before hand. Started out with a breakfast cocktail, the Rest.Redeem.Repeat. Was good but nothing to write home about. Table was ready and we chose to sit on the patio, it was gorgeous out. Not surprised they were dog friendly, another plus. Menu was simple and easy to read. Chose the Border Bowl and the Bananas Foster French toast, coffee and fresh squeezed OJ. The Border bowl was outstanding, a new favorite. A little Spicy, and great flavors. I was sad when it was gone, lol. The French toast, another great surprise. It was sweet, as you would expect, but not over the top. Coffee was ok and the OJ was definitely fresh. The waitress was polite and checked on us just enough not to be to intrusive. Great place for Breakfast!

aRbFzULAn2vskqZ-MZkjcg.text: After hiking Camelback we were looking for a breakfast spot near by. It was an easy pic to go with this place. It was really crowded unlike other places nearby that serve breakfast/brunch.   The menu offers a great variety of items to choose from. I went with something simple and ordered 2 eggs (scrambled), bacon, toast and added hash browns for a slight up charge (7.35). I thought the hash browns were especially tasty and the bacon was crispy just as I had requested. My hubby ordered the breakfast burrito (13) with the extra sauce which they call "monster style". Please split this with someone and you will be much happier. It's a very large portion.   The atmosphere here is trendy and I like the openness of the restaurant. There's different seating options which is nice although most of the outside seating is right on Scottsdale road. We sat around the counter which I found enjoyable. Prices are reasonable and the service was good. Just don't expect anything fancy here. This is a cute casual breakfast joint.

ouFWI_t5bAgmBL_hJ_W8kA.text: Totally a fan! Jam packed on a Friday morning when we walked past, we knew something good was inside. Super dog friendly, quick wait in line for a table outside, quick food delivery, excellent/friendly staff and the food was DELICIOUS! Get the fresh OJ and V18, huevos rancheros and the breakfast burrito. Spuds were delish. Yum! Great spot. GO!

ssx6-wZDLqiiR8TIElOt_w.text: Good food, nothing crazy. Just you standard breakfast/lunch menu. Service staff is nice but super slow on the weekends.  Best thing I've had was the breakfast potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tuscan omelette
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy with a scrambled egg
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cobb Salad

VOo1ca-WKv3ruUcq8LfTYw.text: I used to come here all the time. After this experience I don't think I will ever return. Today I sat up at the bar and had the unlucky draw of having Wade be my server. He really does not know customer service and has no knowledge of what a regular means for business. He completely turned me off of this place. He was not friendly, he made me repeat my order 3 times while he was putting it into the computer (still came out wrong). When my food came out he asked me how it tasted while I was in the middle of my first bite, he did not ask if I needed anything else I had to ask 2 different servers that weren't even behind the bar for silverware and hot sauce. Additionally he dropped the check while I was still eating(nobody else really was at the bar so I don't understand the rush)  he also wanted to charge me an additional 4bucks for a Togo Arnold Palmer that I have never had to pay for the 50+ times I have been there before. He said it was new policy or something. Either way I think he should see the value of someone who frequents the place over double charging someone. Regardless I will not be back I would rather give my breakfast business to a place like snooze, matts big breakfast or even daily dose!

au3psVWDyNNNywOKbIw_zg.text: Went here for spring training, the portions are HUGE! (My friend ordered an omelet). I ordered a traditional benedict. The hollandaise was a little liquidity and my egg was poached just a little too much (the yolk didn't spill) so I wasn't crazy about my breakfast, but it wasn't bad.

9PQPf65U01zy5MDKWSVsjw.text: The best breakfast in Scottsdale! Huge portions, not lacking quality in anyway! Service is so nice and coffee delish! the new renovation makes it hip, classy and fun! Love the new "bar"! Lunch is also incredible!!!! You will wait on the weekend for a table, but get a latte at the bar and wait, it's well worth it!!!!! Yum!

vh-MgIdpjglbHBRe9zZ1yQ.text: Good food, snobby staff... nothing outstanding about this place.

OrfW_--mWVTDI7S-1_ViJQ.text: The food was good, but the service really made the experience an average one at best.  I had the breakfast burrito with chorrizo, and I have to admit, it was really good.  I still cant get over how long it took to get my water glass refilled, however.  I almost started drinking the ketchup!  If the service was better, this would be the ideal breakfast spot!

48VN9BmiaJaPN9nx7FKPOQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this place. We went today around 10 a.m. this morning. We were quoted 40 minutes and waited about that. Prepare to wait because this place is always packed. I was really impressed by the service. The hostesses knew what every single person on their extremely long list looked like. There was no annoying, loud screaming of names or stupid buzzer things. They personally walked up to each person to take them to their seats. It was refreshing. The tables turned really quickly and were promptly cleaned and re-sat within minutes. The service inside was just as good. We were greeted right away and ordered. The food didn't take forever and was DELICIOUS. I can honestly say it was the best eggs benedict I've ever had. The portions were huge for the price. Our coffees and waters will filled before they were even close to being empty. The place runs like a well-oiled machine. Its no surprise they are always as busy as they are. I plan on talking my family here when they come out for spring training. If you are coming from out of town I highly recommend you check it out.  Oh and bonus points for the large television playing the Syracuse game.

xxgEZbEoruPFQ4zmMowKag.text: This is a fun and fresh breakfast restaurant. It gets really busy and they don't have a huge space to work with so if you are going on a weekend, prepare to wait. The menu is pretty reasonable, only a little bit more expensive than your average breakfast restaurant. It's so funny how the mood in Scottsdale changes from Tempe...it seems like a lot of the customers of this restaurant have a more snobbish attitude...it's like hello, you're paying ten bucks for breakfast, not $100 so stop looking at us like we can't afford to eat here. Uggg...but what you can you do about ignorant people? So, back to the food...my favorite item on the menu here is the Chocolate Chip Pancakes. It's funny because I don't usually eat these but they are so great from here! Fluffy pancakes with just the perfect amount of chocolate. Yum-O!

bU1JGyAXfpdp4KiXBZUG8A.text: After spending a few days in the general Phoenix area I was very pleasantly surprised to see this part of town. Finally some grass and clean neighborhoods. We did go to Old Scottsdale for supper but that was at night and it wasn't this nice. We came here for breakfast because, well... its the The Breakfast Club.   We decided to sit outside on their patio which was nice, even though it was literally along the road. A little noisy and next time I would sit on the other side of the building but nice anyway.  The service was prompt and we were sitting within seconds of arrival.  The menu was good. There were quite a few interesting things that you may not see on another menu. After careful deliberation we tried the Asparagus, Ham, Cheese and Onion custom omelet along with the Mignon Benedict for myself. On the menu as "Mignon with Harris Ranch Filet, Sauteed Spinach, Bordelaise & Hollandaise"  I thought what a great idea, Eggs Benny with a steak and to boot I had it with shredded hash browns. The hash browns were deliciously crispy and the fresh fruit on the side was good. I ordered the sauces on the side which I would do again but this was quite good. Tender steak, spicy hollandaise and some kind of mushroom sauce. I would order this again.  My wife enjoyed the omelet and it did look good although I didn't try it. the idea of asparagus with eggs didn't really appeal to me. She said the exact opposite in fact, declaring that she loved asparagus in omelets. Maybe some other time for me.   Any way, this is the first place in Scottsdale / Phoenix that I ate at and would recommend or return to. Pretty darn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This was a great breakfast

kL0ptbdXTDFCogJVxSe7ag.text: A good place..  As a tourist, most places in the area disappointed me, but I liked this breakfast place.  Service was good, and the food was very nice.  I had French toast, but it was the best French Toast I've had.

GdJ36N7pvsPh-W66_7tLaQ.text: Been here many times... like this place for it's lox and bagels...they are always delish...ranchos huevos are ok.  high end coffee.  wait staff is great but the hostesses are a bit dumb--look like they never went to bed after being out all night.  3-4 stars

0AkT4PUdKXQUnFgfJeoFXQ.text: I went with my friend for Sunday Brunch a few weeks back and was very impressed. I ordered the Huevos Con Masa, and it was very tasty. The flavors were so well blended! I thought it would be too rich, but it was just perfect!  My friend got The Bird, he gave me a bite and I was so jealous I didn't order it. The creamy cheese in the omelet was to die for! I am looking forward to going back to order it!  The atmosphere was very comfortable and we didn't have to wait too long, so the overall experience was good!   If you are looking for a good brunch spot, I would recommend The Breakfast Club....cute name and easy to remember!

EvKrMXdj4F53YIKGCZnfrw.text: The food is good, the amount they serve is outstanding, however the service was ok and the waiting time to get a table can be over a hour. I have ate at other's places with no wait where the food was just as good. I would go back if they hire better servers and more seating. Other then that, I rate it a 3 star.  Oh the parking was kind of crazy too.

YACwz0-Ej9j4AawvJAPovA.text: I had the beef hash for breakfast which initially was very tasty but developed a sort of sweet taste which was odd.  The potatos were very good and the fresh orange juice was great.

6iChOVj9ZLm1lHKxtxf4XA.text: This place is a local gem. While on a trip to Scottsdale had breakfast here two days in a row. Love the fresh squeezed juices and they make a mean cappuccino.  Had the cheese and mushroom omelette the first day which was good but not a lot of taste. The second day had a veggie scramble that was fantastic.  Be prepared to wait as this is a very popular place.

mAru2FSCWIYGQTig43oRMg.text: I went with my friends for brunch New Years and this place was nicely packed, the wait wasn't that long. I ordered the Whole Hog omelette and it was good and meaty. It was a huge portion size; I couldn't finish the whole thing. The Bar Harbour flapjacks were really delicious too with their berry puree to top it off. My friend got the Bird, the other omelette I was thinking about ordering, and he gave me a taste of it and I knew I should have ordered that. It was really good. I'll be sure to order that next time I go there.

ik3oE7bW1Ft3Sj-eiLmibQ.text: Great food, but horrible service. Most of the staff are snotty girls wearing yoga pants. No one at the hostess stand smiled or greeted us when we walked in. Once we were seated, tt took about 20 minutes just for the girl to come take our order.  When she did wait on us, she was not pleasant and acted as if it was a bother for her to do her job. I ordered scrambled eggs and french toast. The waitress dropped off our food, without the eggs, didn't mention them, and ran off. We had to flag her down to say we were missing eggs, and she said "she'll check." 10 minutes go by, we ask again, and eventually get them. If the wait staff did their job correctly, the wait for the restaurant would not be long at all. This place could be amazing if they could figure out the wait staff issue. As much as I loved the french toast, there are just too many restaurants with great customer service to go back to this one.

LTqSKrb0DXRDQpzm-Xjjjg.text: Not too bad, my mom friends and I came here for breakfast and had to wait over half an hour for a table (I understand we have four babies total but come on, they wouldn't even let us push two tables together outside). The food was ok priced and pretty good, but their menu was pretty small. The waitress was really nice and we all left full, but I will probable never come here again...just ok.

drYqztz4rV27nLbEYUiqVA.text: you goot try the iced cafe breve (2 shots of espresson and about 8 oz of half half) very decadent, it tasted like a coffee milk shake!  the have outdoor/indoor seating and a bar area that you can order smooths, coffee, food to go  this place is pretty popular, lots of young people trying to look beautiful and cool!

vfYd-RinbAubhPhl2OZpDw.text: The hostess was rude - but if you can see past that - the staff is a-ok - but the food is worth the wait.

5m5sVhxMSmo59hoAyoRrRA.text: Without a doubt the worst service and the lousiest cappuccino I have ever experienced.I dropped in here just before noon last Thursday for a cappuccino and maybe breakfast / brunch while my wife was at a seminar at the Hilton up the road.I had checked this breakfast place out earlier in the week and it looked promising.I ambled in and sat down at the big breakfast bar.The female server came straight over and said,what can I get you to drink?I must have walked into a night club or a dive bar because that's their opening line.I ordered a cappuccino and she left a menu in front of me almost as an afterthought when she brought back my coffee.It came in a square glass mug,2 inches of black coffee topped by 3 inches of white foam.I would need a bloody straw to drink that.I asked her to pour the cappuccino into a porcelain mug which at least should be round.She was very annoyed by my request and made a mess of the liquid transfer.The cappuccino tasted like shit so I was not sticking around for breakfast....that's for sure.This is not the person I would want greeting my valued customers.My wife and I enjoyed superb cappuccinos at The Chopshop just a block away the next morning.

acTRpa1sMj4rl_-jytL1Zw.text: Here is what we ordered:  Ham and Eggs and Steak and Eggs.   Both came with toast and fresh fruit.   I ordered the ham and eggs, and ordered my eggs "over well" and asked the waitress to have my yolks popped, because the sight of egg yolk running around my plate makes me ill. She had a little tude about "over hard" versus "over well", but I thought we had it settled...  My eggs came burned, with brown crispy crap all over them, and they were not hot. The toast came cold, with no butter or jam. The ham was okay, but "off the bone" is an exaggeration. The fresh fruit was good.   My husband's eggs and steak were not hot, and his toast came cold, with no butter or jam, as well.   He complained, and the waitress said she would bring new orders to us, at which time I told her to just forget it as far as my order went, because I was STARVING. She brought me a new order of eggs, and I said that I didn't want them, and off in a huff she went.   When my husband's (new) breakfast was delivered to the table, it was hot and everything was done correctly. However, no toast was present.   What bugs me about this place, besides the fact that we both were served cold food, is the attitude of the waitress.   Yeah, I get it, it's Scottsdale, but as a Scottsdale resident, I am embarrassed by the holier-than-thou attitude you get from some of the businesses here.   We hadn't been here in years, and now I know why.  Despite the long drive, we'll head back to Matt's Big Breakfast, which has THE freshest, most delicious breakfast in this area. And, no attitude...

l17qyvfRf4OiLX5kjekq_Q.text: The best French toast I found in town on business. The only down fall is everyone loves this place if you don't get there early plan to wait for a spot. The service was great and the portions were awesome.

hn-mZHaXKCL9PTJcsKt6-Q.text: Very good fresh breakfast many healthy items to choose from. Very busy place if you're in a hurry watch for a seat at the bar its first come first serve. We walked in and sat right down when there was a 45 min wait for a table. Very clean. Excellent service. The woman that was sitting next to me asked for a diet coke and the waiter told her that they only served coke in a bottle because they didn't have fountain soda. So she passed on the soda and just asked for a water. The waiter took it upon himself to go next door to another restaurant to get this woman a diet coke. Now that's service. Above and beyond.

Dvpe-Y09qvGHGJzoznDzuA.text: My husband and I went on a weekday morning, and there was virtually no wait. We eat paleo, so I ordered carved ham and two egg whites a la carte, and he had the Quick Start Conscious (4 egg whites, Broccoli, Cottage Cheese, Tomato and Fruit). We appreciate their healthy options. The service was quick and friendly. We'll definitely return, but we'll maintain our weekday visit. I hate to wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg whites and ham slices

8gSHq-ZdmlbtRhG9KqimOw.text: The service and hospitality alone makes it a 5 star and the food adds to the experience.  It is a Jen of place with great breakfast.  Great choices - something for everyone and tasty.   Is my must visit once joint every time I am in Scottsdale. Keep it up guys - u have a good thing going here

geCu1MJJzyxRUfeF1nhI_A.text: This place is between 3 and 4 four stars. I'm not dying to go back but I definitely would try it again ~ nothing "bad," just nothing to get truly excited over (yet.) Portion size was good-large. Egg sandwich a great value w/some very delicious bacon. I love when chefs add a twist ~ chipotle to hollandaise ~ however this combo didn't work for us. Husband is a finicky eater (I'm certainly not) but both of us hard a time on that hollandaise. The menu has a lot of other great choices (check it out) so that's a plus.  I did enjoy my chai tea. Just a milk was $3.50. Food is reasonably priced; drinks are at coffee bar prices.    BEST THINGS: our server did forewarn us of hollandaise so we got it ~thankfully~ on the side /  good service though busy and mostly with a smile. Definitely goes a long way to bringing me back for another go.

So6oruEW8lpZqEOHIJhycQ.text: The food was decent, nothing special. I had pancakes with mixed berries ($2 extra for about 10 berries on top), fried eggs, and hash browns. I liked it all, but honestly it seemed just a step above IHOP. Really nothing great about the quality, flavor, or the service.

XWA7x3hdRwjdW43XouU2kg.text: We had to wait about an hour, but once seated the service was fast. We ordered and got our food quickly. Giant servings and very good food. We would come back

GySfJ7R_TKttABX8r2aNAA.text: This is the best breakfast I have ever had! The only downside is the wait to be seated. Don't let the wait scare you though. The food is well worth the wait! I've only been here once, but it will definitely not be my last!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Bowl. I highly recommend this dish!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious!!

SsZ34ISAl-wAgDq81JNo_Q.text: Here's the thing about breakfast food. There's not a lot of variety, so ideally, yours should be better than the next guy's. In this, Breakfast Club fails.   Food isn't bad, but they've never made that 4oz. $8.00 "Harris Ranch" filet well. I've boiled steak in the UK that tastes just as good for half the price.   Also, never have coffee here. Not at least their bar drinks. It's horrible, and the person taking your order will repeat it back to you to correctly three times, but you won't get the drink you ordered.  It's trendy little spot in the Old Town Scottsdale area, but that's about it.

VErsOzOEIYrlqRtTpz5k8A.text: We went here on a Sat morning before flying out of PHX  Upon arrival we could see a wait from the car and then parking was around back. I went to add my name on the list for 3 of us and she said 20 min wait  So we looked at the menu and they had fresh fruit, and typical breakfast foods with a full coffee bar.   I ordered the southwest Rancho Huevos it came in a tortilla with eggs and cheese hot sauce and sliced pork. My girlfriend got an omelet and it came with huge slices of fresh fruit and potatoes with peppers. Her other girl friend got the four cheese omelet and could barley finish it. We all where stuffed and extremely happy with breakfast.   I would recommend this place with out a doubt to anyone in the area who is hungry for fresh breakfast.

i91oIofdwZvI2JrCBhxkVA.text: The wait on weekends is usually long.. when the hostess says it will be 25 minutes, be prepared to wait closer to 45. However.. the food is awesome! Plus the prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get!

6-14gyYo-pmG5lqG9zH_ew.text: Wait was about 15 minutes on Saturday @ noon. Grapefruit juice was delightful, everything we order was consistently good - filet mignon bene , French toast , over medium eggs, hash browns & bacon... Service was nice and friendly, place have a great vibe and seating is very spacious between other tables. My Only disappointment was their advertised ice coffee, it's flavored with Carmel and hazelnut syrup - at the first sip it tasted really watered down... But figured let's not complain before we get our food.. Food was good, it leveled out my need to complain

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Keepin it simple, it&#39;s cool you can order French toast by the slice...
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 4oz mignon bene...

FVVUyJIjeSHXBjWIOImWxg.text: Hands down. BEST BREAKFAST IN THE CITY!!    Pros: * The atomosphere is really chic yet still feels comfortable. * The service is fast! * The food is the best part... the buttermilk pancakes AHhhhmazing.  The "bird" omelete is to die for.  Topped with creme frache and loaded down with turkey, cheese and avocado... I have been dreaming about it!! * You will leave full.  I wish they would franchise and put a BC in St. Louis (where I live).  I would be there every weekend!

cgrtEa8JmqaLFehGBfvQ8A.text: The Challah Bread French Toast was unique.   A good menu with items that are not associated with the normal "breakfast place."    Busy place but efficient and friendly.  I would love to go back again if I make it back in the area from Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Challah French Toast
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Lox &amp; bagel

mJrte0PqKoMKtgj2RlJIvg.text: I've never written a review before but after my experience here, I thought I would come and give my two cents.  I suggested coming here with my boyfriend and his friend for his birthday since we were on this side of town. Big mistake. The hostess told us 25 minutes and we ended up waiting closer to 45 minutes. When our friend asked about the long wait they assured us that the 7 tables in front of us would be seated if we waited just 10 minutes more. I wish they would've just over estimated the time so we would be prepared for a long wait.   I have never been more embarrassed in my life to suggest a place when the hostess seated us at a wet table and threw the menus down and walked away after seating us.
