After that, it didn't matter how hip or delicious the food was, I am never going back here.

xxjp4N9th7bEnJkhYwQfIg.text: Great brunch place. We been here couple times and we will come back here for sure. Good food, good service. Hot servers :) They always busy and our food came after 10min! That was unbelievable. Even if you have to wait for a table it's worth it to wait because service is very fast. One thing I didn't like - honey cup was so sticky and dirty, I feel like you should clean before you bring it ....

plMtcrJyRyp3eqsXY0qx7A.text: I'm going to rate this as a 3.5 stars rounded down to a 3. It's a great place, with solid brunch offerings that are perhaps a bit on the tame side. I've been here before, ages ago when they hadn't renovated yet. Unfortunately I don't live near Scottsdale anymore, and my husband moved in with me some time before we got married, so our reason for being in Scottsdale greatly diminished about a year or two ago.   That aside it's a great place to stop by when you're in the neighborhood. Parking is a bit of a b!#ch, pardon my french. It's old town Scottsdale, after all. And this place is always busy. That day I went it was packed with college kids on Spring Break and people in town for Giants spring training.   The waitresses are perky and the food is good. Nothing out of this world, but I've enjoyed everything I've had there. I think once I had an egg white omelette, another time their lox bagel plate. I do love that they have mimosas and bloody marys for you to order as well. Both were also good- the mimosa was fresh and tart, the bloody mary nicely savory and spicy.   There's a reason this place is always busy. It's in prime real estate and serves up solid food all the time. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if you're in the neighborhood and are craving brunch, you could do worse than stopping in here for food.

Elp7PoVcJguCt7EVQGiubQ.text: Great place!  Food is fantastic and service is outstanding. I personally like the Border Bowl but everything is good.  The place is usually busy but well worth the wait.

O_FR1jXYXtxgKigy1SolYw.text: Friendly server and yummy options for breakfast! The waffle was good- wish the servings were a bit larger, but overall a nice meal.

0VFcn5uww63Cd-2VFFSwdQ.text: Excellent place! Very busy so expect to wait a bit. I stopped by on whim as it was recommended. I sat at the counter and ordered the French Toast with berries.   The waitress at the bar was very nice and kept checking on me to see if I needed anything. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

Kiu66ym0N_06PVCPfe09BQ.text: If I could give it 6 stars, I would. For starters, the chai latte was the best I've ever had!. My husband had a simple order of oatmeal which was delicious but I had the huevos rancheros with chicken that I feel in love with. I am so upset that I don't live in AZ where this would be a regular breakfast top for me!

d_22EJPM_LBtflzhlP2HJQ.text: Absolutely disgusting. I have never paid $23 for an omelette and orange juice. And on top of that the omelette was disgusting. It goes to show you that if it's trendy people go no matter how bad or expensive it is. I will never go back to that place I can honestly say that.

kmsjjZtOlv83cTgVCaNbWA.text: What can I say?   Most favorite breakfast and lunch place to go.  Friendly staff, great coffee,  wonderful egg choices, atmosphere inside and out the best.   Right in the heart of Old Town.

EvToDvujB8R7whEx9bWnJg.text: Another NoWait experience where I walked into a busy restaurant during the heat of breakfast and was seated like a rockstar. All because I joined the waitlist on Yelp before leaving my hotel.  Breakfast Club gets crazy busy -- it's one of the few sit down breakfast/brunch spots in the area and, as a result, has a queue coming out the door between 9 am and noon. The servers are nice, the space is big, there's a patio, and plenty of healthy combined with not-so-healthy menu options.  As I mentioned above, I found Breakfast Club on Yelp, saw that they had about a 12-25 minute wait so I hit the "Join the Waitlist" button on the app and headed that way. It was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel and by the time I got there plus checked in with the hostess, they had a table ready. It was just that simple.  Tinga Chicken Frittata is a very filling breakfast. For two. Except there was just me eating, so I only ate half. If only TSA would let travelers bring their restaurant leftovers on the plane, I would've gladly taken it to-go. Alas, I didn't want a full cavity search over an egg dish in a box, so I had to bid farewell to this big ol' plate of food.   From "front door" (of my hotel) to paying the check, it was a 45 minute experience. With free wifi! Not a complaint from this one at all...

V1wmoC3b8wkMls1gb8Malw.text: Great menu, location and service. Highly recommended As expected the place can be busy so bring some patience, waiting lines can be long.

kgorx2NBsCiKDnMARjHRSQ.text: As a plant-based eater, I recommend this restaurant for breakfast and lunch. They offer several menu items that I enjoy. The coffees and other drinks are delicious. I really like the ambiance of the restaurant, and the professionalism of the staff. My family members who do eat animal-based products love to eat here, too. I go to this restaurant at least once a month. But, beware, it is ALWAYS busy, and you'll have to wait anywhere from 10-40 minutes for a table.

fWvXNv9cy1ump0p7r9qv1w.text: Really great breakfast spot in the heart of the waterfront/fashion square area. Food and cold brew were great, waitstaff was attentive, and being able to add ourselves to a digital waitlist was highly convenient.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Z-wv1f3eRIHEKEBQGPspBg.text: Okay y'all, this place is BUSY. Make sure you add yourself to the waitlist before you get there. Or else you're going to wait. We went on a Tuesday morning and waited maybe 2 minutes as I wanted outdoor seating. That being said it is loud, as you are very close to the busy Scottsdale street. I didn't mind this but I noticed at least two other tables asking to be reseated inside. The weather was gorgeous so my bestie and I just scooted our chairs closer so we could gossip. The menu is great, lots of healthy options. We got the lean and green omelette and and the salmon eggs Benedict. They were both great and the omelette was a decent size. The fresh fruit was delicious. We also had a side of the breakfast potatoes. I tend to always have to tell people to do them "crunchy" as I don't like mine soggy. They were perfectly crispy when I got them after giving the server my request. The only downfall, I didn't care for the staff that was doing the seating. Kind of rude to be honest. I loved our server outside but definitely not impressed with the people who are supposed to be the hosts/hostesses. They were quite short with a lot of people as we were waiting to be sat. Maybe they were having an off day but definitely need to tighten up! Overall, I can't let that one thing take away my five star review as the food, our server and experience was great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lean &amp; Green omelette
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon eggs Benedict
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor patio

L42krOjude7m2_PN8ygJkQ.text: During our golf trip to the area our Sunday brunch is usually here. Crazy thing is it's not too far from our club spot we usually go to on Friday. They use fresh ingredients and the wait staff is outstanding. I do recommend however you make reservations whenever you can because this place gets packed on Sundays. The weight could be anywhere between 30 to 40 minutes but its worth it. They have a wide variety of breakfast options and the atmosphere is also welcoming

9F81oQJZMpxDebZ8Xw40bA.text: Breakfast Club is delicious! So delicious that you'll need to call in ahead of time and make a reservation. The line is usually out the door for seating so make sure you're calling them prior to leaving the house to confirm the wait isn't bad. Whether it's you and a friend, or a party of people needing Bloody Mary's the next morning -- I definitely suggest you try this place at least once.

9UGC_9bWbHBQaSBQBHaYRA.text: Great location on Scottsdale road near many shops. Bar is awesome as it's well designed. Service is great and menu has options for the entire family. They serve alcohol for breakfast, too. Wife ordered bagel and lox and loved it. She said the lox was fresh. I ordered an omelette with turkey sausage, mushrooms, avocado, herb cream cheese and their special sour cream. Herb cream cheese was not a good addition to the omelette. I'll know next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bagel and lox
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bird Omelet
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bagel and lox

g7XjtSmTEbS52n9pz9AViA.text: My boyfriend loves this restaurant's breakfast because of the eggs Benedict.  I love their biscuits and gravy. Unfortunately The staff that works there can never get anything right and we always have to get our food made two or three times and it is completely ridiculous. The teenage manager that came up to us was very kind however didn't offer us anything until we finally decided to leave. They remade our food four times and they could not get it right it is quite disappointing I wish I knew where the breakdown is and I would fix this company.  Our waitress Chelsea was kind but it seems like she didn't understand anything we told her & she seemed overwhelmed and shouldn't be in the service  . My girlfriend has ten years plus experience and was shocked how all around no one put in any effort to make the situation better.  Food good, service terrible.

HkgTCggG4dimfR2mGFMAYg.text: Super good and amazing service! I have eaten here three times and all were consistently excellent meals! All the food is prepared fresh and delicious. The menu has something for everyone.

-sQdHQ90ZG_R1bsToWtDsg.text: Went to BC today for Easter brunch.  I had the green goddess frittata and it was ok.  Sort of bland. I wouldn't order it again. My son got the breakfast burrito with chorizo and it was good but a little spicy. Although my son likes spicy things. My daughter got the grilled chicken on a bagel with chipotle sauce and it was good. It comes with choice of side.  She got a side salad.  They also have good black tea but it's not regular black tea.  It has a little bit of a fruity taste to it which is Good if you like that. All in all, it's a pretty good meal and I would probably come back at a later date.

QqU9HxvHGyS4Lj1y5fc4IA.text: Decent food, definitely not worth the wait.   BC is across the street from the Montauk on corner of N Scottsdale Rd. & Stetson. Parking can be a little tricky because there is no parking lot, but there are quite a few 3 hour free spots down Stetson.   My bf & I came for Sunday brunch. Having found BC on Yelp, we joined the waitlist a few minutes before leaving our house, which about 15 minutes away.  When we arrived we checked in with the hostess, who advised our wait would be about another 15-20 minutes for inside seating, which we wanted. Close to half hour later, two spots opened up at the bar & jumped on them. As we were leaving, we noticed that several parties who had checked in a few minutes after we arrived were still outside waiting for tables.   BC has a great selection of coffee specialities, but we were disappointed they were served in paper cups with plastic lids & not well made. My bf ordered the cafe au lait, which was so bad he sent it back & switched to drip coffee.    Overall, the food is well executed, basic breakfast staples at really reasonable prices. I ordered the traditional eggs benedict, my bf ordered the border bowl with avocado. My eggs benedict had perfectly poached eggs (runny yolks and set whites) on top of thick-sliced, grilled ham over a nicely toasted english muffin, topped with hollandaise. The hollandaise had a good flavor, but was too thick and not creamy. I substituted hash browns for O'Brien potatoes, which had a nice crispy exterior. My bf enjoyed his border bowl, but its presentation was definitely lacking & looked like it had been put through the garbage disposal before it made it to his plate.   Our server was very pleasant, but was taking care of the entire bar (about 18 seats) & didn't have time to check in with us. We had to flag down another server walking by for refills on our coffee, hot sauce, etc.   Overall, we enjoyed our brunch, but we will be sticking to Breakfast Kitchen Bar where the service is more attentive & the coffee is better & served in real mugs.

EL3-cxZxEd1_TcvpTpOFVA.text: Best breakfast in Scottsdale!!! Awesome staff, awesome food. Great outdoor area to watch "stuff".

Wnvy32JrbeF9HoP_iYN1IA.text: The Breakfast Club in Scottsdale is a great spot to sit and eat breakfast or grab coffee or a smoothie on the go! It is conveniently located and you can sit inside or outside. The staff is friendly and while we were waiting for the coffee order multiple people checked in to make sure we were being helped.   The ice coffee was very refreshing and our group ordered the quick start, quick start conscious and the traditional bene. I had the quick start conscious which came with egg whites, broccoli, tomato and a side of cottage cheese and fruit. It was fresh, filling and felt guilt free indulging. The traditional bene was a big hit with the group as well.  If you're in the area, I would definitely recommend stopping in for some breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick Start Conscious breakfast

xWcMzJ0q5egImEL6iInR2Q.text: Great food spot! Not gonna lie it is very loud but besides that a decent place to eat with good prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Club pro protein shake

gH7ftamnWnAdWvX7f0Ahjg.text: A hidden gem Breakfast Club- my husband and I were in Phoenix/Scottsdale area for New Years...   We found the Breakfast Club by accident what a delightful place.  Food was well-prepared and served hot. The servers attentive, the only downfall is the lines can get long, we were told we can  put us in line via Yelp ahead of time which I've never used before. But even with the lines the restaurant moves through it quickly, without making you feel rushed.   All in all an excellent experience. I cant wait to go back and try other offerings on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start conscious 4 egg whites,avocado, sautéed broccoli, edamame, spinach, bell peppers, yellow onions, quinoa
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chai latte- very very good

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bird omelette - turkey, avocado, mushrooms garlic herb cream cheese topped with creme fraiche with fresh fruit.. jalapeño biscuit

99YP9Z0TghtB_oxnkm7FaA.text: This is a cute brunch spot.  It seems to be popular, but the wait for an outdoor table at noon on a Saturday was only about 30 minutes.    The hostesses and our waitress were very professional and seemed to know exactly what they were doing.  We lacked for nothing and didn't wait for anything either.  I opted for the breakfast burrito. The description said two eggs, but this bad boy was huge!  It was also a good blend of flavors, especially when a little hot sauce was added to the mix.  I neglected my poor potatoes because I wanted to experience as much of the burrito as possible.  We easily split the check between the three of us and were  our way. A very pleasant experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

lS4Yg-gDHgy_jsaB8tl6AA.text: There was a really long wait to get a table (like 40 minutes) but it was worth the wait. I got pancakes and my friend got the blt and both were amazing! The manager was very helpful and friendly and even got us water bottles while we waited. We will be going back again.

8z4u0UsvenbdWOTkj416NQ.text: Ahmazing food! Tuscan frittata was delish! Excellent wait staff, everyone was attentive and quick. Good coffee and a great vibe! We got there early, I'm sure as the breakfast crowd gets up it becomes busy..but we enjoyed it!

7VHQWQw3HViZpSTE6iFfmg.text: I used to be a Sunday morning regular here, and the food/coffee was always amazing and the service was fantastic. We usually had the pleasure of being served by Mark at the breakfast bar who was great with conversation and always got us in and out quickly before we headed off to work. But unfortunately it appears that he is no longer with the company and the service and quality of food just hasn't been the same. Twice our food has come out cold or incorrect and always with burnt toast. The coffee we order is never refilled as the girls seem more interested in talking to other regulars instead of getting to know all their guests. It's a shame that he quality of food is so I consistent as I used to look forward to our Sunday morning ritual.

r1IBEtbnEqu-hkPOtDj-7A.text: Visited about 10:30am on a weekday and it was a 30 minute wait. Recommend checking the wait list in advance and adding yourself if there's a wait (we didn't know about this). The setting is nice - stylish yet understated. We had a fresh grapefruit juice while we waited that was great but pricey for the size. For breakfast we had the oatmeal, BC bagel, Lean and Green omelette and Huevos Rancheros. All the food was fresh and great. The service was welcoming as well as efficient. The reason for one star off is the noise level. Why do Scottsdale restaurants do this? There's plenty of noise from the activity and then they add loud music on top of it. We had to nearly shout just sitting a 4-top. If the weather is cooperating, definitely suggest outside for that.

QFL2XQnRdzS69h8w92OSZA.text: Bloody Mary's are on point!! Food was really good too. Friendly and fast service. Recommend for a great breakfast!

AbIVBKzu3X9eS3XUPy5_NA.text: This is my husband favorite place for breakfast and my second favorite ( Butters)  This place is always busy so if you go on the weekend be prepared to wait. Food is consistently delicious and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious Eggs Benedict

EWd8gIgcwgNLkKdhBCiJOw.text: The service was fantastic, and the food was even better!!! I very much enjoyed my meal and will be coming back again!!!

dzrtjyBOT9JfA8xphzk41g.text: We ate breakfast here twice during our stay.  The food and service were both good.  I just had the basic breakfast, which was good.  My husband had a meaty scramble and says it was wonderful.

9EUP_i6EzvrusIByiYICaw.text: With a name like the Breakfast Club, how could you not give this place a try!?!!  Although the wait was 45 minutes, the service was high-energy and very pleasant, especially since they let us sit at their bar and have ourselves a few breakfast cocktails until our table finally opened up.  Here's what we ordered:   The Whole Hog Omelette - If you're into meat and eggs then this is wholeheartedly the best thing on their menu. It has the right amount of spice and flavor to compliment the nicely cooked eggs.  The Mignon Benedict with hash browns - I see where they were going with this but it really just didn't work; please leave the mignon for the steakhouse. Eating it here only made me crave it at a place that actually knows how to prepare and cook it like Bobo's in SF.  Overall, it was worth the stop and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole Hog Omelette with hash browns.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mignon Benedict with hash browns.

fiTDinvhiLg5_lTXosBW2g.text: I have been coming to this location since it opened. I always love the food. Very generous servings at a good price and the green tea is one of the best around. This place is always packed no matter when you go. The only issue I have are the servers. For the most part they are okay, but they usually have attitudes. Today, however, we had the sweetest server I have ever had there. Whitney was amazing! Very speedy, tentative, and a total sweetheart. She was such a delight! Thank you Whitney for the excellent service!

hIT2VrTKvIPukFxfmI5cCA.text: So my wife has been raving about this place ever since she and her friends ate here a couple of months back. Everything was fine until I asked for a diet soda. I was then informed that they only carry regular coke in a bottle. No fountain drinks?!?!?! Not coming back.

__tlE2P3ikvXm-MVxDg8HQ.text: This is one of my new favorite brunch places.   I've been coming here a lot with my friend and we've gotten excellent service, food and drinks each time. The servers are always quick and friendly. The drinks are huge for only $10! Can't beat a huge mimosa for that price! My friend and I always get the same thing because it's so good. I've been getting the Tuscan omelet with adding sausage and I can't get enough. I can't describe how good the omelet is. It's so unique it's delish. I love pesto and this omelet is covered in it with tomatoes and mozzarella. There is no meat so be sure to add some if that's your sort of thing. And those potato skins with peppers oh my gosh.   Writing this review is making me hungry and I just decided that I'm going here this weekend. I can't resist!   Edit. Every time we're here the severs who are ready to leave steal our salt and pepper mid meal and it's getting obnoxious. We come here a lot and it happens every time. They don't even ask me which bugs me even more. Im still eating I expect to be able to keep my condiments. There's plenty of empty tables they can fill im not sure why they need mine as well right away considering they are hours from closing..

3tZ-63mS3lC3t14Fa3dGzw.text: Great coffee and a variety of delicious breakfast options. However, the chorizo queso made all of the difference! That sauce could go on anything! Thanks!

pEtXBDAeGETnHV1Bzmni9g.text: Solid 3.5 stars for this place, everything you can expect to find a breakfast place. Our breakfasts were decent, I did not particularly enjoy the sauce on the Portobello Benedict but overall our experience was good due to the awesome service

-_Gz8_GXzxODU-CHdc3haA.text: Food was awesome! Server seemed like she hated her life :( but the food and the atmosphere were great. We got the french toast, biscuits and gravy and the mexican bowl. All tasted great!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zzXK-b1M71oAaAI5Rltm_g.text: This is MY FAVORITE breakfast spot! Definitely recommend getting on the online waitlist because weekends get busy! Everything I've tried here is AMAZING! 5/5 for sure!

eesFWBM_uepa2t6v2k1Bow.text: Amazing breakfast spot right in Scottsdale with killer menu options. You can go from extreme healthy eating to adding a few calories to your diet...but whichever you choose you can't go wrong! Inside info...try the sweet potato fries with a side of the warm caramel dip that is used to the banana fosters French toast...you'll thank me after!

3IBXPnZ3djEBE0LkDm3XZw.text: Fast service, excellent wait-staff and great bar! Definitely a top notch brunch spot!

Vg3W5aguPueBkqeDSVvW4A.text: One of my favorite local breakfast spots! The food and drinks are great and the service has always been friendly! They do get busy on weekends, but haven't had to wait too long during our weekday visits! Look forward to coming back the next time we're in town!

uZAW_wXFxGeT-VtEZRUraw.text: Came here for breakfast with my dad. I had the huevos con masa which was 5 stars--poached eggs on jalapeno cornbread with a spicy chorizo "queso" on top. It was definitely spicy which I really liked. Our waitress was less than enthusiastic but I can't really fault her for that--seems like a busy spot. Service nevertheless was super fast and we were in and out within 30 minutes. If you want something more relaxed and slow paced this may not be the spot, but for our purposes it was perfect.

VxaRX6-fILCAWPSJyXPLmw.text: Had a great breakfast in beautiful Scottsdale! The food portions are huge, and delicious! They make their own vegetable juice which I wished they sold in stores. Overall experience was great!

JumME2AkFKmGJr1QS9cEXQ.text: A great breakfast/brunch spot with really good food.  There is usually a wait, even mid morning on a weekday, so plan ahead.  They won't seat partial parties, so plan ahead for that too.    On my most recent visit I had coffee and Eggs  Benedict.  Their coffee is truly amazing . . . very rich without being bitter.  The Eggs Benedict was also very good, with hand cut pieces of ham and REAL hollandaise.   Service always quick and efficient.  Some servers are more friendly and chatty than others, but I've always had good service.    My one issue (and why I ave four stars rather than five) is the increasing garlic content in the sausage gravy.  My regular favorite in the past was always the biscuits and gravy (with jalapeno biscuits . . . mmmm).  Over my last several visits, the sausage gravy has been extremely garlicky, and not nearly as tasty as it used to be.    Overall, a The Breakfast Club is great place to eat, with good service and really good food.  I'll definitely be back, and maybe even try the gravy again someday.

Lo-cfUbCBLjpFg1NvRadzA.text: Horrible service. From the bad attitude of the hostess to the waitress who could care less.  We walked out

OMbK4kCXL5ldqQhOr7UlZA.text: What mediocre at best experience this was. You know when you walk into a place and you feel like they're doing YOU a favor ? That's now I felt at The Breakfast Club. I've over decade of experience in the industry, opened restaurants and trained people across the coast so this I feel like I have a tad of credibility. I sat at the bar and was greeted or better yet, "acknowledged" by the brunette girl working this area. She never once smiled, asked me any questions about menu, If I've been there etc. flopped down the menu and walked away. I ordered the lox/cream cheese set up because I do think they do a good job here with that. Coffee is horrible but the food came out quick. It was $14 but it's Scottsdale and was a good amount so I don't mind. She dropped the check half way through my meal without asking how anything was. I pain, left $4 on $17. Over 20%. She picked up the check, entered her tip in the computer and never looked back to say thank you. Food was good, service was 1 star. Not only will I not come back, I won't refer anyone or bring visitors. This type of experience gives Scottsdale its pretentious reputation.  Deuces B-club.

ze_CM_QEKv_5Sj951TvNlg.text: Breakfast club has a good name and location at the north tip of Old Town Scottsdale. This place seems to always be packed on the weekends for breaky and brunch. Therefore, I recommend you find a day off, like a Tuesday morning to check it out. You'll get better faster service, wont be all noisy and you'll really be able to enjoy what this place has to offer: which is a very good staff and bright enjoyable atmosphere.   Food: The food menu is decent, but nothing to write home about. You'll have your normal southwest breakfast dishes, pancakes, omelets, and skillets. I guess what they are known for are their selection of Benedict style eggs using different types of genres with hollandaise. Cant complain.   Overall, its a solid stop and a place you should check out. It may end up being your fav breakfast place as many of my friends state that it is. I however put it as a solid back up to my favorites if they are too packed. All in all, I recommend, but its not at the very top.

fK81w8gKZ_c6Q6oKqSeD7Q.text: Good, but not great, see-and-be-seen Joint with a pretentious attitude regarding their vibe/food. Frankly, after all the raves and top tens, I expected more. Blueberry pancakes -- good. Bacon -- very good. Eggs -- runny (ordered over-medium). Fresh fruit -- very good.  While eating our breakfast, my wife and I were lamenting that we didn't go back to the Daily Dose, one block down. Again, the BC was good, but just good. Live and learn.

Y5IhBYcKxtz6KYdBk6ra3A.text: I have been to break club a couple times.  Decent time each visit.... but on my last visit I noticed something.  I think that the staff are aliens.  I noticed that one was speaking to another in like a robot language.  Then I saw one of the staff use a laser to make my toast.  The whole experience was bizarre.  Nobody said good bye but I felt like they were in my head talking to me.  Must have been telepathy!  Breakfast was ok but the alien experience was great.  Maybe they have some dishes from their home planet that they would like to share with us earthlings.  Like moons over my home planet.

2pIbmIRyN1e5M-MNLMgRVg.text: I finally made it to the breakfast club! The food was delicious and the place was gorgeous.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Conscious Breakfast

fRE5m5tjqIECh6f8Nm2AQg.text: My husband and I try to eat at the Breakfast Club a few times a month.  Love this place!   I'm a real breakfast fan and therefore look for good breakfast places whenever I travel, which is often.  The Breakfast Club remains one of my favorites.  Love the BC Breakfast Sandwich and the Breakfast Grilled Cheese.  The service has always been excellent and though there is often a wait, it's worth it. They are also more than happy to modify a dish to your specifications.  I typically order one of the large mimosas and the only criticism is that the orange juice is a little bitter, however I attribute that to the fact they used fresh squeezed juice which is worth the trade off.

A8fhVeO4Dy5GlaAE3UjwyQ.text: The name of this reminded me of the 80's but with all of the yoga attire being worn by the staff it is anything but. Very nice decor with an extremely friendly staff. They have a wide variety of choices from drink to food. We enjoyed a Mexican style breakfast that was very good without as long of a wait as expected. Everything tasted fresh and just the right portion. The fruit that came with each meal was very tasty and a pleasant way to end the meal.

79u8L5oYWti2DfQJRFcHow.text: This place was suggested by a friend who said this place was great. Came here with another friend while visiting AZ from San Diego, friend from North Carolina. We sat down and was greeted promptly by our server. We had drinks brought right away.  I really liked the fresh OJ. I order the Turkey Bene. I thought it was realy good! The turkey was very juicy along with the hollandaise and and poached egg. The fruit was a little too ripe but no biggy.   I thought this place had a good vibe to it. I'd definitely go back and see what the servers think is the best thing to get. :-)  Overall maybe 4.5 stars.

1XnU-5BwC0wAXTyhvJyDsA.text: Love this place! aside from the wait on the weekends, we had an amazing meal. We will be back.

YAjQOvufIYt-GiChHb2EZA.text: The food is great however just like the other Breakfast Club location in downtown Phoenix, the service was so-so. I would recommend anyone to go here but anticipate at least a 20 minute wait at this location on the weekends.

2t-oiCf7NivMHcCqQYRCgQ.text: Oh Scottsdale, you never fail to amaze me. Honest to God the entire staff had a nice orange glow to them straight from the tanning bed. Plus you even get attitude from the wait staff, I mean really?   At any rate we sat at the "bar" and the "bartender" gave us our Cokes to-go, which was a really nice surprise.

cTcxxMGHqxDa9q4-S7L_ag.text: The best american breakfast i've ever had, hands down.  Great service, great coffee, great start to the day.  Better than any place I've been to in college towns or new york city(where I'm from)  The pancakes(with bananas foster) were out of this world and went great with the quick start loaded breakfast.

6KO3FG88bHrexukTGgArrw.text: I don't usually write reviews, but felt compelled to after experiencing how rude the staff was on multiple occasions. I have lived in AZ my whole life and have eaten at the Breakfast Club pretty regularly. The past three times I have been the staff was extremely rude. After this last time, we decided we will no longer be eating at the Breakfast Club anymore, especially considering there are many other great breakfast places with pleasant staff.

MiBY37LzMDNaaC6ahCY5jw.text: Amazing ambiance and a fun place to meet with friends. Tons of tables so the wait is never too long.

opydurZkIRTQ_SXdaylL0A.text: The food is good but not spectacular.  At 10:00am on a weekday, I'm not sure if it's worth the 25 minutes wait.  They do have alcoholic breakfast drinks.  So if you want a mimosa, head down there.

4v_TjO4v3O-n8TEUZ752bA.text: The wait was long even on a Tuesday morning, but we sat at the bar and got fast, friendly service. The biscuits and gravy were good. Had the coconut iced coffee which was delicious and huge. The bacon was thick and crispy. The potatoes were fresh and overall the food was a great value for the money. Great breakfast option.

6lSEGwRbNtkPW0ehQmrVog.text: I love going out for breakfast, but there are a couple of reasons I won't go back here.  First of all, too expensive.  My girlfriend and I each had eggs benedict and coffees, and it was 40 bucks!  Second reason, the portions are huge.  I am always disappointed to see such huge portions coming out of a professional kitchen, because I realize how much food is headed toward the trash bin each day.  If you must serve such huge portions, please advise on the menu ahead of time.    The most important reason I won't head back here...  unripened fruit as a garnish on my plate.  Just serve me what's in season please.  If it is in season, a tomato in summer for example, please make sure it's fresh, local, and ripe.  I was shocked when the waitress asked me if I wanted to add tomato to my dish and then she served me a hard, barely pink slice of tomato.  It's in season people!  Where did this tomato come from, South America?

3KR32jYlal8oMtajl6KsNQ.text: Excellent.    Good service. Food was great. Nice outside setting.   Would suggest for everyone to visit.

JyV4D1mxaYnMOuhvtl_dvQ.text: Food was good and plentiful.  Had breakfast burrito with green chili sauce - pretty darn good.  The wait and seating is a crapshoot as some that came after got seated before us.

QjGENUj-BFwS9LGDzGs9wQ.text: When you're looking for a big breakfast or brunch to devour in the Old Town Scottsdale neighborhood, this is one club you'll want to belong to. Now, although you don't have to actually own a membership to this club, you may feel like you need to belong to some of Scottsdale's "downtown elite" to visit this joint.  If you're looking for good breakfast food - hearty omelets with fruit and potatoes or wonderfully aromatic pancakes - then this place is for you. They have a great menu of plates, and you can tell that people line up for the flavor. I've had several omelets of theirs, with my most recent dish being overeasy huevos with a salsa-style ranchero sauce over jalapeno cornbread. It was delicious albeit heavy because of the cornbread - a truly savory Southwestern dish.   The Breakfast Club is usually filled with a mix of Scottsdale residents, hungover ASU students, and out-of-place-out-of-towners. But the majority is Scottsdale's old town elite - which include the entitled teens and young "adults" of the city. It's an interesting spot to go people watching at, because you get to see some diversity and laid back attitudes amidst the pretentiousness of Scottsdale.  I actually would have given this place a fifth star if the hostess hadn't made a mistake on her seating list. My diner friend and I put our names on the list and went next door to the shops to kill time...30 minutes after our return (standing outside, right in front of the hostess), we asked if we would be seated anytime soon - because it had been 20 minutes past our quoted time, and we were told that we had been taken off the list. I guess the hostess assumed that our walking away meant that we wouldn't wait - but we never said that. So the beginning of our brunch was an annoying bummer...but I guess that's what you get when you're surrounded by a city of plastic and makeup instead of logic.

9oNkqa-tk6wJrLAPvmVhvw.text: Went here for breakfast during MLB spring training. It was busy, but that was expected because I'm pretty sure that's the busiest time of the year for Scottsdale. We yelped this place before-hand and walked over here from our hotel, checked out the menu and decided to go with this place. The wait to be seated was about 15 minutes. The place itself was super cozy. They had a little barista in the back to grab coffee while you waited.   I ordered the Bello Bene which was their vegetarian option for the eggs benedict. It had portabella mushroom, hollandaise, and bordelaise sauce on an english muffin with of course eggs. Yum, the sauces were delicious. My mouth waters when I think about it. It also comes with homestyle potatoes and cantaloupe. I was craving a waffle, so I ordered a regular belgian waffle with just butter and syrup...$7. A little on the pricey side for a regular ass waffle if you ask me, but regardless it was good.  Would I come here again? Sure. It was better than US egg (another breakfast spot in Scottsdale). It was also very convenient, within walking distance from our hotel and to the stadium.

80qEcWHm8Vg-e2ByJOip9A.text: I have been to The Breakfast Club on several occassion and have never been entirely impressed. I'm not much for going to a restaurant to see and be seen. I go to eat! The restaurant is small and the outdoor seating is placed in the middle of a fairly busy Scottsdale sidewalk. The wait is usually long and there isn't much room to wait without feeling like you are in the way of a waitress.  Their breakfast potatoes are very good but the entrees have left me a bit unsatisfied. My lunch experience has been better in that the Buffalo Mozz Salad is worth going back for if you're in the neighborhood. It  offers a large portion of caprese salad with a heaping pile of mixed greens. Yum!  All-in-all... a decent meal but often too busy with beautiful people to be worth the wait.

kTQtph2a_3VtAZB28LdGwg.text: Odd place.  The employees are clearly disgruntled,  beginning with the hostess; and thats not a generalization. Its obvious that the mood is dismal and that is reflected in the food; quality and presentation.  Absolutely not worth the wait.  There are lots of wonderful options within a couple of blocks .... Do yourself a favor and pass the Breakfast Club by.

orczuS7PYPGEGVkckxCjkA.text: We waited about 45 minutes for table, not including calling ahead 10 minutes before arriving.   After waiting so long I was really excited to eat, unfortunately the food was really nothing special. I would recommend staying away from the crab benedict which tasted fishy and obviously came from a can. The strawberry pancakes were good and overall the portions were very big. The service was ok but nothing great. Our waitress maybe smiled once which is cool, but don't act all put out when I remind you about that side of bacon you forgot.   I'm completely baffled as to why anyone would wait for 45 minutes for The Breakfast Club. I don't think we'll be heading back.

VS0p3BlQumafRdEpWkTsEw.text: Popular, busy, and delicious!  I had a ham and cheese omelet and my daughter had 2 egg whites and a buckwheat waffle with fresh fruit. They were amazing. The waffle was light, fluffy, and flavorful. Service was great and our waitress was very friendly!  Allow for a 30 minute wait but breakfast came within 15 minutes.  Well worth it!

70lAdlimVXydyQuVuicDPA.text: So I don't usually write reviews unless I'm very annoyed or super impressed. Right now I'm very annoyed. Let me start out by saying that the food is good. So I came in and was waiting on my boyfriend, I asked for a booth because he had back surgery. The lady told me yes that they had an open booth waiting for me, to let her know when he got here I said ok and that I could go ahead and sit because we were in a hurry that I was going to order our food. She insisted that this wasn't possible that they had a policy that didn't let me sit until my whole party was here. I understand that if there is a huge party but he was down the road and we were in a rush. So this booth sat empty until he got here. Seems a little ridiculous to go out of your way to make sure you didn't provide a little convenience to someone. I'm more likely to go down the road to morning squeeze or chop shop than back here. Not impressed breakfast club.

wdCZinq7e8PKB-UbJFkamQ.text: The food was good, but the coffee was horrible. I got the loaded breakfast (2 eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, and fruit). Good portion and decent price, but, if you like coffee, this isn't the place to go.

7VyS4yWuqAbrKZM4cePKpQ.text: Good food and the new ambiance is nice. Not a lot of vegetarian options but they have some delicious food. Make your own breakfast burrito is a good value.

C5V2EN750y1kmUYI74MKSw.text: Love it here, after their big remodel the wait isn't as long. The eggs are always fluffy, the side of fruit always good. Coffee is dark/bold and always fresh. The fried potatoes are delish and if you are in the mood for comfort food classic, my fave grilled cheese and tomato soup is right here, and I don't even like tomato soup!

F7HDtRYvq4QOjwWuSf2KOw.text: I had the Belgian Buckwheat waffles and they were cooked to perfection!   Crispy on the outside with butter! Coffee was delicious.  You need to go to know!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HjITW-eTzRrx4qq3q450Jg.text: PREPARE TO WAIT!!!!  i'm not gonna lie-the service is great and the breakfast is really good too-i usually make my own omlett but have also had the salmon lox on a bagel w cream cheese, their yogurt and granola w berries, pancakes...Basically i've had a l lot of food there! haha.  The only thing is that it's never anything SUPER SPECIAL to have that kind of a wait.  Most of the time i drive by to see if it's packed or not-if i wanna go in, and 8/10 times its a line out the door.    But i will say this-it's super consistent.  i've never had a bad order or anything like that and it is reasonably priced as well-so if you don't mind waiting for breakfast-give it a try!

9bnI1DwvzTLTpQ5VXqetlA.text: This place is yum-tastic.  Only got to visit twice while staying in Scottsdale but I WILL be back!  The jalapeno biscuits and gravy were so awesome my fiancee and I had to get it twice although I wish I would've had time to come again and try something else.  Service was OK.  The waitress was not outgoing or welcoming, she gave us a weird vibe.  Loved that eating outside wasn't too loud with the traffic.

iXjJMBmqxrdD6jLMezpClg.text: Love it. Attractive place with good food at fair prices. Went there more than once when we were in town.

gzcEEhXoCTUGWLxj6gZxUQ.text: I've eaten here 3 or 4 times and my second to last experience was not good and I hadn't been back in awhile. However, a friend wanted to meet up there and have breakfast this morning so I decided to give it another try. To my disappointment the 2nd chance experience was just as terrible as my first bad experience if not worse. I don't feel bad for writing this negative review either because my friend (who suggested the place) was appalled as well by our time there.  If you only have 20-30 minutes to grab a bite to eat then I would recommend this place. Other than that I won't be coming here again. Try the Orange Table for better food and better service. Upon my arrival I went to the host stand where two girls were present. I requested a table for 2 and the blond RUDELY informed me that they didn't sit incomplete parties. I have no problem with that, I work at a restaurant with the same policy but the tone of voice of how you tell people is always key and hers was definitely rude. When we finally got sat there was miscommunication between the two girls working and it was clear that the brunette hostess was having a serious problem with her fellow blond coworker. My friend and I shook it off and were simply happy to be sitting at a table with our hopes of breakfast on the way.  The service started out ok, but because we're servers as well my friend and I were prompt in ordering and made it easy. Food was out quickly which was nice but I wasn't pleased with the quality as I have been times before. My omelette was extremely oily, which is never something you want especially when you order an eggwhite veggie omelette, and my potatoes were undercooked. The fruit was mostly what I ate. After about 15- 20 minutes of dining our server came over and dropped off the check. My friend and I were both not even half way through our breakfast, forks full with the next bite, and our server Bethany didn't even offer us anything else while my coffee sat 3/4 empty awaiting a refill (which I finally had to ask someone else for). We were a little put off that she dropped the check so soon and we both felt rushed. After another ten minutes Bethany came back and offered us coffees to go. A nice gesture but the fact that we hadn't even touched the check and were still eating simply stated that she wanted us gone. We looked around the restaurant wondering if they were waiting on our table for something but noticed that there were 3 or 4 empty table around us and nobody waiting by the host stand so we didn't think so. Upon checking my watch I noticed that we hadn't even been there 45 minutes.  We continued to enjoy what we could of our breakfast but at this point we felt so rushed that we sat there til the last second possible before we had to go. This experience fell hand in hand with my last negative experience where I was literally told to leave by the busser after an hour and a half because people were waiting. Like I said I'm a server myself but these people are so eager to turn tables that it simply takes the enjoyment out of going out to breakfast and having a nice meal with a fancy mimosa. If I do go to the Breakfast Club again it will be at there downtown location but that will be no time soon. If you're in Old Town looking for a good breakfast joint save the rushed feeling that they put on you and enjoy it somewhere else like the Orange Table or Morning Squeeze. Even Daily Dose right down the road have good breakfast! The BC just isn't worth it any more.

pVNq-KbuNmdu6ZNdF8zm8Q.text: Ok... So I am a sucker for a great breakfast joint that isn't some huge national chain.  Maybe it's the fact that orange county seriously lacks many good breakfast joint option.  Secondly, the fact that they have dog friendly patio service elevates the place in my book.  Our trips to Scottsdale aren't complete until we make a stop here for breakfast.  The portions are huge!  The surprising part is that the food is good, which is not usually the case with places with places that do large portions (usually hoping that size covers up the taste).  With their Mexican options such as the breakfast burrito or huevos ranchero... They knock the cover off the ball.  The green chil pork in the huevos rancheros is fantastic and keeps me coming back for it.

quGwqLRsdaHJKsApZ1gjvg.text: Great place for breakfast!  Our aerver, Julia, was friendly and attentive, the menu offers a good selection, coffee is tasty and served piping hot, OJ is freshly squeezed, and our omelets were made perfectly!

r84krexd_PZiNjvU4ZYCIw.text: Outdoor seating for breakfast was great.  Food came quickly and was delicious.  Great waitperson too

-74h9SCcyKshhc4rLuI_4g.text: This place was AMAZING. I came here during my Spring Training trip for breakfast and it definitely hit the spot. Be ready to spend some time with their menu; there's a lot of great choices and some are pretty creative. Service was A+ I don't think we had to ask for anything the entire time. Portions are huge and definitely filling. To top it all off we got to meet some players too. This definitely a must visit for breakfast in Scottsdale and we will definitely be back next year for Spring Training!

8_jUtAWJ_S1e9nixUUDi5A.text: Always fresh always good. Servers are nice. This place knows how to cook bacon properly. Restrooms are clean. Good solid breakfast choice.

rc7S4oN7AffcOND9MPT4GQ.text: Food was good. Restaurant was way too loud. I was there at 11am on a Thursday.  I asked the server to please turn the music down. Nothing was done, so I asked the server and the employee behind the counter to please turn the music down. The employee behind the counter (bar area) stated that she turned the music 'way' down.  I could not tell any difference in the noise level. I was very polite.  I returned to my seat. The server came next to me to take our food order. I spoke in a normal tone when ordering.  Ironically,  she asked me to repeat my order because she could not hear me. She was standing right next to me.  I again was very polite throughout my entire  time there. The open concept of the restaurant adds to the noise level.  The restaurant was busy, however the loud music level contributed to the noise level. I do enjoy the type of music that was playing, but I also enjoy speaking to the other people in my party.

YQ9_UXeopJjasA5TwUziDQ.text: Everything was excellent except the coffee.  Didn't seem to match the quality of food.

ksnmQCH6u5P80oWKffFiwA.text: The banana fosters pancakes are a decadent dessert for breakfast.  When we travel we like to spoil ourselves and go out to breakfast.  The Breakfast Club is a fun place with an 80s vibe.  It has outdoor seating and is dog friendly.  Which is one of the main reasons why we go because our little pup can join us.    There's an extensive breakfast menu and full coffee bar to choose from.  My husband had the huevos ranchero, which he loved.  The Banana Fosters Pancakes were good - but you have to be in the mood for sweet and indulgent.  It's topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  I have also had the Challah French Toast. It was too sweet and rich for me but I know it's would be a favorite amongst the kids.  It's a place that we'll revisit again.

op-Cd2N0QuPcDAcZox7i5w.text: Robo hostesses... went there for lunch, asked for a table for two and a third would be joining us shortly (they were parking).  Hostesses  wouldn't seat us because of policy whole party needs to be there which I understand if it was for a party of 6 and only two of us were there.  We waited a few minutest then decided to sit anyways and at least start with coffees for the two of us.  The hostess  relented and said she would seat us but we'd have to wait to order until our third got there.  Kept saying..."its our policy".  Walked out and went across the street... apparently hostess doesn't realize there are lots of choices in downtown Scottsdale.  Sadly, the wait staff are great there just hostesses need more training.  As marketing guru Seth Godin might say... some people just don't know why they are in business.  Its not about them or "policy" its about getting and keeping customers.

Mh5jdk2vQOXZOeQZc8tRyg.text: Is this where aspiring porno stars go to be seen and discovered? Besides LA, I've never been surrounded by so many silicon-chested, orange-fleshed, platinum blondes before in my life. It's like I've been transported into a really bad tv show hybrid of Real Housewives and Real Sex.   Anyway, when I could unglue my eyes from Ms. Chestica McBlondie next to me, I had an omelette with turkey, boursin cheese, and avocado. Overall, the food was pretty good, but I just couldn't focus on the food. The sillicon balloons all around me had my full, undivided attention. Man, guys must love this place.

dtqKK4aMYjO5quSNPFZiJQ.text: The following of this place kills me... Im from northern California where this place would be average.. but in Scottsdale.. its considered the bomb! OKAY.. some things I LOVE.. such as the eggs benedict.. its worth the splurge..but I get the hollandaise sauce (with a hint of chipolte in the mix) on the side... The coffee is strong and I love it! They carry the sugar in the raw, 'stevia'.. that rates high with me, even though somewhere in Cali that would not be a special thing..but I love the small things when I get them in AZ. Ive had their huevos rancheros.. wont do that again.. its not like any Ive had before.. so give the chef a 'A' for going the creative way on the rancheros! BUT after a nite at the W.. it made me feel not great.. its overpowered in sauce... and the tortilla covering the bowl was weird to me.. too much.  BUT again, I give it 3 stars bc for here its a great place to grab any kind of breakfast you want.. Challah french toast, pancakes, coffee bar.. and still watch the cutesy Scottsdale---ites.. weekends plan to wait!

GIWQJIBMAFCbCOeSCCt9YA.text: I effing LOVE TBC.  Located smack dab in the middle of "the scene" its Truely the best breakfast place in town.  Apparently its the thing to do to actually shower and change from the night before prior to arriving so you can watch the rest of us stumble in looking like hell.  Whatever.  While you wait for a table (and you WILL wait for a table), sit outside on the patio and people watch some of Scottsdale's finest.    The Breakfast club isnt all about being the "it" place to be though, its also about the food.  Those of you who just came from the gym might want to try the egg white veggie omelet or the best oatmeal this side of the Mississip...  Those of us nursing a killer hangover might stick to the cinnamon challah french toast, benedict-style eggs, or belgian waffles...  You'll never want your loser boyfriend to make you breakfast in bed again.  Lunch at TBC is round two of fabulousness.  Salads, sandwiches, sweet potato fries...  I'm suddenly starving.  Dont let the line or the wave of D&G sunglasses outside deter you from waiting for the best meal of the week at the Breakfast Club.

-1ejwSW5A8erYFo3fptz-A.text: My mom recently visited and wanted to have breakfast in old town Scottsdale (she love's cowboys ) We decided The Breakfast club looked nice , having breakfast on a awsome patio just seemed perfect for a sunday morning .  I ordered a omlete WOW ! That's all I can say its huge , really enough to share , my mom ordered steak and eggs she was pleased .  I am going back !  That's a promise :)

ESqJeJMdET26sEFiZv-Eog.text: MEH.   One would think that this place would (and could) pay homage to the cult film, The Breakfast Club. But when you see the interior, you immediately notice how bare the walls are. The rest of the decor is plain and boring, too. This places looks like something you'd find in Terminal D of an airport. MEH.   Service is spotty. My lunch date and and I ended up having to ask permission to sit somewhere, since nobody acknowledge our entrance and earnest appraisal - where do we sit? do we wait to be seated?   The menu offers a range of things to pick from, though don't expect to be blown away by your options. They are of "average" variety. Sure, some looked intriguing, like the eggs benedict with crab.   Of course, we had coffee. This would be, in my opinion, the best thing they offer. All I needed was a little cream and presto... the coffee was delish!  For lunch I ordered a chicken sandwich with bacon, with a side of sweet potato fries. Of the latter, I ate about 20. Just okay. I ate 1/2 the sandwich and noted that I could have easily made this at home. My date commented that he was expecting his sandwich on dark marble rye. While the food was okay, it wasn't great. And considering I hadn't yet eaten all day (and this was 2 p.m.) you would think that an average sandwich would taste like the tears of Jesus by this point. Nope. It was merely MEH.   I have no reason to go back here.

e09MhZdYv04pFxAcCfZ-GQ.text: I was SOOOO EXCITED to eat here.  For realz.  I love breakfast foods.  Of all kinds.  But I would rather eat at IHOP than this place.  Honestly.  I've tried all their variations on the eggs benedict, and found them all to be so disgusting they bordered on inedible.  A friend of mine insists that I should return to this place and order a "sweet" breakfast, but I'm scared and very hesitant to ever eat here again.

Lsjscq2didCfl5cz_x3itw.text: Breakfast places are my thing. Once I find one that I enjoy, forgetaboutit. It could be my coffee addiction. But all the same, a place that does a great cup of coffee and breakfast gets high marks in my portfolio.  Candidly, The Breakfast Club always intimidated me - the crowd that is there all day long. Because, let's be honest, if a place is THAT crowded all the time, it has to be fantastic, right? I didn't get it, for the longest time...then there was Eli.   I sidled up to the coffee bar, a nervous wreck. I wasn't sure if this was a place I could eat, drink, both, or if it was for Take Out (by the way, its all of the above). And, I started to ask questions. Eli is his name. It seems that he runs this joint on the weekends and he's got one hell of an ear (read: don't gossip about anyone or anything) and a smarty-pants sense of humor; but, he was open to questions and he lead me through all the ins and outs of the Breakfast Club.   My biggest piece(s) of advise: Use The Boards. They are not just for decor and their kitchen will make anything for you. Make your own omelette. Add a side of green chili to anything. Order a drink from Eli on a weekend day. Sit at the back bar and eat, read your paper, eat your Lox, and have a second cappuccino. Is it perfect? Is anyone? Probably not, but now that I've seen how they intended the restaurant to be used, I understand the crowd and I'm one of the many that will return...

O_CoPqEdGmvvwjHuoceqnw.text: We came on a Saturday and they were super busy even at 1pm.  We waited for a little bit for a table, but the food came out quickly.  We ordered the eggs benedict which was very good.  The egg was a little too runny for my taste (the yolk just gushed out when cut), but the hollandaise was scrumptious.  The best was the nutty waffle!  Sweet, but not overly so.  Candied nuts on a hot crispy yet soft waffle. Delicious.  I'll be back to try some other waffles!

UpSsHINPJZDbwJE9-r4TIQ.text: This should  be a 4 - 5 star place but I can only bring myself to give it 3 - 4 stars. I am an omelet FREAK and I love that The Breakfast Club lets you build your own...HOWEVER...even when I picked the perfect arrangement of ingredients the omelet was only okay.  I was also annoyed at the long wait when tables were empty. Oh - and the hostess was kind of a biatch too. And our waitress NEVER re-filled my drink. Hate that.  Hmmm... Now I'm remembering why only 3 stars.  I'll have to go back again and see...

yK7AUxH7OBQkjgZMauEs8w.text: Big kudos for serving breakfast late in Scottsdale (unlike, ahem, the Orange Table, which stops the pancakes before 10 a.m.). But would I go back? Only for the pomegranate smoothie.   Otherwise, it was pretty bland stuff. Ironically, the menu looks uber creative, but the execution? Not so much. Case in point: the ballyhooed cinnamon challah french toast was dried out and had no custardy center at all, plus the side of scrambled eggs was also extremely dry.   Servers were OK, though seemed very not thrilled to be there. In the end, that's a fair attitude, I guess, since neither were we.

DZFPStgxUaXOQs8AgMbZiA.text: I know lots of people love this place, but I had the WORST blueberry pancakes I've ever had here.    You know when you just have a jonesing for nice fluffy pancakes and you HAVE to get a fix?  Well, sadly I made the mistake of coming here.  The blueberries were *tiny* and the blueberry compote on top had a nasty saccharin-ish taste to it.  The service?  Uh, forget it.  We waited about 15 minutes before we were even acknowledged.    I see the lines of people waiting outside on my way to church on Sundays, but I just don't get the appeal.

gb3Lw27-us1qwlEWhGvdGg.text: I have never had anything bad here from the breakfast menu. It it much more spacious since the renovation! If you wait a little it is okay because they always get your food out fast making up for it. The have great frozen coffee. Try the toffee nut:) Although we live clear on the opposite side of town we like to stop here first before other errands in the area.

SM9TGmJgxcyYE31oUz5Kew.text: Breakfast Club is one of my favorite weekend hangover cures. One of the reasons I like it is because they DON'T have a bar, so there's no possible way for me to order a mimosa or screwdriver. Sometimes the best way to live a healthier life is to just avoid the temptation all together.   I've been going to Breakfast Club for years, so this review is based on several visits, not one particular experience. A lot of people dog on this place for being too "Snottsdale" (and I've surely seen that attitude SOME of the time), but overall, I've had good experiences here.   First off, great bacon....thick and yummy. I suggest ordering a side order when you first sit down (you know...as a "breakfast appetizer"). Second, good coffee. Last, last but not least, the food. I LOVE their breakfast burrito and can't seem to order anything else. I recommend it "Monster Style," smothered in pork green chile and chorizo queso. Then, I recommend that you walk about 5 miles to stave off heart failure. It's a lot of food.

psK63wwx7Sny6V-WfVT2LA.text: Great People watching and good food in oldtown!

vyBdSDDgWixP5JQXrs2JWQ.text: We had Brekky here on Sunday morn. It was a small wait which I filled the time enjoying the awesome Bloody Mary I ordered. The Egg Benedict was the best ever and I loved the Obrians. I recently moved here from Seattle WA and am a Chef who has been in search of a fave place for breakfast, I think I found it. It is a noisy bustling place so you have to be able to hang.

6HQSmSqmC2Qto9j_MqdMZQ.text: I went here on a Tuesday morning about a month ago for the first time. I've passed by on the weekends and because it was always packed never stopped in. Finally it looked not too busy but it was still a little busy! Our waitress was friendly and prompt. The V12 tomato juice made in house was one of the best things I've tasted. The omelette I got was delicious, the fruit was fresh and service was very nice. I can't wait to go back for some more delicious food!

PothBqclIl-jjIg6yvvihA.text: Went for breakfast with a friend and everything was really good! I would definitely recommend their white chocolate mocha!

_i8xCZMKJu9ocV8IfspSrQ.text: Great, quick breakfast two days in a row.  Sat at the bar on a Tues and Wed back-to-back for a great experience both times.  The staff was attentive, the Quick Start was great with perfectly prepared eggs and bacon.  Nice TVs with morning news and markets. Highly recommended!

38v5PMljCm87lFsECFq91A.text: We came in from Chicago and we're looking for something different from the typical room service breakfast that's cost you an arm and a leg. So we got on Yelp and found this wonderful place! All I'm going to say is the Breakfast Club is awesome! Great service, great atmosphere and solid menu! Definitely a new spot for us when we come to Scottsdale!!!

EepAGeFZMAORsmGmxcIeew.text: Very modern place.  Good food.  Had breakfast: -Potatoes ok. Could have been cooked more. Not great.  -enjoyed variety of dishes. Had proteins, fruit, & veggies.  -Hollandaise sauce ok, but tasted too much like cheddar cheese.  Noise level: Loud, but great for noisy kids like our kids.   -Service good. Nothing above & beyond.  Overall, good, but not awesome!

OTPo6GijzCJFzNPH1E3vQA.text: My favorite breakfast place! Everything I have ordered was great! Love the waffles and fruit. Coffee is great, and there are fresh squeezed juices to go with your meal.

21cjPi072Q_XSB-u6jUEGg.text: Here's a GREAT choice...$17 buys anything on the menu (tip included). Sample the blueberry pancakes with a hearty side of their bone-in ham steak, bottomless cup of coffee & you're set for the day. Service is ALWAYS prompt & courteous. Conveniently located in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale.

MdrZE5xyadyz0pIpOIngNw.text: The service could have been A LOT better. I felt like we were pushed to the side and forgotten about. Honestly, the service has never been that great but, I keep coming back because the food is absolutely amazing. I will continue to come back despite the service. I highly recommend the BC french toast with fresh berries and walnuts! Mmm! My stars are for the food... NOT the service!

huCfanj6nwZNyPoZMLHmgQ.text: I've been to the Breakfast Club several times now and it just gets worse and worse. The only thing this place has going for it is the cheap breakfast cocktails and you're gonna need one if you want to stomach the food.  Firstly it is expensive. Secondly it is greasy when it feels like they claim to be a health type restaurant. Thirdly they have messed up my order almost every single time. Often things are missing that I asked for or cheese on an omelet isn't melted - that's just plain unappetizing! There are plenty of other breakfast places in the surrounding area that are more worth your while. Skip this place and go elsewhere!

vegMY51uxg-tuDW1Z8jqTQ.text: Because of the positive reviews, I stupidly tried this place for the third time. I feel as though sitting t the counter was bothersome to the wait staff.  They barely spoke, and trying to get a second cup of coffee was met with rolling eyes as I interrupted their own discussions about a date night. Limited coffee was fine as it did taste like dishwater.  And really - it is only an egg, not worth the pretentiousness.

DIvyeLEoKxYwmFo1nsueIQ.text: Great place. Had the breakfast Burrito. My wife and I go here on our birthdays. The food is always good and the staff friendly.

6NVauJShIga9EJQOxTzr1Q.text: It's the only possible explanation for this place. Why would anyone spend ten minutes looking for a parking spot a half mile away, stand in line for forty-five minutes among a gaggle of droopy-eyed young people whose faces are wearing the previous night's story, only to have the effort rewarded with extremely slow service and mediocre food?  I think it's called "misery loves company."  Well I'm pretty miserable most mornings, but I don't feel the need to make my miserable worse by standing in a line gawking at others equally as miserable, eating food that's miserable, and becoming even more miserable after my server, who I think may be related to David Copperfield, mysteriously vanishes, only to reappear with a smile and a check.   Here's a tip Breakfast Club. Hangovers require water. Lots and lots of water.

A1SA6AfJ41cAP5uwoERhzw.text: The best breakfast spot in Arizona!! I try to go at least once a week. Make sure to try the bacon too :)

elSiNfWkM7neY_9k-NQ_zw.text: ugghhhhh Breakfast club-  why did you change the most homey, comforting, warm breakfast spots in the Phoenix area??? "WHY"  Grandiose visions- now it' cold and corporate!    the locals are just programmed- sheep!  I loved you so 8 months ago before you sold out!    at least your coffee is still the bomb!  You just went off my top ten list.  What the hell do I even need to visit Scottsdale anymore for ;(
