GCF1cMvS2RPzmuVq1YGq6w.text: The food here is pretty good (nothing to write home about, as my boyfriend would say) but OH EM GEE they have THE BEST hot chocolate!!! I want to shout from the rooftops how much I love it & if I ever won the lottery, I would buy everyone a hot chocolate from here.  So yeah, try the hot chocolate.

jQ47mv4UPwBmH5n6w1RnQQ.text: Great place. Have been there every few weeks with with my brother and nieces. It has been perfect every time. Love the dog friendly and very nice staff. We also love the green tea. Would recommend any time.

NQY4_B9Nabb7or8viW3K9Q.text: This place is my go-to every weekend. Their BC iced coffee is incredible and the eggs Benedict is good. Get there before 10AM if you don't want to have a wait.

TmeXcq3N1NxM0nInju-6RA.text: I ordered the breakfast grilled cheese sandwich. It was delicious. Big enough to split, since I don't eat big breakfasts. For a breakfast place, I was kind of expecting a bigger menu. However, I'm not that let down since I liked what I ate. I really like that there is alcohol here for a day I might come back with friends for mimosas with brunch.

ddkmDld6bkuz4ldf9Eh2tg.text: Great food and cocktails.   Would definitely visit again.   I had a cocktail made with cold brew coffee and it was so tasty.

7yXFOjXtFM5IVviovMFMlw.text: We have visited the Breakfast Club several times over the years when visiting Scottsdale and now winter here.  We always looked forward to our visit.  My wife and I recently had breakfast here - the famous French toast covered with fruit and nuts.  We waited an hour for our seat.  This is understandable on a Saturday morning.  The service was very good, the coffee expensive, and the famous French toast had dropped in size and quality.  The fruit was skimpy as well.  We left thinking we are "over" the Breakfast Club and there are several better places for breakfast in the Valley.  When visiting with close friends who live nearby us, they shared that they had independently come to the same conclusion a few weeks ago after a visit there.  I don't think we will need to review this place again.

CXakQ4s4lbyzK1j7H_TgSg.text: Looking to grab a light lunch in Scottsdale so dropped in here......major disappointment! Ordered eggs Benedict and a BLT with sweet potato fries  The poached eggs were COLD...not room temp but refrigerator cold! The sweet potato fries were not hot but closer to room temp. Waitress offered to bring another eggs bene but didn't want to wait or bother so said no thanks but bring new fries  The new fries were piping hot but they charged us for a side of fries! Needless to say we'll never go back and neither should you!

-A_QUe_2BSOb2DpbSqwLpQ.text: Omg! By far my favorite breakfast place in Scottsdale! I'm here on vacation and they have the best food!   Wait was long and we had a big party but the staff was very good about keeping us updated on our table and timing and when people are leaving.   Service was incredible! Our server was so nice, informative, helpful and fast! 8 of us got in an out in a little over and hour!   Food was delicious! I made a create your own breakfast burrito and it came with potatoes and fruit. Perfect size and portion.   I would come here every time I visit!!!

P6B9gEpcA__TGu7yBcFZ4Q.text: The food is always very good. The service is hit and miss. Often you are the second or third most important task of the server. Once you get their attention and order,  you will enjoy the strong breakfast menu. The masa is great!

MVwST08Vc915XDa61edA8g.text: Great atmosphere in the heart of Scottsdale! Also the service was great and very fast paced. I must say though that the food is just average and no different than any other breakfast joint. Nothing stood out that said "wow" I must wait for a long time to nourish my body with that goodness. Unfortunately, just average breakfast fare. On the upside you can use the yelp app to be put on the waitlist to reduce your wait time before you even get to the restaurant. All in all, its not bad. Just average.

689iAxzW7lFki5a37Dbivw.text: Excellent ambiance. Lively place, courteous staff, nice assortment on the menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Cfuh4tCpiMIVvZi_0r5cBg.text: Had breakfast for the first time during a staycation at a local resort. Very similar vibe to snooze. However, no wait and food was just as good. Looked on no wait to assess wait time. We got seated immediately upon arrival. With a party of 5, seating was comfortable. Service was great and attentive. Had the quick start and it was a solid breakfast. We would definitely come back again.

LJOWaTBtDn3hHDYnmAP7xw.text: One of if not the best breakfast joints in the Valley of the Sun. It is a must. Come hungry leave happy.  Fun funky place well worth the wait. From the time you walk in to the time you leave. Just a fun place with GREAT food and service.

hKFBJMEuzwHB1aOFVR4EWQ.text: Horrible experience Breakfast Club.  I wish I could provide them with a lower rating! When we checked in we were told our wait would be 30-40 minutes for a party of 8 at 8:30 am. While waiting we saw several people walk in and were seated and it seemed the hostess did not have a plan for us to be seated and did not communicate with us at all, despite standing 5 feet from them.  We were "next" at about 45 minutes into our wait. At 1 hour and 10 minutes, hostess said a table was about to be ready for us and it would be about ten more minutes. Nearly an hour and half into the wait the manager came over but it was to late as we had reached 1.5 hours and our entire party was hangry!  Still there was no table available and no communication about their plan for us. Breakfast Club displayed NO CUSTOMER SERVICE today!  Kyle-Not sure what your hostess/staff reported, but to be crystal clear our entire party was present from the moment we arrived at your restaurant at 8:30.  They should just own up to their failure to be customer focused. Like I mentioned in my review, your staff showed NO customer service as we were the ones who initiated all communication regarding our status on your wait list. At the time we left your establishment, we were the only group standing 5 feet from your hostess stand; they knew how long we had waited!

RQb0baNMjBlX1WqQeQMO-g.text: Scottsdale has many great spots for Brunch, but the menu was too tempting not to stop here. Don't be too intimidated by the wait; there's a reason why everyone is at this place! The inside and outside seating options were nice for a sunny, March morning. Peruse the menu of creative breakfast options; you won't be disappointed!  Don't forget to check out the breakfast cocktails menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos con Masa- 2 eggs on chipotle cornbread covered in chorizo queso, served with potatoes o&#39;brien and fresh fruit.

V9f5kUNXk99fvRXgpNJu_g.text: Very nice breakfast with solid customer service. But the best part was the reservation system integrated within yelp. Getting in line before I got there made a real difference in my overall experience.    The food was delicious and server was incredibly responsive.

s3nqIa_C3ls8LI338b2jcQ.text: I had high hopes after hearing good things about this place. However, I ordered eggs Benedict with the pork and the eggs were hard poached. Not a drop of runny yolk in sight. Now the pork and hollandaise  was tasty, but the hard egg pretty much killed an otherwise creative take on a classic.   My wife got a protein platter with steak. She asked for mid-well (I know.... I know ...). What she got was rare verging in blue and eggs that had zero flavor. Not much taste in the veg either.   The waitress was kind and offered to get new eggs but I had already consumed half the dish. It just didn't seem worth it. They did take the steak back, but then they just seared off the cut part and it was still rare throughout.   The waitress did take the protein platter off our ticket which is why this is  3 instead of 1. They maybe just had a bad day. But I probably won't choose to go back.

jGXB68CVhVWdpnYDZue2sA.text: While spending an extended weekend in Scottsdale, I had breakfast here twice.  Can't say enough good things about this place.  Staff are all super friendly, and everyone's fit & in great shape.  Is that a requirement to work here!?   Their homemade V8 style juice is great, as is their cold brew coffee.  They offer an extensive breakfast menu, and I had a great vegetable omelette one day and a steak and eggs Benedict another.  Also tried some of a friend's pancakes.  Everything was fresh and well prepared, and prices were reasonable.  If I lived in AZ  I would def. frequent the Breakfast Club*.  *Also, awesome name right? Who doesn't love a Brat Pack reference....

Txfvq05dxVghJQvH4IG_3g.text: If you are missing some real southwest chili flavor check out their southwest items.  Their homemade hot sauce is the real red chili deal!!! Pancakes were phenomenal and the service is excellent!!!

8PeUyPDP7zxJ5TNZxYbG3Q.text: Delicious!  Came in and had a Bloody Mary to start off followed by a delicious breakfast.  Great service.  I will be back

HdnEHgRPd6D2FnwFFF0Lrw.text: This was the best breakfast I've had in Phoenix! I love the Huevos Rancheros and their lattes! Amazing place to just enjoy your morning with friends and family!

esP3Yb3Ab2FbEVsqT6onMQ.text: This was a perfect breakfast for our entire party of 10! So happy they could accommodate us quickly for my daughter's birthday and everyone was more than pleased with their meal. The surprise was the hatch green chili pork, holy moly...all I can say is amazeballs! Great service, amazing cappuccino and decent atmosphere. The only complaint is a personal taste for Bloody Mary, tried it and sent it back. Definitely not good. Everything else amazing!!!

WJMa3CsngWZ3pRXs-VPJdg.text: We came here for breakfast on a Sunday, they weren't terribly busy, only waited 10 minutes. Couldn't finish my french toast, was so full from it! Their potatoes were great, my husband order the Breakfast grilled cheese and was so yummy, I wanted to steal it from him.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

39JvUumHpQlYA3e1R1u6Hg.text: Yummy!  Party of 4. Had a great selection for all. Ham and Eggs for the classic breakfast, Huevos Rancheros for what you think of out west, Bennedict, and Border bowl delish too.   The pancake was a good bite of AM sweetness to share. Bloody Mary and Mimosa tasty for those who partake. Would come back without question. Thank you Yelp for the online check in. Was #44 in line when I put us on list.  When arrived was #5. Maybe waited 5 mins on Sunday at 11:30. Parking only issue for such a busy spot. Some type of arts & crafts fair in area may have contributed.

uzc9Pdc3oF_WPYWGo6Jgng.text: Great place for breakfast. Ordered a basic breakfast plate: eggs, bacon, and toast. It was delicious. I'm not a big bacon fan at all, decided to just take a bite and ended up eating all of it because of how good and juicy it tasted. My server was very nice too. It was a busy spot for a Wednesday morning.  Would recommend this place for sure !!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_fxQl10jpsIwFzCYgb_I7g.text: One of the best breakfast places in Scottsdale my first time here and will be back for sure our waitress Chelsea was amazing couldn't be better! I wish I could give more stars!

exazSsJ2dUB3AUT2fLgseg.text: Lovely experience regardless of the wait! We waited about 45 mins for a table of 5 on a Saturday morning around 1030am. Our server, Whitney, was so sweet, attentive and personable. The food was delicious...we had 2 green goddess frittatas, one cup of oatmeal, huevos rancheros and the whole hog omelette, we finished everything. Highly recommend.

XMmDFZRCXN-C-euUDGOzbA.text: Second visit to the chain and so far the staff is at first take one of their best assets here. They are so friendly and attentive. I ordered the standard huevos and they were off the hook!    Fresh squeezed OJ to start and a yummy brafa, NO BETTER WAY TO START THE DAY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The after. If you leave a single bite I&#39;ll be amazed!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. After loving the huevos over cornbread i went to the standard huevos. Yummy!!!!

luVuwZqWGCIlx5iEFRRspw.text: Favorite place. Great food and service. A must go when in Scottsdale . Very clean and friendly service.

Sk1QKeeYsz0ebEiMMDonnA.text: So this was a first for us. Woke up late on a Sunday and wanted to try something new!  Now, there is the age-old debate one has in their head when you realize there is a 45-minute wait. One knows that you don't ever want to wait but knowing that people are willing to wait 45 minutes, it is worth it.  Come to find out, yep, it was worth it! Food was delicious... very unique take on breakfast... not so "cafe" but more well thought-out options. We enjoyed everything we ordered.  The staff was super attentive... couldn't be happier with our experience. Price was on-point and location was absolutely perfect!

lVX61o9DVE2ipUSW7KEFsg.text: Our new favorite breakfast spot in the area!  As new "locals", we've been trying many places on a frequent basis. On Mother's Day, we decided to try this out and instantly became fans!  My #1 advice: CHECK IN via Yelp!    We checked in on our way to BC and were able to receive constant updates. Once we arrived, we were seated within 5 minutes. If we would've waited to put our names down after arriving, we could've easily waited for 50 minutes or longer. There is also a parking lot adjacent to the restaurant, which is very convenient.   Once seated, Ryan and I tried their amazing Bloody Mary! It has be one of the best Bloody Marys we've ever had! The rest of the review can be solely on the Bloody Mary but we'll move on!  Service was outstanding. Our hostess and waitress were very friendly, attentive, and quick! Our food came out  fast considering how busy it was. Everything (Salmon Bene, Pancakes, and Southwest burrito) was fresh and super delicious!  Although we sat inside, there is also outdoor & bar seating available . The restaurant is at the intersection of Scottsdale & Drinkwater- perfect for people watching ;)  I also received a complimentary chocolate covered strawberry for Mother's Day! How cute is that?!   We highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary chocolate covered berry for Mother&#39;s Day :)
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mother&#39;s Day brunch
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Online check in! Best thing since sliced bread ;)

QynjaTWEYwn7olb5TB6PFg.text: This place is only okay. I ordered a small cold brew, which was a little on the strong side so I'd recommend asking for some milk to go along with it. The cold brew was also listed with three different prices, so I thought they had pitchers, but they actually only have two sizes (I think it's 8 and 16 oz... not positive).   To eat, I had the chicken fried chicken which was very small and mostly consisted of fat, which made it very hard to chew. The flavor on the fried outside was delicious, and I'm sure if the meat had been more tender, it would've been delicious.   All in all, probably wouldn't go back. The wait is very long even if you use the Yelp waitlist. I think I waited 30 min on Yelp, then got to the restaurant and waited another 45 min. Definitely go on a weekday or very early weekend, if at all.

zJxl8DZOlq30LmQEScCueg.text: Really good breakfast bowl, pork green chili, scrambled eggs, hash brown & avocado. Orange-juice tastes fresh. Nice location & ambiance

k7yOiEmmQOksIdOh986tVQ.text: Old Town Scottsdale's best breakfast hands down. This is a first class breakfast throw down! Get the huevos rancheros, you won't find better.

7xP3f4uTHgrUzpccf-Bb0g.text: In A Nutshell:  -The Breakfast Club (not the movie) in Scottsdale is easy to find. -It's on the corner of Scottsdale Road & Drinkwater Boulevard. -It's modern in design w/ great tasting breakfast items, juices & coffee. -It's the perfect place to stop by after hiking Camelback Mountain. -This place does get busy, but if you use the Yelp app you can sign up on the waiting list. -I was able to do this & by the time I got there was ready to be seated by the lovely hostesses. -The Chicken Fried Chicken was a guilty pleasure, but so worth ordering. -The batter was perfectly fried to an excellent brown crisp & wasn't salty. -At only $11 it's a steal. -My brother ordered a fruit bowl & some fresh squeezed juice along w/ a plate of Biscuits & Gravy.  Overall, the service is very attentive and I plan on coming back again when I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Exterior view.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuits &amp; Gravy.

1E9UsoFfJ9UQQaeNO83hMA.text: Service was perfect, server was friendly and attentive. Our table had the BC sandwich, breakfast grilled cheese and huevos rancheros. Yum! We will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Restaurant

jlygEXzd_i2PZ14J0-BEYg.text: Came here for breakfast and then the following day for coffee before heading to the fiesta bowl! If you're a coffee, breakfast lover you're going to love this spot. They have endless options for pancakes, french toast , and omelettes. They also have spiked  coffee options. So if you're looking to sub your Sunday funday mimosa with spiked coffee and kill two birds with one stone this is the place for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8VqcNut2Nv0M2QhK92P9wQ.text: We came here on a Friday morning. The place was packed and there was a 5 minute wait. I checked on yelp on what people have ordered and of course, I read Hailey P's review and get the Bird omelet and the BC iced coffee. Definitely did not disappoint, but the portions were generous so I had to box half of my food for later. Unfortunately, it wasn't good later in the day as leftovers. I do see why this place is a hit in Scottsdale. It's a great Breakfast Club so be sure to try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelets

asxA4paok4RYI_szs6bHUA.text: Love love love this place.  Will for sure come here again.  They don't give free lemonade refills but this place is worth it anyways.  The waitress(Ilana) was super kind and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Border bowl I ordered without the cheese and chorizo
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start breakfast without the toast and they offered extra fruit to replace the toast

P7dXABvzwDxkpvYYbQGYvg.text: Loved this place.   The chicken fried chicken is delicious. Try the jalapeno biscuits too. Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken and a jalapeno biscuit.

e1EN_fDsmEwpvUqbkQxfGg.text: Lovely service! The staff is super attentive and kind and quick but unfortunately the food fell short. My lox Benedict was extremely salty and the hollandaise sauce felt too thick like it had been pre-made. My husband enjoyed his French toast but didn't feel it was worth the price. Would come back if I was in a pinch but I think there are so many better options on the same street. But again thank you for the great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon lox Benedict
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast

T1oPD1BPJSX7FG_EvGSClw.text: Started my Birthday off with a hearty breakfast and was excited to try something different off the menu.  My second time here and was not disappointed at all.  I ordered the breakfast bowl, my girlfriend got a vegetable omelette with an amazing green sauce on top and my daughter a bagel stacked high.  Smiles and fully belly's all around.  I look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

44N7WB2umOFQBBHlm12Pvw.text: PROS: Great brunch food, fresh squeezed juices CONS: Long wait time  The food is about as good as it gets, and the juices taste amazingly fresh! Though you can put your name down on the waitlist via phone, it seems the counter doesn't start until after your party is there. We waited maybe 45 minutes to get seated.

mxIUeqKYunQCqTQnOhHc5A.text: The outdoor seating is the highlight of this place. You cool look out at downtown Scottsdale. Food was ok lots of options on the menus. Will like to see some type of Vegan or vegetarian sausage on the menu, pricing is a bit higher... but then again is SCOTTSDALE. service and ambience was ok.

9mQRIN1pbX9JVGMREZJOEA.text: I had a good breakfast here, but even though I have an expense account when I travel for work, I'm still not comfortable paying excessively for what is ultimately a run of the mill breakfast. I had the cinnamon French toast, a side of scrambled eggs (served lukewarm) coffee and orange juice, and my bill with tip was $25. On the bright side, the service was a lot better than the Yelp consensus, just not enough to warrant such a steep price.   Add Molly Ringwald to the equation and it would be well worth it, but without her this Breakfast Club is just a pedestrian experience posing as something it's not.

U3RKvZVf8mFxmW8zfIQ9sA.text: The food is very good and reasonable however there is a considerable wait and the noise level for seniors is very high.

w6EDXQfsGOoXYccUEC8NiQ.text: UPDATE!! I bumped up their review from 3 starts to 4! Their message to me after leaving this review was so professional I feel they deserve a second chance. A well run business means a LOT especially when they listen. Looking forward to the WI-FI...  I'll be back!  Here is the old review...  I like everything but the potatoes and soggy veggies they call O'brien potatoes. Omelet was really good and the bread is fresh. Service is too lax but more importantly for one who works at these kind of stops NO WIFI !

JPB_hgctzCe9yW_J1XcFeQ.text: Have to stop by this place if you're looking for some good breakfast.  I ordered the BC French Toast and my wife had one of their Benedict's.  There was a good amount of food and we both basically inhaled what was on our plate.  Our server was also pretty awesome which added to the experience.

U3Op9oW5D1yahMSIH8vFrg.text: Great French toast... Topped with fresh berries and Carmelites nuts' served with warm maple syrup! If your mouth is not watering by now... The bacon is so thick and crispy, the coffee was like crack... Super great place, the area truant just got renovated so seating and the wait was great!

49J3S3OcBs0e4g6fKMY7Fw.text: Great customer service and the food was yummy. Fresh fruit and French toast were superior. Love the fact you can have many options in what you want to eat.

IWXa6qc0P36DPIzPSFz0tw.text: Super yummy! Be prepared to wait for up to an hour, but well worth it. We will be back in Scottsdale in a few weeks and we plan on going back to the Breakfast Club. The border bowl is my fav!

ZLO8RB-518uhWL6oVEOxfQ.text: Great food wait staff is great hosting and wait times a little confusing? Still a good experience

zykhJkc4ggdzhhtF-t-n5A.text: After checking out of the hotel from my staycation with the girls we decided to check grab some breakfast here since my friends absolutely love this place. It was super packed and we had to wait almost an hr for a table which was fine with me it gave us a chance to hang outside and people watch :-).   We were all starved once we were seated so we ordered right away. I started with coffee and decided to go with one of their club plates that came with eggs, potatoes O' Brien, toast and fruit...for my meat I decided to go with sausage. The plate looked amazing when it came out but I was really disappointed with how bland everything was...the eggs which I requested to be scrambled with cheese were bland, the sausage and potatoes were also blah. I felt like I had all of this food and I was just eating it because I was hungry. The best part of the meal was the toast and the fruit, you can't mess that up! At least the service was decent :-)  I may give this place a do over but I may have to come during the week so I don't have to wait an hr for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LSWo7XoozjBUsjzyMyYOfQ.text: I thought this place was just A-OK. I appreciate it being a place definitely for the locals and the staff was super friendly and attentive.  The things I really enjoyed were the french toast (challah bread) and the fruit bowl (strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, pineapple, and a few others). The things that left me wanting more were the turkey sausage, pancakes, and omelettes. I just felt meh about it.. but the french toast was amazing. One of my dining mates had the "special" which was french toast covered in fruit. I'd totally go back for that.  It's a cute restaurant with True brunch/breakfast hours and outdoor seating. Great for people watching!

W_C1gres1BTtbFr_OtV4aw.text: The food is delicious, but not terribly unique. Standard breakfast fare.  I have gone three or four times, always with a group of women. I don't think that we received the best treatment; the servers were nice enough, but always seated us in the glaring sun or under a mister or in some other lackluster location. Also, the chairs outside are cheap plastic lawn furniture.  I will go again, but I do not expect to be treated the same way as, say, an attractive group of young men might be.

TYMdDd0KFaalnFCOQFJq9Q.text: Went in around 2:30 to eat they lied said the card machine wasn't working just so they can close early. Bad Business to be in Scottsdale.

WaEKjfgBoQYWbAIeI54amw.text: Seated quickly - servers are really nice. Started off either coffee which was really good - I decided to go with their famous French toast after reading previous reviews and so glad I did - it was SO good!!

7-9jlfOyV2JYy_Uv0uVZPw.text: This place is awesome! Delicious food with comfortable outside patio for sitting. Will be back soon!

he7Vlaiz_Za9tPKSDmOmQw.text: I came here on a Sunday at 11AM and of course it was very crowded. We waited for almost 40 minutes for a party of four table. Food came surprisingly quick, about 10 minutes after we sat down. Menu is sort of pricey, well, mostly because it's in Old Town Scottsdale, but the food portion is pretty generous. We tried the Quick Start Conscious which has 4 eggs and a lot of veggies and a bowl of cottage cheese. it's pretty good, very fresh. My cousin tried Border Omelet, or something like that, which tuned out to be a tex-mex type of food. It's huge, and delicious.   So, besides the long wait, everything else is pretty good!

uCUT0vyUvJCKWnsLyqjsqA.text: I cant believe the ratings on this place.   Something is wrong...  Its a 5 star all the way.   Try some Eggs.   Best looking wait staff in AZ.

bf7gmFE4B-t4YyMas8JBFw.text: If you're coming on a weekend plan on a wait. Bring your newspaper, tablet whatever entertains you & be courteous. We got lucky on our last visit with just 2 & got a seat at the breakfast bar. Love the bene's & pancakes. Yum-my!

1D7J_Zm_5QProdZ-rMAq_Q.text: Great spot for breakfast in the trendy east Hollywood neighborhood of Scottsdale.  Hands down best mimosas due to the temperature and the fresh squeezed OJ.  Staff is extremely friendly and service is top notch.  The burrito bowl is excellent, as is the huevos rancheros.  Their omelettes are galactic, overflowing off the plate.  Fresh fruit is fresh - now there's a statement.  Coffee is a little bland, but the beauty of the Arizona desert more than makes up for that.  Get a mimosa.

xI7GyYOYwgmJiPudd0jIjw.text: The reviews say it all! You want mouth watering breakfast?? go here! I can't see why anyone could be disappointed, the options on the menu were appetizing and the service was good! If you can't decide between an omelet and the waffles? my rule of thumb is split the goodies with a friend! or make one in line ;)  Yumminess!

pNzi10qAn19f45cA5Uqdxw.text: This place always has such a jammin' atmosphere! Large outdoor patio and nice selection of dishes. Though everything I have eaten has tasted fine, I would come here more for the people watching than the good, but average food.

zZ0E5z7M46H3h97PFODuAg.text: Had breakfast here, thought it was going to be a treat since there were all these people waiting out front and there was a 20 min wait for a table inside.  I ordered the wild mushroom omelet and my friend ordered the blt with cottage cheese since they didn't serve sweet potato fries yet apparently.  (I wasn't too impressed with the menu selections either btw, there was like 5 salads and 6 sandwiches for lunch, but i guess it is BREAKFAST club) The omelet wasn't very good - I'm not sure if it was because I should've ordered a meat along with the mushroom or the 1/4 lb brick of cheese inside but overall it was bland and the cheese was just ridiculous even after I pulled the excess goo out.  No amount of ketchup, salsa, Tabasco or Patio could salvage it.  My friend was nice enough to trade with me halfway through and the BLT was ok, but I gotta say this even though it feels wrong - there is too much bacon.  There would be a pile of 5 strips of thick sliced bacon in each bite and whereas I do love bacon, it was a bit overpowering.  Not to mention, between each slice was a thick layer of grease which made me wonder if they cooked it in layers in the oven???  Anyways, after I pulled out all but 2 layers the balance seemed restored AND my friend got some meat for the omelet.    All in all - the service was great, the hash browns were good and I loved the strips of red and yellow peppers in it, but did not like the menu selections which were pretty limited and the entrees.  The omelet had more cheese than egg, and the BLT had more bacon than LT and bread combined.

nzefFZWV7VhtaiCji4dFYg.text: By FAR one of my favorite places to have breakfast. The intimate setting gives off the "mom and pop" breakfast joint feel you might find in a beach town. The menu accomodates for the health-conscious but breakfast-loving eater. The only reason why I knocked it down a point is the wait. Unless you go during the weekdays or early morning on the weekends, expect to wait upwards to 45 minutes. My suggestions... their egg white omelets and for those coffee lovers, you HAVE to try the BC coffee!

fg184lX6Epw21kPycHrgnA.text: Great food and good juice.  had to wait 30 minutes due to the many people wanting to eat there. fast and good service.  Orange juice was $4 and expense, but worth the price.  good value.

WKOHf1dOrL0pxbkdr41pNw.text: This is a solid place for breakfast. Better than Denny's and Waffle House but it doesn't match up with Joe's Dinner or Over Easy and for the same prices.  I had their flap jacks and two eggs over easy with a side of bacon.  All good but nothing to rave about.  My friend had their whole hog omelet, which is what I might order on my next visit.

IYu1Kmhx1L1ytiiCwXVNtg.text: Delicious food! Every time I go there, the service has been great. Best breakfast place I've ever been to in all my life. Their strawberry jam is freshly made. So delicious on their hot bread.   Portions are gigantic. 2 people can eat off 1 dish....well, maybe one and a half people.   I read the service isn't that great but I've been there a dozen times and never had bad service.   Cant wait to go this week and have chorizo omelet.

L5HWbiw1Ri5j9ZbQbOFgow.text: Went to The Breakfast Club a couple of weeks ago for lunch with a few of my Girlfriends. Place is really nice, clean and welcoming. Food was really good and the portions were huge. I ended up taking 1/3 of my omelet to go. server was nice and attentive. Only downside is the parking (in the back and limited) and that fact that the first one to arrive from our party was told that she can not be sited until all arrived (she had to sit at the tiny bar). Will definitely go again and you should try it too.

kdVma88ixHcxJQQpeTBMWQ.text: I recently went to the Breakfast Club to meet a family member who was in town for a quick layover.  I didn't know too much about the place going in, other than it was on the wife's list of places to try.  I have to say I was definitely impressed.  We arrived sometime around 10am on a Sunday morning and were able to be seated within five minutes, which was nice.  I ordered the turkey/avocado/boursin omelet.  (This normally comes w/ mushroom but I got it without).  All I can say is wow!  This was a delicious omelet, I literally ate the whole thing (though I did slow down for a moment so my wife could taste a bite).  The service was good, though a little slow on bringing the check, though after that I did appreciate that they didn't pressure us to leave while we caught up, even though a line had formed.    Great food, this is more like a 4.5, rounded down to 4.

eLPEQ-usVBbPSXuWSc25wg.text: We go out to breakfast everyday and visited the Breakfast Club while we were in Scottsdale. It's a very popular place (ie: there will be a bit of a wait) and for good reason. The restaurant is full of energy, comfortable, and the food is great. You should give it a try.

VBN1KcLzgE7vPs7Fl7fgcA.text: Great food. Had the blueberry pancakes that aren't too sweet.  Also I tried a bite of huevos rancheros and they were quite good. Tip. This place is packed but no waiting if u ask to sit outside.

DGXiTLpkni7Ce4zllCI1bA.text: No Wi-Fi which at this point is a must have for those of us meeting customers out for breakfast.  The greeting staff was rude and won't seat you until your entire party arrives. The food is good but giving two stars in that service carries a heavier weight for me over Breakfast food quality.

1QqK-hGGUxYGalBMyByXDg.text: Delicious non-franchised breakfast place in a hip Old Town Scottsdale area.  In a sea of franchise-dom that is Phoenix metropolitan area it is hard to find good, non-farmed/chicken/cow or whatever themed breakfast joint.  The Breakfast Club happens to be a rare gem in a prime location.  Is the food the absolute best you will find...no, that title is reserved for Matt's Big Breakfast.  But, the food quality and selection and atmosphere are well above average and a solid 4 star'r and blow any chained breakfast joint out of the water.  When the weather permits sitting outside is enjoyably boisterous and always entertaining via people watching.

fCYmjJWUc1hwPemPtrpD4A.text: This is a great restaurant with fantastic breakfast cuisine. My only complaint was the wait but that is to be expected on a weekend. Once we were seated, our server was prompt and the food was brought out very quickly. We had the pancakes and wild mushroom omelette (with avocado!) It was delicious, we will definitely return to The Breakfast Club!

UruYhe8b3mWwxWcwHzlU6A.text: Weil it was my first trip to The Breakfast Club and I ate real healthy but I did oodle the Eggs Benedict and friend to the right of me ordered it and I was jeoulous. The Eggs Benedict looked "Scrumdelicious"!!!! I  had eggs poached with bacon and fruit. Great price at $5.95 and plenty of food for me. Bacon was not scrimpy but nice and thick, crisp and perfect! Maybe as a reward for myself, after I finish running the 1/2 marathon, I'll eat a big breakfast on Monday. Looking to give it the fifth star it probably deserves. By the way, it's worth the wait....and you will wait at this place.

RKTzIObs3j5R8n6fGyBpTQ.text: I used to be a HUGE fan of the breakfast club, even when I had to wait in the 100 degree heat with a hangover and now I am not. I have had the eggs Benedict, the breakfast burrito, and the Greek omelet and they are all bland and quite frankly taste the same, even with the red and green sauces on the burrito. I ate there again last weekend (because my boyfriend wanted to) and I had the lox and bagel, which was down right gross. The salmon was the nastiest color and tasted almost as bad. The bagel, was well, a bagel, but not even a good one at that. Next time I am in Scottsdale I will be going elsewhere for breakfast, I'll skip the wait and the bad food.

oFf4AsrXUPq5oxCjxqXnIQ.text: It's no great shock that breakfast rocks my culinary world, and The Breakfast Club rocked it, socked it, picked it up and dropped it!   I built my own omelet with spinach, mushrooms and turkey sausage folded into 4 light and fluffy egg whites. It was definitely way more omelet than I could chew, but it was cheaper in the end than doing a two egg omelet because it came with potatoes and fresh fruit. Everything was cooked to perfection: Flavorful, but not too heavy for an early morning meal. I washed everything down with some tangy grapefruit juice, which I'll say wasn't as good as I can squeeze at home, so save your $2.50 and perk up with a specialty coffee bev from the espresso bar.

tc396i36skRIX6tpiDlVSw.text: The Breakfast Club is as good as you'll find. The blueberry pancakes are superb, their coffee is beyond description. For a change of pace, try their Eggs Benedict, Southwestern style. A GREAT spot within walking distance...a beauty.

pul7YKoj7n0guIm3E19oiQ.text: kool spot. visting from Los Angeles...feels like we are having breakfast in the Santa Monica area :)

0XrpbFLwume1a7i2g_cw3A.text: I realize the place is called The Breakfast Club, but if you're open for lunch and have tomato soup on the menu it should not taste like ketchup mixed with water.  One star since this will be the fifth bad review on it.   C'mon already!

ZP0eKHgcihSxA71mpUNNWA.text: We came here for breakfast on Saturday morning and we were very pleased with the meal and the service! I had the lox and bagels. The salmon was very fresh and there was enough to top both halves of the bagel. My boyfriend got the Huevos Rancheros and this was absolutely delish. The waitress recommended it and he was glad he ordered it. It was spicy and there was a TON of pork. The prices were pretty reasonable. I would definitely recommend checking this place out for breakfast, they have a lot of different options on the menu.

xDSM1w4z1uqtjvTe39EUdA.text: Food is completely average but they get much love from me because they have the best chai I have ever had in my whole life.  If there is a wait, grab a chai to go and skip down the street to a better breakfast.

W1nqQuRDQ3glR2tD9h7qpw.text: Very good food. Excellent service. So nice to find a restaurant with great service these days. The staff hustled and paid close attention to their tables.

c2ITSoOVn7qFyTlh5_1Jog.text: Been here a few times but when I came here with a friend we waited quite a while to be seated. I don't mind waiting but we could've went else where for breakfast and gotten our breakfast faster. The food was pretty good but to be honest we immediately had to use the bathroom afterwards.  The service was good, I didn't get as much refills as I wanted but I still enjoyed the waitress, she was friendly. The woman in the front was expressionless towards us, I don't know if that's just her personality, or had a bad morning, or she just didn't like us for some reason. If you decide to come here I would come prepared to wait awhile and be careful what you order.

sdbRg3P9H39XfDQxEpzSiQ.text: Great place, amazing food! Loved it. I went on a Sunday and the wait was pretty long, you can get into the waitlist through yelp which helps a lot, once you arrived just let them know you are there. Perhaps, make sure you have your complete party with you as they will not let you sit if people are not there yet, that happened to me. Besides that everything was amazing!

pAIPk6ZS5ecZI7LRbz3KjQ.text: This place is the bomb! 5 days in Scottsdale and we are breakfast here each day. The service is awesome from the moment you walk in. You will probably have to put your name on the list as there seems to be a wait, but well worth it. The servers were all very friendly and had great suggestions for things to try. I even ended up sitting next to someone who used to be a server there and she still comes in for breakfast often. She made some wonderful suggestions. This place does not disappoint and will be a favourite whenever I visit. Keep up the good work Breakfast Club!

8R3eJVnqoDtMyDIARcd7JQ.text: Excellent customer. Shawna/shauna was very attentive. Truly appreciated her smile. The food was over the top. Seasoned well and very fresh.

z3AZMllwgSCd5eEMgiaLjw.text: Wonderful little breakfast place. Clean and modern, but comfortable.  This is no greasy spoon. Had the huevos rancheros and they were excellent. Plentiful and served with fresh avocado   The service was bright and cheerful, just the kind of atmosphere for a morning place. Locals and tourists appeared to be equally represented. I'll definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros

VV5L9dbUuW-2KzbacfikZA.text: The Bloody Mary tasted like the mix went south. Menu changed to a meat fest, but they did let me order a mushroom omelette that was dry and flavorless even with salsa and Cholula sauce. First Watch from now on.

X8iXIeyp6QtKNSHQDwiUug.text: Fast service, social atmosphere, amazing breakfast!   Originally was looking for a place to drop in and eat breakfast but stayed a bit longer due to the friendly wait staff who made me feel so comfortable and welcome. Additionally, sitting at the bar enhanced my experience. Everyone around me was friendly and outgoing.   No better way to start a day than with positive vibes all around!

7fZ-NJ3hwvgUDDH1NN3TIw.text: This is a great place for breakfast or lunch. The egg dishes are generous and delicious. Sandwiches are the same. Service is good.   When my brother was in town we went here for breakfast. When we wanted lunch on a couple of other occasions, he said "lets go back to that place".   Hit this place up if you're visiting or local.

jiACOFg7qfeZQUsgd6rtNQ.text: Breakfast redeemed! Today was met with great service and great food. Nice surprise after a couple bad breakfasts and some time away.  Maybe time to add back to the rotation.

OG6KeU56SQLokYCeasbDTQ.text: We decided to go for brunch here on Sunday since our friend was visiting from out of town. The parking was a little chaotic but once we found some we headed on in. They have indoor seating and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is great during the cooler months but I would avoid it during the hot months for sure.  The menu has your typical sandwiches for lunch and breakfast options. I decided to try the breakfast grilled cheese. For the price it was huge and they even added avocado to it as well as tomatoes. If anything get your egg over easy, it gives it an even better taste. We tried the side of biscuits and gravy and it was amazing! Definitely worth it even though they were a bit on the pricey side.  I would have loved to have given this place 5 stars but the prices were a little high for what we received and the parking was a bit of a mess. Also call in reservations if possible so you don't have to wait as long. Definitely worth a visit if you are near Scottsdale on a Sunday and searching for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The breakfast grilled cheese

hAFoyv7I9J7HQCQAK9wR0g.text: Terrific as usual. Everything is always delicious especially their potato's O'Brien that comes with most dishes. Our server was Jamie who was not only at the top of her game but super sweet! As an active Air Force member, I know they don't normally do discounts because their menu is reasonably priced but I was curious if they had any specials for Veterans Day. The manager surprised us by comping the whole meal. Always our favorite place for breakfast in Scottsdale!

FgEauI9lj7R6gQ54BHgtYw.text: The food was good, the location and view from outside was great.  The price could have been a bit less, but I guess that's what the kids pay for brunch these days.  I had the huevos rancheros, which, of course I did because I always do.  The crispy tortilla was a good touch--though it got to be a bit much after all of the liquids from the beans, salsa, egg, etc. all soaked in.  I would've opted for refried beans instead of the (somewhat watery) black beans and could have done with some spicier or more flavorful salsa (spicy tomatillo salsa is my personal favorite), but all in all, it was a nice time out with my lady.  The kombucha was a good option and was as pricey as you'd expect for such trendy things.

bCOtOr3u8TebFzuVl5T0Ow.text: I was in Phoenix for a short vacation and found this place on Yelp while looking for a brunch spot. We were not disappointed! Everything was amazing. I got an omelette and a piece of french toast, and my husband got the biscuits and gravy. We both had a cocktail. There was no wait on a Saturday around noon, and the place was clean and staff were friendly.

725ijn3AmDNkAThz7M963w.text: I had one of the most amazing brunches of my life at the Breakfast Club in Phoenix.  I went with a large party and we had a to wait a bit for a table, but they had a coffee bar which was super convenient.  The iced coffee was incredible, so delicious and strong--the wait time flew by.    The menu options are incredible.  I had so much trouble deciding which omelet I wanted, so a few of my friends and I ordered 3 and split them in thirds.  My favorite one included mozzarella, tomatoes and pesto. They are large enough to do that, and are served with roasted veggies, potatoes and melon. Totally unique compared to the standard toast and hash browns that you normally get with an omelets.   Service was efficient and friendly, which I appreciated with the large group. Honestly, I can't stop thinking about brunch and wish I had more time in Phoenix to go back to The Breakfast Club.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelette game strong! Served with O&#39;Brien Potatoes, fresh melon and roasted peppers!

fza5jOypUT3C0itRdJNOiA.text: Best breakfast restaurant in town! Omg!! The atmosphere is hip & lively, the service fantastic & the food incredible. I had the BC special French toast with nuts & berries; the best dish I've EVER had!!!! Portion was huge at 4 slides it they allow you to cut it down upon request. Next time I will for sure, but the quality & taste was unsurpassed. I also ordered a side of eggs & bacon. Mmmm. Delicious & cooked to perfection.  My friend ordered the BC waffle with eggs & bacon which he said was also delicious. I would HIGHLY recommend this gem to anyone. It is a must try for anyone who's hungry for quality, value & taste. Yum!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Belgium Waffle with eggs &amp; bacon cooked to perfection.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GQqrHX9TgK--Uavbfi2PLQ.text: I want to love this place because everyone else does but I personally wasn't impressed with what I ordered. I had the breakfast burrito with no meat and a carrot juice. The juice was FULL of pulp which I'm not a huge fan of and the burrito was stuffed with eggs which I'm also not a huge fan of. The service was fair. I did however really enjoy the fruit served with the meal and the banana foster French toast my friend ordered.

J4jjVmcVYMo8NnT0jVGqKw.text: Crazy good breakfast. Great service. Worth every minute of a wait. Get the masa platter thing...I don't remember the exact name but it has a masa based pancake thing. It's super good. You go, guy/girl/corporate conglomerate. You got this breakfast thing DOWN.

SiQKDURBBECi7sZ3DH6E8A.text: This restaurant is in a nice setting, there's a lot of variety. The orders are large, so bring your appetite. They offer coffee to go, which I thought was nice. We had the option of sitting outside. Service was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zjlkzM2Ndu3OALokJ0vCNg.text: As a caution, this restaurant can be extremely busy on Saturday and Sunday mornings. In part, it's due to the delicious food and convenient old town location. I'm an early bird, so popping in when they open at 6am is not uncommon. Order what you like as the most items on the menu are delicious. Cheers!

HKaZn6SFvmTFLCq53M_6kQ.text: Food is good. The servers are nice, but the service is a little slow. Don't go if you are in a hurry.

tehzEcWwhgVLETs3RGd4fw.text: My bf and I decided to check this place out simply because it was there and we needed to get some lunch in the area. The service was prompt, efficient and friendly. I ordered the tuna salad sandwich with cottage cheese on the side. The tuna was pretty run-of-the-mill, prepared with mayo, and sandwiched between lettuce leaves, tomatoes and two thick slices of 9 grain bread. The large dill pickle spear was a nice touch. I love cottage cheese, so that's a thumbs up. My bf's breakfast burrito was almost as large as his plate, seriously. It was huge, smothered with green chile and pretty tasty. Try as we might, there was no way we could finish our meals. I wish they had put the fruit on his plate separately, since some of the green chile sauce got onto it. Green chile covered watermelon just isn't very appetizing, you have to admit. I would go back, but only if I were in the area.

pINYy-cCNW4iYOtPqPleWg.text: First experience here was with my mother. Food was great our waitress was pleasant but I actually think we got more help from the buss boy who I ended up tipping.  So second time was with my fiance and after this experience I will not ever return first my fiance is weird and doesn't eat with metal utensils so we asked the hostess for plastic ones and she said she would return with some and never did. No big deal she is only a host.. anyway our waitress was awful.. tired, lazy and I had to ask her for a hot sauce like 5 times she never offered to refill my drink however anytime my fiance was running low she seemed to notice she had a horrible attitude towards us both, my guess she was hung over..  Still no excuse. Terrible terrible service from the waitresses however the buss boys do an amazing job with assisting customers and are most of the reason I returned a second time. However the waitresses ruined it and I'm never going back and wouldn't recommend it for someone who is actually looking to enjoy where they eat.

N-Mmitl40OFop3G9heiQug.text: This is a great spot for a leisurely weekend breakfast...just don't make it too leisurely if I'm waiting for a table, okay?  Every time we hit The Breakfast Club we end up waiting; but it's worth it.  You can always wait in their coffee bar...but good luck as that's always packed too.  I love their Eggs Benedict with the spicy sauce and smoked salmon (can't remember the name of it).  They also have  a board with daily "specials" and list some great breakfast burrito options...my husband has gotten pretty creative with his and he loves them every time.  I don't suggest going here if you are in a hurry or have somewhere you have to be in an hour...it's just unpredictable.  Enjoy!

Tuml4KQJoBCSjCtdevAbXw.text: I used to come here all the time for breakfast.  I must say that I was never disappointed.  I really like their eggs Benedict and their jalapeno biscuits and gravy.  Their coffee was great too.  Today I came for lunch with some co-workers and had the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup.  The grilled cheese was very good with fontina and cheddar cheeses between to thick pieces of sourdough bread.  The tomato soup I could tell was homemade, but it was lacking in something for me... I think it needed to be a little thicker maybe with some croutons or something.

JWFrKucUo0LOkJNIihmL7w.text: I have eatin here 3 time, with the food being very good, with great coffee.  The portions are huge! The only disappointment was the waitress, hostile, grouchy and looked pissed to be at work.  The only time she was remotely cordial was while she over us waiting to see what her tip was!   The Daily Dose down the street, has become my new spot for great food and really nice people.

KNsuwMBwo5H-TAvBNrNXAA.text: Brilliant, and possibly my second favorite breakfast place in Scottsdale now. The food was exceedingly yummy, the service was excellent, the price was totally right on, and it's in the middle of town. What's not to love? I did ding it a star for the 25 minute wait we had to get in, but consider that simple logistics... Be warned that this is a VERY POPULAR spot to eat, so if you want solitude, you're going to the wrong place.

xrRMbOUJA5wBnvrBDMYVBw.text: On my second official weekly brunch with my friend, we decided to hit The Breakfast Club up, and I really liked this place for Sunday brunch.  We had to wait for a little while, but it wasn't any more than I would expect to wait for a popular brunch spot.  We had the option to sit in or outside, and though we said the fastest seat was ok, we were secretly hoping to sit inside.  Lucky for us, our wish was granted and was seated inside.    My friend ordered the cinnamon challah french toast, which looked AMAZING.  It came topped with candied nuts, seasonal berries, and Vermont maple syrup.  I ordered the BC burro, which was egg, ham, cheese, and green pepper wrapped in a tortilla with a side of hashed browns.  Let me just tell you, BC knows how to do their hashed browns right!  Perfectly browned but not burnt.  The burro was pretty darn good, too, and came with a side of salsa, but I personally liked it better topped with ketchup.  Let me also state here that the burro was totally cheap: about five bucks.  The french toast was not as cheap, but it also was not any more expensive than other brunch places.  The coffee we ordered was awesome because it came hot and strong, which is perfect for a lazy Sunday morning, and the waitress was quick to come around with refills, too.    The reason I'm not giving this place a perfect five is for two reasons.  The first is that the waitress came back with a side of bacon for my friend, which he did not order.  It wasn't a big deal, but he doesn't eat meat, so it was gross for him, and he had ordered hashed browns, so technically, the order came out wrong.  The bigger issue was that about 80% of the way through eating his huge portion of french toast, my friend discovered a hair in it.  Lucky for the staff, my friend is not grossed out by hair found in food and just removed it, then continued to finish his meal with the idea that if he HAD eaten it, it'd have been considered more protein, but for normal people, finding a piece of hair in food is a deal-breaker, so I thought I'd mention it.  My food was fine, though, and it was good, so you go and make your own judgment call.  Oh, and I might also forewarn any of you who decide to go here that the parking situation is kind of crappy.  Just so you know.

yYuHcPPSuSzIRe9ymmvE_A.text: Nice place, but trendy in Old Scottsdale.  This is a place for the college students of Phoenix from ASU, Tempe, etc.  This is a place to see and be seen.  Many races are in here, but mostly your young frat or sorority friends.  I personally thought it was fun, but I can see families get a little bewildered by the place.  If you are a middle aged person who has a family, skip this place even though the food is good.  OR better yet, come in the late afternoon when the college kids are out and partying so you can avoid them.

Phzgrl86TQugFXzD2M1MbQ.text: My first experience to the Breakfast Club.... eh.  There are much better places to eat breakfast for the price.  We often drive by and see it crowded so we tried it on a Sunday morning.  Our server was very helpful, but the food was nothing to write home about.  Much prefer Butterfield's, Taylor's, or Cafe ZuZu (favorite) for breakfast.

iS8r4RTTKN0XsrK3VITXjg.text: This was my second trip here and both times I've been pleased but not overly impressed. The food is good, the service is good, the selection is good; I'd sum up that in general, it was 'good'. Not great, not amazing, not knock my socks off, but definitely 'I'll come back here again for breakfast'. Maybe I need to branch out of my comfort zone and try something different there, but honestly I'm a big fan of eggs, bacon, toast and hash browns. In that spirit I ordered the Quick Start Breakfast and everything came out as I'd ordered it, the Orange Marmalade was very good (if a little too sweet rather than fragrant) and the iced green tea is a very refreshing option especially here in the desert. It's a cute (if basic) atmosphere and I really like how they put alot of their menu up on the chalkboard above the coffee bar, it looks very hip and colorful. I definitely wouldn't sit and wait if there was a wait, when we came it was 9ish on a Monday so it was pretty easy to get a table.

tsibM_PDeXS2BP-Ct69Jyg.text: Nothing special. Not much to compare it to as there don't seem to be a tonne of breakfast joints in the area. Food is definitely not "huge portions" as others have reviewed. Normal portions at an above average price for the just-above average quality.   Lots of cute waitresses though.

zbpPo0zX8vsL_xmP59HZVQ.text: Boyfriend & I were in Scottsdale for golf vacation so breakfast was a must. We went to US Egg, the Good Egg and Butterfield's Pancake House on Shea Rd. All three were better than BC. Sat down to nearly empty restaurant late on a Tuesday morning  when waitress finally came over , BF ordered diet coke and was told that they have Coke only. I ordered iced tea no lemon and got lemon and after I added a Splenda & tasted it it was fruit flavored which I don't like. When asked the server said it was black tea then admitted it was mango tea. So I said I'd just have water and after some eye rolling I finally got it. My tomato soup was ok but the grilled cheese had some burnt charcoal bits from the flattop. Boyfriend asked for cheddar in omelette and got  pepper jack(yuck) also asked for fruit but got barely warm potatoes O'BRIEN. More eye rolling when he asked for the fruit. This place seems to want to be a healthy hip place but with the bad service I got I wouldn't ever recommend or give them another dime.  Go somewhere ele

N6GP7VUCcCMP0oUVE58bug.text: Had the Huevos Rancheros.  The torilla could have been warmed up and the black beans were a little al dente for my liking.  The whole dish was presented in a bowl and all you could see was the pulled pork and the tortilla.  Couldn't find the pico de gallo promised on the menu. If you want better Huevos Rancheros, head east to MPJ's Grill in Fountain Hills, you won't be disappointed.  My wife had the Eggs Bennie, and the hollandaise was cold.  Service was good, the price was reasonable for the amount of food, but not the quality.  Overall, I wouldn't go back.  Looking for something better in Scottssdale.

bnSRSU32ClmJp0kBEkKEgw.text: If I could give it a minus 10 I would.  We were in Scottsdale a few weeks ago.  We drove by TBC a few times it looked like people were there alot so we thought the food must be good.  Boy was I wrong.  My sister and I went there one morning for a light breakfast.  We got in there and the wait staff weren't friendly.  I don't think there know how to smile.  We ordered the 2 egg, bacon, toast that came with fruit. I order a cup of coffee.  Simple small breakfast.  The coffee was OK.   When I ordered I asked for eggs over medium ( can't stand running eggs) so what did I get you guessed it running eggs.  I only got 1 piece of bread for two eggs and the fruit wasn't ripe.  My sister ordered scrambled eggs and they were OK.   The waitress didn't ask how were were doing, did we like the food.  Nothing...  The vibe wasn't great in there it was a very negative feeling.  I don't suggest anyone wasting their money there...  Go to the Denny down the street..

5_H5G_ImesnLXw3prrirrA.text: Excellent breakfast spot. Definitely worth the wait for a table - friendly staff, extensive menu and the food comes quickly. They have excellent coffee and espresso drinks.

sbPuBdTU4gH9c8dPRE5Zcg.text: Sorry but there is always a wait here but you'll just have to get over that because this place is so frikin delicious! They serve pancakes with ice cream on it!!! Ive tried the cherries jubilee and bananas foster pancakes with the honey wheat pancakes I believe it is and bananas foster definitly better but it depends which you prefer because both were fan frikin tastic.  (im sure only like 5 calories too right??, ha ) And I have also had the eggs benedict with the portabello mushroom on it (don't remember what it was called) I dont eat meat so I get it with out it and with out the other sauce it comes with, but still get the hollandaise and man, its good! It has a little spice to it and I love spice.  The iced green tea is yummy also. The servings are big so you can always order to share (or if you cant decide, order a couple things and  share everything) When the weather is nice, I recommend sitting outside. All in all, love this place!

t68mpriVXhP4mozSTfSZgQ.text: Been there twice.  I remembered liking the food, but the second visit I had  the breakfast burrito and coffee (their espresso machine was broken that day).  I left with a stomach ache.  The coffee was terrible and the burrito was yuck.  If you go, stick to the standards...but in my opinion, not worth the wait.

X-pFV2-j5e0oPKpC0FSXYw.text: Pretty basic food choices, but really cute interior. Liking the vibe and the service was excellent.

2sfoFwnKuM4YQWqk3zTC1g.text: there's always a wait here, but you can slip in and out if you have a small party.  the coffee is really good, and i'm a sucker for eggs benedict so i gave it a shot.  nothing to write home about but i was satisfied in the end.  like i say in every breakfast review: there's no better breakfast in town than the one i cook up in my kitchen.

RRzgsXkaODXqX618dvlWiA.text: Food was good but nothing to write home about. Very similar set up to "snooze" the issue for us was our waitress. She seemed very annoyed with our group the entire time and seemed inconvenienced whenever we'd ask about certain things in the menu. She was also very much trying to rush us and brought our check before asking if we were done or not and took some of our plates before any of us were even done with them. I'll give her the benefit of the doubt since it was a busy morning, but it was rather disappointing.

rbhuXHLPH-6xZUJVYvmzIw.text: The blonde hostess acted like the customers were annoying her by gong out to eat this gorgeous Memorial Day. But Alaina was our waitress and was amazing. If you can get past the hostess the food is good, the atmosphere is fun, and Alaina is the BEST.

Npopb_pFqcGYC5_QX_d_yA.text: Pass. Hard to say if this should be 2 or 3 stars but aside from the great patio seating, this place is very much mediocre. I got the salmon benedict and I can't recall what my husband ordered, so that should count for something. We're big Yelpers and tend to take photos of our meals, but this experience didn't warrant that. The menu is pretty standard but won't knock you out of the park. I'd suggest exploring elsewhere for a more "brunch and mimosas" outside type of place, of which there are plenty along this road.

exSfeb8wPixhQ6UpFWKvmQ.text: Loved that we were able to reserve a spot through the Yelp app!   The restaurant is spacious and has outdoor seating.  Service was prompt without being overwhelming.  The food overall was good.  My daughters pancake was a bit undercooked but she was more interested in my meal.  I'd stop here again next time I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RcHO7L4jIL5_TRUFmM39gg.text: Great place for breakfast. Don't let the long lines scare you, tables more quite quickly and the heavy traffic just means plenty of people love the place!

04yhi9xPGUINkhyGjkhIVg.text: I came in and had breakfast on the patio had the turkey bird omelette it was absolutely amazing the fresh fruit  Carly was my server and it was such a nice surprise as I remember her as a server in Discovery Bay California fresh out of high school.   Excellent service today this place is lucky to have her  I highly recommend sitting on the patio

OXs0Vm4MVEo8t_NxtcWEpw.text: The Breakfast Club was our "go to" place for breakfast/brunch.  We loved the tex-mex options as well as their "platters" with great portions on everything they serve.  We also appreciated being able to "mix-and-match" our meals with side orders of just about everything on the menu.  So, if you want a waffle with 2 fried eggs and some ham, you can do that; very nice!  Also quite convenient AND tasty was their offering of a bottle of reasonably good sparkling wine and a large carafe of freshly squeezed OJ.  You can then make your own Mimosa with as much (or as little) of both that you like!  We did take advantage of the Yelp waiting list feature that worked well for us.  I put my name into the queue and it told us the time by which we had to check in.  All three times we visited, we never waited longer than 15 minutes!

3GlHskY8vnQhkONaK6l2BA.text: I feel like a lot of people might be turned off from this place because of the crazy wait times. But they did add a wait list app system, which helps a lot! Clearly lots of people wanting to get in means it HAS to be good!  Honestly, the food here is really good. The menu is extensive so there is something for everyone. Their sweet cream pancakes are indescribably delicious for a breakfast lover like myself (added chocolate chips in my attached photo).  The other pictures show the bagel and lox (so pretty, right?!) and eggs benedict. Both were delicious and I always leave there super full!!  I love how they serve breakfast all day - I used to go in on my lunch break and build my own scramble for a quick healthy meal on the go! Definitely worth a visit.

lkpkWS3JcYbFTswcRAIPyw.text: Average food, great service, nothing spectacular to bring you back for a second time. I had the breakfast grilled cheese & it was just a breakfast sandwich not much special to make it a grilled cheese, besides, well there was cheese. Waffle smelt amazing but tasted generic, hubs had the chorizo breakfast burrito and it was too big to pick up, overall 6/10 mostly for the great service at the bar.

iHsVjYb2MUCZxQChEnyNkA.text: Great breakfast spot! I had the breakfast burrito with queso. My husband had the huevros rancheros. Service was quick and efficient. The staff is on top of their game there, always making sure coffees are topped off and customers are happy. Never seen a breakfast place so busy on a Monday.

gS3kOu8gqUYse1ugYK0aHw.text: The only positive thing about this place was the service. The French toast was bland and overpriced. It was thin sliced bread and was super soggy. The biscuits and gravy were not flavorful or taste anything like biscuits and gravy. The biscuit itself was also dry and sour. Our waitress was very kind and attentive but that's the only good thing I experienced.

V21Hj2Wcf5MmvhXv1OpvTA.text: Breakfast Club is my go to! Great food, vibe, just an overall great place! My favorite!

13MDsRJZ0267vyrox0rtOA.text: They always nail it here! Great service and food every time. I haven't eaten in but all the plates I seeing going by while I wait for my takeout look lovely and the guests look happy.

ViW1IRBH5P8phILpj8A_IQ.text: Enjoyed breakfast during spring training! A bit of wait, it was busy, around 11am on a weekday in mid March. Once seated among baseball players and travelers alike, the service and food was terrific. The manager greated us and was very pleasant. Would definitely return.

qomXuAtHeswGCnEz91nPYQ.text: The menu: wow!  If you want big helpings, fresh ingredients, and pleasant service this is your jam. Also, they have several tasty jams, we're told. Waking up on eastern time in the PDT landed us there at opening, and 30 mins later they were packed. I can't imagine the Saturday @ 930a wait.   The breakfast bowl was piled high with pulled pork, could have upped the awesome with more veggies and cheese in the scramble, but it still wins. The Lean and Green omelette was a great choice, especially paired with the biscuits and gravy. We also ordered one slice of the French toast... Amazing.  Lastly, they have a really creative bar. The bloody was better than most, and the Salty Dog came with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice... so good you have to have two of them!

aZxetmHuWmGw9jv7dzYxiQ.text: Holy smokes was this place good. To start with, the vibe is welcoming and upbeat. Nice coffee and juice bar when you first walk in. As our table was going to take about 15 minutes, I went ahead and ordered a couple large iced coffees. Nothing fancy about them but they were $4 a piece which I thought was a tad steep. That, however, is my only gripe. My wife and I both got the breakfast grilled cheese. It was PHENOMENAL. Eggs, hash browns, cheese and bacon on perfectly toasted bread - so good. We also got one buttermilk pancake to share with was light, airy and delicious. The total for the food was around $20 which is perfect. We will definitely be back to Breakfast Club next time we're in the area!

Vy9TnHJhrkIRbY04skDgnA.text: Amazingly delicious breakfast. We had the eggs Benedict, the breakfast burrito (minus the HOT sauce on top), and the BC bagel. It was yummy, and the service was great!! We had about a 15-minute wait on a Friday morning, but it was definitely worth it!

5mc4B4Y2MWX51Kb1mCqvwg.text: The food is decent but the business is so wasteful. We were in a rush and asked them not to put our food in plastic containers because we were eating there by the waiting area. Why waste all that plastic?! We asked to speak to the manager after they said no and he/she never showed up. I guess we weren't worth the conversation.

YFiWEv9FyeyFEq7wUyIwuw.text: We had brunch here on a busy Sunday morning. I joined the waitlist through yelp right about when we left from home. 20 mins later, easy check in and 5 mins after, we were seated. That was very convenient considering how busy brunch spots in Phoenix/Scottsdale get. Very chill, trendy place right in Old Town. They squeeze fresh orange and grapefruit juice on site which is great; most places have canned juice squeezed elsewhere and brought to location.  Service was fast and our server was helpful answering questions about the menu My husband got the huevos racheros which he thought was good. The menu doesn't mention that pork is already included in the dish without having to add it on additionally.  I made a "healthy" choice with the lean green omelet - bad  decision! The omelet was very greasy and tasteless. I would go bak to this place but would definitely get something else.  Even if you're getting your own food orders, definitely try a small side of french toast!

2bMV3yU2rjDK_89KrSAe5w.text: Decided to go to breakfast here with my friend. We stopped by before going to hike camelback. Never had tried this place before but we figured we'd give it a shot.  The prices were not bad at all and the food was delicious. We had one of the signature omelettes and a breakfast burrito and we were both impressed. Tasty delicious breakfast. If you're in the area, I definitely would give this place a shot! Will be back in the near future for another delicious breakfast!

P9KMthE9CXp_9IRIyc-PMw.text: We went on a Saturday afternoon right before closing.  Maybe that was why we didn't have a wait.  I loved how it was set up!  It was so bright, airy and clean!  It reminded me of the brunch spots in Manhattan (albeit more roomy - think of cafeteria or union sq cafe).  The employees here are all very nice.  We loved our waitress Vicky, such a sweetheart!   The food was good and fresh.  Although the award for the best french toast in town has already been taken (sorry guys - the nuts were a little burnt but the berries were a nice touch), they still have a very tasty eggs benedict (perfectly cooked Bello Bene).  I also liked the fact that fruit and hash browns/potatoes are included in your meal (although I couldn't tell from the menu).  Nice portion size for the price of the meal.  Unfortunately the fruit/melons were not sweet at all on the day we went, but the overall experience warrants a return visit (3.5).

R4jDYG4OhP2stOjdcQ71jQ.text: Always been a fan of this place. Took my boyfriend here last minute at 2:45 even though they close at 3.. Right away we order: me the regular breakfast, which I got scrambled eggs and sourdough bread and my boyfriend the lox plate. I have always remembered they have fast service, and they lived up to my expectation once again. Everything was perfect and so fresh. Must come back again soon. I forgot how good it was!   I also love the ambience. Very clean and has a good Scottsdale feel. I remember a few years ago when they revamped the place, and it's looking better than ever.

eTAJnDoIaA-PMS9crBDo7A.text: Tried visiting this place last time we were in town with no luck so we decided to try earlier and were fortunate enough to get in this time. Hubby and I had the Huevos Con Masa and it was delicous! Our daughter had Chocolate Chip Pancakes and she lived them as well as the fresh orange juice. Now we know why this place is so popular, well worth the wait!

u6p8lpUJ375knDGJApQDmQ.text: Casual breakfasts....  Location: perfect if staying in scottsdale.  Interior:   Great layout.   Tables and a great bar area.  Staff: very cute and friendly.   Attentive and seems like the locals love them.    Food: healthy and large portions.   Great for the hungry and the healthy.   If in town....go

469-9WqqzRON1FwyAF__nA.text: I've been here a few times and it never disappoints.  Usually come in here for brunch and each time it's just simple and well done.  Would highly recommend.  The Eggs Benedict are excellent.  Can't go wrong with the Traditional Bene!!! Wait staff is always friendly and love that they also have a coffee bar..

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict.  So good.

h0CBpD3PCj9mS17kdb6WgA.text: I'm very surprised to see these guys don't have a higher rating.  They came highly recommended by the manager from our hotel and we loved everything.  Cool, laid-back kind of hipster atmosphere.  As much as possible in Scottsdale anyway.  A lot of the food is made from scratch including the hollandaise sauce which delish.  My wife ordered the salmon lox eggs Benedict and I order the BC something sandwich which was their spin on a french dip.  Sweet potato fries were tasty and maybe the best french dip I've had.  The Aus Jus was nothing to write home about but they had this awesome pesto mayo that more than made up for it.  I would definitely recommend going there for breakfast or lunch!

fFphD07HwpV9b5R9PBTGEQ.text: Great food! I was with a large party and they accommodated us quickly, everyone in our party enjoyed their food. We were slightly complicated because we each ordered 2 or 3 drinks but it was no problem for the server! All in all it was great!!

sw80boXvz4A_6VRkTxO9SQ.text: The Breakfast Club is like a combination of Lululemon and Ihop. OK it's a lot more upscale and serves a whole different level of food but you get the visual. It's a unique environment because all the staff wear what seems to be yoga or workout pants. Pretty casual there, but makes it trendy. You can also see into the kitchen which is pretty interesting. The coffee/tea/juice bar is great! So many healthy options makes it defintiely worth coming back for.  But what really makes this spot special is the food. Plenty of spice and flavor.Everyone at our table enjoyed their meal and we all had unique dishes. The portions are really big too (almost too big) but these were leftovers I was looking forward to eating.

ce2dxYI1azg2NNdMp0LpMg.text: This uber-hip breakfast place is definitely built for Scottsdale-ites looking for a great breakfast in a beautiful place. The staff is attentive and prompt; you can clearly see as you enter that the vibe is deliberately established by the management to attract dealmakers for power breakfasts and early meetings.       The food was quite good, and doled out  in generous helpings, but a highlight was  the potatoes O'Brien, which I would recommend you try, no matter what else you order.       At the right time of year, I'm sure the outside seating would also be amazing, but the fact that it was Arizona in August prevented me from sitting on the sidewalk.     The prices seemed about on par with an IHOP, but the ambience was much cooler, and the entire dining experience was more enjoyable.  (I'm not bagging on IHOP, just saying this place has a different feel- one that I enjoyed more.)      All in all, if you're up early enough in Scottsdale, and looking for a good meal, this could be a good choice.

R3946EkiN8VBVdX1R1T0AA.text: The border bowl is so delicious.  Everything I've tried  here is delicious.  The atmosphere is cool and upbeat.  Definitely recommend

baYVebkIKulzn7TX6iDtag.text: Fun, vivacious & lively atmosphere in a great location - the food and coffee were subpar - nothing memorable.

4xKBiofxBimby1uJN9vTWg.text: We tried a sitdown breakfast today with very good results. As long as you arrive early (before 9am), you will enjoy no waiting in line. The outdoor patio is dog friendly and the cars going bye on Scottsdale road are noisy, so sit inside. The signature french toast was pricey at $14, but the combination of the fresh fruits and walnuts and cinnamon made this a special dish. Also tried an omlette called the bird made with real fresh turkey and huge chunks of avocado. The potatoes had fresh cut onions and peppers and were a nice addition. They are very nice here and give you free refills on iced coffee during meal and after you leave also. One of the better breakfast spots in town if you get there early enough.
