nkJ2U_p0-swm38iNl10YQw.text: If you want to enjoy a nice breakfast place, this is not for you. Worst service I've ever received! The food was ok. Wait was long and then they just wanted to rush us out as soon as we were done eating. The staff acted petty and too good for everyone. When we kindly asked for a manager to explain how we were treated, we were completely dismissed. I honestly have never been treated so poorly at a restaurant. If you are in the area and want breakfast, I suggest you go to the McDonalds down the street. You will at least be treated like a human being and get better food than this place has to offer! *Disclaimer: I'm not knocking on McDonalds, just saying that this so called "nice" restaurant will be a waste of your time and money.

as6AUDm6ZMhJfvcCkVLCWA.text: Came here had the border bowl. It was amazing .. The service was super fast and friendly. A place you must stop to visit if you like breakfast.

TMrtiybxfkr0pH9ySnJydQ.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I've never written a bad review but I've never been treated like this before so I feel it is necessary. Readers digest version:   Poor service. Hostesses who give your table away to the wrong party. Blatantly rude waitresses who push through in between your guests aggressively to retrieve a water glass and kick you out when you just closed out your ticket (who isn't even your waitress). A manager with zero customer service skills who dismisses your concerns about the lack of service from her waitresses, claims you are lying about your wait time, and is full of excuses.   SPEND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

8r8-dMFn0Us_Mb5sh-R04g.text: Great prices and excellent service We ate at the bar and were seated as soon as we walked in

MiiOXPi6yAtZsB0XR6DvjQ.text: Best breakfast in town! The border bowl is by far the best thing on the menu, never had a bad experience here!   Their waffle is also amazing, best waffle in town for sure!

II7D6NWyq6ujQFFiTb9_Ow.text: Best BLT sandwich I've had. Unfortunately, The service was so-so, the only thing that kept me from rating 5 stars.   Fresh squeezed juices are excellent, overall experience was above average and we would come back.

TIPQwZtFdLP68LVRJenxnA.text: Food was great, if you go on a weekend, expect a wait!  Our service was good and the food was rather quick for how busy they were. My husband and I were trying to eat healthy and were able to modify our orders for what we wanted. I would suggest going here for brunch or breakfast!   A good tip, if you want to avoid the line, download the nowait app, as they are on there, it saved us 45mins of waiting.

QIkmLWkwA4d_lEm_qudXsQ.text: I want to start by saying Employee Whitney is a natural for customer service. It is rare for a restaurant veteran like me to find millennials who are capable of looking at your plate, cup or entree and determine what the customer needs. Whitney does this effortlessly. A Natural. If she is not a manager BC is missing the boat. Serving is all about serving.  Food: Having lived at Citiscape with an adjacent BC I am fully aware of all the menu items but it is the BC French Toast that makes me drive from Chandler to Scottsdale. Fresh berries and roasted pecans without that syrupy goo most places like to add. Decent enough coffee and an open airy atmosphere in Scottsdale add to top quality.  Service: Why 4 and not 5 stars. Three people were working the counter. Two seemed to be novice servers intent on smiling and looking good while Whitney took care of everyone at the counter whether it was her customer or not. With the NEW concept of walking into a restaurant and ordering at the register(hmmm, get the money before they eat) it is a telling trend that we are less inclined to deal with servers and tipping for sub par service( instead of training and retention of servers). Soon, if not already, service is rare in fast casual dining. There is an art to serving the general public. I've seen waiters put their kids thru medical school on their wages because it was a CRAFT and they took pride in what they did. Now, it's something to do between changing careers or schooling.  I'd love to talk to the dishwasher. If management is good that person would want to be the BEST dishwasher. No dirty plates on their watch. It's all about personal Pride and Integrity. All of these things lead to longevity in this business.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uurKizN61sPC9ihJBNXzxA.text: Rare does it happen that a restaurant experience is either so profoundly great or terrible that I am moved to write a review.  In this case, I am writing about the latter.  Breakfast Club is one of my favorite breakfast/brunch places in the entire Valley.  The food quality is usually outstanding for the price, the wait staff attractive, efficient, and accommodating, and my ability to get seated and served, prompt, despite the expected usual wait of 20 minutes or so on a weekend.  But this past weekend we ended up waiting nearly TWO HOURS to be seated!!!  As usual, the food quality was great, and the wait staff courteous and helpful, particularly Jessie, who handled the situation with aplomb, and even managed to get us moved to a large table inside that accommodated all 8 of us after we were forced to separate at two outside tables across the patio from each other.  Unfortunately, the manager seemed she was over her head in terms of her sense of logistics, inability to deal with a large weekend crowd, and quite frankly, common sense.  Our family gathered for a wedding over the weekend, and the 8 of us decided to have brunch before leaving town.  I called ahead to inquire about the wait and was advised that the wait for our group of 8 was approximately 45 minutes to an hour.  The hostess offered to place us on the wait list, which I accepted and received a confirming text shortly thereafter at 10:33 a.m.  Having worked in food service, I completely understand the challenges of seating a large party, thus our decision to call ahead.  We arrived at 11:05 a.m., and were told there would be about 15 minutes more to wait.  We repeatedly checked in with the hostess stand every 20 minutes, until TWELVE FIFTEEN!!!  At wits end, and short on time, my fiance pulled the manager aside and explained our frustration.  Finally, HE HAD TO SUGGEST breaking our party in half at two separate tables just to get some food on board before we got too "HANGRY," which had long since passed for my 7 and 9 year old boys.  The manager looked surprised as if she hadn't thought of this solution.  Again, having spent years in the food service industry, I try to be super chill about problems beyond the control of the staff.  Even our servers commented that they had heard similar complaints from other patrons about ridiculous waits.  Unfortunately, the manager was so inept, my frustration really grew to the point I felt I had to write a negative YELP review.    At no time did she 1) apologize, 2) check on us once we were finally seated and served, 3) comp a single item on our check despite a nearly $200 bill (which we still tipped 20% on!), or 4) acknowledge us before we left at roughly 2:00 p.m. to apologize for the absolutely SHITTY job she did to attend to us.  It wasn't just ineptitude she displayed, but complete stupidity.  Who lacks common sense like that in the food service industry?  Despite my anger, I love the food and ambiance, and will likely be back.  I hope very strongly that this girl is fired, because the landmark brunch restaurant in Old Town is no place for such an abject rookie.  She has reflected poorly on the entire team and undoubtedly cost the wait staff a fortune in lost tips.  I'd also be pleased to receive some sort of coupon or gift certificate, but won't get my hopes up.  Regardless, you have a brand to protect, and the young, blonde, female manager who ran the show Sunday morning August 13, 2017 is a huge liability to you and the entire staff.  She needs you to help her find her next opportunity...maybe at Denny's.

r2nRiZ5UA8RnoEVu-YPwMQ.text: Ambience is cool and trendy! There's nothing this place doesn't have- love love love! Patio is sunny, the bar is quick and I loved everything I got.  I'm here visiting but I'll def go back tomorrow.  Oh and the music is good too!

hPWO8ou80_7DcqQM_nICYA.text: A pleasure... wait staff was very pleasant, the food was absolutely delicious, quality of the food was exceptional. People watching always fun in downtown Scottsdale. Definitely recommend this as a fun little spot for a breakfast respite

Hzho4hOPF6ZVb9WtbuImeQ.text: Back in Scottsdale and was excited to dine here. The hostess, was rude and dismissive but the food was amazing. Tried a new frittata just placed on the menu. Table service was great.

LMiXptvUdvUaishvBs146w.text: Brunch here was okay but maybe was expecting it to be a lot better. We were sat outside and our waitress quickly came right over. I had an Arnold Palmer and my friend had a lemonade. We ordered our food which surprisingly came out quick! I had a breakfast grilled cheese sandwich and my friend had the quick start loaded.  The food was bland and I found myself drowning it in pepper, Tabasco sauce, and salt to give it a kick. I also ordered a full order of pancakes which tasted like pancakes from home. Nothing that really stood out from this place. IHOP is better. Paid about $40.

i5SOGdemgW2q7ANx0B2Zaw.text: Border bowl it was.  It's like lunch with egg.  Plenty of protein meat selections and other fixins to complete the bowl.  Spicy sauce on the side was good, allowed for me to choose the amount I wanted, though it wasn't too spicy.  The sausage and ham were both good.  The crispiness of the hashbrowns were a bonus as well.

kY_7H__VTIvIG1bG8C8Q_g.text: Pretty tasty food! Long waits on weekends unfortunately and slow service too sometimes. I've had pleasant results with the french toast, breakfast burrito, egg white combo (forgot the name of it - a healthy start?), and most recently, the biscuits and gravy. Definitely tasty and I will be going back for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sLuhSVR2GxMvpGqV-Uv6Vg.text: I enjoy this place for breakfast. They have great service and the people are very friendly. The food is outstanding. Give it a try if you get a chance I don't think you will be dissatisfied.

UtqLxo5X_gUA-W0bEI3lOA.text: Very nice, good atmosphere but like most places nowadays very loud and open. Service was wonderful and we had the biscuits and gravy  and a bacon and egg breakfast grilled cheese with hash Browns that was very good. The biscuits and gravy could it had a little more flavor but it was OK.

_GOMB-_A2_oHKpGjUeWZKw.text: Had a little bit of a wait but it wasn't bad.  Our breakfast was delicious.  I had the Burrito with chorizo and it was a bit spicier than I typically care for so I had to eat with care.  Had I liked really spicy food it would have been great.  The french toast looked amazing and my son said it was very good.  All in all it I highly recommend!

q7YhUV43ubupIG55fmKk-Q.text: Great menu. Friendly staff. This is a popular place, but you can add your name to the wait list right from Yelp. I had a mimosa and the French toast. Very good.

F_UlaHwkhltLBTyFvgW0NA.text: my husband and i were in scottsdale around 12:30pm and decided to try Breakfast Club...he for lunch and i for breakfast, which is served all day. he ordered the BC dip, which arrived piping hot with yummy au jus and horseradish mayo on the side.  he sub'd fresh berries for potatoes and his order was executed perfectly.  i had the blueberry pancakes, no compote and again, my order, although the pancakes looked a bit pale, were cooked thru completely and delivered exactly as ordered: no strange powdered sugar or butter anywhere near the plate.  our server was terrific with iced tea and water refills and offered me an iced tea to go, which was great.  service was not rushed and the wait time was minimal (10 min.). the app to notify us how many parties were ahead of us worked great.  we will be back to try out BC again!

krz1-C2PsFdNHcVnurf3dQ.text: idk. this place is just so idk.   I feel greasy after i eat here. like that sneak-up starbucks grease feeling. The food isn't visibly dripping in grease, but it makes my insides feel like an angry incinerator. this has been after getting the breakfast grilled cheese, the breakfast burrito, the turkey reuben, and the tuna melt. those are all adequately different things. So, its not like i just keep making the same mistake.  idk, people seem to really like this place. I feel like there are just a lot of better breakfast/lunch places literally on the same street with better/more interesting menus and better food

ccaU3H4eQdKn_XHTwkR83w.text: Breakfast club at 9 am on a Wed half full with customers.   The food is good but the hostesses are extremely rude especially this young lady.   When my friend and I came to BC we spoke with this young lady and asked if we could be seated while we wait for the third person in out party and have mimosas. She quickly replied No. We will not seat you until your whole party is here and if you want a mimosas you can go over to that counter and order it. We asked why the restaurant is empty and she turned her heard and said that's just policy. Come see us when you whole party is here and instantly resumed her convo with the other hostesses. Had to speak with the manager to get seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WR9JgtxD_ga05RgIcXTdIQ.text: Great food, good prices, great staff. Worth a wait. Drinks are very well made and the food is spot on.  Great place for a boozy brunch or something with the family. Good music but not too loud for conversation.

ROfaZ7Mmo_OEXuB-qX1w7A.text: Delicious breakfast! A little over priced but the service is great and so is the food. The last time I came in, they were close to closing but still were very accommodating and provided great service!

y2OFmXQosu2UACyKRD3CGA.text: Bad experience & bad management! Will never return!  Food came out cold. Had to wait for new food that was still bland and unflavored. Manager did not care about bad experience. Did nothing to rectify the situation. Will not return or recommend

7uEd28boXjnvU4vxRxhrFQ.text: The atmosphere is fun and trendy, but not unwelcoming. You can go enjoy breakfast with your kids.   The coffee bar counter was full of people enjoying breakfast and drinks. Next time I want to try their dirty chai which is just chai with espresso.  As for breakfast I ordered a breakfast burrito smothered with half chili Verde and half chorizo queso! Oh my yum! Next time I'm getting full smothered chorizo queso. It really made a normal breakfast burrito something special that you'd crave. The potatoes were really full of flavor, but a little greasy. The fruit on the side was actually good! It was the perfect ripeness which is unusual - usually it's more garnish for the plate.  My kids ordered pancakes (there is no kid's menu). Their pancakes and syrup were so tasty as well. I had more bites than I should have.  After breakfast came,  I decided to order a mocha. I was impressed worth how quickly it came out.  It is made with Ghirardelli according to their menu.  It was good!  Way better than the chalky mocha taste of starbucks!   Overall a great experience!  The only downfall to this place is i think the wait can get pretty crazy,  but we got lucky today.  It's new years day and I think everyone is hung over and still in bed!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cafe mocha!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito smothered half chorizo queso and half chili Verde ! Chorizo queso makes it a winner!

G6qZ0d91KsJgTQrHUTCO4g.text: Absolutely delicious! Ordered the bannana foster waffle for breakfast and it was amazing! Wait staff was fast , tentative and friendly.  Such a cute place.. busy but was quick to get our party of 8 in! Recommend and will eat here again

TKYDLrurz2n9xBEuVjbTYw.text: Love this place!!!!! The food is great, but the wait staff is what makes this place, and what has me coming back.  They are attentive and respectful, and always have us leaving on a very good note.  The biscuits and gravy are amazing and finishing it off with a chocolate chip pancake to share is a recipe for an amazing brunch.

wnvuaUW8FDfiTMR4xjgQyQ.text: I have driven by breakfast club often and there is always a line. As a result I have never stopped to eat. Yesterday, on Sunday, I braved the crowds and tried BC for the first time.   Service was great. Even though the restaurant was very busy, the servers and waitresses did a great job of taking our order, keeping our glasses filled, and getting us our food quickly.   The food was good, but not the most amazing breakfast I have ever had.   I would/will go again, but it will probably be a few months before I look at going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito. Definitely was not the best breakfast burrito I have ever had, but it was still pretty good.

zxhjgX07M8VdF2R6c1RhpA.text: I honestly don't understand what the big deal is about this place. It's always crowded just because the location is in a great spot. Breakfast food isn't anything to write home about. If you want runny eggs and soggy toast, this is your place. Also, as a paying customer, I don't appreciate the snotty attitude of the waitresses.

9LXbXfMj1JxtTHac4S33_w.text: Loved this place! Great scene, amazing food, really well-priced and in a great area. Plus wait staff was super nice.

6rlTvsvpkBAqE-i8R7ZJjw.text: Slowest service ever! 15 mins to get a drink after being seated and there wasn't a large crowd. The cokes are pay per bottle and not fountain drinks. Go across the street for music and great food at Montauk. We left after paying $12 for drinks at Breakfast Club.

VlWyTkaNlFMQlpak5OMyFQ.text: When we arrived at 1030 and there was a 45min to 1 hour wait my expectations were raised.  And they were met.  BC uses the nowait app which can cut down on line time.  Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. Excellent service.  The fresh squeezed lemonade and apple juice were superb.  The French toast had an excellent rich vanilla flavor.  The Dip sandwich meat was perfect and the flavor wonderful.  The huevos con masa had a rich spicy flavor that was very satisfying.  The only real drawback is how loud the dining area is, as it makes it hard to hold a conversation.

8B3BHPTI0QXNiovIxGnfLw.text: This is located in OLD Scottsdale and was so convenient to our hotel. It's packed so be patient. I sat at the counter. The menu is somewhat limited but it's all good. Portions are just right.  The staff is young and energetic. Very helpful with pointing out where other things to do were so early in the morning. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Very busy morning

dU1tUx_v35lkephmH0jVUA.text: I ordered a bloody mary as well as eggs benedict... the food was great and very filling! Everyone in my party was happy with their food. The only complaint I have was that there was some sort of faulty equipment on the ceiling that dumped water on a couple girls at our table, one got it so bad she was drenched. Eventually our table was moved, but it took a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Zdk96Xr9ZGV7LXhczOQb-Q.text: Nice service but way over-rated. Hung through the estimated hourlong wait to find great service and mediocre food--from the cappuccino to the hue is rancheros. Cap was muddy and rancheros soggy. Oh well, next time will know to just walk a couple blocks where things are quieter and the wait time shorter.

mosv5JUmaPSaTMQBotFLBA.text: I hesitate to write this because I've been here so many times and never a fan of writing negative reviews but here is what happened on my last visit. We knew it would be a long wait so we put our name in and gladly waited. When they sent us the text that our table was ready the girl at the counter asked if everyone in our party was here. I said yes and that my wife was parking the car and getting the baby out. All she said was "Ok". 25 minuets later we were still waiting and even though my wife had been there with us for a while we weren't being seated.  I was watching party after party come in and get seated before us so I asked when we we would be seated and the hostess seemed really annoyed with me. She told me she couldn't seat everyone until our entire party was there. I wish I would have known!  I certainly don't want to be an annoying customer but when she said "ok" the first time I had the impression we were going to be seated.

KXPl2M5o7a2XYbrkqX7knw.text: The food was excellent and so was the service! I had one of the omelets and the portion size was huge. Orange juice was freshly squeezed. I'll definitely be back!

wIGyPIho76ImSCfwMus_fA.text: Came here for breakfast this afternoon (Saturday around 12) and was very pleased with my experience!! Michelle was our server and she was great! Very attentive, without being annoying. From past experiences, that's hard to completely accomplish so I was very pleased! My boyfriend and I barely had to wait ten minutes for a table...on a Saturday!! We're in Old Town Scottsdale so it's totally understandable to wait for a table at a delicious restaurant (which I don't think people around here understand). I created my own omelet, and it was delicious! My boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito and he loved it. We are foodies...especially me with breakfast food so I couldn't make a decision so we also ordered French toast and loved it too!! Cute place with a very friendly staff definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Create your own omelet, French toast, &amp; breakfast burrito!!

ZW53C2hAElMVEPdfcf1oHw.text: I had breakfast here twice in a 3 day period while visiting a friend in Scottsdale. As a breakfast lover, I was impressed with their selection of Benedicts - I had the Filet Mignon my first time eating there. The 2nd time I went I hit paydirt by ordering the Huevos Rancheros. This is everything a breakfast should be - hearty with lots of texture, seasoning and just enough spice, with two perfectly cooked eggs on top. And the plate was huge. I seriously could eat that for breakfast every day. I also appreciated their freshly pressed juice, though there was too much of it. Offering a large and a small option (that is legitimately large or small) would be helpful. Other than that, a very pleasant meal, and I didn't have any problems with service as others have mentioned. We were served quickly, and allowed to linger the 2nd day when a flash storm came. Great little breakfast spot!

9pmcAC4FJNAZ6g-aG38VVQ.text: Yummy! Had the signature French toast while enjoying outdoor seating with light water misters to keep you cool on a hot AZ day. The breakfast grilled cheese also looked amazing as it went by us and had been recommended by our waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Signature French Toast

ZYfdiY3kbXxhGbbUuzzASg.text: Its a bit crowded and loud but their grilled chicken is out of this world. Full of rosemary flavor without the crunch of it. Its excellent!

UUYMldgxX4Z0xBKaDhIbZA.text: Great breakfast place.  Highly recommend.   Biscuits and gravy was different then you'd normally see and very good.   My husband had the breakfast scramble and really enjoyed it. Large quantities so you'll leave full.

j2eWxCT6g1PqIKNwwSUOUg.text: Best omelette I've had in a while! At most establishments, low carb choices for breakfast can be dicey, but the whole hog omelette was outstanding! Nice and friendly waitstaff. Will be back for sure! Wait wasn't that bad, and their smartphone texting service should be the standard at all restaurants for queuing customers.

ju05u2QRq2lCioYm1KqDqA.text: AMAZING  Allows dogs outside which is great! Generous pours for the mimosas!! Amazing verde sauce and coffee bar selections!

5BlOWBHcC0LBmJfIGPZlwg.text: Food was delicious. Our waitress was excellent. They have a really good coffee bar. Would highly recommend!

ZERvShQvwEF5YPh10Oj_4A.text: We had always wanted to try this restaurant. Mostly because it's noticeably always packed every time we have driven by it and there was always a long wait the times we had tried it we ended up going somewhere else.  Long story short we got there early 8 a.m. we were seated in a very back booth that gave us a great view of the whole restaurant &  kitchen. Our waitress was very friendly and quick. I got a cold coffee with a hazelnut flavoring that was delicious. I ordered the huevos rancheros which was a crispy corn tortilla underneath lettuce ,pico de gallo, avocado,  black beans mix. Which sounds like a lot but it was very light and I enjoyed the crispy  corn tortilla .

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good morning!

RxqgeWZjEG5KhGLH8tIwfA.text: We made our decision to go based on the the great reviews and the reviews were accurate!  I ordered the malted waffle and my hubby the steak and eggs. The waffle was slightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Perfect combination.  I was also happy that it came out warm. My husband stated over and over that his steak was cooked to perfection--medium rare. He offered me a taste and I agreed.  We definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffle
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; eggs

SVUtnPhdsZ79TlMDgAHjnw.text: We were on a staycation at the Hotel Valley Ho and we needed a fast high quality breakfast! I have been craving waffles for months and that's what I got! Fresh Berry's a super delish waffle! Highly recommended and the prices are reasonable!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffles with berries

kOeTuLgGt-AAKrQnQNePhA.text: We sat at the bar and the servers were great other than it took about 10 minutes to get our drinks (never order the tigers blood it was possibly the worst coffee infused drink I ever had). The disappointing part was the food. We order the eggs Benedict and biscuits and gravy. I was surprised when our food came out so quickly but it made sense once tasting it. I felt like I was eating fast food and that everything was pre made in heaters. The biscuits were dry, the english muffin was pathetic and no flavor in the hollandaise sauce. I've had better ham on a Mcmuffin. I would not recommend eating here unless you are looking for something quick.

xoQIgW-g95ssqBIeX3FWEw.text: the staff were all friendly and efficient. we had to wait about 20 mins, which wasn't a big deal for 12:30pm on a saturday. the menu has a lot of options and the food came out pretty quickly. unfortunately, it was fairly bland and just average at best. i've had better breakfast sandwiches for similar prices elsewhere. also, the atmosphere is reminiscent of a denny's. if that's a place you love then you'll be happy, but if you avoid that specific chain, i'd pass on this place.

vpY5vumZVGnuNzNNWNy6gw.text: Came here on a Sunday brunch and of course, it's packed. We had a huge party, and we didn't know that everyone had to be there. We were waiting on one person, we asked to get seated so that we could order. We asked ahead of time for our friend that was coming what he wanted so we could order, but they declined our request. We ended up sitting for another 20 min before our full party was there to get seated. Another party after ya, got sat first, so due to that, we had to wait even longer for another big table to open up. At this point all of us were tired of being hungry and wanted to leave, but we stayed. Our server was so nice and really accommodated our full party. We ordered quickly as possible, and our food came out at a decent time. The food was okay, not anything crazy special. I got the steak and eggs, and the steak portion was small I thought. I wish they could of sat us down so we could order and get our food started while we waited, that would have helped our time and hunger as well.

gbDnp8hvQORFtIaBIDdTMg.text: Always our favorite! Yummy jalapeno biscuits, blue corn pancakes, delicious omelettes, haven't had a bad breakfast yet  Just know that you'll have to wait; call ahead for larger parties & get on the list

7y59NRlCaIJj5kXgGu1Nxw.text: OMG!!!! Where do I start with this place?   We were visiting Scottsdale for girl's trip. This place has super amazing food with very good customer service. I have to tell you upfront that the wait is little longer than other places but trust me, the line goes very fast. They also send you a text which lets you view how many parties are front of you.   What's also great is that the place is located center of old town Scottsdale which means you can hang in other shops while you wait for your turn.   We decided to order butter pancakes, BC Bagel which comes with tomato, avocado, and veggie cream cheese, and hash brown. The food quality was very fresh and tasted very good. Besides the food, I like the fact that the servers checked on us multiple time to see if we needed anything else.   We loved this place so much that we came back on the last day of our trip! Can't wait to visit this place again !!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Butter Pancakes Chai Latte BC Bagel Hash Browns

tOFyhyUM7Cx_AAPFMjdCig.text: We had 6 people. The staff was nice, professional and timely. Everyone's breakfast was great! I would totally go back and I would order the same meal again. Those are the two questions I ask myself when trying a new restaurant.  3 of our 6 people ordered the bagel breakfast. It looked fantastic . There were no leftovers. Thinking about when I can get back to try it.

e9LagTQTlyOed76RLnI7lA.text: Avoid - my boyfriend and I went last Sunday.....  had to wait an hour for a table (that gave me the impression that it would be worth the wait).    Got seated at the worst table in the place - right by the kitchen.  I should have said something, but I was hungry and thought the food would make up for it (it didn't).  Had a meat lovers omelet (something like that) and the sausage tasted like bologna.  Seriously - I kept thinking it was a bad joke and somebody put bologna in the omelet.  I picked out all of the nasty sausage -   This was my first and last trip to the Breakfast Club.  Way too many great restaurants in Scottsdale to waste time and money here.

aVsv1sPFkWBTyTW557MkTg.text: This is a classic must for brunch or breakfast in Scottsdale. Very good food and the service is great. I would say you'll probably expect a wait as it is busy during brunch times ! Other than that check em out!

aoWZiXm0xwtAyDIurAjqOg.text: Had the breakfast burrito and it was amazing. Could not finish it. Make sure to get the queso. My friend had the tamale con masa and even though it only came with one tamale still was good. Wish it would have came with too but still a good amount of food.

jqOHJyDK2YCeILnRzqv1ug.text: If your a local or just visiting I recommend stopping here! We went on a Sunday so of course the wait was around an hour, but we checked in on yelp before we left the house and that helped minimize the wait. They have misters so sitting outside is comfortable. I highly recommend the French toast and the breakfast sandwich, they were amazing and plenty filling! My boyfriend had there BC Infused coffee and he said it was amazing. The staff was so nice and the food did not disappoint, I would come here again:)

KgnjBSKQeiXvqxQvAD1rEA.text: The food is always good and very affordable, but the experiences with one particular waitress leaves me questioning whether I want to come back. Whitney was our server a year ago, and she seemed to be upset that day. Today, she seemed much more chipper, but the moment we paid the bill she literally stopped serving us and seemed to make deliberate efforts to avoid eye contact where we had to ask someone else to help us get coffee to-go. Really disappointing. Feel somewhat stupid for thanking her for the great service on the receipt.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole hog
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pRKb63kX_xvtTPGaPf9h7w.text: We stopped in for a quick breakfast before heading to the airport. I love that you can join the waitlist through the yelp app, so when we arrived we were promptly seated. I ordered the fruit bowl and Scottish oatmeal, and both were delicious. I can't rave enough about the fruit-it was all fresh and delicious. Not to mention the little pineapple boat it comes in is adorable. It was served with a little yogurt and granola on the side which was a nice little dip to add. We also ordered a side of French toast (which was amazing-that challah bread was perfectly crisp on the outside and soft on the inside) and the breakfast classic with eggs, bacon and toast. All the options were very reasonably priced and kept us full for hours. Our server was also friendly and the whole restaurant had a happy, relaxed vibe. Would definitely come back if we are in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fruit Bowl

2kToUYPLPlcT1vpb6amBcQ.text: Visiting Arizona for the next few weeks. This was my first breakfast in town and what a wonderful start to my business trip. The food was fresh, tasty and quick. The espresso was delightful. The staff at the bar were fun. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced Americano and Quick Start Loaded

8UdBz8yR6X3v7FPiOlGq_w.text: Use the Yelp app to add yourself to the waitlist!!!  We failed to use the app and waited 45mins in person for a table for two at around 11am. They have a weird system where there are cafe tables where you can sit and order coffee from the bar while you wait for a call to tell you a different table is now available for your meal. Meanwhile  their bar seating - which accommodates about 20- is a total free-for-all. Expect no mercy or sportsmanly concessions from those who will jump in front of you if you snooze when a customer at the bar vacates their seat.  Once you do get a table, you can expect an overstretched server but the food comes out quickly. Decent fried chicken sandwich served with not-super-crispy sweet potato fries for my husband. They made me a great customized breakfast with my favorite foods and get bonus points for offering non-pork breakfast meats! I try to be low carb at breakfast and this menu offers options.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Customized breakfast: filet mignon,  turkey sausage, poached egg, hash brown served with hollandaise and ketchup.

Xy9GYd6PlFnwzZnnK4KL8A.text: My favorite local breakfast joint. Great place to people watch during tourist season but can be very busy then. Their iced coffees are huge and really good.

vBu6mw2XozxdTxBCemmCGg.text: Fun, lively, good food, and almost no available parking. That about sums up the Breakfast Club on most days. While I was fortunate to get seating right away (at the bar), there were several other couples that had to wait between 15-20 minutes for a seating area not at the bar, nor outside (there is water mist provided outside).   Saturdays are raucous with locals and tourists alike, so try to get here early. Mimosas are served here all day long, yet I'm not certain about when beer, wine & spirits start to be served. Friendly & attentive staff throughout. The Tinga Chicken Frittata omellette ($11) is completely on point here, and hard to mess up! With the avocado, the blend of light seasoning and vegetables fall effortlessly down your esophagus. Just pure bliss. The Cold Brew Nitro? Absolutely outstanding. Even better are the prices. For Scottsdale? Very, very reasonable.   The one annoying thing at the Breakfast Club is the parking. Good luck. Very tight, extremely limited. Although there is a restaurant next door that seems to open late, why take the chance of getting towed? I'd park further down the street, if necessary.   Altogether, this is on par with Lolo's Waffles for Scottsdale breakfast options. And like Lolo's, it is loud, loud, LOUD up in here!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tinga Chicken Frittata with avocado. $11.

YrTBAX3lKigGRvhxXLIKQQ.text: Went here for the first time with my husband. Ordered the turkey omelet which was not Carved Turkey, it was processed turkey,gross. Then the fruit on a toothpick was covered with bugs. See photo. Will never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SGFUDmMJt87wAA-m6BpjDQ.text: What a great breakfast. I sat at bar and met some people. Great place to just trade talk. Food was great. Staff was great. Place was great. Go here people. Go.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. At the bar

8h0yFPlfWnBCqO1mOmcxSg.text: Seriously. Been coming here for a few years now. It's like any other restaurants where you get some great service and some others but over all this place freaking rocks. Food is awesome, ambience is spot on and service is pretty good. Love this place. Huevos rancheros... unreal.

x5p_IiOPPnURVpHjxIH_Sg.text: I've been here a handful of times, 2 of which were terrible, but recently it has been better.  The first 2 times I had really poor service and one time I found a hair in my food.  The other times I went with a group so it wasn't my choice, but surprisingly the service was better and the food was good.  Seems like it's always super busy on the weekends, but I don't think it's worth a wait.

4ceGu1RXw3D8pMUOXd3Mvw.text: Run. Don't walk here! Great food, service and scenery. Everything in Scottsdale is wonderful and these place is no exception. I had a craving for sweets and tried the Bananas Foster Pancake! If came with ICE CREAM!!! At 8am in the morning!! My inner child was dancing bc I had dessert for breakfast and enjoyed every single bite!! Seriously though, it won't disappoint! Lots of good, healthy choices too!!

40nG1pNe3TKMvjs8FB-lzA.text: Really great find and a 3 min walk from the W Hotel. We sat on the Patio and just took in the early rays and service was really fast and efficient.   They make fresh smoothies and juice drinks as well as my Cafe Latte was amazing. Food is fresh, healthy, and good sized portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing Latte

AWu0SDypPmMwcnuPrHaVfg.text: The food is standard.  As someone who avoids gluten, there is nothing gluten-free here to be super excited about.  The restaurant staff is meh.

MN6TfoZGYCpuxfROsiYANQ.text: The food was excellent the portions are a great size. Extremely positive atmosphere. The fastest order to table delivery service we have ever had. It was astonishingly quick.

lm5Y968KpxKTapZ07981wA.text: Great place to go for breakfast... huge menu, yummy adult breakfast drink options, fun atmosphere, great service, delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jJvPog8nFRseyaS-vMCg4Q.text: been there multiple times and sat at the bar, 2 servers and no clues. waited to order, waited to get refill, and waited with napkin in my plate to get bill. Oh, and the food is ok.

KyRf8JVqAfJPs61UmgbvHA.text: Breakfast club has okay food. This is a restaurant I would wait for max 20 mins before being seated. I don't understand what all the fuss is about. Tried the Huevos Rancheros and made my mind up that it tasted like any other Huevos Rancheros I have had else where. I think it's over hyped.

uBcIEfTyIA5QvvOhNfcWPg.text: This was my first time to the Breakfast club. It was a great place to enjoy some tasty breakfast options. I ordered the Tuscan Grinder which is more of a lunch option. Luckily we were able to use the yelp app to put ourselves in the waitlist before we got there because the wait time was 30+minutes at 9am. Everyone around us seemed to enjoy their breakfast but everything did seem a but rushed. Maybe if we had sat outside it would have been different. Overall great placr

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious Tuscan Grinder

AdZW0UvMO-xvWvO1qDptTA.text: before you leave your house, make sure to check in via the waitlist app. this will eliminate any waiting! you'll thank me later.   this place has great food with amazing presentation. i ordered the Breakfast Club Signature French Toast and it was very flavorful. the fruit kind of makes me feel like i'm eating something healthy... haha. if you're into bloody mary's or mimosas, they have them here!   i love the selection here and everything that i've ordered didn't disappoint. my first time coming, i had to wait more than an hour so make sure to take advantage of the app. the food is great but wasn't worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BC Signature French Toast!

TyTpHdN6YOWocplruJlRGA.text: The food is okay. But the service is terrible! I never been to a restaurant serves like that, that's for particular waitress, I don't want to watch your shit on your face! Literally we asked everything twice, she come to put the check when we just started to eat! And  was asking us if we finish the meal while we were still eating?? I never been to a restaurant that put me into such a mood.

tG3UYxTFzta4jyI1i1jUtQ.text: Meh. There was a long wait and the food was okay. The waitress was super sweet and nice.

5vCikqMNzCRNy6nLGo1xMQ.text: Breakfast was okay. I hope that the manager/s teach the servers proper manners to ask if customers are done with their food and not just take the plate which my friend was still using. She just left the check on our table. NO WORDS.  I hope you address this.

2WWhe6By763oev-zFUjEug.text: Love this place!  Food and staff are awesome!  Great environment for business breakfast or meal with family or friends (lunch or dinner).  The food is so fresh and consistent.  Making a stop here for breakfast when in the Phx area is a must do for me.  Look forward to my next trip to the area!

z-nHyipvIf2nPYJwrfpmHA.text: Great Service along with some good grub. Enjoy visiting when in town.  Breakfast burritos to amazing Huevos rancheros that we're unreal tied to some good coffee (bulletproof) makes for must stop. Little busy but for good reason.

HZzYwOsyfw69VUOnfE01Pw.text: Its alright nothing to special about it just your normal breakfast spot. Morning squeeze and daily dose have more unique concepts

L4SJaBE-WSmYrDOQC9dHHA.text: Came here while I was visiting my younger brother and before we had to drive back home. This place is very good and was very busy for a week day and being about 10 am. Just a heads up, come a little early due to the parking being very tough to find.  Ended up getting egg Benedict and pancakes which was very yummy! We didn't have any food left at the end of the meal. Would definitely come back!

reVAop-FDbcrkJNScrPJ8w.text: The 1st rule of the Breakfast Club is not never talk about the Breakfast Club. The 1st rule of the Breakfast Club is NEVER eat at the Breakfast Club. The 2nd rule is NEVER talk about the Breakfast Club.

W1XE6aW1V88X5nm9nRBKpA.text: Food and service were amazing! We went on Sunday before labor day with a large group (bachelorette party) and were seated without waiting too long, and the waitress split all our checks with no issues. The restaurant is clean and the style/decor is fresh. The food was yummy-- one of the best smoked salmon bene's i've had. the pickles in the bloody mary are also yummy!

Sva0p7acKd-hH-czcuq2lg.text: I was very surprised that this restaurant (that I had been told to try by lots of people) was only very average. It was a long wait (which was normal I guess) but the hostesses were not very nice and neither was our waitress. All of the staff seemed a little stuck up. The breakfast menu was pretty standard and a little overpriced. The biscuits and gravy were $11 and it was not big at all. Usually for that amount of b&g it's only $7/8 at other places. All of the food my  table got was only luke warm, which was a major downer.  Also, it was NFL Sunday and they had a good amount of tvs inside. Only problem was, there were two games on tv and they had infomercials and news on every tv except one. It just seems like this place could be better if they did some things different and tried to be better then average.

mTjxhucI02OfvksECZnFTA.text: I'll be gentle, as there is no negative star listed on the grading scale. I consider myself an adventurous and easy to please type of guy but there are limits. After successfully scanning previous reviews, I decided to partake of a Tex-Mex breakfast experience in Scottsdale AZ. Boy was I disappointed. In fact, in the defense of the chefs, perhaps certain delicacies are best suited for an acquired taste. My primary complaint is not food but service. Well, partial. My waitress was warm and helpful. However, some form of kitchen management returned a meal that was not to my liking and basically said, "deal with it". Her exact words were.."we take great pride in our food"....and "I won't take this off your tab"...and "the menu states the ingredients". Ummmm. First, I have a doctorate. I can read. Secondly, I never asked for a free meal. I just returned it and asked for something else. I walked in with 850.00 of pocket change but was treated like a vagabond. Guess what lady, I'm also contacting Fodors. Any service industry business must be first concerned with the satisfaction of your customers. They can make or break you. Perhaps you will learn.  Even after this poor manager service experience, I left my waitress Christie a 50.00 tip. Never judge a book by its cover!!!!

quJ9S7vH8o1OZUEMLeqOWg.text: I'm very surprised by the good reviews. I went for brunch on a busy weekend and had to wait quite awhile. I have no problem with that.   My disappointment lies with the apparent lack of skill in the kitchen. I ordered a custom omelette with spinach and bacon. Sounds simple and tasty, right? Well, they ruined it. There was NO seasoning at all. I NEVER add salt to meals, but had to to make it at all palatable. The hash was also bland.   Our waitress seemed especially dim. I wonder if they primarily hire girls who couldn't get into college. I didn't see a single male employee and no female employee looked to be older than 25.   There were two tables of LOUD frat boys behind us, which didn't improve the experience at all.   It seems like the place is overrun with inexperienced people. They turn over tables quickly, but I definitely won't return.

Di3v132rAXxfpnLzuKYM8A.text: So as often as I don't venture to Snottsdale, the movie I wanted to see was only showing here so eating nearby just made sense.  The open floor plan is nice and the decor is simple but modern and clean.  Did I notice that all of the waitresses were wearing yoga pants?  I did, and that isn't a bad thing.  I got the french dip + mushrooms and swiss and a coffee to help with my hangover.  The sweet potato fries could have standed to be crunchier, but the flavor was there and the sandwich was quite tasty.  Normally at a place with a name such as this I would only stick to breakfast - but when one is hung over, you must go with your gut instinct, and I'm glad I did.  Traffic / parking was a mess, but I suppose that's to be expected on a weekend with such beautiful weather.  Overall, I dig this place and will likely be back.

dTgyGsQI_mdEQ4eidMbBwA.text: Yum! I visited this place after hiking Camelback one morning, and it was just what I needed.   It's a relatively busy place, especially on a weekend morning, so even though it's been around for a while, I hadn't decided to check it out until recently. And I'm glad I did. Definitely expect to wait, but if you've got good company, you can hang out in their waiting area - the coffee bar - and get yourself some drinks to start with and just chit chat.  The atmosphere is lively but relaxing; easy to zone out and be in your own little universe. My friend and I ordered two different dishes we were interested in trying and split them - a challah french toast dish and an eggs benedict dish. Both were amazing! We were not disappointed. Though probably not my most favorite french toast in all my life time (I love challah french toast, only way to go), it was quite memorable and something that would encourage me to return so that I can try some of their other items; though knowing me I always seem to go back to what is tried and True.  Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed. Service was fast and friendly, so even though you'll most likely have to wait for a table, it's worth it.

YjNREAynM2tUuZmwumCPZg.text: at a friend's suggestion we tried this place out.  it was a mere 35 miles from our home in Anthem!  We were so happy we made the trip.  My husband has been dreaming about the pulled pork since our visit!  I loved my breakfast and the coffee was the best.  We are going back to meet the friend that suggested it this week.  Yummy!

AaXbx1YS1YcS1LbyUxRflA.text: I loved this place. Great atmosphere, great design and decor, great crowd, and great employees.  I kept coming here every morning it was so good. The thick bacon was amazing, and I appreciate the small serving of fruit they include.  All the food was tasty and ample. Very good quality ingredients.  Parking around back is a little tight and tricky. Get here early on the weekends or you'll have a bit of a wait unless you want to sit at the counter.  Definitely GO!

ALFbj_QpLUXEABV99qRVZw.text: I had heard great things about this place and was very excited to try it. All of the food is really fresh and good quality, and is prepared perfectly. Their iced BC coffee is delicious and I am not even a big coffee drinker. The bacon is perfect and their sandwiches are delicious on bread or a bagel.   The service is great and extremely quick. They get you what you need and are fast.  Awesome place and I recommend it for breakfast or lunch!

LGO7ZCwkKAQU0pVHu_JU0A.text: Don't come here they will mot seat you until your entire party arrives. Not a friendly policy for a place to meet.

8ufg_gR0jMZtgc84WQ5oUA.text: We go here for the breakfast/ brunch. Everything taste good and there Mimosas are off the chain!! Yummy.. Bacon is really good. They give large amounts of food, u never leave hungry ur pretty much set for the day. I like both locations Scottsdale and downtown. The only thing is wait!! It Can be like an hour long but it pretty worth it at both locations. If u want a great breakfast and nice drinks go here. Love this place.

b2r-ofxN1fHytSWlFaeENA.text: Oh. My. Freaking. Goodness.  AMAZING breakfast!!  One of the best ever!  We got there 10:30 am or so on a weekday... thinking maybe we would miss the early crowd. NO such luck. It was a spring training baseball day, with the Giants playing just around the corner apparently (we were going to an afternoon game too,but at a different stadium, thus we didn't know about this closer stadium-Giants).  Anyway - had to wait about 45 minutes. That was ok, because it gave us a chance to walk around some of the cute, unique shops in Olde Town!    Got seated out on the patio (overlooking the street - so I just pretended we overlooked the ocean or something beautiful like that, ha).  Good server, fast service.  AMAZING fresh squeezed grapefruit juice for me ($7 for a large - wow), and... the BEST PART OF THE MEAL - portabello mushroom eggs benedict in the most delicious sauce EVER!!!!!!!!!!! SO SO SO wonderful!  Daughter's chocolate chip pancakes were great, and hubby and kids had normal breakfast stuff (eggs, bacon, etc) and loved it too.  So glad one of hubby's friends had told us about this place.  It's on our list of places to go to again next time we are in Scottsdale!  Go there... you won't be sorry.

BZsUqM_ntdMk_VrH7kV9BQ.text: Been here a couple of times and the food's been good each time.  Have had a couple of breakfast entrees and also had the Chicken Sandwich on a wheat bagel that was good.  The service I've received hasn't been very good and the wait staff aren't very friendly.

nom5-XSY7hZBbnbHqwOVjg.text: Good food, a bit pricey. Definitely has some high class clientele, but it's not a dressy atmosphere. I like Butter's in Scottsdale better for breakfast.

NOaK0ZyRzAI9KuXftMAOIg.text: Went this morning for the first time for a meeting with one other person. Wanted to sit at one of the high top tables to have some privacy and be able to speak without people close by. Was advised there's no service at these tables. They had us go to the counter and order carry out. Ok, we did and explained we would be eating there. So, instead of bringing out food out on plates. Everything was packed in individual plastic containers. Between, the omelettes, toast, fruit, etc we had 6 containers in two plastic bags for over $38 w/o tip. The restaurant was very nice and clean. For 8am on a Monday morning they weren't packed. Kind of surprised they wouldn't have gone out of their way a bit.  I won't be going back.

-Wt6bXKy7taG4aAidQZ86w.text: The Breakfast Club? Wasn't that the old movie from the 80's where a group of delinquents found that they were deeper than just their surface looks? Well, unfortunately, at this Breakfast Club- it is all superficial.   I thought with the Old Town location that this would be a good breakfast choice. And given the fact that there were people standing outside to get in at 9:15am - that is also usually a signal that a place has a following. So imagine my surprise when the food didn't live up to my expectations.   If this review was only for Eli- the super fast, all seeing, all knowing, ever patient barrista who also minded the counter superhero, this would be a 5 star review for sure. Here's a guy who is pleasant, quick, multitasks and puts up with the most inane requests from people, all with a smile on his face.   I sat at his counter, ordered up an espresso (perfectly made) and some breakfast. The breakfast came out post haste! I mean- I had barely cracked the binding on my book when placed in front of me was huge plate with two Eggs Benedict, a pile of melon and pineapple and breakfast potatoes with pepper and onions.   But it was here that my dream morning came to an abrupt halt. While the eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise sauce was almost orange- not the golden buttery color associated with real hollandaise. And it was full of red pepper. If I wanted my eggs spicy- I would have ordered them that way. I wished my Eggs Benedict had come looking like the picture that is posted on Yelp. And those potatoes? Eh. Not so good.   The people next to me ordered pancakes and bacon and had there been a contest- those would have been the big winner, for sure!   Breakfast and an espresso ran about $18. There is plenty of parking in the lot or on the street. If you go- and want stellar service- sit at the coffee bar and have Eli take care of you.   Great service from Eli. Friendly and accommodating host staff. But the food? I felt for a moment that I was in detention at the Breakfast Club. And that alone will have me looking elsewhere for my favorite meal of the day.

APj5JzdIk7HbQVoMKeD_4Q.text: Food was okay.  The service was snotty.  My brother-in -law didn't  get his rye toast and realized when the check came. It was brought up to the waitress and she did not handle it well. Said she could bring him toast now.  When we were all done eating?! He declined and she did nothing else to comp for it. The wait was normal for a popular breakfast spot. Sent back our bloody Mary's because they were watery and bland. Got a screwdriver instead but it was still too watery.  My sister got a greyhound and it was a little better but still somewhat watery. My daughter loved her chocolate chip pancakes. Wouldn't go back.

INWK5A4bKa0t3TeD8zQdTQ.text: This place is great. The service has always been wonderful. The food is outstanding. The coffee is amazing. I love the atmosphere, great big windows to look at the bustling downtown area. My favorite breakfast spot to go to.  Prices are very fair.The only legitimate complaints people have is that it gets busy. Well it's busy for a reason, so if you have the time it's worth the wait.

40WlFrJ7tJzvlVh6B0xnxQ.text: Ambiance is perfect!  Service was under 10 minutes on a Saturday morning!  Management was personable and took care of us! Thank you Stephen!

mu-Yoos96VkokmNUJLNDFg.text: I came in from NYC this weekend to experience Scottsdale and was taken to The Breakfast Club by a friend who lives in the area. I can honestly say much of my experience here can be best summed up by the word / sound "Meh"   I was quoted a wait time of around 10 mins but it ended up being closed to 30 mins. The waitress was ok but not overly attentive. The coffee was alright. I ordered the Huevos rancheros which was actually pretty good. I order this dish whenever I can and this was a great authentic green chili version. I thought the pork was top notch but the egg was entirely too small for the size of the dish. Having enough egg to add to every bite is what makes the dish perfection and this fell a bit short.  All and all I think you can easilly get a better breakfast at over easy but it's not in downtown scottsdale. The location was very cool and gave me a nice feel for the city. Bottom-line not the worst place to get breakfast but you could do better.

ca1EjHITPqOnXv5UVfpnjg.text: Went here twice last weekend. I tried the lox salmon eggs benedict and enjoyed it. Then, I tried the waffles which were pretty good. It's a nice location and they also have mimosa's and bloody mary's for a weekend brunch. I'd like to come back here soon.

gxp2U1l3E0ZTvlnw_Xv6zA.text: I finally checked this place out last weekend, and I am so glad that I did! This place is great overall. We sat outside on the patio, and it was fun people watching and looking at the cars going by. I had a mimosa, which was a bit pricey at $10, but it was in a huge class and was very tasty. My dining companion had a Bloody Mary--also $10 for the big size--which he enjoyed. The coffee was very nice as well. Following the recommendation of my server, I chose the Cinnamon Challah French Toast. It was SO good! Unlike some breakfast places, where you only get a minimal dusting of toppings on your french toast, my plate was loaded up with candied nuts and blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries. It was well worth the $11 because it was a HUGE serving. I think it came with 3 giant pieces of bread. The service was really great, friendly, and attentive. I can't wait to check this place out again. There are lots of other items that sound tasty, and they also serve lunch.

fJt9InZl8LoIL7t3G9ZiDg.text: On a recent trip to Scottsdale, we walked over to the Breakfast Club every morning for breakfast. I would dare to say that you would have a tough time finding something not to like here.   I tried something different every day and was never disappointed. By far the most impressive item was the jalapeno biscuits and gravy with fontina cheese. We got an order for the table to share, and they didn't last long!   There is typically quite a wait at the door, and they don't serve alcohol, so don't count on bloody's or mimosas. Don't let that discourage you, though. The Breakfast Club is worth the wait, and sobriety.

TAUX3itxCyZJffAilW-uQQ.text: Really great place for brunch!  Huge breakfast menu!  My only complaint is that they say they have "black iced tea" but it's really some passionfruit or peach black tea.  Otherwise a winner.  Be prepared to wait if you arrive after 10AM!

JNYmcZWB5efu9DPi7zNyeg.text: Good food, good location.  One quick recommendation.  Tone down your portions on certain items, namely the Eggs Benedict.  Maybe offer a half portion or something.  It was a good dish but, as I am currently not subscribing to a 7,500 calorie a day diet, it is too much.  The waffle was the best this side of Over Easy.

C-KtZACtMOPJomEMK5M90Q.text: We started each morning of our vacation at The Breakfast Club.  Everything was so tasty; juices are fresh-squeezed.  Menu has quite a variety and portions are very filling  It gets busy early.  Be sure to give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rancho

2gIaz1zTVVsat-xqp2YbSg.text: When you say Breakfast Club, I say awesome '80s flick full of detention and dancing through hallways -- but let's save that gnarly story for another day.   Many a morning, I'll pass The Breakfast Club and there's a line out the door like bacon's going out of style. At first, I wondered what it was all about. Then I ate there and have since been back over and over and over again. It's pretty good! Worth the wait? I'm going with a solid...heck ya if you have the time to spare.   I'm an avocado snob and you can get a good selection of the buttery green goodness in any omelet or egg dish you choose...or if you just want it on the side to accompany your waffles. I love the omelet selection with the grilled veggies and salty potatoes. The pancakes are large and in charge. Their coffee is roasted like the best of them. Plus they have the option for community dining seats which can sometimes be fun and a cool way to meet new people (but they also have normal solo dining as well).   The only main deterrent against making The Breakfast Club my go-to breakfast all the time is the wait, but I've learned that I need to go at off-times in order to avoid the line. The main hours of craziness are around 8:00-10:30 AM on the weekends -- pretty much the prime time breakfast hours. But, if you could.. let's say ... wake up a tad earlier (eek!) or make it brunch instead of breakfast, then you might avoid the lines. Otherwise, just sit tight and wait for the table. You might also try to find an excuse to have a breakfast meeting during the weekday there. It's a lot less crowded on the weekdays. Regardless, I think the wait is pretty much worth it.  You can also grab a coffee to go while you wait in case you're a caffeine addict like me (even though Diet Coke is my drug of choice) and you need your fix.

Gi71ATXpPjHc7cDByStlKA.text: I went for the eggs benedict. Very disappointed. They use a thick slice of virginia smoked ham, and it was quite greasy. The hollandaise was broken and curdled, and way too spicey.  The poached eggs were cooked in too hot of water, the whites were quite rubbery. The service was good, but aloof. Waitresses wear tight black pants. Some of them even look good in them.

MApjVaY7papPYc0WH9iNtg.text: Delicious food and a great waitress who definitely knew her stuff, rest of staff was beautiful to boot as well.

TKgp_P6XVbmTB97slaBn7Q.text: Good Food and wait is waaaay better since they expanded awhile back. Staff is prompt and pleasant. If you have to wait order a beverage at the breakfast bar on the left.

U1JfJ0A-gDjZOGxQU0TfUw.text: I am a regular at this breakfast spot, and it's money every time. The food is great, the service is solid, and the drink choices are even better. If you're in Scottsdale then this is a must try for breakfast.

QwcsO4rD7k-ltIDZYpA5NQ.text: I love breakfast and I Iove trying new places. Got to try the Breakfast Club today and I wonder why this place gets so busy. We got there at about 8:15am on a Sunday, immediately seated. I forgot to say iced on my dirty chai and told my server before I got my drink. She said they would remake it although I just asked for a glass of ice. The drinks were the best part, I got the Turkey Benedict my husband got their eyes, bacon and toast. Most of their breakfasts are made with 4 eggs which is a lot in my opinion. My poached eggs were rubbery and my husbands over medium eggs were runny. Cost wise, I struggle with paying $11 for a basic Benedict and most items were over $10. Last week we did brunch right across the street at the Montauk. I recommend going there, their steak and egg sandwich was really good and big enough to share. We will stop into the BC for coffee drinks if we are in the area but I don't see myself making the trip over to Scottsdale for BC. I gave three stars for our service, the drinks and how my server handled my hot versus iced coffee situation. Also I am a yogi and I wear yoga pants all the time, but not sure about them being used as a uniform. Again just my opinion.

zAGryr86xzxs53VPUsqTRA.text: I've come here many a time straight off a hike off Camelback Mtn, so yeah, my buddies and I certainly ain't looking pretty.  Never felt slighted.  I always get the Quick Start Conscious Breakfast, depending on someone else to order the dessert style breakfasts (Cinn Challah w/ fresh berries.. mmmm) to snag a few forkfuls from there...   Today was a first for lunch.. the place was so relaxing and never felt rushed.  The turkey wrap was surprisingly good (not healthy boring), and the sweet potato fries should be the std for all such fries in the valley.  OMG.. I'm ordering that as a side forever more here.

AVF48jQe2tloN5tNqYzvOg.text: The breakfast club is definitely a great stand-by for good brunch food.  My personal favorite is the Turkey Bene, I really appreciate how great their hollandaise sauce is.  Also, the portions are great for the price.  I see this situation so often though where the food is great, but the service is pretty crappy.  The last time I went to the BClub was on a Sunday, which of course is their busiest day.  Our server didn't make eye contact with us for the first half of the meal.  Not even a smile.  I get it, Sundays probably suck to work as a brunch server...but hey, no one is forcing you to work here.  Put on your smile, and get through it.  If you want a conveniently located brunch place with good food, and you don't mind a wait, check this place out...just don't expect bubbly servers. To improve the experience, stop by the bungalow across the street for a mimosa during your wait.

6Oy3gKOFNBp7S2cn0oTsGQ.text: trendy but the food is great and the staff is incredibly nice, don't not go because of the old town stigma. There is a loooong looong wait for breakfast on the weekends but definitely try it at least once because it is well worth it.

Uyqh9StCsT6DI9sRUyP2hA.text: We were staying at the Phoenician Resort and we were not turned on by the menu they offered. My sister in-law recommended The Breakfast Club do we drove a couple miles down the road and got a delicious breakfast.  My  wife got the "Foster: Topped with Bananas Foster & Vanilla Ice Cream" and she thought it was really good. I got the "Huevos Con Masa w/ Chipotle Cornbread, Chorizo Queso & Pico de Gallo" and that was really out of this world. I never had anything like this before and i commend them for how unique the dish was. This place is better than Ihop (which is 2 stars in my book) and probably cheaper. I would come here again and again.

7t9Io3fAdV-LArxdba4yOg.text: Great way to breakfast! I like that they will modify your orders to give you a meal the way you might prepare ti at home for yourself!

_7disGLBETi7J0AlAN5U5g.text: Have eaten here a couple of times and have been fairly pleased.  Ate here Saturday November 3rd.  Service okay, but food was cold.  Later, after no other food, stomach problems and out it came.  My impression is that they are so busy they cut corners, with the food and probably with the prep in the kitchen.

MdgmcsXUD65vJcCFm-blug.text: As below average as one can expect of any restaurant in South Scottsdale.  We wound up here, I don't know how, for breakfast this morning... and let's just say - it was everything I thought it would be.  Snooty waitstaff - check Overpriced completely average food - check Pretentious crowd - check  I got a $10 waffle and a $3 bottle of Figi water.  My husband had a sip of OJ for his $2.50, then spent another $2.50 on coffee (no creamer).  He also had really greasy potatoes and an "eh" omelette (and he is not hard to impress with food).  Why two stars?  His fruit was good.  Last I checked, that's thanks to God and good farmers, not snooty Scottsdalites.  We won't be back.

ENesUjtzh8GCMQXSvVsQcw.text: What an awesome find. An old friend suggested we meet here for breakfast this morning. Walked in at 8:30 and was told there'd be a 15-20 minute wait for a table. That's a good sign...that people like the place...  Instead, I camped out at the breakfast bar and waited for my friend. In the meantime, I ordered a BC Coffee...which is iced coffee with Hazelnut and Caramel syrup...mine with Almond milk. It was great.  Once my friend arrived, we ordered. He ordered something massive and great looking. I ordered the "Grilled Cheese"...a total euphemism since it includes bacon, hash browns and eggs in addition to cheese on sourdough. Our server suggested I add avocado and tomato to it...which I did. Simply awesome.   Our server, Victoria (a/k/a 'Barista1') was awesome as well. She was attentive and proactive. Never had to ask for a refill on my water. Table service showed up unasked for. And great positive energy.  Huge portions. Great coffee. Fantastic food. And supreme service with a smile. Definitely a "go-to!"

-PCtePbOcEVLwK-lMPPYwg.text: Delicious, fresh meal. Great and fast,service.Nice and friendly staff. Good location.  We will be back again.

8j3HVM2hAqSPVNfoKNj6eg.text: Loved this place! Great fun vibe at 9am on Sunday. 30 min wait, not bad. Coffee excellent. Food delicious, fresh, eggs cooked perfectly. Service was fast.  We'll be back soon!

veEEpNKBmOxos-5QFhmCAQ.text: Riding a bike nearby customer 's eating going very slowly. Out walks a waitress verbally asssaulting us! In front of the customers. No one hit by either bike. No signs up. Decided to have breakfast in a friendlier environment. FYI

fP24Eiv9JSqg3NMisk1JZA.text: I had a great breakfast with my VIP David G this morning.   Alicia took care of us (with pride and confidence).  The food and the people are so delicious and beautiful here.  I was impressed: this organization recently remodeled.  It wasn't long after that it became one of the most popular eating establishments in Scottsdale.  I chose the three egg omelet with turkey sausage, mushrooms and jalapenos.  The only changes I will make; I wish to stay longer and visit more often.  David G; when can we breakfast here again?

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The people are beautiful here
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast with my VIP

NunZAAcQDqIfn_f0rBW69Q.text: We were there at opening. Nothing like 72 degrees, all the doors open, and the scent of freshed squeezed orange juice wafting through the restaurant!  The food was great, fresh, and reasonably priced. Great location right in Scottsdale.  Get the orange juice!

WUPV0DAJGheujL-kDMNz5g.text: Everything here was amazing! It definitely should be one your bucket list for breakfast in Scottsdale and is worth the wait. Luckily you can get in line on the Nowait app and yourself save time.   We ordered the breakfast burrito, huevos masa, biscuits with country gravy, and the pancakes.  Everything was great and couldn't be better.

hrziv952xj4MtCZEyC4PTw.text: Great experience, used the Join wait list from yelp and it worked. The hostess was friendly upon arrival and directed us to where we could order very good coffee at the counter. We were seated in few minutes and the server was very a professional. The food was very good. The blue corn meal pancake was the superb. The omelet  we ordered came with a spear of fresh fruit which were well portioned slices of pineapple, honey dew and cantaloupe. The potatoes were sauteed in peppers and onions with just enough oil. We loved our server and gave her 25% tip. This  was a five star breakfast.

_N8rkbJ4n89jSB0bGVWt2A.text: Dined here for the first time ever while in town for Spring Training.  The place was busy.  I ordered a Breakfast Bowl which was apparently pork with chile verde sauce on top of an egg scramble.  It was okay but nothing special.  I think that I could do better making something like that at home.  I also had a Bloody Mary.  I got what tasted like a Virgin Mary.  Very light pour of vodka.  I opted not to complain to my waiter because I didn't want the hassle.  I won't be back on my own accord but if I'm with a group of friends who would want to go,  I wouldn't object.  I won't be ordering the Breakfast Bowl or a Bloody Mary.

7ROBuQR16cxEXqpgw_-fZg.text: I'm not a huge breakfast guy, so when I say this place is great, it must be.  If you can manage to get in without too much of a wait, you will most likely have an exceptional experience.  Great food, awesome vibrant servers, quick turnaround on orders and their Bloody Mary's are the bomb. On the way out the door, our server overheard us talking about hiking Camelback, so she brought us all complimentary bottled waters for the hike.  Great overall experience.

kUDIR0U8VZywDMeyrDncJA.text: Once again the breakfast club does not disappoint you and what are their signature omelettes customized to my liking with my grilled onions and grilled mushrooms fabulous fabulous fabulous service was extremely courteous and extremely friendly my waiter Jayme and her coworkers make sure you have all you need. Besides they have a great people watching  outside seating area at the Scottsdale location.  Definitely recommend it to anyone in the area, not pricey either.

RnoD5aEdAh8wsMKMH8n38Q.text: Excellent food excellent service very little wait with online checkin. Noisy inside so we sat outside.  Im looking forward to going again soon for breakfast!

8FZRPBwhyEByPTMk1Spk3w.text: Today I'm having the omelette it was very good and the service was good Will definitely be back to this place

HWyY-t08gRQ5lHh6HZTziA.text: Food is stil good, but the remodel is not for me - too spacey and cold - not my style - I like cosy with breakfast, thanks for not changing the menu - hubby loves your pancakes - we will come in on accasion when he needs a pancake fix.

qyraGkOcGn6q5qusXvoIjQ.text: Breakfast starts with fresh squeezed juice of your choice and the Orange juice is fantastic liquid sunshine! Today I had the Ham Bene and it is so tasty complete w potatoes and fresh fruit! Hubby had the best blueberry waffle yesterday . A comfortable walk from our hotel. We love it here

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ham Bene
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Umbrellas and heaters on the patio
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy coffee and latte and fresh squeezed Oj!

BqVee9HlvolRUOIuMH3YIg.text: The food here was great!!! but the only problem I had was they were trying to seat us next to random people that had 4 kids jumping up and down and no one wants to sit right next to kids. It was basically the same table.

tRvlZiUxWmsB6kh_4rC9Ew.text: I had high expectations for this place but was very disappointed. I ordered ham and eggs (over medium). Instead of a ham steak off the bone I got an oval of pressed, salty ham wanna be. Then there is the eggs. Even the most humble of restaurants is able to cook eggs over-medium properly. These were very sloppy with the whites not even cooked. I sent them back but meanwhile my breakfast mates were about done. The potatoes Obrien were just ok but not my favorite type of breakfast potatoes.  Service was fine but the waitress a little surprised that I would send something back. Perhaps the majority of diners don't know any better?

uDBfGr_XRnurNnpu_il6gQ.text: Nice menu with old standbys (pancakes, egss, bacon etc.) and some interesting items as well - eggs with chorizo sauce over cornbread, huevos rancheros with green chili pork topping in a bowl over lettuce and a small amount of beans and cheese, eggs benedict with salmon.  Lox and bagel plate for $13 could have used a bit more salmon for the price.   Jalapeno cheddar biscuit with pork gravy was mediocre.  Service is quite, quite fast so tables turn quickly.

60M_pYNVLISaxNFhpNYImw.text: Ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it was delicious! I didn't mix it all together but instead ate from a couple parts at a time to enjoy all the flavors. Also ordered the Quick Start Loaded and it's the right portion for a great price. I also had a bite of The Bird and I love the filling in this omelet!  The service was quick and great and I think the food is worth the price here.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick Start Loaded with sunny side up eggs
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros with The Bird in the background

MOWBONjyRMLzHqDzyVPRLg.text: One of our must go to places to eat when coming to Phoenix/Scottsdale. Always good quality food! The berry salad Topped with the Pine crusted chicken breast is my favorite. All egg dishes and sandwiches are excellent. Their signature French toast dish is over-the-top delicious.

sq4EZb8wjAqcv6ssAcaraw.text: First off, I want to say that the hostesses was amazing. She was beyond amazing and help me choose my seat, my meal and made some amazing conversation.   Second, the food was good, it could've been better if my waitress wasn't such a rude person. She drops my food off and walks away. No smile, no hello, nothing. I watch as she interacts with every other customer, she chats away and seems to have a grand old time. Meanwhile she makes no attempt at a conversation.   Third, drops off the check, I pay, she brings it back, still no conversation. It felt like I was given the bums rush. Such a shitty experience, maybe the hostess should be the waitress, she definitely has the people skills for it. Also I'm glad your location is next to PHX start up hub... This will cause for some interesting business if you continue to hire shitty waitress.

RJn80BmEKthOnVd2Idwxkg.text: This place in two words....FIRST CLASS.  I was told about this place from a cabbie (Thanks) I ordered two breakfast plates the next morning and no regrets, everything was put together like I was eating in house, I can only imagine what the in house service is like.....Oh I did I mention the food was GREAT!!!!!   I will recommend this establishment to all......

7nTFgbTuJIDrxxsLWo-zrA.text: If I lived near here, I don't think I would go anywhere else for breakfast. I would definitely be a regular.  Without a doubt, the Border Bowl I got was one of the most delicious and perfectly executed breakfasts I've ever had in my life. When I ordered it, I half expected it to come out a sloppy mess...but the fact that I loved all the ingredients won me over. I mean, I MORE than half expected a sloppy mess.
