9scXfQgH576lE7GQe3prQg.text: The wait for brunch this most recent Sunday was not too long. We did have to wait for our whole party of 10 to arrive before putting our name down so be sure all of your guests are present if you have a big party. The service was timely and our server was calm, not super excited but did her job well and made sure we were taken care of. The food was great and there was a large variety of options. They had great alcoholic beverages as well, super creative. We were able to sit down and eat in about an hour which is rare for a brunch/breakfast place at this time on a Sunday in Old Town Scottsdale! I'll definitely be returning!

_Yg5oAcFqefe2HXdzINZPw.text: Absolutely not disappointed in this place! Fanatic food and service. Food is OUTSTANDING...we had the boarder bowl and the banana fosters French toast...was out of this world. Fresh squeezed oj, good coffee and love the fact the patio is dog friendly. The best part is you can be put on the "waitlist" on Yelp so you don't even have to go and put your name on the list ..BIG BONUS POINTS there! We will absolutely 100% be coming back to enjoy the food and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Fosters French toast and Boarder Bowl
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patio is dog friendly which is always great for the doggy mom! We will be bring our fur baby next time!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Rest.Redeem.Repeat breakfast cocktail. Was not bad, didn&#39;t short on the alcohol which is always a big plus! Nothing to write home!

BFccetu4BCBJoS42p-cv4Q.text: Came here for breakfast with my friend and it was about 930 or 10 AM. We were sat pretty promptly and ordered And received our food within 30 minutes. Really tasty! Will be back again

Q-_YpM8UNbdZQJiU2f_u5w.text: Adriana was fabulous this morning.  The service and food were fantastic.  Definitely a place to keep on your must stops in scottsdale.

ixLhmXrB2mYPfdfl6lUbiA.text: Great for breakfast! The huevos rancheros was the best I've ever had.  Eggs Benedict were also good. Good menu; something for everyone. Nice outdoor patio.

jDt-1lxHP-K9wlSwJ_Zn7A.text: I ordered "The Bird" omelette. It came with 4 slices of fruit and potatoes with red and green peppers. It was excellent!! I also ordered a jalapeno cheddar biscuit. The biscuit was burnt on top. That's my only complaint. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

kn-bWgTAWzZ6TYDqzqs_NQ.text: So great!!! Our server was so amazing, and the service was super quick!! Went on a Saturday morning, and since we did the "add to waitlist" option on Yelp we barely had to wait at all! The food was nothing short of amazing too. Highly recommend their Dirty Chai's

U3XWO9hqfY2hWM9hyG0faQ.text: Great place for breakfast!  Good food.  Good service.  Good prices.  Quality food .  Patio seating for when the weather is nice.  Try the eggs Benedict!

QVh4UUoCnXgqGVI70IL55Q.text: Came here during the week since friends were in town. About a 10 min wait at about 1130am. Got seated outside and order a Bloody Mary. OMG. A little on the spicy side but garnished with a pickle, green olive and a Peperoncini. Delicious ! Being so close to the traffic seems strange on the patio but hey, it's Snobsdale... our meals came and we were not disappointed! My eggs were done perfect everyone else's dishes were superb! Nice menu full of breakfast and lunches you won't want to miss

MMYp7CnNpsJJP7oe992LQw.text: We were in need of breakfast/brunch and how can you go wrong with place call Breakfast Club?!  There was a ten-minute wait on a Friday mid-morning but well worth it.  I am very particular about my over medium eggs and they nailed it! Whites fully cooked with the runny yolk. Thank you thank you thank you!  Good food and good service.

ipbQB791qFZdmDpWETjDnQ.text: Stayed at a nearby resort so decided to try it. I got the fried chicken w gravy and it was delicious. They do only have sweet potato fries which was the downfall personally for me. Food was quick to come out and the other person that came with me had a turkey wrap that also was real good. I recommend coming here if in the area.

_rbqmN5cc4nb2Ex-LETQdw.text: Good breakfast spot.  Coffee service was on point and the food was tasty.  Just what I needed before a long day of meetings and travel.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PLNAQtLDxJFg3uLCMt9sng.text: My son and I really enjoy having breakfast here. He loves the yummy French toast with berries and I enjoy the Huevos rancheros. He was a bit disappointed with the size of the chocolate milk for $3 in a tiny kids cup, but other than that we really enjoy it. There is usually about a 30min wait but worth it.

qM9UAkIEzoPSAv9gIpsBqA.text: The bar staff is hit or miss. Some appear bright eyed and bushy tailed others seem to be in a haze and forget condiments/ water refills etc.    The place is clean and offers some hardy breakfast plates.  Another plus side is that I have never enjoyed bloody mary's until I came to Breakfast Club.  They know how to shake up a quick pick me up. I do appreciate the flavorful and crisp bacon accompanied by some hash browns that are adequately seasoned.

8khQuPMd0Vx0aq8LbA1AbQ.text: I have been coming here since they opened. Consistant good food. Their bacon is the best. My hysband loves the pancakes and he can get different things off the side. Everyone is friendly the wait staff are on top of it.

dwWsR2ySHJAJGLGKrNeOyQ.text: I'm giving breakfast club three stars because the food was good but not great. The service was wonderful and the ambience is diner style. I did not try any of their cocktails but they looked great and were decently priced!  The wait time on a Wednesday around 10am was about 10 minutes! I will go back but it might not be my first choice for breakfast in Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chorizo breakfast burrito

YyhpHrRlqOATN4gUocv2hQ.text: Not kid friendly at all, they scoffed when we asked for a kids menu. I don't now how to convay this any more. They don't want you to bring kids here. Not only do they not have a kids menu but they suggest to order everything a la carte.. and at four dollars an egg that is absolutely outrageous. I could understand if this was an adult oriented business but it's just breakfast not a night club.. and not family friendly breakfast at that.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NjQTlfrNshe4iJ0KD783Gw.text: I had always wanted to try this place but it looked so busy all the time! I decided to take a Friday off of work since a friend was visiting from out of town and we were able to get seated in 5 mins. The menu had a lot of great brunch options. I ordered a waffle with berries and a side of chicken sausage. Both were really good! I appreciate restaurants that offer chicken or turkey variations of bacon/sausage so that alone was a plus for me. The atmosphere was good. We sat outside and they had misters going so it felt very comfortable. I will definitely come back here again and try other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VZNjz-mifXwrFAtk0USBhQ.text: We come to Spring Training every year, and this place is always packed. Never has the time to wait, but thanks to Yelp we were able to get on "Yelp Waitlist" while we got ready.  Food was all great. I had the French toast and it was tasty!  The rest of the table enjoyed their meals (breakfast burrito bowl, eggs benny).  Very reasonably priced.  Several gluten-free options (my wife is celiac and had the burrito bowl with a couple minor changes).

wW0L0kreDyEZLQ6v00bN9Q.text: This place is good all around.  The food is prepared very uniquely, you can't find the dish anywhere else.  The ingredients are so fresh,  real fast is always spot on here.  Service:  service is great, the servers are obviously committed to service which is a rare things these days. Drinks:  good pours keep em up.  The screwdrivers are what you need. Just make reservations prior or it can be a bit of a wait.

pVqAev2LbQiNDzjxzsfmrw.text: Underwhelmed. I realize this is the place to go, but don't get it. I am all for a decadent brunch or fancy breakfast. But for the price it costs you are receiving very ordinary food.

RCa_mGtJgeky7YNV_8HhLA.text: Had breakfast with the gang. Great space to bring a your group with lots of choices and tv all around. The food is ok probably I just ordered the Quick Start egg and bacon. Great service which definitely is a plus.

R1FrqmJd74lChC6W21-hJg.text: Ok this place has the best breakfast in town! And i mean it if you snooze you lose trying to get a table here past 10 am. SOOO worth it though. I bring my family and friends when they come to visit and they love it!!

gxt_O0HWkA3UwjGLuEFg7w.text: The wait here gets a little long on weekends but it is situated around a part of town where you can walk around and grab coffee/shop. We ordered the lox Benedict and banana foster French toast. Both were delicious. I especially appreciated our waitresses enthusiasm for food! At one point she thought we didn't have syrup at our table (which we did) and almost freaked out saying "you gotta have syrup!" As foodies we thoroughly appreciated her concern for us at the thought of us going syrup-less!

ERwRxvuIltLIGoJeF6ebEw.text: Staff was amazing every one was very nice and out waitress was awesome. She cracked jokes and had a great time! The food was good. We tried the biscuits and gravy which was very interesting because they were jalapeno cheddar biscuits with a homestyle sausage gravy and they were absolutely amazing. I ordered the chicken fried chicken with eggs and potatoes. It was good but I wouldn't order it again my family loved it. I wasn't personally a fan of the potatoes but my family loved them and would absolutely order then again. My brother ordered the monte cristo which we all loved and would 100% order it again. My father ordered the mignon benni which was ok he loved it but the rest of us wouldn't order it again. My mom ordered the traditional benni and it was great, the hollandaise was great and really food for a traditional benni. Over all we all had pretty food meals and I definitely know what I would order again.

uyYmxRMhG2-5g390ANzQ7w.text: Popped my eggs Benedict cherry and couldn't be more satisfied. All i would say is WOW!!! WIND BLOWING #explosive.  Breakfast of champions. Ask for the server Maile. THE BEST.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_6A_KwrNBN-kO2xbdEInag.text: I was in Scottsdale for a week and Wednesday I found this gem.  After breakfast Wednesday I made it a point to go the rest of the week, three more times!  The BC iced coffee with infused caramel was a perfect way to start the day.  I tried three different things, BC bagel, BC sandwich, and Breakfast grilled cheese.  They all were amazing!  The BC sandwich is great for a lighter choice and the horseradish mayo has great flavor and not overpowering.  The grilled cheese was phenomenial!  A bigger sandwich but mmmm mmmm good!  Bacon thick and perfect crunch, cheeses melt in your mouth and a heap of hashbrowns on your sandwich!  A definite must to get your day started!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast grilled cheese and BC infused iced coffee, so good you need TWO!!

IXwDr42cXpOppKUNi2Tn0w.text: Arrived to the restuarant on a Sunday, just my son and I. It was about 10:30, 11:00, so a pretty busy time. They quoted us about a 45-60 minute wait, which is very reasonable. What's cool is they have a bar area you can order from while you wait. They also have a text message feature where you can check the progress of your wait. We ended up waiting a lot shorter than expected, so that was nice.  The staff was very nice, and our server (Alana/Alanna, not sure of the spelling) was absolutely amazing. She was very upbeat, positive, and enthusiastic. You can tell she not only enjoys being there, but enjoys her customers as well.  The menu has plenty of options for breakfast, lunch, savory, sweet, health conscious, etc. What I had was good. I would say more about it, but I'm giving this place 5 stars for a reason. Perhaps you can find out for yourself? :)   The vibe is also very nice. It may tailor more to a certain generation or two, but it's most definitely appropriate for all ages. It may be a little loud inside, but that's mostly due to patron/employee conversation (not loud music like some places).  So, anyway. Great place. It gets as busy as it does for a reason. I recommend, and I look forward to visiting again.

yZptOmlVeYIyycgPQfGz9Q.text: Great service. Whitney was my server & she killed it! Great food.  I had the Huevos rancheros with Tinga  Excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2QsvxI5iSFGt9cm6aF1j_A.text: This place exceeded my expectations in every way.  We did the online Yelp waitlist, which worked great, so thank you Yelp and BC.  I was a bit wary at first about this place. Why? The name put me off at first, because the word "club" always makes me think about some cut-rate retail store, as calling businesses a "club" was trendy for a while. The other issue was the prominence of the bar. That normally means that the focus is on the beer, wine and cocktails, at the expense of the food, and the young "hipsters" as the expense of the everybody else.  To my great surprise, the food here really is the focus, with the beverages a nice complement to the great food. Even more, the service was very down to earth and the place was quite able to accommodate families and hipsters, the retired and the working class all together.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bananas Foster French Toast
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blue Corn Pancakes

D0HYdQC7PgwYpRrOBM4U-w.text: Definitely one of the best places for brunch in Scottsdale.   The chicken fried chicken was hella good. Seasonal carrot ginger juice and the jalapeno biscuit was very good too! 10/10 would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken

wx7lZtxrHV_iOQHO4MGxNA.text: Thanks to Yelp's virtual waitlist we were able to snag a seat here. This place gets BUSY. There was even a wait for breakfast on a Monday, if that is any indicator.  I joined the waitlist from the hotel and by the time I arrived at Breakfast Club my wait was only a few minutes. I'm a big time #fangirl of this Yelp feature, just saying.  In Scottsdale most of the brunch spots open around 11, whereas the Breakfast Club starts serving food at around 6 or 7 AM. So it's basically like a diner with a hipper feel. Before 11 they are pretty much the only game in town for this (at least from what I came across) so the huge wait time is not surprising.   The menu is classic breakfast food. Again, it's sort of like an elevated diner experience. You can find anything from a breakfast burrito to chicken and waffles, and then of course there are a ton of omelette and pancake options. I went with a veggie frittata that had lots of fresh veggies, mozz cheese and was topped in a green goddess avocado pesto sauce. The cheese was melted on the top instead of mixed within which I didn't love, and there were also some cold slices of cucumber and tomato on top which didn't really blend with the eggs. Otherwise the dish was tasty! I also really liked the side of potatoes with onion and pepper.  Our server was extremely sweet and friendly and we were in and out in under an hour. Overall it's a good pick for a fast and quality breakfast. Not as trendy as some of the other brunch options in town, but for hearty breakfast you really can't go wrong.

yE0oZlcdjIKU2jAGgfbsWw.text: Went to this restaurant, based on Yelp and we were not upset with our visit. We sat at the counter because Sunday mornings are very busy and the wait was 45 minutes.  The food was good and we'll just leave it alone.

b14oKUR1OaKp6ldZSPWyjQ.text: Breakfast club is my guilty pleasure. When I first moved to Phoenix I was looking for a good Breakfast place like a normal person. Breakfast Club is a couple blocks from my job so one morning decided to stop and grab breakfast. WHEN I SAY THIS PLACE HAS THE BEST EGGS BENEDICT AND BREAKFAST POTATOES,  i mean it. It was so good that every time I go that's all I ever get. I know one day I'll get tired but until then I'll enjoy the eggs Benedict that as so addicting.  The place is so clean, every time I go the waiters and waitresses are beyond amazing.

bKkT-JPTLBmEJe82a4P2pw.text: My fav weekend spot!!!!  Not sure how a restaurant makes eggs better, but they did, love this place!!!

_rv2aBAKDMil4LjVzqogBQ.text: Good morning.   I write this as a helpful message. You should to pay more attention to your bar staff, "some"of them lack any personality, attentiveness or smiles. I believe as someone that comes once or twice a week for the last 4 years you are loosing your FUN yes FUN. I used to leave with a smile and now I leave with hmmmm Sometimes I think should have just waited for a table or gone to my other go too for breakfast.    Also I have notice that 5 time out of 10 I send my food back because it was not hot and this happened yesterday as well.   Please don't take this the wrong way I love the Breakfast Club I just wanted you to know what I see.   The  3 star is for yesterday's food and service.

WYU1O3EKZQFuKh3ckLjFXA.text: We enjoyed the breakfast club The food is excellent and we called ahead and they said it would be about a 20-25 minute wait when we arrived 20 minutes later we still had to wait another 40 minutes before, we where seated. This was on a Friday on the weekends we get seated in 20 minutes. Too many hostess too much talking and not paying attention.

dUW2ILqOqlrMX29qNQHDxg.text: I frequent BC for brunch and love their food! They have a great, diverse menu of delicious food but I personally recommend the biscuits and gravy. Their drinks are tasty, though they are a little pricy. My one issue with BC is spotty service. Some of the servers don't seem to care very much and depending on who you get, you may never see your waitress the whole time. It is not uncommon for them to disappear for a long time and you end up with empty drink glasses or wait a long time to order. I'm not sure if it is an issue with management or if they are perpetually understaffed. If you plan to go on a weekend day, I recommend calling ahead of time, seeing how long the wait is, and getting on the list. On a Saturday or Sunday, it can easily be 30-45 minutes and you can save yourself a lot of time by calling!

wRrAKZTMHtdo7l_mzcT6HQ.text: I wanted to dislike this place in the worst way.  The Decor and Staff, like Scottsdale in general are a little too pretty - but I was proven wrong.  I had a Tuscan Omelette - Buffalo Mozzerella Cheese with Pesto, and Husband had Huevos Rancheros which was served with an insane amount of Beef on a Baked Tortilla.  It was good - Really good.  The side potatoes had nice fresh green and red peppers which was a cut above the rest of the homefry mush we'd been having all week.  Coffee - meh.  One amusing item - the "Breakfast Cocktail" list offered to supersize them!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tuscan Omelette
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Club

8GLdqJ2dKaj6lP1UgP8HVg.text: You can always judge a restaurant by the lines outside waiting to get in.  This place was busy each and every single day that we came for breakfast during our vacation to Scottsdale!  We chose to sit at the counter during our 3 visits (yes, we decided to eat here every single morning!) and the service was impeccable!  The waitresses were over the top with their customer service!  Being from out of state, they gave us many suggestions on where to visit, where to eat and what areas to look in during our home search.    The food was reasonably priced and portioned.  My husband had both breakfast and lunch during our times there and said that both were delicious.  This is definitely a location that will be our "go to" when in Scottsdale in the future.

NF0hCWR3W7eHcbwcFjv8JQ.text: We needed to have an early breakfast since my husband and I were both working that morning.  We had planned on going to RnR, but they were closed when we got there at 7:30....I really need to stop assuming that restaurants actually open early for breakfast!!    My husband was working in the area and notice the Breakfast Club the day before and suggested that we give it a try.  I almost never try any restaurant without checking it out on Yelp first, but we were in a pinch.    Well, you know that saying "everything happens for a reason"...well, the reason by RnR wasn't open was so we would try Breakfast Club.  The host at the door was very friendly and welcoming, the restaurant was spotless, the service was very friendly and attentive, and the food was VERY good!  My husband had a custom-created omelet that was the Southwest version of a Denver omelet, but with Chorizo instead of ham.  It was fluffy and flavorful and loaded with tons of fresh veggies, cheese, and tasty Chorizo.  The omelet was plated with fresh sliced fruit, and AMAZING potatoes!!  I had the Southwest breakfast burrito and it was delicious!  It was eggs, Refritos negros, Lettuce, Chorizo & Cheddar Cheese.  (It usually comes with Pepperjack, but I subbed for Cheddar).  It was topped with a spicy sauce and I could have had it topped with Green Pork or Chorizo Queso, but I went plain.  It was very, very good!  My plate was also adorned with delicious fresh sliced fruit and the AMAZING potatoes.   The potatoes are large pieces of tenderly sauteed red potatoes with fresh peppers and onions.  Seriously...I have eaten many types of breakfast potatoes in my day and these are easily in the top 5!  We are only here for 4 days and I wouldn't be surprised if we go back again before we leave!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

blMCG_IoLy4q9HR540h8Og.text: AMAZING service (our server was Jayme, super sweet) and food came out hot and fast! prices are also affordable and not too long of a wait either. overall, great place for brunch in Scottsdale! would recommend to anyone!

t9rFfqzbnGzPtPEJJ2bvXg.text: Delicious breakfast burrito! Staff is friendly and helpful. I here on business and plan to visit any time I'm in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tWFOmbx9m71_aCLhMepYWQ.text: This place has quite the hype in Old Town Scottsdale, however I have begun to wonder why. Consistently I have received poor service the multiple times I have been, though the food is not terrible, it is certainly not a place to go have a meal with a staff that does not really hear and pay attention to what a customer is saying. We received the bill on this last visit, there was an item that was not ours, which I suspect is when the waitress goofed on the computer because when my breakfast arrived it was wrong, followed by taking 10 minutes to produce the right one. Then we asked her to fix it, my friend had put down her card, before noticing the goof, however we were going to separate the bill with our items; the waitress assumed she was paying and charged the whole bill to her card (she did not bother to clarify how we wanted to pay). Then we let her know we wanted to separate our items (I had even pen marked which items were mine on the itemized receipt). She then comes back with the bill just split in half, at this point we were already frustrated that our waitress refused to listen to us and simply kept making assumptions. I will not come here again (this is not the first time our service has been less than sublime), the food is not worth feeling as though the staff is not paying attention to their customers.  P.s., consistently when choosing a table outside, I have noticed they are slow to start the table off with even drinks at the least, thus keeping you waiting.

ce44mePmtFoUNueOepJVGg.text: Our server was wonderful! The best part was I could actually see in the kitchen. This transparency was great! Eat here! Great food and atmosphere!

jtwaIVgzp5JMe6Ks7BirJw.text: There was a long wait but that's expected in Scottsdale. I got a coffee at the juice bar while waiting, which was perfect. Their food was delicious and the service was excellent. Also, their mimosas were giant. I loved it and would recommend to others. Just expect a wait

pb1qa1GtQaw_cV3RrY0crg.text: Apparantely they aren't connect with yelp's digital waitlist. Because when we got here, they didn't have my information. I got no apology from the front of house staff, and was asked what I wanted to do. Then told its another 20 minutes. Gimme a break.

TsZLdCJasxqbUILtfvwBFQ.text: Perfect place to refuel after an evening in Old Town. The people watching is some of the best around. If you ever wondered what that hot girl/guy at the club looks like first thing in the morning, this is the place for you.   Food is fantastic, especially the classic French toast. Give it a shot you won't be disappointed. If you're looking for something a little more complex than the standard eggs, pancakes and bacon combo, breakfast club should be at the top of your list.

Kx4b9YcuF-QXPwhPOCpGSg.text: Nice little brunch spot and it happens to be the name of my favorite movie so we had to stop. I got "the bird". It was good, I had the hash browns instead of the potatoes with peppers and onions - glad I made the switch. It was hearty and flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HytFep3QOwTcakXf_zbzeA.text: Perfect food, perfect atmosphere for an amazing breakfast. Asha was a perfect server as well

YBa6p7uIKxfDv3YMTx0OsQ.text: I am not a breakfast nut like my gal Nydi, but when I am feeling HUNGRY after a long night out there is nothing like some greasy wholesome breakfast food!    What sets Breakfast Club (BC) apart is the younger crowd and the lively vibe, and quite frankly just about everyone in the room seems to be in the same state I am when I stroll in here on the weekends...except the few random tourists.  The two servers I recently had here were fabulous and quite funny as well.  Sometimes I feel like they need background music in here though, I felt like I was very aware of everybody's conversation around me.  And heaven forbid anybody have to listen to me and my friends' ridiculous conversations...Although on the flip side I have met some cool neighborly people in the BC due to this feature.    My other complaint is there will most certainly be a wait.  However I guess that is to be expected in this busy part of town and a testament to their sound and hearty breakfast grub!  I usually just have crispy bacon and hash browns at the BC, but I can say all my friends have had some impressive and yummy breakfast dishes for a reasonable price!  I also highly recommend their hazelnut iced coffee; my server recommended it to me last time and it is now a staple when I come the the BC!

XfUD0dqCUV2Lo0EkEEkFqQ.text: Food was good but very spicy which I wasn't expecting until the food found my mouth.  Service was okay, but nothing extraordinary.  We got there and they didn't take our name for their list until after another couple entered and they took theirs first (about 5 min later).  They didn't offer a high chair for my friends 16 month old, we eventually asked when the food came.  And no kids menu.

Hi60KEiEzgsdGXiEj_xESA.text: I'm gonna judge on food and than will rate customer service at bottom.   The food was fantastic! I ordered the breakfast grilled cheese and it was phenomenal! The mushroom ommlet was also very yummy and filling, however the fruit served with it was out of season and bitter. The orange juice was OK and for the price I would definently sit it out the next time I go there.   Now the customer service.. our waitress was pretty snooty..look I know I wasn't dressed in the best clothes. Lulu lemon yoga pants and a victoria secret hoodie but It was breakfast time and I was comfy get over it. Yet the table next to us where the girl who apperead to be around the same age as me was wearing a nice shirt and carrying a Louis bag got a huge friendly smile while you just had a blank dull fake smile when you talked to us..you would have gotten a good tip, but instead your attitude was unprofessional and rude. Not impressed with that aspect.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast grilled cheese

qQHQuqcH1moUWsHOOifMPA.text: Delicious food and quick service. Beware of an hour to a hour and a half long wait on Sunday mornings:

11jQkmTVPfGmRfHk6wIwgw.text: I think that the atmosphere and the staff was great. Things were very busy on a Sunday so it makes sense things took a little long to get to the table. Me and my girlfriend ordered eggs Benedict, and a breakfast burrito with chorizo queso. The food came out warm not hot. The fruit looked very dried out, and old. My biggest problem with the food was that it was flavorless. The potatoes were diced potatoes cooked with bell pepper, and had no seasoning whatsoever. The eggs Benedict did not have any flavor either. A little salt and pepper was all they needed, but I had to do that myself.. I usually love eggs benedict everywhere I go, but this was the worst I've had ever, mainly because it was so bland. My girlfriend had similar complaints about her burrito, but I can't really speak for her dish. It is a very nice place with a great atmosphere I would consider possibly coming again , and ordering something different.

MILOL2LWVOYAcJgEEvqrAw.text: Crowded for a Monday morning... but the service was wonderful, the food came out fast, and it was absolutely delicious! My friend recommended this place knowing I only had a few days in Scottsdale and it was a home run!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The French toast... a must!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Make your own omelette with delicious potatoes!

a5pikOXUelLbf9VjqeEltQ.text: Where do I start? A beautiful morning needed some good breakfast a couple of my friends suggested to come here. Me I did not want to because of the 3 and half stars on Yelp and reading a couple of reviews. But I always like to try places because everyone has a different opinion. We got there and they told us a 45 minute wait. It was nice outside so we suggested to wait because any place would be busy at that time. So we waited the 45 minutes and they call us inside. I look at the menu and I had no idea what to order. No like suggestions or Stars by popular plates how most places have it now. So I asked our waitress she gave me a couple options and I went with Border Bowl. From the description it sounded amazing. Bacon, ham, hash browns, etc. So I ordered that and their tomato soup. The soup wasn't soup it was like tomato sauce from a can.. Literally.. And right when my plate came out I looked for my bacon. I then found out it's like shredded bacon.. Very disappointed. The description didn't explain any of it or have any pictures. So I ate and I can eat a lot of food. On my 6th bite I couldn't do it. My stomach wasn't allowing it. It wasn't really bad. It just wasn't acceptable. My friends ordered the same thing and felt the same way. So I paid my 25$ breakfast.. Didn't know I had filet mignon. My stomach did not accept any of this food. I wanted to get it out of my system so bad but I just couldn't. I really was disappointed and im truly never coming back here again. Also the iced coffee there's a big poster outside about it and it looked so good and it has a special name so I thought this ice coffee was going to be BA. I think McDonald's ice coffee is better. Just truly wasn't satisfied. At least the women are good looking but got an attitude. Customer service was alright. 2 star joint. I would prefer something different maybe McDonald's breakfast?

0FiDiEDbycKPwNfx-p37Gg.text: I expected great things about this place and was disappointed - maybe because we came for lunch instead of breakfast?   I ordered the BLT - probably my most favorite sandwhich - how could you mess it up?  Well, I will give props - the sandwhich was good - lots and lots of bacon, fresh tomato and lettuce.  the bread was typical nothing fancy there.     I am most disappointed in the sweet potato fries - they were sooo bland - I couldn't even tell I was eating a sweet potato.  I ate ONE fry and not one more.  Just because sweet potato fries are so trendy doesn't mean everyone should try to serve them.     The service was ok - nothing great - we had a table of 6 and it was the tail end of lunch, so the place wasn't busy.   the main complaint is that we were having a discussion about a friends dislike of eggs - when the waitress chimmed in and said "yeah, I hate eggs - maybe because i work in a breakfast place and I know what happens with eggs".....did I mention that one of us at the table was eating eggs???     Well she put her fork down after that comment.   Not so smart there....  I won't be going back - not because it was so terrible, but since it was so bland!

4OD3QG6313rw3z_3Sm0aGg.text: Honestly, Ive never written a bad comment on Yelp. But this place kind of deserves it. A group of 6 of us went on a busy Saturday morning. We knew that there would be a wait, but didn't antisipate an hour wait, epecially when we were told 20 minutes. When they finally called our name 30 minutes after we checked in, 3 of us came to the host stand ready to be seated. The incredibly RUDE host told us that we needed our whole party to be seated ( I really wish she would have told us that when we checked in!!!) After the rest of our party had arrived, we walked up to the host stand and informed them that our party was complete. She then informed us that we would have to wait for a table to get up because they gave our table away. No big deal, so we stood up front and waited..... and waited..... and waited. Until finally the hostess heard us talking about how long we had waited, so she begrudgingly led us to our table while she rolled her eyes at us. The service once we sat at the table was fine, and the food was excellent. But i have NEVER been treated like that before as a guest.  I have been in the Restaraunt industry for almost 8 years, 5 of which I was a host, and 3 years as a server. I usually am not one to complain because I know how it is being on the other side of things. But seriously, the front of house service here is absolutely appauling. In my 8 years, I have NEVER treated a guest the way that I was treated here. Hopefully they hire some good people soon...

OZaxrx47DdrBl7RwNE6FHw.text: I have heard about this place for years so I figured I would finally give it a try. I wasn't disappointed but wasn't impressed either. We tried it on a Saturday which we were expecting it to be crazy busy, which it was but the wait wasn't too bad about 20 min. Thankfully we got sat outside which I where I was hoping to sit. It's a good place to people watch and everyone is always cruising their newest ride up and down scottsdale trying to show it off. I had the buckwheat pancakes which were recommended by the waitress and my hubby had an omelet with every kind of meat imaginable in it. My pancakes were ok, a little dry, my husbands omelet was fantastic. I would probably give this place a go again but wld try something else

9Lzpkg-Ox3Zd2haB1jYGCw.text: I love this place! I had a turkey Bene and my date had a salmon oxe. Very yummy! Crowded in the early hours of the morning  , and especially on Sundays.

pFTkGyT3I-O5DjLdLgcNOw.text: This place is amazing. It's a little crowded around the times for which I would normally eat, but the wait is never too long. Everybody is always friendly and I've never had a problem with the service.  The food is fantastic! Huge in proportion (in my opinion, but I also don't eat large meals anyway). I've had the french toast, eggs benedict and pancakes, all of which were amazing; very flavorful and definitely worth the extra buck.

WpoI5M2DvDoaZaq-t7Dxgg.text: I am glad that I remembered this place for brunch this past Saturday because it was good food and I love the atmosphere in the area as well.  I went with my BF and we put our name in, got some coffee and was seated quicker than the time the originally gave us, which is great in my book.    I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo.  I wasnt a fan of it, it was good but not GREAT.  The chorizo really lacked flavor and punch...maybe I am use to the chorizo I get back home.  My bf had pancakes with ice cream on top of it and it looked amazing and he loved it.  I would come back and probably will to try some of there other things.  This is not a place to go to thinking you will get in and out quick, there are almost always people waiting but the walk around Old Town Scottsdale is worth it.

KESM5b7kqnilx1Ij81hpGQ.text: I think they made me a 23-egg omelet. It was honestly enough for four people, but it was delicious so I may have eaten two peoples' shares. I customized my own with spinach and mushrooms, and the innards were cooked perfectly. The omelet could have been fluffier, but I imagine it take some time to flip an omelet that weighs 2 lbs. I also had some biscuits which were covered in some of the richest gravy I have ever eaten. I didn't touch the potatoes on the side because I was too full from eating everything else.  The best part of the this restaurant, in my opinion, is the coffee bar that is attached to the restaurant, but accessible through a side door. This really helps with the early morning wait. Simply ingenious.

aM3Eie93dqMs6h1NCLgwfQ.text: Food is great hostess is terrible since they are the first experience when coming in they should be more respectful my hostess put such a bad taste in my mouth my awesome food just wasn't as yummy as usual.

zA6xwJ2q7OXBOjA9ySj0Jw.text: Great place for a Sunday brunch if you don't mind waiting a while for a seat. This place is delicious and popular but very packed. We waited longer than we would have liked, but once we were seated the service was great and the food was delicious.

QitZ3uZ1X20dH-imMa2r0A.text: The best breakfast place I've been to so far! My fiance and I go out to a new place every monday and The Breakfast Club is beating everyone!!Hands down! The bloody mary was great and the steak eggs benidict was devine!! Oh man..I'm hungry again! Can't wait to go back!

luVQTJnKDOM8ep123xa5zQ.text: I love John Hughes movies, but this Breakfast Club did not live up to its namesake. The eggs were serviceable, but the potatoes O'Brian (I learned a new thing here!) were nothing special--kind of soft and oily, with large chunks of pepper. The jalepeno biscuits, which sounded conceptually grand, were not quite what I'd call a biscuit. They were tough, unflavorful little disks with jalepenos baked in. The heuvos rancheros looked like something my cat barfed up, however, they tasted fine, according to my breakfastmate.   Overall, I think this was a shade greasier than we were expecting. And outdoor seating is nice, but a mixed bag when abutting a busy road. The service was good, but something about the waitresses reminded me of the Stepford Wives.

W6woqymDtalTA0C5RVOqHA.text: Consistently good food and we have always had outstanding service.  In reading through a lot of mixed reviews I suspect our run of great luck has to do with we get here early and have not had the experience of waiting.  I can imagine if my husband had to wait 45 minutes for his first cup of their delicious coffee he would probably force me to take at least on star away. :)

pkzmHJf1NyRprMcpiAmWbw.text: This place is amazing! I always get the Bird omelet. It's a little pricey but the fact they are always consistent with quality and taste. It's worth it.  It's very popular so plan on a bit of a wait on the weekends.  But now that it's cooking off the patio is great to sit at

2VfC8M2QneLgoTfqOdTzjQ.text: Great location but the food is mediocre. Really nothing special.  Ever since they renovated it (which is a lot larger) the quality of the food has decreased.

v1jrgBr0yv8-oHwu9fRIXw.text: Great atmosphere.  Seating took a bit but we held out even though there seemed to be a lot of open seats.  Food wasn't that impressive.  We both had the eggs benedict.  It wasn't awful -- but wasn't stunning either.  It was close to our hotel so it was a good location -- I'd probably give it another shot but would try something else.

yHoCPH-JzaonFSpZh-3FFA.text: breakfast is amazing!! would've given then a 5 if they had better service.

CCV022SqZkXBUj6QL837nQ.text: Very good breakfast place; best pancakes and pineapple juice in old town! The service was good, and you can reserve a table 20 minutes out, which you will need to because it gets crowded.

h2N1YA26wWXYybMFZ9fJiQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Scottsdale. They have amazing coffee, a must for breakfast! The service is really top notch. I have had an omelette, which was more than I could eat, eggs Benedict, that were outstanding. I've also had the basic 2 egg, toast, and bacon plate. Everything is cooked perfectly, and it comes out fast. The prices are honest and there are friendly folks if you want to chat at the counter. A great breakfast is a great start to the day, and they do it well.

-mQpwQ8pYcpACbsnsU5PvA.text: We thought this place was great. They had really great omelets and the coffee was strong! There was a wait but it was worth it. The service was great. I had changed my order to substitue the eggs with egg whites and the waitress gave me NO attitude! Really a great little breakfast spot that we just happened to pass by while in Scottsdale!

LP44_Mw21BbO3UZJd9I09A.text: Food took forever. I felt like they were trying to kick us out halfway through our meal. Good food and chai tea

_KtzYNqZORW-j9iEydC6cQ.text: There's always a long wait here but you'll fit right in on a Sunday morning jumping out of your Escalade or Mercedes, geared up in full lulu lemon, running up to the hostess stand to put your name on the list as your boyfriend parks and then you both stand outside starving for an hour, waiting for your name to be called. I swear I witnessed this exact scenario about 10 times in a row. But then after standing there for about a half hour, I looked down and realized I was one of them. Damn.  Oh well, the food is obviously decent, (it's really hard to mess up breakfast after all) but the people watching is even better. My favorite are the walk of shamers, stumbling across the street in last night's sexy outfit, high heels and smeared makeup only to turn back around after interpreting the situation and the wait time. Sometimes you just need food, I get it. I just happened to have time to get somewhat dressed.

9Zo2iu5IoyIUwgw4y5TOhg.text: Service was terrible, completely oblivious attitude.  food quality not great, cheap ingredients and you can taste the difference plus they play annoying teenybopper music with douchey clientele

PhSIQHpPDalYWW2KkuNAOQ.text: Great breakfast spot in Scottsdale.  Awesome menu selections, helpful staff, and FAST service.!

rVNzY9ZBwgUYMDZ-BDqKPQ.text: I've heard about this place, and I had to ck it out! Great location and setup, food was amazing and pricing was fair. I will definitely make this "A MUST" every time I go  to Scottsdale. Thanks again for the great service Ve!

tpBEzn9UM1nrmihsDNo0sQ.text: worst Benedict ever. Asked for a median and got a well down. The Benedict has no seasoning at all! Disgusting

tZptOzr2MUDfMnOgF-xBAw.text: Had breakfast here this morning it was great the breakfast club sandwich is the way to go eggs bacon cheese on an English muffin and its very reasonable and fast the service was great it a great place to start your day at

82bfVm5q-LWSjVvNQZ8YRA.text: I'm catching up on some Yelping and I did not want to forget about this place!  New to the area and brought some friends here who were in from out of town.  We all had a great time!  Food was delicious.  Atmosphere is happy-go-lucky.  Service was on point.  It was a great place to start the day as I showed some folks around my new hometown.

KPp1zpC-bR528AA8AFww3w.text: Probably my fifth time eating here..  It is definitely becoming my favorite breakfast spot..  The menu is simple yet complex in flavorful choices.  I always get the Turkey and eggs combo and it is always great..  The waitresses are great, I am not a chatty person and they are always good at noticing this..  I just want to read my paper or play on my phone and not be bothered at 6 or 7 in the morning; they seem to get it.  I will definitely continue to return thru ought the week as I have not been disappointed yet..  Thanks BC staff, keep up the great work..

_8GZemquf_GFfkLwTLW7dw.text: If you're looking for a good breakfast in a classy place, this is the restaurant for you.  My friends and I took our cars up Camelback for a photoshoot at 7:00AM on a Sunday morning, but were saddened when we saw that a black Jetta with steamy windows had beaten us to the spot.  We left dejected but decided on this place for breakfast.  It was hands down the best breakfast I have ever bought.  The orange juice was fresh squeezed, the waitresses were pretty, punctual, and polite, the buckwheat and chocolate chip pancakes were fantastic, and the restaurant's atmosphere was pleasant and classy.  You'll pay a bit more for a meal (OJ and chocolate chip pancakes with a side of bacon was $17, not including tip), but it will be totally worth it.  I'll be taking my next girlfriend here for sure.

r-bmJh2QZ_GTfkJzj1jGBQ.text: I love this place. They have the best green chile pork I have ever had, and I try it wherever I go. The service was fabulous also.

e3oRXNhlo7NvktV_UyoXOw.text: YUMMY BREAKFAST/BRUNCH place to eat at! Great service too! Definitely would recommend to anyone.

tZRfUyN2f4BuVR6zirHgHA.text: My first visit to the Breakfast Club was great! The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. Definitely going again in the near future. If you're a health freak like I am I highly recommend the Lean & Green Omelette!

gI_MHhwml9Wiut8Cdh0Mng.text: Clean,bright cheerful atmosphere with wide variety of menu choices. Wait staff upbeat and helpful. Breakfast grilled cheese sandwich with hash browns and an egg on it was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese breakfast sandwich

IsspjgtNnbna3X9GbX1KjQ.text: I ate here once and we still talk about it. We stopped here on the way from the airport to Mesa. I've never had a fluffier pancake in my life. The benedict was amazing. The fruit they serve your food with is fresh and delicious. The portions are great. The coffee is good. Seriously, we joke about driving to Arizona just for breakfast.

ASIRGVKtsOTeL8_EbzIMpg.text: Great service and food make for a great dining experience.  This place was busy bit quickly cleared tables to keep the wait time down.  Thr potatoes Obrien are food and the food had a great flavor. A great place to take friends and family.

HTaGpc7ya_5pGihsw_XeqQ.text: I had a breakfast bowl it was amazing and the service was awesome yes it was very busy but the wait was not long and the waitress was very attentive I will definitely come back maybe even tomorrow!

Q69AqfyQKMauwrIFJmpeng.text: Going out to breakfast is something I love to do because I love eggs and corn beef hash. I basically order the same thing at every breakfast restaurant I go to (it makes it really easy to form an opinion). I'm pretty sure my small cholesterol issue can be blamed completely on my obsession on over medium eggs! If you like corn beef hash order it here, it will not disappoint!   The service is fast, friendly enough, the food is cheap, and tastes great if you are looking for a traditional diner breakfast.   Many people before me mentioned again love it

sa0AMzo6ZOKx07a00uSRKg.text: This breakfast was well worth the 45 minute wait for a table. I had the Quick Start Loaded which was delicious. I love places that don't use a grill lube that you can taste. Potatoes were good and the 9 grain toast was tasty. The service was quick and I appreciated seeing how quickly they cleaned and reset tables - it really kept things flowing.

b2fBKpGrOduW7K3upM_h5A.text: Well,had a awesome breakfast this morning. Good service, friendly face and awesome view off the patio.I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a good breakfast or lunch menu.

QOdl1kpJPyP40lIq8G5okw.text: So this review is mainly for the hostesses then I will get to the food. We were quoted for a 45 minute wait. So around TO BE EXACT from the hostesses 42 minutes, my boyfriend went up to ask where we were on the list and in a sassy rude way she said "we quoted you for 45 minutes-1 hour and its been 42 minutes" like okay. I remember putting my name in and getting quoted 45 minutes, but thats besides the point. I was a hostess back in the day and even when customers came in before their time there is no reason to be rude or snarky. There was like a whole squad of them there just with bad attitudes. After she gave that sass to my boyfriend about how much EXACTLY we were waiting for she told him "why don't you go enjoy the sun some more" like WHAT why is that okay to say to someone in such a rude manner? I don't know what their issues were. But the hostesses need an attitude adjustment and to learn to put on a smile and ignore it which is WHAT CUSTOMER SERVICE IS!!!!!!!  The food was really good though. The food was huge portions but so yummy. Bloody Marys were good and spicy and our server was really nice and filled waters very quicky. And this smaller blonde lady with a southern accent was super sweet as well.  My boyfriend got the hog omelette and I got a the eggs bene and both were wonderful. I also really liked how they give you a fruit stick along with the potatoes.  I would've given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the young hostesses who act like they are snobby b****es who apparently don't know how to put on a fake face because it's their first job.

Hzd7hp4lMESqnPVPItul3A.text: We come to this gem in the heart of Scottsdale about once a month now and trust me, I would go every day if I could. It's usually pretty busy but we've never waited more than 10-15 minutes. The food is to die for, whether is something light and refreshing or a big hearty breakfast, they take the cake.

UhXjROHFAznzcLuV0br3NA.text: Tried this place while on vacation, it was fantastic! Healthy menu and large variety.

Koy_lsyprkoI5N4hH-UCaw.text: We had a great breakfast at the Breakfast Club. Parking was easy. We had a short wait to be seated but were happy to wait in the lounge area by walls open to a sunny Arizona winter day.   The restaurant is bright, clean open- it was bustling with smiling staff and happy diners. We had the egg and quinoa vegetables- delicious, fresh and unusual. The quinoa veggies had a light lemon oil dressing- just the right hint of citrus- cooked crisp,very fresh. Another of us had the Benedict- very good. We had two other plates. Every one agreed the food was very good and we would definitely recommend t.

fzGEHmElHUK-_3rBw1LJjQ.text: Went there for a Saturday breakfast.  Very busy!  Friend had the huevos rancheros and absolutely loved it.  I just had eggs over easy, bacon and toast.  Came with a lovely stack of fresh fruit.  Other than eggs being a bit under cooked, was a great meal.

NyrC6Jo-uPFb_4ye6odw6A.text: This was my first time there. It was a busy Sunday brunch. The service was great. I had the huevos rancheros and it was fantastic. The portions are big so come hungry.

83y7TQ2OoKoNoqG4__tDPA.text: Alright, I don't get the poor reviews.  Most of the complaints seem to be focused on the wait time.  I understand thru-put for a restaurant.  But wait times are what they are when you want to eat a popular spot.  Today was awesome, showed up and there was a line, asked what the wait was: seated immediately outside.  Haley, our waitress, was on it today.  I've sat on the patio every time and service is either good, or in today's case awesome.  We ordered the quick start, which is the simplest thing on the menu, but I did not figure it would come out as if I had snapped my fingers.  Haley brought our plates steaming from the kitchen what felt not five minutes after putting in the ticket.  She then gave us coffees to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The simplest things take the simplest time! Out in five minutes.

sZD6gfRUZYjd7p8sJ863jg.text: Dang.  This place is awesome.  I am a member of this club.  And I will be for life.  Got on the waiting list via Yelp.  This place makes me believe in a higher power.

Nm-3mzkfiEnwBUgAkmBVhQ.text: We come here every time we visit and I'm never disappointed. The coffee is great, the mimosas are awesome, the food is phenomenal and the servers are always on top of it. I always order something different and never regret it.

(We've been here on a Sat morning & contended with a 45" wait, but it was managed with a 'no wait' app successfully...crossed the street and had Bloody Mary there during the wait!) This morning: I enjoyed a large freshly squeezed OJ & my wife had a bottomless coffee.  I had the Biscuits & Gravy and she had a single slice of French Toast with blueberry compote.  Both were hot, flavorful, and sizable. We'll be back!

So I had to explain the difference between sunny side up/over easy over medium and over hard. They said they have their own definition of over medium. They came back out still over easy. The pancakes were good l, but if you can't cook eggs right multiple times I don't know what to say.

-wT0Mz8uqNOoI_6Ot5z7Yg.text: One of the most amazing breakfast spots!!!  Food was outstanding and they have a little bar area to wait in which has fresh coffee, juices and cocktails.  Our waitress was very friendly, quick and attentive.  Made awesome recommendations as well!!!

Ym8RjddLcnuoGBV8CpGCww.text: Absoultely delicious and delightful wait staff.  Clean and friendly.  Had the Huevos rancheros.  Awesome

vJ2mePEzvRe47XnIj1TUsA.text: Yum! I visited Breakfast Club on a Thursday morning and sat outside on the patio. There's construction across the street so the view left a lot to be desired but the food and service...good and great! The location is particularly great if you plan to spend time in the area shopping.   I opted for the Huevos Rancheros and a side of French toast. Definitely couldn't finish both in one sitting so it was nice to have leftovers for lunch. I also order an iced coffee and somehow enjoyed the presentation more than the brew itself.   All in all, I'm a fan. There are so many yummy breakfast options in the area that I look forward to trying other places but when I'm back in town for a visit I would keep Breakfast Club as a contender for another meal.

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced Coffee

mHv13yNBPimrbffOTCYQBQ.text: For the price, the wait, and quality of food, this place is at best a 2.  I know, I know, there are some innovative dishes on the menu.  I know, it isn't *that* expensive.  I know, the brunch drink offerings are diverse and interesting (talking to you, Kombucha Mule), and there is a great variety of choice there.  However, the two items I ordered were both sub-par, and one egregiously so in a way that was really shocking, which I'm detailing here.  So, let's just start with the Lox & Bagel dish.  First, when you order it, you don't want to hear the waitress say "An everything bagel ok?" because it implies either: they're bad w/inventory or they're pushing the high priced bagel for reasons you don't understand but likely aren't good.  But as it was, I was asked that and I immediately just said "Yes, no problem."  Second, let's compare what I got to what was on the menu:  Lox & Bagel Stack smoked salmon | tomatoes | capers | hard boiled egg | avocado | pickled onion | creamed cheese  I'll grant you, they do put the word "stack" on the menu.  But that's not in and of itself telling enough to warn a customer of the COMPLETE ODDITY of what is actually served.  First, let's deal with the False advertising (be ready for a ton of "...as you would guess, but rather..." clauses):  1) The "avocado" is not sliced avocado as you would guess, but rather literally guacamole. 2) The "tomatoes" are not normal tomatoes sliced in 1/4 in sections as you would guess, but rather halved cherry tomatoes. 3) The "tomatoes" are not separated out as you would guess, but rather mixed into the "avocado" (read: guacamole), and in fact not visible upon initial inspection at the sides of the guac 4) The "hard boiled egg" is not whole and sliced as you would guess, but rather included in your run of the mill egg salad mash (w/mayo, and some salt I presume). 5) There were no capers, and honestly, one of the four essential ingredients in lox/bagel servings are the capers. 6) The salmon wasn't sliced and in sheets as you would guess, but rather chunked up in 1/2 in rectangular prisms as if it was going to be part of a unique Peruvian ceviche. 7) The cream cheese wasn't actual cream cheese in normal form, but rather a kind of whipped cream cheese with an unexpected consistency. 8) The entire lot of it wasn't separated out into its own piles or sections as you would expect from literally ANY PLACE ON THE KNOWN PLANET, but rather "stacked" (per the menu one-word adjective) on top of one another in four basic layers.  The ONLY things that were normal were the bagel itself and the pickled onions.  So the menu was completely and utterly misleading.  To top it off, the salmon was overly pink/bordering on taupe, and seemed roughed up and warm (effect of being chopped, handled and stacked?), and the guac was sub-par, with the cherry tomatoes unfortunately drowning in it such that I wasn't able to get a bright, tomato-only taste from them.  The lack of capers at all, the cream cheese being alien and then the egg being what I could expect inside a sandwich at 7-11, and I give this dish a solid 0.  I mean, it really deserves a negative score, however, Yelp hasn't provided such a feature for the exceptionally bad and mis-advertised....yet.  Adding to this, I pointed out all the inconsistencies in the menu, verbatim, to the manager and he did offer once condolence (Yes, it's probably confusing), and said they are overhauling their menu and would take this into account.  However, I wasn't offered a comp on the dish.  Also, he actually stated "Well, sir, for future, you can always ask to have it prepared deconstructed..."  Uhhh, yes thank you for that suggestion, but I would have to clearly know it was *constructed* in some bizarre way beforehand, other than one single adjective ("Stack") on the menu.  To be totally honest, I did start by saying "I'm not looking for a comp here, but..." statement.  However, the fact that an offer didn't come from him, that it would have been a paltry $14.50 write-off, a small price to pay in the face of food description so inaccurate and dissembling that I needed 8 numbers to point all the issues out, and that we ordered 5 drinks from the bar along with 4 entrees so it's not like we're skimming, and this place gets a solid 1 from me.  I thank only Maya, our waitress, who I over-tipped of course ($50 on $34, cash) as she was working hard to please a pleasant, but clearly stunned patron.

vs9BYKcume9cUBQHxc7iYg.text: Sure this is a trendy place and everybody wants to be seen going here. Every time I want to get a quick breakfast though it's always some crazy long line and wait and everybody just stares at you. That is just not even cool because I just want to get a quiet breakfast without any drama.  Long lines while people just stare at you is not my idea of a relaxed cool breakfast.

MICjLGwH_l6RO59nGGqCAw.text: Love love love this place. Wish we could've eaten here more than once. Very clean and fresh looking on the inside. Online wait list options were super helpful. Love that there is a waiting area where you can order drinks before you are seated. We came in in a Friday which was very busy but we didn't have to wait very long to sit or get our food. The BC iced coffee was delicious. Love that most of the dishes come with fresh fruit. We did the healthy conscious breakfast and the quick start loaded. Both were fresh, filing, and tasty. So many other tasty things I wish I could've tried. We will definitely be back next time we are in Scottsdale.

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Juice bar menu
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drink menu

XhRGL7ztizYj1HZ56c1tyA.text: This is a solid place to get breakfast in Scottsdale. We came here on a Friday with a 15 minute wait. The staff were all attentive and courteous while we were there  I ordered the chilaquiles and it did not disappoint. The food came out pretty quick as well. I love different textures in my food and this hit all the spots.   A crunch tostada sits on top of tender chunks of savory pork with a layer of well done black beans. Since the tostada was elevated on the meat, it kept it from getting soggy. I had eggs over easy and they came out perfectly with flowing golden egg yolk. The avocado and lettuce added some freshness and helped to cut the meal a bit as it's a pretty heavy and filling meal. Everything was flavored extraordinarily well.   It was one of the better chilaquiles I've had and would definitely stop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros

uRj9wbDJO2RsI24_5n5GKg.text: The service was amazing . That was the first thing impressed me there. They were so busy , we chooses to sit at the bar instead of standing in the line for 30-40 minutes. They still managed to give us a perfect service .   The salad was amazing , seriously one of the best salad I've ever had . The portion is huge if you are really hungry will fill you , if you want to share that works too.  The pancakes was not good at all . We barely touched it. I tried to add a lots of butter and syrup on it, well still not delicious.  The grape fruit fresh juice was delicious . The coffee was okey.  The restaurant is really nice and cool . I think it's a perfect place to go there for brunches . They have cool sits outside.   Perfect Brunch place to go for hangout with a friend or a date. Not sure if it's good to go for a group while it's so crowded and have a long line .

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WKYAo-VIYPWuNWQ7As5bKA.text: Came here with my family on a mini vacation. We had a group of 11 and therefore on a Sunday morning its not the easiest thing to get in they were fortunately were able to get us in with only a 30 minute or so wait so that was good with us. While we waited many of us enjoyed their Mango Mimosas and Lemonades. I wasn't much of a fan of their Mango Mimosas (why change up an already prefect thing) but their lemonade was delicious, especially in the AZ heat.   The restaurant itself is located at a very nice spot and is huge. Probably why they are able to seat larger groups. The service was also very attentive and polite especially for the place being packed and on an hour wait by the time we got seated.   The majority of the group ordered breakfast burritos, with a couple of us ordering their Steak and Eggs, and Huevos con Masa. Everything was delicious even though the Steak and Eggs really wasn't filling (weak Steak size) and kind of left me and my brother wanting more food. I ended up ordering their homemade Jalapeno Cheddar Biscuit after my Steak and Eggs for more food which was also delicious. Best thing I tasted on their menu was the Huevos con Masa it was delicious and full of flavor.  Overall I would absolutely be back. Am definitely a fan!.

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos con Masa

7ivSgCMVf8CHMjP9ekQgAw.text: Great food. My favorite breakfast joint but unfortunately Chip in the plate is non appealing and this presentation in an upscale restaurant is a turn-off.  Which means a cook, a server and our server (after I pointed out the chip and greasy plate)  Were too busy to care about how the food served to me represents their place of business.   I didn't need the food to be remade. I just think my request that my food at an upscale breakfast restaurant be brought out with a wow-factor-can't wait-to dive-in-but-must-take-a-picture-first-to remind-me-how-amazing-this-restaurant-is.   Disappointing and honestly,I think reasonably - a just expectation.   Yes We will be back but maybe we might revisit a few of our other favorite breakfast/brunch joints.   This didn't make us feel very special but just a number and lost the excitement we had for this place.   Food is really good and prices are on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great food. Chip in the plate is non appealing
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced coffee with a cute little sidecar

2zQS3Y4sbhVz6P4lYy1YSQ.text: I have to admit.... normally I don't get the chance to establish a long term relationship with an eatery due to my ever changing cravings and food trends. However, The Breakfast club is my go to place for breakfast when in Old Town. First, they open the door for you when your still on the sidewalk and that alone is five star service. They always greet me with a genuine smile when I stand at the hostess stand. All the staff there are friendly and excellent in service. The must have entree is their Huevos Rancheros.. It is worth blowing your diet on! I drown mine in Tabasco and Cholula and yowzers! It's delicious. If you can get there early as to get a good seat and not have to wait. After 9 am it is busy and rightfully so, don't forget to order a tigers milk to cool off!!

FYtG7DO-ExHamjBxwym6ZA.text: Good food. Quality service. We had breakfast here and a few drinks. Loved the Chicken Tinga and Champagne. My friend got Huevos con Ranchero. She liked it. For drinks we had Greyhound, Mimosa, Grape Mule, Champagne and Chai Tea. Hmmm probably doing too much. Would be back, slight wait for tables but all and all had a good time.

EN99CfjPB4aZmsxvw6iX7w.text: Apparently this is the hot spot brunch in Scottsdale. I recommend putting your name on the yelp list and then showing up as your time gets closer. Warning they don't call your name if you're on the yelp list so make sure to check your phone for a text.   Food was good. I got the Border Bowl. It's basically a skillet. Lots of different meats and peppers. Great flavors that's for sure. All the food we ordered were large portions so if you aren't hungry you might want to think about splitting with a friend.   I would not mind coming back if I were in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sLRDUm4w7BGuiNiiGLPzKQ.text: This was my first time stopping by for breakfast. I drive by it all the time and every time there is a huge group of people waiting outside, so it must be good, right?  Well it was and I'm glad I finally stopped by. We arrived around 8:30 so we didn't have to wait and we sat on the patio which was nice and shaded. I ordered their BC Iced Coffee and it was really good. Flavors of caramel and hazelnut topped off with milk, yum!   I ordered the breakfast grilled cheese and it was really good. It was a little greasy but to be expected for a grilled cheese but kinda messy for breakfast. It was worth it though, it was yummy and a great combination of egg, cheese, potatoes and bacon. I would definitely recommend this option to anyone who enjoyed a good breakfast sandwich!   This place is really good and I definitely understand why there is always a line. I enjoyed going to early to beat the rush and will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BC Iced Coffee

PWjMJF5FKIY8-AvvJiKuCA.text: Well, am back sooner than expected for another breakfast of dark browned plain waffle, 2 eggs medium, burned requested potatoes, and 6 shot Americano with lots of honey. Busy today, more like usual other times I've been. Great customer service here and attention to all requests. Surely one of best in area here. Today was wonderful food experience.

sqcqUYfhyX-M9C18wbH36g.text: I met up with a good friend recently, to celebrate our birthdays. Lunch and dinner didn't work with our schedules. But breakfast did and it gave us an opportunity to catch up. Fortunately, Breakfast Club is not too far from either of our offices. Also fortunate is how good the food and service is!  Kayla was our server and she was excellent. I arrived first and she brought a pitcher of coffee to keep me company while I waited. It's got to be hard to be so personable this early in the morning, but she managed. Her timing throughout the meal was perfect as well. I also appreciated her offering a coffee to go.  The menu at Breakfast Club has plenty of options. It includes the basics, comfort food, healthy options and some elevated surprises. The next time I'm here, I want to try the Eggs Benedict which is served over a filet mignon. But my entree from this visit was delicious. The Border Bowl included scrambled eggs with literally everything but the kicker was the green chili pork on top. It's a great breakfast and very filling.  My buddy and I got a chance to start our day right. Breakfast Club is clean, modern and relaxing. And the kitchen provided a very memorable breakfast. I don't plan to wait until next April to visit again.

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My flavorful Border Bowl
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smooth delicious coffee

rePCE_KRVNi2aP64l25hJA.text: This place is AMAZEINGGG!!!  Would definitely recommend for visitors out and in state, the weather was amazing. Eat outside for more privacy and a chill vibe.   Although it was super packed on a Saturday morning at 8, we lost our place in line which they sign you up for using your number due to a systematic error where our reserved place in line using yelp actually which I loved, was forfeited for some reason. When I told the young lady at the front she did a fantastic job assisting me in resolving this inconvenience by immediately seating us.   Chelsea was our server and tended us to very well she checked on us twice and offered a bag for our leftover food containers without me even having to ask. She also asked for which condiments we liked and brought a little rack of hot sauce.   The food was soooo good! It was so nutritious and healthy just up my alley as I love eating healthy and so does my sister. The portions were really large. The tinga chicken omelette was very good and flavorful something I definitely prefer over a bland omelette. The way it was garnished deserved a round of applause. I also appreciated that my mango smoothie which was super good not too sweet and syrup filled. The picture speaks for itself!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IRRoAiXTkI68pgUr-EEPuQ.text: Always a great spot to get a good breakfast. Bring a lot of my out of towners here for a good filling meal. There's something on the menu for everyone in your group.

8L47gkK2d4X63PJ_-H7HkQ.text: I'm so glad I decided to come here instead of eating breakfast at my hotel. I was very satisfied with their Eggs Benedict with avocado, just add a little cholula to give it that extra touch ;)  And the Hazelnut latte, wow, wow, wow soooo good! I drink lattes almost every day & this one definitely went beyond my expectations, kudos to the barista! And thanks to Ilana for being such a great server!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hSa_B07W4t4SWPbigDtgXA.text: I'd been craving breakfast the past few days. Typically I can't stand the wait and every now and again, I'm off all the meats.... eggs... cheeses.   Not today though, not today. I wanted breakfast. I've been here in the past but it's been a while and historically speaking there has always been a rather ridiculous wait, so I was apprehensive about heading there around brunch time on a Sunday.   Open seating at the bar, so that was a bonus, there happened to be 2 seats available. It took my friend a few extra to decide and I was also torn considering lunch and breakfast were options. I went with the huevos con masa and I am so stoked that I did because all day after breakfast I kept talking about the awesome breakfast that I had.   The friend went with the burrito which I'd had in the past.   I do have to admit, we probably would have had a bit quicker service had we sat at a table but they did their best with us at the bar.   I ordered my eggs over medium and I was certainly impressed that that is exactly how they were prepared. Perfectly.   I'm glad we went in and I will be visiting again soon. Definitely a decent breakfast spot!

vBasBJLHUpvQCGifNP-PXQ.text: I took my mom on a mother-daughter lunch date and this place did not disappoint! I had the Traditional Benedict and I have to say it was the best of Egg Benedicts that I've had to date. Usually, I just like the hollandaise sauce, egg, ham, toast, but not the yolk because of the texture, however, the poached egg broke just right and the yolk mixed great with the hollandaise sauce! The potatoes o'brien along with the super fresh fruit made the dish a solid brunch meal - we will definitely be back!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

U8g1nbdACMiFqx3uNF_SIQ.text: First: Definitely join the waiting list through Yelp if you can because the wait was 35-45 minutes when I came with my dad and we only ended up waiting about 10 minutes when we got there. Second: The BC Signature French Toast is so good! It came with fresh fruit, dried raisins and cranberries, what I'm assuming is granola crumbles on top, and this super yummy, creamy, sweet dollop of something that had cinnamon too. Third: Our server, Dee (Deirdra), was amazing! She checked in on us constantly but not too often to disturb us. She was amazing! Thank you Dee!!  Recommend: Yes! Plus, they have a very nice patio seating area and you can bring your dog to sit with you :D
