3bo-yY-cRm4PXhwe1fyAIw.text: Great breakfast/ lunch spot. We knew this place was busy so we called ahead and they put us on a wait list via text message. By the time we arrived, our text came in and our table was ready. They had a nice selection of food, a relaxed attractive environment with a pretty diverse crowd for Scottsdale. Service was nice, it was pretty fast, food was good. They make substitutions and even have almond milk and other dietary substitutes that many people like myself find necessary. Hope our next visits are as good as the last two visits.

tCWCDa0nN2R3HTq1tCVWXg.text: Great menu, great food, great service. Because of its popularity you are more then likely going to have a small wait for your table but it's worth it! I recommend for any breakfast lover.

t_awDGY3apWFwsb56GNDrg.text: When its busy on a weekday morning, its a good sign.  Even with it being busy we were seated right away.  The waitress was prompt and we had our drinks right away.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it didn't disappoint.  I have nothing negative to say.  The food and service was great!

oE8MZKi6hKKJJzDSVdTaiQ.text: I've eaten here around 6 or 7 times over the past few years. Sometimes it was during the week, sometimes on the weekends. If you're going to go there on the weekends, please get there as early as possible otherwise you will be waiting for an hour. This is not a reflection of how poor the service is, it is a reflection of how good the food is. It is well prepared, uses high grade ingredients, and always made to order.   It is not like going to Denny's as I have read on other reviews here. As far as the service goes, the staff that work there work their asses off. I have yet to see any of the workers milling around or chatting with their coworkers. Yes you will pay a little more, but it worth it. Take away: if you plan ahead and leave your childish pretensions about what good service is at home, you will have an excellent breakfast!

WoxOUwDuMKey8UuxnfZSQg.text: Came here based on the recommendation of a few people we met during our stay in Scottsdale.   We ordered:    Breakfast Bowl - Think breakfast burrito without the tortilla and with pork green chili on top of your scramble.    Huevos Rancheros - Breakfast tostada bowl but the tortilla is not crispy.  Topped with green chili sauce.   Biscuits and gravy - very dense. Not too much flavor  Mushroom omelette - needed more mushroom.  Creme fraiche is pretty much sour cream.   Overall, food was good.  Some dishes were better than others.  We recommend getting the dishes with the pork chili, since the chili was really tasty.    Service:  Very nice.    Ambience:  Cute, casual breakfast joint.  Pretty large place with ample seats inside and outside.  Parking: Ample rear parking   Overall:  For food, we would give 3.5-4 stars.  Good breakfast joint but short of mind blowing. If you are near by, I'd pop in but I wouldn't go out of my way for this one.

RcrPjknxN4GNgKiqjcoZIQ.text: This place was packed Saturday morning. I loved that you can grab a morning cocktail or coffee while you wait!! Cafe Au Lait was wonderful!! I had steak & eggs for breakfast. It was cooked perfectly!!! Love, love, love. I would definitely go here again!!

fPAbnRbkh2xSJ6UaH-QsXA.text: Very good food.  At first I thought the special french toast was overpriced, but once I saw it, I didn't think that anymore - it's a huge plate, with lots of fresh berries and nuts.  The make your own omelet I picked (lox, tomatoes, capers) was delicious, as were the bacon and potatoes.  We'd definitely return.  It was also nice that the waitress offered me a coffee to go when I said no to a refill.  Edited to add:  added our name to the waitlist via Yelp, and it was great - nowhere near as long a wait as it would have been otherwise.

1KHSU-MpXVWY60pcdHHOgQ.text: Heard great things and waited an hour on a Sunday afternoon but disappointed. Ordered smoked salmon lox Benedict and huevos rancheros. Lox was mushy with a bland sauce. Huevos wasn't traditional. Came with a full tortilla on the plate filled with a mushy mixture of shredded pork in a sauce with shaved cheese over it. Wouldn't go again even though it comes as top rated on every Scottsdale list. Need a delicious coffee? Go around the corner to Cartel.

9gGEQiVqWfbjcS3pHyR2AA.text: Delicious food and well worth the wait.  Most entrees come with fruit and potatoes but you can select whatever sides you want.  My hubby opted for corn bread and pork green chile  (too salty for my taste) with his Portabello Eggs Benedict.  I had The Bird Omelet filled with turkey, fresh avocados, mushrooms, and a delicious sauce.  Can anyone say yummmmm!  Porions are abundant  and priced well.  All food was very fresh.  We will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bird Omelet with fresh fruit and potatoes.
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portobello Eggs Benedict with Corn Bread and Green Pork Chile.

OWRpIitr25CrDexbiPNMrw.text: Stopped here on my last day in Scottsdale, and it was completely worth it. The omelet I tried was delicious, service was great. I would definitely eat here again.

3fLaCDrW6jo32hgFACxhLA.text: Im not really a big breakfast person but in all the many years this place has been here this was my first time here. I kinda did a brunch type meal and had the Chicken Cesar Wrap with breakfast potatoes. Its came with sweet potato fries, but not really a fan of anything sweet potato flavored so switched it up. Was very good and flavorful, loaded with chicken. Also, had a bloody mary and i have to say was quite impressed.  Service was great as well and people were friendly. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary&#39;s!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Cesar Wrap w/Potatoes!

YYMeqKmLMjLHmjTRHbbVPQ.text: I was there for the first time for a breakfast meeting. The 4 of us ordered breakfast and talked throughout our meal. Perhaps we were taking too long as our waitress brought our bills (BTW, we were sitting for less than 1 hour at that point). She then proceeded to take my plate and place another one on top of it. Did she ask if I was finished? No, she did not. I still had my fruit and potatoes left.  Since 2 of us lingered a bit longer I left a 20% tip...She did not deserve that much with her terrible service. She then came back to our table and asked us to leave and sit somewhere up front and talk. As it is, when I sit at table that could have turned, I am sure to compensate the server well. never gave us that chance.   I was so angry, I decided not to tell the Manager because I would not have behaved well. I will never go back and not only will I not recommend it, I will be sure to tell many others!

Qun4mrtNBBbcOMGtiqHqLw.text: Great breakfast spot! Said our wait would be 20-30 min but ended up being like 8 minutes. Definitely come by, the eggs Benedict and breakfast burrito were bomb.

bYhQ9Wac6Y7w7FBmmMPfYA.text: Some impressions:  Hostess tried to seat us at the worst table in the house (back, next to kitchen door)  in spite of the many open tables.  When we requested reseating, she obliged. Ambiance is open and noisy; plenty of room between tables; hard to hear the person across from you.  Waitrons, all female, wear a uni of skintight workout clothes.  So, like, if you'd like to do some Bikram yoga with your breakfast, maybe they can oblige.  Did I mention that they all appear to have been ordered from the same Chinese rubber factory?  "Huevos con masa" looked offbeat and interesting - a change from the usual breakfast stuff.  It was not.  Two not-very-hot eggs atop highly sweetened dry cornbread with a wobbly sauce that looked like cat upchuck.  Al dente dinner potatoes and a vicious-looking spear of fruit.    Hey people - masa is not the same thing as cornbread.  WTF?  We looked at this and my pal ordered toast.  The waitress brought it promptly.  He asked for butter.  She looked at him funny, went back, eventually brought that out.  Then he asked for jam.  She looked at him funny again, and returned with some very nice raspberry preserves.  Evidently on this planet, people don't eat toast, and if they do, there better not be anything on it.  Total for breakfast about $30; we left two nearly-full plates of food on the table.  The toast was very good.

iNOBcC7EQuRkLYI27twO7Q.text: I was craving cornbread so when I saw the Huevos con Masa on the menu I got really excited. Jalapeno cornbread topped with two eggs and completed with chorizo queso. I have to admit that anything with that chorizo queso is going to taste great.   Savory, salty, sweet, delicious!! It's a winning combination of flavors.

RXw9UsFlnsZwGKZCwFzURw.text: After putting my name on a list and waiting for 45 minutes the hostess staff made some random decision to just take my name off the list.  I started to notice that people that showed up after me were being seated.  Makes me furious that I wanted so long to just carelessly have name taken off of it.  Horrible waste of my Saturday.

tZyNfRDhTQWNKW2ehfj0cQ.text: Great breakfast! Sat with my wife and friends, everything we ordered was fantastic. Only drawback was the wait for a table, but it was well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lox and bagel
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast bowl! Very hearty, taste great

rtGJZ7KbVY0Iel3wFU45_g.text: We go here every Sunday, can't beat it!!  I eat out for breakfast 3-4 times a week and at different places.  This place is my favorite breakfast spot.  We almost always have a different server and we have yet to have one that wasn't great.  Today it was Bethany that took it over the top and got me off my butt to write a review.  Thanks for the great service!!

F7OUYznLVVIwMXTMT5YfCg.text: This has to be one of if not the best breakfastplace in Scottsdale/Phoenix area.    Excellent meal.  Had the egg scramble.    Others had the pancakes l and french toast.   All were amazing.   Highly recommend checking in online.   Made check in to seating very quick.

sMgsVgUGxHBE5uXN3FbLHg.text: Before I start my review I want to state that I previously went to the one in downtown Phoenix and I wasn't impressed at all !! So my aunt was in town from Detroit, MI and we wanted to take her out to breakfast as a family so that we one we showed her love while being out here and two so we don't get slandered when she goes back "I didn't see them"  anyone who has family can relate.  Moving forward we decided to take her here and I must say I was thoroughly impressed. It was a party of 8 my sister and I arrived first and the waitress did a great job of showing patience while waiting for the rest of our party to show up. Then I informed her how my first experience went and she gave me some recommendations and informed me if I didn't like what I ordered they could make me something else . I liked how she gave me that extra security while ordering my food!! So I decided to pick "The Bird" omelette(egg whites) meal with a side of Carmel Banana Foster French toast w/ ice cream on the side. It was amazing everything tasted amazing and it was hot and the presentation was great. My family and I enjoyed it and we appreciate when we can bring a out of town relative to a restaurant and hear her say "I LOVE THIS PLACE". I will dine here again.. Oh a helpful tip on weekends it can be packed and they don't take reservations but they do have a call ahead service which was beneficial! As soon as we got there they sat us at a table right away with no waiting!!

dUP9dcWoM9Kqil0A66fTMg.text: A native of Scottsdale, this establishment BELONGS here.   Great service. Fast. Friendly and healthy. A little noisy inside, but they have "mist machines" outside if you can handle the heat.

WS5TbIEUhmfjw3Nm1Eo1aQ.text: Love BC with a passion. There is Nowhere else I would go for my daily breakfast. The staff there is to give the credit to. They are top notched and unmatched

bg4Zobm-8e40eUKxi--2gw.text: Well executed today by the Breakfast Club. Used the waitlist from Yelp and they were timely, the service was top notch (friendly and quick), and the food was great (especially the Eggs Benny). Good sized portions with all the right flavors. Good job people!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict. This one was on point!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mickey Mouse Pancakes

Z4xOJnN7Fua2tBpwwuNf1A.text: one of my fav breakfast spots! I would agree that service is just avg at best ... just shows how much I like the food. that is, the place still gets 5 stars with blah, blah service.   Dear owner - the cooks/chefs should be paid much, much more than your servers / front folks ... it is the thing that brings me back and gets your 5 rating. BUT if you do not eventually fix the service issue, I will adjust the rating lower ...

jdVOS0aZpD9eAg8_I41k9w.text: Love this place! I wish they had one at home!  I got an enormous iced coffee (house cold press hazelnut and caramel) for only $5!!!   I got The Bird omelette, filled with fresh sliced turkey, avocado, mushrooms and creme fraiche, potatoes o'brien and fresh fruit.   It was a freaking TON of food for $10/$11 - I should have shared with my boyfriend. I had to tap out 2/3 of the way though my omelette, hardly touched my potatoes and ate my pineapple slice and watermelon slice. Totally worth the money, great service and wonderful atmosphere.   I look forward to visiting again in the future!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pchz-hoX-Yp-4K41QXHIrg.text: We were pressed to leave by our server, (unnamed), this was a first for me during a business brunch.  (Unnamed server) blatantly removed our empty coffee cups (after nicely clearing our plates), and told us In not so many words to pay and leave because people were waiting to be sat.  Now, in her defense,  she did offer to move us up to somewhere in the waiting area if we wanted to continue our work discussion.  Please note that we were not by any means using the table for an extended period of time, maybe 45 minutes in total.  First, I've served tables for many years in the past and wouldn't dare ask a table to leave.  Second, I'm well aware of our use of the table and would have tipped accordingly if we stayed long, instead, I really didn't even want to leave anything for the embarrassment she caused, but we did, of course. We likely wouldn't have stayed but another 10-15 more minutes anyway, but it's the principle of the matter.  To add insult to injury, when I attempted a small joke to her about taking our coffee cups when I thought we were just getting topped off after she asked for us to to pay and leave, she quickly responded not by saying what a server should, 'that the table is ours and we are happy to have you here', but rather, she said that if I wanted more coffee she'd be happy to fill me a to go cup. Mind you all reading this post, we were polite and respectful patrons. Very very disappointed in the Breakfast Club.  She actually cleared our table, then asked us to pay and leave, and shrugged her shoulder....wow

6JFGbn_tAj7K8H2LcXV-ug.text: Nice breakfast brunch place. Affordable and the portions are generous. Staff very friendly. Wait time about 40min on a Sunday noon. Very satisfied, will return. I had the Traditional Benedict very tasty with a side of bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Benedict with side of bacon
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The breakfast Benedict and Bloody Mary

2cQffVZ5Q_sCApte_PKcGw.text: Was in town visiting Arizona ... Came across the breakfast club. This place had Amazing quick and Fast service .. And they have one of The best breakfast places I have ever ATE..     You must stop by here if You visit Phoenix.

ztgxmn6ENHy5lMUhRqXTdg.text: This is probably the worst place to go for breakfast. So many more other options in the area and way better service. The hostesses have horrible customer service and have learned nothing on how to actually quote time to clientele appropriately. The management should be ashamed.  I guess if you enjoy bad service and subpar food choices this place is for you.

VBPSGh8w0PIQIqqE6DXlkQ.text: The breakfast bowl was an amazing blend of breakfast foods paired with a sensuous green chili pulled pork.  Flavors blend well while the crisp hash-browns buried below provide just the right texture...bloody Mary was so so... Highly recommend stopping by for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BC Bloody Mary Boom...yummy!

Nf0lZkz63sOfCRQdDu-7ew.text: I visited the Breakfast Club this morning 8/9/17. I was there at 10:00 am. I got right in no wait. My server took my drink order almost immediately. I ordered the BC Sandwich with my Lemonade. My sandwich came out in 5 minutes. The sandwich was good, fresh and hot. The menu prices are very reasonable. The server was nice however no WOW experience. She never did a check back and the bus person took my plate after she presented the check. I asked for a refill on my Lemonade and she said refills aren't free. I thought that seemed pretty strange for a casual breakfast / lunch restaurant. I did appreciate that she told me before just charging me. The restaurant was fairly clean however it had a terrible odor not a food smell. I was in the back of the restaurant and noticed it was worse. It wasn't a pleasant smell. I might return if I was in the area but probably wouldn't refer to friends.

pjakcAEqW7Kf4xSZFvp3_w.text: Yum, yum, yum. Great food, service, and a cute name!

UWjKl6GIqoJ2JOBK8P_yNA.text: Meh. That's how I feel about this place after finally getting a chance to eat here. I feel like the wait is always super crazy so I was thinking it would be a bomb breakfast but honestly everything was just mediocre. Nothing was terrible but nothing was great either. Service was mediocre, food was mediocre. Mimosa was overpriced. 10 bucks? I'll pass. I could go somewhere else and get unlimited for 15. Overall, not impressed. I would go back if it was my only option but don't see this as being my first choice. I've had better breakfast elsewhere.

DhClcABL9Ynlbd5_zplGRQ.text: This is a really good breakfast joint. The eggs are good, bacon is great and fresh squeezed juices rock!  Tried a Mimosa and they were bitter. We told the waitress and she took them off the bill. We are coming back every day so you know the food is good.

3195neARWrryyOKGi74swg.text: I overall liked the atmosphere of this location, however I felt my waiter was really fake, I would ask her questions and she would give me one worded answers, she would ask everyone around the bar if they needed anything, but Skip me. I wouldn't say she was rude, just fake. I felt like she was being a smart Alex.   The young lady working at the bar should learn to treat all customers the same.  I don't remember her name, she was a Caucasian blonde, working at the bar.

gfwb7Vb3Pxgzs6dU8NYPPQ.text: I am sure it's good but the way they accommodate families is not very "family friendly". We came in and we were kept waiting, way beyond our time and watched other large groups after us get seated before us because we had kids and the table that was sitting didn't want to sit next to kids.  Are you kidding me?

mKvAsEYejtepkBvmD2pUXQ.text: There was a little wait to be seated but the coffee bar had seats and it was great to be able to get our coffee while we waited. Service was fast and friendly. Despite our numerous menu modifications, all our orders came out perfect. Parking is easy, location is great...This is THE breakfast spot for us when we're in Scottsdale.

O8_fWMk8LjYprdZ2bvuBpQ.text: Cute place! But too much hype I think. The food was just okay and we waited about an hour and thirty minutes. Wouldn't go again. Nothing special.

WXY8AquYQY2ZuX9qvwIo9A.text: Every time I have been here I have gotten the same server and she completely ruined my liking for the breakfast club. Each time we have waited very long to be greeted. For my first experience with this server, I had to go to the host stand after at least 10 minutes of not being greeted. My brother's drink went empty multiple times, my dad's food came out wrong and we barely saw our server and when we did she did not seem like she wanted be to there. we we're dining here for my dad's birthday & it really dampers a celebration to get completely awful service. I was hoping this girl was just having an off day but the next time I came to BC I sat in her section again and we received the same awful service. Not only does she walk around with RBF but she didn't seem to care about our needs. She barely stopped by and seemed to avoid us - but is smiling when talking to other employees. The reputation built by the food & nice hostesses are ruined by the attitude of this server. I will not bring my service this location ever again!

k6h2oTwufazlMWHkPCp3hA.text: This is a really cute place unfortunately I had the worst omelet of my life here, the mushroom omelette. It tasted completely dried out and spongy like they cooked it in one of those microwave omelette dishes.  My friends that I was dining with enjoyed their meal.   The filet mignon Benedict was the favorite at the table. Service could have been a bit faster but it was adequate. My friends raved about how good their juices were because they were supposedly all homemade in house with juicers. My pineapple juice taste like anything you would buy in the supermarket so I'm not sure if that is really they case.

iILzFj_fzEuqeU99q2BVBg.text: Great place for breakfast! Good service.. Clean place.. Good comes out quick. We had the border bowl, bc French toast and breakfast grilled sandwich. All were very good. My fave was the French toast it had blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, candy walnuts, almonds and powdered sugar on top. The bread was light and fluffy with a hint of cinnamon. If your a French toast lover I recommend trying it:)

ji9RxWDkWsvZkMHm7cn1bg.text: Hands down, one of the best breakfast spots I've ever been to. The service was excellent. Food was amazing. Just make sure you are prepared for the wait to get in! You'll love this place!

Dn8riyyQC4e0KIf_9NCVRg.text: Just ok brunch  Ate here on a Friday late-morning. Surprisingly busy, big mix of people. A lot looked like they came from the gym..or just wearing workout clothes ;)   SEATING: They do have some counter/bar seating as well as a variety of other tables. It's not actually a large space and we did have to wait about 15mins (at 10:30am on a Friday).  Annoyingly they have quite a few high top tables and stools when you first walk in for "waiting only". Seems like a waste of space, if they served at these tables there would be less waiting.  They do have outdoor space with misters   SERVICE:  Pretty good  FOOD: Again, good not great. I got the Huevos Ranchero - which was NOT Huevos Ranchero...it was a soft flour tortilla, lots of lettuce, no ranchero sauce. Super disappointing. The avocado was presented beautifully, the best part of the meal  The menu has a lot of variety so would be good for a group  DRINKS:  They have the brunch basics (mimosa, Bloody Mary, etc) I got one with grapefruit juice and vodka. It was huge and just ok   PARKING: There is parking out from and a parking garage

13h9I0hI_xmxFwfjAixrow.text: Best breakfast in Scottsdale!! Just make sure you get there early because there is typically a wait. Servers are amazing and food is delicious! Can't beat the price and the food and beverage selection! Def recommend everyone to eat here. I always order the juevos rancheros because it's the bomb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Juevos Rancheros

v00pGCwCwB66ZDX_3Usdlg.text: This is my second time visiting this place and my first review on it. I thoroughly enjoyed both visits here. Breakfast club is located in the heart of old town Scottsdale and is in a great location. I like this place because of its fast and friendly service and the pancakes are very delicious. I also like the fact that they offer turkey products as well and not just pork. It's interesting how several breakfast restaurants still do not offer turkey alternatives to their sausage and bacon foods.   In addition, make sure that you try their coffee. They have one of the best coffee's I have had at a breakfast restaurant. The next time I am in the area I will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pancakes and turkey sausage links

J3MjnlFoIHdGLL_KUQ0GLQ.text: Great place for breakfast.  Love the vibe and service at the counter with Jamie was excellent.  She was friendly and attentive.  Recommend this place highly.

qVpK47VjoBJ44Pcd3xPZrw.text: Had the most amazing jalapeno biscuits and gravy on the 19th of March right before the SF/Cleveland baseball game. Sat at the counter which we love to do otherwise the wait was 30 minutes. Can not rave enough about the food and service plus the most pleasant crew. Recommend to everyone and will definitely go back. Gayle O

Eg-_k_pwTU3ad_Zo76vP8g.text: Place to go and be in the mornings in Scottsdale.  It does get crowded but they do a good job of moving tables.  Food is on point.  Service is attentive.  Wished they would include some kind of hash browns with the meals.  If you don't mind the wait, solid place.

ekHxpdiBHzHtRzMzuthNFQ.text: Ok breakfast place with a large menu but nothing unique.  Long waits on the weekends with better options a few blocks down the road.

ETQRSGRec_kglcKiPeQTKQ.text: Sunday morning, hour wait starting at 10:30 am. Seated right at one hour. Ordered a chai tea latte at barista bar which was very good. Ordered the BC signature French toast for breakfast. Very good meal and more than I could finish! Service as very good and timely.

285IoUTodr6TsmOmCiYxiA.text: Deplorable, is how I describe my experience at the Breakfast Club.  A friend and I dropped in after a hike on Camelback Mountain. We arrived at 2:40pm. We were aware that the restaurant would be closing at 3pm and already knew what we wanted to order. We were waiting at the front for a hostess and were not greeted for 3 minutes.  There was no one at the front. When the phone began ringing I was sure someone would come to the frnt but no one did!  In fact, three waitresses made eye contact with us then ignored us.  Finally, the bartender hollered over that we can sit anywhere we like and to seat ourselves.  We chose a table outside due to having a dog with us.  When our waitress arrived she was contemptuous.    We ordered our food immediately after the waitress brought us water.  We also asked for a couple cups of coffee.  Before our food came out, our waitress came back to our table and informed us "by the way they poured out the last pot of coffee so there is no more coffee". We were perplexed that she wouldn't just brew another pot if we wanted another cup, which we did. When our food finally arrived half of the food was hot and the other was cold.  My potatoes were hot and appeared to have come right off the stove however my eggs were cold.  How was it possible that my eggs were just made but became cold so quickly? We asked for a manager to explain what I have written above. The manager was very nice and apologetic and offered to remake our plates.   After receiving our remade plates, we noticed the waitress's and busser began closing up shop. While we were still eating, our waitress asked if she could take any plates away and if we needed our sugar packets any longer... Our plates weren't even half eaten. I was so appalled that she was trying to take away anything she could from our table that I considered asking her if she "needed to collect our silverware to put in the dishwasher leaving us to use our hands?" We paused before we replied that we were not done with the sugar. Soon after the bus boy began turning off the space heaters, including the one at our table. We had to finish our food in the cold. I was quickly beginning to feel like a second class citizen. There were a couple of parties still finishing up their food inside when the waitresses were placing the chairs on top of the tables in preparation for closing. I'm sure particles of dust and dirt were swept into the air and landing on their food. At the very least, I was comforted that we weren't the only ones receiving bad service, as weird as that sounds.    In the end, the manager comped our meal and we left most of it on our plate after being freezed out and our waitress chomping at the bit to take our plates away. Her behavior was more clamorous than our dog who was hoping we would drop crumbs that she could gobble. Needless to say, our experience was regrettable. We expected very different from a restaurant in Old Town with a modern open feel and large bar.  I frequently see lines out the door for the restaurant and it looked like a happening place. My advice is if you are going to dine here be sure you will be finished with all your food before 2:40pm otherwise your service will quickly dissolve.  I'm still wandering if they gave me eggs off of someone else's plate which would explain why they were cold. If the Breakfast Club does not want to serve until 3pm as their hours state they should close their kitchen earlier or close the restaurant earlier.  They certainly should not have asked us to have a seat and treat us as if it was an imposition.

0EuCo9JWPWQbOXWSTp8vkA.text: I have always been a big fan of this place. I have been coming here on the weekends for the past 4 years and it never disappoints. Every time my parents come into to town they come eat here. They will drive down from north Scottsdale every morning for breakfast. Sometimes I end up going here back to back on Saturday and Sunday! Anytime I have someone visiting from out of town, this is where I take then for breakfast. Be prepared to wait on the weekends but it's well worth the wait. You can always grab a drink at the coffee bar while you are waiting. They move people in and out pretty quickly.   The omelets are great (the Whole Hog being my favorite). The fresh fruit that's comes with the omelets is good. Omelets come with potatoes too, but I often substitute toast for the potatoes. The Lean and Green omelette is also a good option if you are trying to behave. I'll substitute turkey and broccoli for the fruit and potatoes if I'm trying to keep it healthy.   The blueberry pancakes and the french toast are incredible. If you get the french toast, make sure to get the fresh fruit and nuts on top. It's a game changer! Even if I get an omelette, I can't help but order 1 pancake or 1 piece of french toast on the side, or both :) It's that good!   I can't speak to any of the lunch menu items because the breakfast is that good! Maybe I'll try a lunch item one day, but not any time soon. If you are not in a rush and have some time to hang out, this is the perfect place for breakfast or brunch on the weekends!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole hog

Oyi3gb1uM5fIQxTmUOdpBA.text: Stopped by this place prior to our apache trail drive! For our party of 7, this place was great! We have picky eaters from carnivores to vegetarians, including some that don't eat eggs!   Table Ordered the breakfast grilled cheese, huevos ranchero, jalapeno cheddar biscuit, mushroom benedit(has another name on their menu), yogurt/granola and a order of waffles for the table! All items were delicious, the biscuit was very cheesy, and my grilled cheese was made to perfect(hash browns, with cheddar eggs and substituted bacon for avocado!) each dish also came with fresh fruit, which was very delicious!!!   The fresh oj is a must!!   Overall had a great time despite a 20 minute wait on a Friday morning! Now I know why the wait occurs, want to come back if time permits before we go!!!

CJAF2dCGo67Ls8DwJLveWg.text: Walked in and was immediately welcomed. I ordered the house Bloody Mary and unfortunately, I wasn't impressed one bit. However, the food made up for it! I ordered the bird omelette that looked like it had a whole bird and avocado inside. The portions are huge so I wouldn't recommend kicking your plate clean. My brother ordered the border bowl and my oh my was it tasty. There were so many flavors in the bowl and it too was a large amount. I need to go back soon!

Nmb_0fQLQMPXdrSNMKl4YA.text: 2nd time here & still very good. It's a very busy weekday breakfast place w/ communal tables a la Le Pain Quotidien wannabe.  Had a little Greek yogurt w/ berries & oatmeal w/ side of raisins & brown sugar.

BVa9pGbPoH5kcxGSUy5OXg.text: What a great choice for breakfast!  On our way home after a fabulous week here and it was a great last meal.  Fresh food, great service, outdoor seating.  A must in Scottsdale!

b3DzZJ_H7R4evjhvINuazg.text: Wow, great Brunch. Being from Texas I like hot food, their hot sauce is up there. Wife had the Challah French toast and I had the Breakfast burrito both great!  Go ahead and put yourself on waitlist on weekends and show up 10 mins before. Good reason this place has a long wait. Definitely try it.

EBToPz15EyZbzcD0ywdUSw.text: This place has the best French toast I have ever had in my life! Not to mention the hostess and all the waitresses are so friendly, even the ones that weren't serving us. Would totally recommend to anyone looking for a great breakfast with friendly service and good prices.

dxr78XFA2XeM9dqvXWMrsw.text: Enjoyed awesome coffee freshed squeezed orange juice waiting for my omelet and french toast. Great atmosphere with out door seating enjoying Scottdale down town view.   Had an egg white omelet with roasted tomatoes,  swiss cheese,  avocado and turkey. Very yummy!  We also enjoyed a scrambled egg mixture with chorizo and other yummy ingredients.  Very flavorful and a hint of spice.   Enjoyed some yummy french toast with fresh light maple syrup.  The turkey bird omelet was also well enjoyed with a nice white creamy sauce.  Expect a 30 to 40 minute wait but it is worth it.  You can purchase a coffee and or other drinks while you are waiting.  They will refill your coffee when seated no extra charge.  Hope you like our food pics.

C-sd5B2jmIn1J-Vi8-qHew.text: Freshly made pineapple juice! Omelettes are great here. Service is on point, and lots of options to choose from :)

fhthKOakf4K5pC3dykdnYg.text: So visiting Phoenix and wanted to give this place a try.  Tough review - the food was good, but the service wasn't.   We were sitting outside and our waitress rarely came outside. Never had the chance to ask for some sugar for my espresso. Didn't get the chance to ask for salt with my eggs. And my husband only had 1 coffee refill, but he did say the coffee was good.   It was mid-morning and wasn't crowded, so there was really no excuse. It's a shame because we would have gone back there for the food. My husband really liked the southwestern egg convention that he got the was served on a tortilla.

nqYlgnkqJ_hA2myU1NaSug.text: The food is moldy, my friend became very ill after eating this moldy sandwich.  We talked to the manager and still had to pay for the food that we did not eat and made my friend ill.

9eaeudQhd2uEi2AcQWq7aA.text: I went for breakfast and would say this is the place to go if your location is old town Scottdale. Very nice, open, bright ambiance with plenty of counter space for lone diners. The selection of food is varied, to include low carb/high protein dishes. The staff is attentive, prompt and friendly. The only reasons I did not give five stars is that the music is too loud and the table coffee is sub par, very similar to hotel room packet coffee.

PaPHGDAVT2PVuo273GeXtg.text: This is a meet & greet place from the looks of the serious and not so serious conversations taking place at the tables.  Men in suits.  Or with marvelous tats.  Women in flowing Native American skirts.  Or Lulu togs.   Come as you are.  Or as you wanna be.  Breakfast is wonderful.  I liked the breakfast sandwich, stacked with a rich yellow egg, bacon, gruyere cheese, and wasabi mayo.  Coffee is dark French Press, and left in a an ergonomic, triangular pot at your table.  I think I left a dusty colored scarf with net and glitter running though it beneath the table.  If it's True that you leave something behind when you unconsciously hope to return, I'll make it back to Breakfast Club one day.

BYEiY9smxJsce1tuxhGz-w.text: Had the best breakfast today!  The waitress was fun and friendly and ...hot!  The food was a nice big plateful of awesomeness and hot!  I had eggs over easy, turkey cutlet which is this amazing piece of protein unique to Breakfast Club toast and their stellar iced coffee.  The Omelets and stack of hot cakes are amazing too.

Mex_bx8xtYKpU1F6ZPgj3A.text: The food was great the server who took care of us was even better but I was there with a group of six people for less than an hour and they kicked us out IMMEDIATELY after we paid we were still drinking our alcoholic beverages and it was super unprofessional especially considering my friends and I rarely spend time together and it was a special event for us.

jjI1FqpEdY16196COQa1rg.text: Definitely come here if you are from out of town and looking for fresh, fairly healthy fare. The wraps are generous and stuffed with fresh ingredients- some are spicy which could be a deal breaker for some. Very consistent in taste and presentation so we have our go-to faves which is the berry salad and turkey wrap - delicious! Crowded around noon so use No Wait app to get in line 20 minutes or so before you arrive.

X1HFKFlleek0mKd0k5E0pw.text: I got he huevos con mass and it was Awesome!!  Cute place, went on a Sunday.  Be prepared to wait!

FguF8ZXSNYPET4IK1QDncQ.text: This place is awesome. Food was great. Was seated right away . Food came out fast . My server was new, her name is Rachel. What an amazing server .When my food hit the table she was right there asking me if everything is how I like it .GREAT GREAT GREAT server . If you go to breakfast club to eat asked to be seated with her and you will have the best experience

hwt9h4sBLpM8b3UdFPL_Hg.text: Booo!    When a restaurant is super busy, very popular and has large crowds, it can mean two things - it's an awesome place to eat or you're going to have bad service and cold food.  For us it was the latter.    We were taken to the patio (dog friendly) to be seated. I don't own a dog and I find it repulsive to be sitting next to someone else's dog while I eat!  My chair was right by a the door to the patio.  We asked to be seated inside.    Waitress took our order and it was about 20-30 minutes before we were finally served.  I ordered an OMELET MY WAY and did not get it my way!  All there was on the plate was an omelet, no fruit and no side of bacon.  The bacon was in the omelet which I did not request.  A different waitress took it back to the kitchen and returned the plate with a side of bacon and hash browns (which I didn't ask for). My fruit with whipped cream also arrived and was the best part of the meal.  The hash browns were cold and the bacon was cold and leathery.  My whole meal and experience was screwed up.    Then Mister Manager himself said something about our waitress having personal problems with her father because she never returned to follow up on our meal or provide the bill.  If it was me, I would let her go home to deal with it and get another waitress to take care of the patron, instead he just kind of stood off to the side.  I'm not sure what his purpose was.  The bill was screwed up because they charged for items I didn't ask for and didn't charge me for items I got.    I don't think I'll be eating here anytime soon.   The second star is for my husband's breakfast which was good and correct.

kBbDP41WprSicGWE6bilPg.text: Unbelievable. Best service and steak and eggs in town. It is my new go to spot for breakfast. I like sitting at the counter. You get 3 eggs and fried potatoes laced with peppers and onions; along with a good sized steak cooked to perfection. The mocha coffee was also amazing. Love this place.

_4cUHayMZjqsiArjf4PCzg.text: Took my husband out for breakfast and didn't want to go to our typical spots. I saw Breakfast Club on yelp-4 stars and over 850 reviews-it seemed promising. Thank goodness I joined the waitlist on Yelp. It was 9 am on a Monday but there was a 20 minute wait?? I figured this place must be amazing! When we arrived, the 20 minute wait was almost done but we ended up having to wait another 10 minutes at the restaurant. It wasn't a huge pain since they have lots of tables for waiting customers. We are seated by the hostess and receive menus. Less than 20 seconds later our waitress shows up asking what we would like to drink. Not sure yet we just order waters and let her know we just arrived. She practically rolls her eyes but simultaneously plasters on a smile and says "sure! Take your time!" while still standing there. My husband and I look at each other and quickly order drinks, coffee and a latte. Fast forward to 10 min later and she hasn't returned with drinks or to see if we are ready to order. I guess she really meant she would be taking her time. I didn't see her helping other tables so I don't know why it took so long. She finally comes out with my husband's coffee but says my latte isn't ready yet. Quite the wait for a simple small latte...We try to order and the waitress isn't even sure of some of the items. "Is the biscuit and gravy two biscuits or just one?" My husband just wanted a small side. "Umm, well the biscuit is cut in half so it's just one. Well actually maybe it's two. Haha, I don't know for sure." Okay...thanks? We order, another long wait, the food comes out. And after this whole ordeal, I take a bite and I'm relieved to say it tastes...JUST OKAY? I got a slice of French toast and hash browns, basic breakfast place stuff and it's just okay....Thankfully the waitress only came by once to check on us and at that time I was able to just ask for the check. This place really disappointed my husband and I. The prices are really good but the food is mediocre. I much much rather go to Matt's Big Breakfast. But obviously from its rating some people really enjoy this place! I will say that the restaurant was male dominated and almost all of the waitresses were completely arm and back baring with slightly low cut spaghetti strapped shirts. I saw another reviewer post that it's the "Breakfast Hooters". So I'm not sure if that's the reason why people come here. I can just say from my experience with the staff and food that I won't be back!

AC75gt9sGrNziZnauWlnuA.text: Awesome breakfast- we had the breakfast bowl and breakfast burrito. Good sized portions, staff was very friendly, great service! Long wait, but was worth it!

Eu7IBLllUIk4-zPJPc5TTQ.text: Very good food and ambient.       I went for the Border bowl which right away you could tell and taste the quality ingredients. The bowl was very big, the only thing I would recommend is to cut the size maybe a quarter and add tortillas maybe avocado even.

RZeKGACEkKzWYm6mvN5z0g.text: I second Christian A's review. Hostess was great! Food was cold, no follow up by the waitress, awful service. I spoke with the manager heidi, who cared about as much as the waitress. Afterwards realized the manager watched as we had to get up to get condiments and ignored our obvious need for assistance.   We still left $5 on top of a $32 bill. What a rip. Won't be back.

ahhOLFbjC5SDb7SgenlXqA.text: Second time visit. Both bad. Staff wants to be helpful, but wind up being pompous, not helpful and working with a kitchen that obviously defies the owners intentions. Distant and why they are so busy, I'll never know. Stay away.

6cud8gvGCMMo_snSlzv7pg.text: This is the first time being here. Awesome food! I had the Bagel and lox. My husband had the Whole hog omelet. It was amazing!! Or waitress Emily is very attentive, always making sure my husband had plenty of coffee. I had the black ice tea. This is a must for breakfast. We only had a ten minute wait. Come and enjoy you won't be sorry!

zSL2TsvEZzbMTG9gSULTHw.text: Definitely my favorite breakfast/brunch spot in all of Arizona! I have never been disappointed by the food. My favorite dish is the breakfast grilled cheese, which I never regret getting. No matter what day of the week you go, the wait is insane. However, the counter is first come first serve so you could end up not even waiting to sit down. However, if you want a table, the wait usually seems to be around 30-45 minutes. The servers are very attentive and so kind to the customers. Also, this place is also very affordable, and the prices are not that expensive unlike other brunch restaurants. Great place to go if you are looking for a quick and good meal!

DWrppuym-WNU5gmx3lKRGA.text: Best brunch I've ever had. The Southwest Breakfast options were on POINT. Food was quick and so delicious. I may plan a trip back to Arizona just for this brunch.

RUMlslXjtePmPifOOGV1Hw.text: Don't you forget about me, don't, don't, don't, don't  Don't you forget about me (Simple Mind - Don't You "Forget about me")  The Breakfast Club was a cult classic in the 80's.  The Breakfast Club in Scottsdale does not disappoint.  Though not so much a classic yet, they do serve a mean breakfast - Yum!   I ordered the Eggs Benedict while my partner ordered 2 eggs breakfast.  Eggs Benedict Arnold - haha! (Peter Griffin from Family Guy).  Needless to say I loved a good old fashion breakfast and they did not skimp on the portions.  (Enough for 5 mischievous students hmmm).  Like going back in time, back to the 80's, where breakfast was a time to stuff your face!  My eggs were over easy for sure while the soft and warm hollandaise sauce gently glazed over the eggs and ham.  Not too overpowering and just the right sweetness.  I had my hash extra crispy and my bacon; I like them soft and chewy.  I added some hot sauce and I had myself a grand meal.  Will you recognize me? (After eating here and gaining some weight) Call my name and walk on by (A walk more like a run I'll need) Rain keeps falling, rain keeps falling (More like falling asleep) Down, down, down, down (I go!) (Simple Mind - Don't You "Forget about me")  The place itself had a business diner yet modern feel.  Not your typical dive diner for sure!  Service was spot on and keep that coffee flowing! - Enjoy!

IWSC6OL0jDEFEgR9pwCIFA.text: Breakfast was par. The hype and wait was not worth the food. Comparable to Denny's.   However, the location is convenient if you're staying at the W.

k2XWZTgIg-H6_vHkhVO3uw.text: Love this place and the BCfrench toast is amazing! brought family from NJ and the wait ahead list was great!!

PEQXhzitgcyKQN8gurOM2g.text: Excellent way to start the day. Smoothies to eggs. Great service. Coffee flows. Recommend it

h3geQoZZ_SgW3tFXdtvgAA.text: BEST BREAKFAST place ever!  I love everything on their menu.  Fast & excellent service.  Be sure to go!

KU5jEcdhAFjb_E_UE9Qu4A.text: Not a fan at all. The hollandaise sauce on my eggs Benedict was not hollandaise sauce, it was some runny yellow soup. The meal had no flavor, and the fruit was flavorless. Looking at photos from the reviews confirmed our visit was not isolated.

-dqQU-q_kYltg2rmAFXqkg.text: Love this place and Chelsea was amazing today! We have eaten here twice and never had a bad experience. Great service, amazing food and wonderful cocktails.

DuBZS_ycrrFi4INfgiaWGQ.text: I ordered the border bowl with a few modifications (no onions, peppers, or hot sauce, it was delicious! The pork green chili gave it a great flavor. The reason for the four star instead of five was our waitress was just ok. She did the bare minimum.....

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

clWofuzWZZMSqLZDO21QSA.text: Good breakfast!! variety of foods.. always busy in the morning...love the French toast...and bacon is awesome!! Standing room only .. sometimes the wait is kinda long.... over all very good place

pvwxjxpX-x0IynPVBVicwQ.text: This is a great breakfast place located in the north part of Old Scottsdale.  The service was fast and the restaurant is clean.  I asked for a few changes to my breakfast sandwich and they were very accommodating.

xnAA-aFcuM4sNx042rEOKg.text: If it's breakfast/brunch time, this place is always busy. The menu offers a good mix of items for people with different preferences in breakfast food. They have a good sized patio and do allow you to call ahead to put your name on the waiting list. There are not many options for where to sit when waiting except outside on the walls of their planters in the sun, so keep that in mind and call ahead!

MZLfno3kdA8QKpdXUs9LCw.text: We ate here two days in a row because the food was so good the first time. The huevos rancheros are amazing! The orange juice is fresh squeezed. Hubby had the jalapeno biscuits and gravy which was different than anything he has ever had. Today he is having the breakfast burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito.

bmvnsMk5Fn1C7x1ofvVtDg.text: The food and service was great. The wife and I had the Irish oatmeal and the kids had pancakes and eggs. The family had OJ , pineapple juice and apple juice all were excellent. I recommend this place for breakfast.

BT2nC-bggyPbgN29pFXDgw.text: The place was great for a pre-race weekend breakfast place.  The staff was extremely patient dealing with dietary questions.  We also had a fairly large party and they were very accommodating.

V0X7VOFyxqClGuzso5bJAA.text: Went here for breakfast to catch up with girlfriend. Food was mediocre. 2 stars given because the waitress kept circling our table ... attempted to take my plate of way TWICE, even though I was still eating. Shady maneuvers such as not refilling water, rolling her eyes when I mentioned that I was still working on my plate. Definitely a place where they turn tables. Been there 2x ... similar experience.

nGmqZZg6dQywOUtCo5gNvw.text: This place is amazing. The food is really tasty and delicious. One of the reasons why i love this place is the gravy is sooo good I ordered biscuits gravy and it was so fabulous. Actually we ordered mocha and it was so goood.  I absolutely will come there again.

VILpnBi53sxHGOj9j7KGew.text: Love this place!  When we visit Scottsdale, we love having breakfast here. Juevos Ranchero and eggs Benedict are our favorites. The service is outstanding. We always bring a book to read and wait, the wait is worth every second. Thank you.

e2KvM8R7JgB578d4M7a4eQ.text: Very cool place to grab breakfast. We stayed nearby the W hotel and this was a nice 5 min walk. Had great food and great service. My advice, the breakfast sandwich or the burrito. Orrrrrrr the chocolate chip pancakes. They are HUGE!

QngTGgBEwQbhFvV7CcNRnQ.text: This was my first time here, coming on a Sunday after a 5k race with a group of 9 friends.  We were seated in about 50 mins (pretty typical for Sunday brunch around these parts). They have a full bar, so you can sip and chill while you wait.  Once we were seated we had the FRIENDLIEST waitress ever!  All smiles, super patient, and got everything right.  Everything I ever wanted in a server.  Now the food....I got "The Bird" omelette.  This thing was stuffed full of turkey, mushrooms, fresh avocado, and this heavenly garlic crema sauce.  That sauce came from the gods....I savored each and every bite all while holding back tears of joy.  BEST omelette ever!  Even the sides delivered- the fruit skewer fresh and perfectly ripe, and the potatoes were DELISH!  Awesome well-rounded meal.  Will definitely be back.

6qkczmZ4wc5i0HuxAPCuVw.text: Lousy Service they don't follow the waitlist Sad customer service not the first the first time this has happened will not be coming back.

3csu3devCRh9bGqh9XRU5Q.text: Today is my first time at this terrific restaurant - and I will definitely be back! The Setvice was prompt, very courteous and professional. The quinoa salad was one of the most creative I've had for sometime. And the compilation of foods and spices made it delicious, yet very healthy. I did treat myself to a side of applewood smoked bacon - after all my name is Bacon; so it was a must :-).  Even though it was thick sliced, it was refreshingly crisp, yet tender. The only improvement I would suggest is for the music to be slightly softer. This was an exceptional experience, and I enthusiastically recommend the Breakfast Club!

vQ3pYCBm2rAECufQn778gw.text: Great Service. Food came out 5 minutes after we ordered in. Everything was tasty, but my husband really enjoyed his "border bowl".

XDe-lmTthFSDJlXCh1435g.text: You can't be seated until entire party is there, meanwhile more and more people take your spot. Stupid rule, I  do not understand how someone thought that that was a good idea.

7uQPmkktHaoi9HCTqsubmw.text: This place was fantastic! I had the Applewood bacon, scrambled eggs, and regular French Toast. The bacon was nice and crisp with no undercooked spots. The eggs were nice and fluffy and the added just the right amount of cheese to them. Lastly, the French Toast...DAMN! It was so good! I definitely recommend people to try this place!   The decor is nice and the waitresses wear all black shirts with black tights. Women won't get anything from this portion of my review, but they had some very nice looking waitresses in those outfits! Lol!

r1X7OR6_dyqnCqfnt37YPQ.text: Breakfast club was a nice breakfast spot in OldTown Scottsdale. They have a good menu with quality breakfast items that were reasonably priced. The food was good, nothing special however. When I ordered coffee, it came out cold, but the waitress replaced it quickly. The staff was friendly but service was average. Overall it was good, but nothing special. Good spot to bring co-workers or friends. Oh there might be a little wait early morning and during lunch time.

B68jwd4ZGPB3_uw0TFntaw.text: Me and the Mr finally got a chance to go here.. simple, easy and well presented.. you cant go wrong here even though my fat ass only ordered a smoothie and steel cut oats.. now the Mr he ordered Eggs Benedict.. huge yummy looking portion of ooey gooey eggy goodness.. I wanted to dive face first into his plate! Instead I ate my oats and loved every bite.. perfectly cooked and served with brown sugar and milk, just like mom's before her divorce introduced her to the single life. Oh those were the days.  Id go at opening if you're hungry 'cause there is always a wait!

IOWMGZ1Jab1CRMJyV3J3JA.text: I'm not going back. Nor would I recommend it. They were under construction when we went but they had a small area for people to eat. No reason to wait that's for sure. My wife ordered the Challah bread french toast, it was dry and didn't even look like it was Challah bread. Mine was worse, I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. The flavor of the pork was good but that's about it. It looked like dog food, and the order of the ingredients were all wrong. The egg was burried under pounds of pork so when I found it to cut, the yolk had already disappeared in the beans below it. They make a tortilla shell act as the base in a bowl, like a taco salad, so it's hard to include the tortilla with each bite. The pork was so watery/greasy that after a while the whole bowl was just a bowl of mush. Friendly wait staff though, fairly attentive, so they can refill your water or coffee well.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros looks like poo

UpBwUVEPeTMiaZaSTVIVPA.text: The Breakfast Club really got me excited. I mean first of all it's named after a movie that I really love. Secondly it's pretty cute and the patio has those misters that are ubiquitous in Phoenix. But, the thing that really got my pulse racing was the idea of jalapeno biscuits and gravy. I've said over and over how I'm always looking for delicious biscuits and gravy and have such a hard time finding them. I thought I may have struck gold with the addition of jalapenos.  Unfortunately I didn't. The meal was just okay. The thing that made it weird for me was that there was a layer of biscuits, then a layer of cheese, then the gravy which was topped with eggs. I like eggs, but usually on the side. I love cheese, but I really only wanted the gravy on the biscuits.   Oh well, each to his or her own. The place was cute, the servers friendly and I'd go back to try something else if I were back in town.

p6nXQjftB41Uam2NVM1aEQ.text: I think this place is an over crowded, diner. I was incredibly unimpressed with what I got after such a long wait. With so many great brunch spots near it I will definitely never be back.

45lb37ZG0LhH0ZP3QDZPXQ.text: LOVE The Breakfast Club!  I must admit that my whole life was spent going to greasy spoon restaurants for breakfast...  Until I met a friend who is an interior designer.  She suggested that I get away from my backwoods grass roots and go to brunch somewhere that has "real" food.    The only reasons why it got 4 instead of 5 stars: Going to The Breakfast Club for Saturday brunch is not a good idea when you are starving.  Chances are you will have about a 30+ minute wait, but the wait is well worth it.  Also, you can't sit on the patio and drink alcohol.  Which really sucked when after a 45 minute wait we were seated, handed our menu's, got comfortable, and then were told that we had to move inside if we were going to drink mimosas.  This was the only bad experience in the 10+ times we have been there since.  Good:  When we walked into The Breakfast Club, I could see why my interior designer friend loves this place.  Simplistic design keeps it clean and feeling uncrowded, even when every seat in the house is full (and this place can hold a LOT of people for its size.)  The food is amazing, and although I have tasted other items on the menu I order the biscuits and gravy and a mimosa or two every time we go.  The staff is cute, friendly and attentive and everything is a decent price.

B6gVDXTt00cyPaNYydzO2Q.text: Terrible food. This is for college kids with amatuer palates and amatuer hangovers. And, I suspect, illegal hiring practices. The waitresses are all conspicuously pretty.

AxyQGSEnCh04H2_wSLrTtg.text: One of my favorites where I know I will always love my meal- breakfast all-day or lunch! I work nearby so I also pick up the yummy, yummy spring berry salad with tuna or delicious pine crusted chicken.  My favorites are a build your own omelette with a huge variety of options, French toast, turkey rueben with sweet potato fries and the above mentioned berry salad with pine crusted chicken.  The servers sometimes have what I will call an "i'm Hip, Scottsdale attitude" but they are generally very efficient and attentive (kind of like if you are in NYC).   I love the new expanded space and the large counter service.

fQvIYst5_iuHQT0s2pTRUg.text: crazy busy on weekends... good food, but order it for pickup.  Good omelets

asDf_Hd95WbhVKzGQMXGJQ.text: Yeah guys,  this is definitely a breakfast spot. If you've never been....warning! You will wait a looong time on Saturday & Sunday morning. The huevos rancheros  and breakfast burrito (shown in photos) are slamming! The omelets are delish and the side of fruit is almost always sweet.  If I order lunch, I typically just get the grilled cheese and tomato soup. I must warn that the tomato soup is more brothy than creamy. The salads are ok but not worth the 45min table wait. The prices are great for the quantity and quality of the food (breakfast).   Bon Appetite!

V1QaiAbv7RsvEeQlenuSjQ.text: I love the breakfast club. Every time I go there the service is phenomenal and the food is delicious. My favorite thing on their menu is their French toast but their breakfast burrito is also mouth watering. I would definitely recommend going there, and waiting cause there is always a line. But I promise you, it'll be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is their French toast!

RZ14NTRmRmnmKXW-VgQ9UA.text: Stopped in amid the hustle and bustle of a restaurant under a large remodel. No worries here. I like the look of the new decor. The booths are roomie and comfy, the tables appear a little bigger and the interior seems brighter.   My gf ordered the Turkey Benedict. She thought it was "great". It was perfectly spicy, and the Hollandaise was very good.  I had the Huevos Rancheros. I have had it twice before, and it is consistently good. It could be a tad hotter, or spiced up, but I like my food hot. Like 10 out of 10 hot. Not much a gripe, just a preference.  Service was great. Server was fun, friendly, and efficient.   We always have a good experience at The Breakfast Club.

oP-K3yrElE_FDfewz3oi_w.text: Great breakfast and great staff! Had the Bird omelet and it was chock full of Turkey and avocados.  Great experience.

aNvXimO65mFUbPSd-A_ZeA.text: I had lunch at breakfast club with some co workers and the service was awful. Our server was very rude from the start when taking our orders. After our food was brought out she never returned back to ask how everything was or if we needed refills. I had to flag her down to ask for our checks. A few of us paid with cards, a few with cash. Those with cash did not need change back. When she brought the other checks back for signing she proceeded to say "did I do something to not deserve a tip?" Mind you those who paid with cash gave at least a 20% tip minus one person. She did not give those who paid with a card time to even sign their bill and enter the tip and total amount before she called our table out in the middle of the restaurant. Then she proceeded to make a nasty comment when she walked away. It was very rude and unprofessional for her to call out a table in front of other people before people even had time to determine a tip or sign their check! I understand that servers work for tips and I respect servers very much but this was beyond rude that a customer walking out at the same time as us even made a comment stating how rude she was. Needless to say we won't be returning and those who had yet to enter a tip amount BEFORE her outburst did not leave a tip after that because she did not deserve it.

UW9pCwXEuvNSbn0FrQEQPw.text: Everything here rocks!  Excellent java...iced or hot and they will give you a roader...I had eggs over medium...cooked perfect with a nice buttery taste, a crazy great piece of grilled turkey...IDK what it was but so darn tasty, fresh fruit and the cranberry toast...oooo I want it now!!! My mates had choc chip pancakes and they were tasty, fluffy and so yummy!  The home fries were awesome as well...this was a fantabulous foodtastic time!

GFgaaS6CJk0QLjMr8Ml6cg.text: Great pancakes! And the eggs Benedict was fantastic until they changed the recipe :( but overall this place rocks for breakfast.  So much better than a Denny's or other chain. Also great for lunch. Yummy salads

2wuQOgBuhTP4Ox6uZr9ybw.text: I really can't recommend The Breakfast Club.   It's been on my mental "to try" list for awhile and I was excited to check it out for brunch with a girlfriend. I've heard it is a busy place on weekends, so I took advantage of a rare weekday off to go and try it without having to fight weekend crowds.   Upon entering, I was impressed with the decor: a cute, bright bar borders the front area and there is a smattering of high cocktail tables with barstools in the "Bar/lounge" area. The buttery yellow freestanding curved booths through the center of the room are tres-cute and the cheery color scheme is complemented by the exposed brick walls - all adorable! There are windows lining one side of the dining room and an outdoor patio with umbrellas that would likely be lovely in nicer weather (but not in July)   I showed up on time, but my friend had texted me to let me know she was running a little late.   There was no one, I repeat NO ONE waiting when I entered the restaurant, and several free tables of varying sizes were available in the dining room. The bar area was pretty empty (I think there were a few people sitting up at the counter)   I approached the hostess stand, where THREE hostesses were standing around, not helping anyone. I let them know that I needed a table for two, and was asked where the other person was. I explained that she was running a few minutes late and the girl haughtily advised me that "we don't seat incomplete parties - you can wait over there until she gets here". Over there was the bar area. I awkwardly clambered up onto one of the barstools and sat alone while alternating between staring at my phone and eying the several still empty tables in the dining room. After about 5 minutes of this, I was fed up. I get it, the Breakfast Club is a busy breakfast spot on the weekends. I bet that the "we don't seat incomplete parties" rule is something to live by on Saturdays and Sundays. I'm sure that they're overrun with pushy, obnoxious people demanding tables and annoying guests who camp out at tables for hours on end while waiting for their elusive additional guests who never show up. But this was a Friday, there were empty tables, and I wanted to sit down and order a drink instead of being punished by being forced to sit in their lobby since my friend hadn't gotten there yet. So, I tried again in hopes that they'd relent in light of their non busyness. But alas, the young, rude hostesses unhelpfully stuck to their guns and directed me back to the bar area.   When my friend arrived, we were promptly seated in a booth at the back of the restaurant. We waited a considerable amount of time for a server to finally come to the table (my 10 minutes of waiting in the lobby would've been more productively spent sitting at my booth waiting for the server to finally show up - the timing would've been perfect!)   I asked for a Diet Coke and was smugly advised that "we don't carry any diet sodas... we have bottled natural sodas" This was weird, but this is Scottsdale so I guess I should expect pretension (?) I switched my order to Orange Juice - flustered by the server's curt demand for the size I'd like, I mistakenly answered "large"... we'll revisit this in a moment.   For my entree, I tried their BCs B&G - it seemed like one of the few interesting items on the menu, with Jalapeno Biscuits topped with fontina, sausage gravy, and eggs.. I was looking for some flavor and the jalapeno biscuits sounded like just the ticket. Unfortunately, I was wrong. There was a little hot sauce drizzled on top of the gravy, but even that was overwhelmed by the creamy blandness of the gravy, leaving the dish heavy and lacking in any sort of complexity. My friend ordered an omelet and  she remarked that it was very greasy.   When our server dropped off the check, I learned that my large orange juice was $7.00 (!!) I took another sip of my average glass of orange juice, just to ascertain if perhaps I had groggily ordered a mimosa or screwdriver in lieu of my standard OJ... NOPE! Regular orange juice = $7.00, guys. FYI.   I can't pinpoint what I disliked most about sitting by my lonesome little self in the bar...perhaps it was that it was morning and while I'm not a big bar person generally, I'm particularly less bar-ish before noon. Perhaps it was being isolated as though I was being made an example of. Maybe it was my time spent puzzling over the decision to alienate a customer after they've barely crossed the threshold of the restaurant. Or maybe it was that I was being treated like I was trying to get into an exclusive nightclub when really it was just a mediocre, overpriced breakfast restaurant. Regardless, it absolutely ruined my visit. I could continue regaling you with my thoughts on this awful experience, but I've got to get back to my busy schedule of studiously avoiding The Breakfast Club for any and all meals for the rest of my life.  Ciao!

NYQyJCQCwnT84RLgvL_7zA.text: Best breakfast in Scottsdale, AZ period! Karen and I always look forward to going to eat at the Breakfast Club in our annual Spring Training trip. Great foods and great services, highly recommend to others.  Blue Crab Egg Benedict are the main reason why we go there. Go A's!

Q2FjtPO0YgGfWDPiwz9AbQ.text: After deciding that we really just wanted some breakfast at 12pm, we stopped in here on our way to do some shopping at the Fashion Mall around the corner. The place seemed relatively busy which I think is always a good sign.   We were seated promptly and our server was at our table shortly after that. We sat outside along Scottsdale Road. It was pretty loud, but it was also great to people watch! I couldn't believe how quickly our food came out! And it was really delicious!   I had the Bird Omelette, which had avocado, turkey, Boursin cheese and mushrooms stuffed inside. My meal also came with pan fried potatoes and huge, fresh hunks of fruit. I couldn't finish, so I saved the fruit and potatoes for later. My Mom ordered a traditional breakfast with bacon, eggs, toast, potatoes and fruit. It was also massive and she said it was very good.   Our server was excellent. She was friendly, prompt and professional. I would recommend this place for anyone looking to people watch and not looking to pay astronomical prices for breakfast in Scottsdale.

mBLI6NqMP8YlCrnTdxpwlg.text: Our first visit of all days was on a Sunday on a holiday weekend. The wait was the norm of 25 minutes for the time of the day. The staff was friendly and professional. Once seated, the server was attentive and had a great smile. She gave us good info on the menu. With the time of day we expect a long order wait, however the food came out fast, meal recommendation is the Huevos Rancheros if you are hungry and like the taste of the south. The meal was yummy and authentic. In addition, you must try their Bloody Mary. I ordered it a little spice.

THwCMOMKW-6x0S2TEzkWgA.text: Visited here on a weekend trip to spring training. The food was wonderful and I especially enjoyed the fresh fruit that accompanies each dish.  I had the chorizo breakfast burrito which I recommend highly. We waited on a Saturday morning for about an hour so don't expect to just show up and get a table. Be prepared to wait but in my opinion it's worth it.

_VRvS99OT_NbpFNSZg2JyA.text: TBC has become a bit of a Scottsdale landmark over the past few years...I use it as a navigation landmark when I have people meeting me in town.  "Go north on Scottsdale Road and if you see 75 hung over people dressed in Affliction tee shirts and sequined mini-dresses, standing on a street corner waiting for a mediocre breakfast, you've gone too far...in so very many ways".  I live (for another few weeks, at any rate) pretty close to TBC and yet, I don't really "go to there" very often (or at all) if I can avoid it.  I just don't look good in Affliction...or a sequined mini-dress.  In addition, the food and service have left me cold (much like my last omelet at TBC a few weeks ago) on my infrequent visits.  But the amusement factor provided by TBC is (for me at least) quite high, and for that, I'm grateful!  I've been twice in the past year...once for lunch, out of renewed curiosity (I was headed to another spot for lunch and saw a couple reading a menu outside another restaurant and discussing their lunch preferences in loud Scottish accents "I dinna want a fookin TACO, Angela...I wanna go to the fookin Breakfast Club!").  That was almost a year ago...and I went once for breakfast, recently, because the Beautiful Carin likes TBC.  And what Carin wants, Carin gets!  But both visits featured mediocre food (esp. for the price) and mediocre service (at any price).  My last visit also featured an apparently broken exhaust duct that runs under the booths at the north end of the place.  Hot, humid cooking exhaust, coming up through the seams in the upholstery, steamy cooking aroma's wafting around me from below...I was about to call Guinness because I thought I was setting a new world record for sustaining a fart!  But the aromatic breeze didn't stop!   And even though I'm close to senility, I eventually realized that it wasn't me!  Our server was uninterested in this turn of events (when I let her know what was happening)...apparently I'm past the age when a 22 year old "model" (who happens to be slingin' hash) needs to pay any attention to me...even when they are theoretically being paid to do so!  Maybe she wasn't being paid enough to listen to me...that's probably why some hookers get $2-3,000 an hour...to listen...bareback.  At any rate, I was going to add a star to my review, since the warm air enema felt so darn nice, but what other restaurant can compete with that?  It wouldn't be fair!  TBC is clearly a club that doesn't need me as a member, and I'm OK with that.

pSuFV6Kym5KRcio2SZPsMQ.text: I've eaten here too much, they don't have many vegetarian options and the tomato soup is ridiculously bad.  Go to "Daily Dose" a few blocks south and you'll be much happier. "Bacon" was also nearby and so much better, but they didn't make it.  Even a restaurant named "Bacon" had more vegetarian options.   Not sure why this place draws the crowds anymore, it just doesn't stack up.

7VQbazqBGHBTjEDmo7NbYQ.text: This is my 2nd time eating here it is a bit pricey but the food was very good!

-YuRILSgUJC6CF2_uN4nAg.text: A great breakfast spot.  Our waitress was very pleasant and provided quick and friendly service.  The food was also very good.  We sat outside on the patio under the cool mist and had an enjoyable time.  Will be going back.

dNA8BJGn5jymE4N9XX4q6w.text: Terrible! Some of the worst service and management I've ever seen! Our server said about two words to us the entire time, and checked on us one time before bringing us the check. The manager looked completely unprofessional, he was chewing gum, had blood shot eyes, and smelled like alcohol! The food was overpriced, their pancakes cost $8 without any sides. I will never go back again...

RAcvt0UPDVU_55hSYw6aug.text: Food was great and menu options are awesome. And the waitresses are easy on the eyes. I would come back here anytime I'm in town. You won't leave here hungry.

bwxab5LMp9ZcrNHucMj03Q.text: Got the breakfast burrito monster style grew chili and queso on the burrito with over easy egg inside..   Delicious!

U_dzdN850lmQa0LUNCTSEQ.text: What better place to meet up with an old friend for breakfast that was visiting Scottsdale!? Oh wait they over charged our debit cards by mistake and besides the tremendous wait, consumed a less than average meal. Next time they are in town I will make breakfast myself.

yXtHBRfJS3lWZreRrK6aqQ.text: Delicious and fresh breakfast options, and reasonable prices. Glad I stumbled across this place and will definitely be back for more!

fPDHUfN_CtVHLA8aLDunQw.text: My new favorite breakfast place! I wish it was closer to where I live, lol.  The service was prompt and super friendly. The food was beyond delicious! I can't eat potatoes and toast and the waitress quickly substituted broccoli! Awesome! The menu is pretty varied. Would definitely come back next time we are in town!

laHcyoyGh0b-lu2UCHWPyA.text: Visiting from Nebraska !!! OMG why can't they have this place there?! Food is awesome!!

uQoFrVdwLG_8oDYeOHiTYw.text: One of my favorite breakfast places.    Heads up, to prevent sticker shock on your check...  Expect $20 per person.  Some people don't think that you should have to pay $20 for breakfast.  Then again, this isn't Denny's.    The food is always delicious.  Try the biscuits and gravy, nothing too complicated.    Most likely, there will always be a wait when you get here.  This is a very popular breakfast place for tourists.  I'm not sure how they find out about it, but you won't find any special priority seating for being a local Scottsdalian.     Enjoy!

WI5IIfjR12BJ0mHGteiMgQ.text: I've been to the Breakfast Club dozens and dozens of times, but I will never  go there again. On Saturday, I attempted to go with my husband and 2 friends - and the hostesses wouldn't seat us.   My friend and I got there and were told of a 30-40 minute wait. As we were waiting for our husbands to join us, this was no problem for us. Then..they got there, and we still weren't seated. When I went to check with the hostess, my name had been crossed off list. Now, we were waiting by the front door, but I know my name was never called. I was kind, understanding that mistakes are made, and I was informed that we would be seated next.   She then proceeded to seat a group of our size that had arrived after us. I went back up to the hostess station and demanded to know why people who had arrived long after us were being seated before us. The hostess lied to me, telling me that she hadn't told me we were to be seated next, but that we were just "coming up."   I was shocked that I was getting the runaround, so I took the news back to my group, and as we were discussing whether or not to leave, the hostess seated ANOTHER group of our size that had just arrived instead of us. At this point we got up to leave. The hostess, seeing we were leaving, said "you know you guys are coming up." Whether that was a taunt or what I will never know, but I do know that I will never go there again.   It was ridiculous to be treated like a second class citizen while trying to get breakfast. I would rather eat at Denny's, which I loathe, as I know they will at least seat and serve me.

xEFp-Nztantifekic6grJQ.text: Quickstart breakfast of 2 eggs,2 strips of bacon, cranberry bread toast  (sooooo yummy) and fruit for $5.99. Can't beat it'

d4DoCkkz89cy9oXXVgI5sA.text: We came upon this place accidentally through yelp....and are sooo happy we did.  While there seems to always be a long wait....20-30 minutes both mornings we came, it is worth it.  Though I'd have to say that our first experience was WAY BETTER than our second, though it was extraordinarily busy that second time.   As a first timer I was overwhelmed with my delicious choices.... though my husband quickly narrowed my options claiming that one of us was going to get the french toast and the other the omelet.  Being that I'm more of a savory than sweet person, I picked an omelet--within his "no red meat or pork limitations" in mind.  I opted for the Bird:  turkey, mushroom, and boursin cheese with sliced avocado on top.    When breakfast came, we were beyond drooling and ready for our feast.  I immediately smeared a little cream cheese on my everything toasted bagel and took a bite...not a new york bagel, but this is az.  Then I turned my attention to the omelet....overfilled with freshly shaved thick cuts of moist turkey!!! I almost didn't want to share, but luckily it was big enough, and with the bagel and all ;)   Next to the omelet were their O'Brien potatoes...omg, the tri-colored roasted peppers sauteed with the potatoes were full of fresh bright flavors; these I refused to share!
