There were also three or four big hunks of fruit on the plate, though I never got to the healthy stuff.  My husband, as promised, ordered the Cinnamon Challah French toast.  He enjoyed it, though I found the thickness of the bread to be lacking completely.  Being a Jew from New York, I have partaken in many a Challah french toasts and the thickness is of vital importance...1 1/2 to 2" thick is perfect...you get the soft, eggy fluffiness of the center and the crispy buttery crunch on the outside....with a thin cut peice of challah...your missing the eggy fluffiness, and it sometimes just gets limp under the syrup; which it did.  The candied nuts and fruit, however, make up a little bit for that limpness, as it added texture!  Overall, we felt we would return, and even did the next day.  And while the service and food were not as good as the first time; ~~when is it ever?  We'd still return!

1DrysMB7WrXfp7c6fX9vmA.text: Great breakfast! We went on a Saturday morning, so we had to wait a little bit, but you can order drinks while you wait. The wait was worth it. Service was fantastic & very attentive. The food was delicious! I had traditional eggs Benedict & they actually poached the eggs properly (most places over cook them), my husband had hue is rancheros & they were very flavorful. All-in-all, a great breakfast spot!

ZHVZ7Qg3iZAtQhORfaFDVA.text: My first time in Scottsdale, so i looked on yelp for some assistance. Heads up this is a VERY POPULAR spot to eat.  If you want a quite one on one with someone this is not the place for you.   The food was very good and and prices are appropriate. The only downside was that the service was average at best.

yDpLdaphQtTko7LKyo4i3g.text: I really enjoyed this place, it wasn't the best breakfast and I'd be happy to try a new place when I'm in town but I'd certainly be happy to come back.  I sat at the bar and the lady working was nice and funny.  I liked it, the breakfast burrito was good, not special, but certainly good.

nmCe5sKli-pBpz5ObCC1YA.text: After reading about some of the reviews I was still optimistic that some people were over critical.  The food was decent.  I got the Eggs Benedict and it was pretty good.  I got bacon but it was over done, burnt and dry. It came with cut large cut pieces of assorted fruit which as very much welcomed.  The busboys I think make the place happy.  They were always really polite and never reached without asking.  Most of the staff were either groggy (it is the morning I can understand that) or just not happy to be there.  I asked where the restroom was and a server bascially looked at me, looked at the direction to go, pointed and turned her back to me.  I asked a general question to managment and he directed someone else to answer it for me.  I felt a little offended by this gesture.  The food is good but I will say it would be nice to have staff that are bit more oriented towards customer service.

ga6ifVkv8_ILBLvueHMYBQ.text: After a few days of drinking and being out in the heat, I needed something refreshing and healthy to get me back in sync. Fortunately, the Breakfast Club was just a few blocks down from our hotel. As soon as my friend and I arrived, we were seated right away on the patio. Service was prompt and friendly with none of the small chit chat. We were shocked at how cheap everything was.. breakfast entrees under $10 on vacation?? Unheard of unless you're eating at McDonalds or some other fast food place. I ended up ordering the egg white scramble with cottage cheese and fresh fruit and a glass of fresh carrot juice. I'm not a carrot juice fan but I thought what the heck let's try this. WOW! It was amazing! I didn't know carrot juice could taste so good and sweet by itself. I'm definitely hooked on carrot juice now! The food itself was really good. For the price, we were served pretty big portions and nothing tasted too oily or greasy to weigh me down. I especially liked the fruit selection which were slices of juicy watermelon, cantalope and pineapple - not the typical bowl of pathetic looking grapes and banana slices at other restaurants. I highly recommend the Breakfast Club to kick start your day in Scottsdale!

mhWoLl_ntX-zwrqtydpnBQ.text: Huevos con masa.  That dish absolutely rocked.  The chiles, the cornbread, the queso sauce, now that was the way to start the day.  Great service, too.

XgUUc8Vy3bn7ANhOi5j4dA.text: Great food! I've had the breakfast chorizo burrito and their tuna salad sandwich, both of which were incredibly good. The prices aren't that bad either especially for the great quality of the meal. Really fun environment, super busy on weekends though especially Sundays. Worth the wait though!

9yKggfHrUckTjT2VraYKSg.text: The Whole Hog omelette was large by too dry. The tea selection was poor. No alcohol. Service is fast but somewhat sterile. Waiting for a table and menu pricing, while reasonable, are incommensurate to what you get.

XYaKz0UNJeY0_WkwKRyJgg.text: Great portions, lengthy wait.  Clean and yummy.  Would return.

ak3g4bh4pcZuSK8tkJY9Fg.text: I love the breakfast burrito. I mean its excellent. I get it smothered in pork green chili. Whew!  Today I am getting the also lovely jalapeno biscuts n gravy w/eggs. Never a bad visit. Always @ the last minute

kSPut3qxbT6KNnK_aqDDDw.text: We had build your own omelettes. They were great, not too greasy but fluffy and light.  Their hash browns melt in your mouth yet maintain the crispiness.  They also have delicious jalapeno biscuits those were very good also. Overall one of the better breakfasts I have had.

VGA6oP3jwNfsNl-XlxKPBg.text: Plan on having a long wait... If you're okay with that, "The Bird" omlette with turkey, avocado, and gruyere cheese is oh-so-good! Not a very thorough review... but I only order that dish (don't want to ruin a good thing).

WH3UkwKQAM3ovK44UjN83A.text: The breakfast menu is excellent.  Our group of nine was seated quickly and the service was great.  It's definitely a place I would return to for a brunch date or a special occasion.

iKspBgMKXTp-EZ5KWEDeeQ.text: Ordered the turkey egg benedict. Holendaise sauce was different and very good. Had a little spice to it. Breakfast potatoes were very good. Good service.

yznW3gPdrh1ms-4TjJq3PQ.text: Overrated. Very busy, always a wait to get in. Patio is loud. Food is meh. No soda. Kind of pricey too.

pUq1ax1G1AA_ACMihsihbA.text: Jalapeno biscuits & gravy and huevos rancheros...the bomb.  Me and my boyfriend get this and split it everytime (just 1 biscuit though not the entree) and we are stuffed.  The only thing that drives me crazy is the wait - which really isn't that long, but for some reason I'm always STARVING when i want to eat here so it seems like an eternity.

USqh_6TDq__ycmM2dAzdcw.text: Under normal circumstances, I have this thing where I feel that anyone who is doofy and un-creative enough to name their establishment "The Breakfast Club" doesn't deserve my attention, business, nor opinion. But the line here is so freaking long during the weekends I just had to try it.  The food is good! Servers are attentive and friendly, food and drinks come out at precisely the right moment (not too soon, not too late) and portions are pretty big. Ingredients are fresh and some of the dishes are creative. I've been here twice and have had a crab benedict and a build-your-own omelet (which includes choices of like a billion different veggies/meat and cheeses... i couldn't believe how many cheeses there were written on the board... what is it, ten? twelve? Heaven!) The crab benedict had more crab than I expected... maybe twice as much! Real crab, too, not "krab" although I'm not sure where it came from (obviously a can but prior to that, where did this come from?)  The menu has a LOT of choices. My only drawbacks are the long wait (we have been told "about 40 minutes" and that turned into "about 35 minutes" after the first 40 were up), but this is a breakfast place after all, and while I do expect to wait, I don't like waiting twice. Also, there is no booze here. Granted, I probably don't NEED it... but if I had it, I would not feel that they should drop menu prices by about $1 or $2.

1ssvGCfLeaMIBsT5J25DMA.text: Went there yesterday morning after dropping off my vehicle for service.  The food was great, was seated right away.  Prices are reasonable since it's located in Old Town Scottsdale.  The only downside to the restaurant was the service was pretty horrible.  Might try it again in the future, but as of now, no thanks.

CYZd7iq1_0Kh3mcERtUJbQ.text: This use to be a good place to get breakfast a year ago. The quality of food is cheaper now, but not the price. The french toast was stale with about 5 berries on top, and their omelet had about 12 eggs in it and you had to surf through it to find the other ingredients. The waitress developed her personality from a car crash I think. There are two many other great places in Scottsdale to go for a better price and quality. Don't waste your money.

X69Ciw_GL3VAAaXaGYKCKA.text: This place was nothing short of awesome!! The cinnamon French toast was wonderful & the omelette (we got the wild hog) was huge & delicious! Nicole was a great server. Made great menu suggestion and was very nice! A must-visit place for great breakfast!

8cw8zlyBVfP3JOKkWyGkMw.text: O-M-Goodness! What luck to have eaten here for breakfast!! Huge portions served with fresh fruit slices or mixed berries. Great service and very nice to sit on the porch under the heat towers as it was a cold morning. The only downside was there were so many good things it was hard to choose!

ATxH2AuvIKrdyWbeSr2Oow.text: I came here with five of my girlfriends for our girls weekend. In short I had the best omelette of my life. Got the tuscan omelette and added bacon. Our food was out in literally five minutes after we ordered it. Fresh squeezed OJ and amazing service!

palCpNUKg1ZwAin6lw155g.text: The Breakfast Club was a great choice for eating breakfast on our stay in Arizona. Our party of 6 went in a busy Saturday, but the BC was on top if it's game. The coffee bar was great for while you were waiting for a table. When we ordered and got our food, it was tasty and delicious. Everything was great for breakfast, even the drinks from the bar.   Highly recommend.

lwln20Y19e78B2Pn-nxCVw.text: An okay breakfast spot.  The good news? If you're staying at the W Scottsdale you can walk here, it's only a block away. Oh and the W has no other breakfast options unless you feel like eating at Sushi Roku, yuck.  The bad news? You'll likely have a bit of a wait and as far as breakfast places go, it's not that remarkable. Sure the eggs and bacon were fine, but nothing about this place says: kick ass breakfast.   My friend and I were seated at the communal table. There was another random group of 2 seated at the other end. Two of my other friends tried to join us mid-meal (there were plenty of seats at the communal table) and were denied. The hostess said something about us dominating the communal table, not sure what that was supposed to mean but it sure was annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Four eggs $8
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VR3cmv3jOVsybtB62YgmjA.text: A couple weeks ago my husband and I stopped here for breakfast around 12:30 p.m on a Sunday. They were very busy, but the hosts took our name promptly and in a friendly way let us know that it could be 45 minutes to an hour. We were sat at a table in approximately 35 minutes and greeted quickly. Our waitress was nice and the food arrived in a timely manner. I had the biscuits and gravy and my husband had a caprese salad. Both were absolutely fantastic. The food was fresh, served at appropriate temperatures and seasoned perfectly. Now I understand why they are so busy! The prices are very reasonable as well. This place is a treasure among the Old Town bar scene and we will most certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy and a single chocolate chip pancake from our visit! Delicious

W5kSTPxUeXrGkCa8d-8wzQ.text: So, I've been to this place a couple of times.  It is currently going through a renovation, so things are a little tight around there.  It has not stopped the speed that kitchen works though!  I've been 3 times in recent months, and my food came out very quickly.  I'm giving this place a 3 because I probably will go back, but I was not happy with the way they do the wait list.  It appeared to me that they were discriminating on people based on the descriptions that they wrote down about each party.  I stood there and watched them for a while pick over some parties and then pick others with the same number of guests in the parties.  It was a little weird.  I want to believe that they were not doing that.  So, perhaps I need to get there on teh weekend at 8am or whatever time they open so I don't have to witness that.  Anywhoot, The Whole Hog is my favorite thing on that menu if you want to venture off the beaten path into the artery clogging.  When I have ventured into the high saturated fat realm, I have definitely enjoyed that option!!!

VVj-zASLUmRnFW2jLf5TRA.text: Long wait.  Ordered nutty pancakes,  Spied neighbor's great-looking omelette while waiting for said pancakes.  Tasted the cakes and wished I'd ordered the eggs.  Price-y menu made my mediocre dish even more disappointing.  Felt out of place here with so many well-dressed, salon-bed tanned people. Breakfast is my favorite time of the day, and dining here brought my cheerful mood down fast.

xdh7mQ-3eqrHUeAhxTcmvA.text: I know The Breakfast Club has been here since at least a year or two before I moved from AZ (which was a little over 3 years ago) and I never tried it until this past week when I was in town for the Holidays.  I can remember many a Saturday & Sunday mornings being driven back to Old Town (often times by my mother) to retrieve my car from the night before and always debating on grabbing a hangover breakfast here, but I never did.  Anyways, I came here for lunch and I really liked it.  Apparently this place has had a pretty extensive renovation recently and is quite a bit bigger than it once was.  It was crowded and we had a bit of wait for a table (and this was on a Tuesday).  From what I understand this is often times the case here.  One of the reasons this place never really tickled my fancy is because something about it just always seemed pretentious for whatever reason, but that's not the case at all.  Sure, the decor is nicer than Denny's but it's still pretty comfortable.  Both the the breakfast & lunch menus sounded delicious & hearty.  I was surprised.  The portions were big & there was several options.   I decided to go w/a lunch option (the grilled chicken sandwich), and it was delicious.  It came w/sweet potato fries, which were good.  Between the sandwich and the fries there was quite a bit of food on my plate for only about $8.  Most of the breakfast & lunch items are around &10 and under.    Even though this place isn't pretentious like I thought it would be when I ordered a diet coke our waitress informed me that they only have "natural soda in bottles."  However, I'm giving brownie points because as the waitress was telling me this she rolled her eyes (not at me, but at how ridiculous that is).    Overall, I really enjoyed Breakfast Club and it's a solid breakfast and/or lunch option in Scottsdale.

LNgQIYVUNcjnXUczuzEieQ.text: I can't say enough great things about this place. I've come here 5 times in the last 2 weeks.   The outdoor/indoor set up is really great on a beautiful day.   The staff is fantastic and on top of things.   They give you coffee and bottled water to go!   And the border bowl is by far the best mix of greatness I've ever had. 4 scrambled eggs, peppers, hash browns, sausage, ham, and topped with pork green chili that melts in your mouth.   Oh yeah and I forgot to mention the pancakes. They are literally a little slice of heaven. IHOP be damned.

ROzhcQS9c3LP6HC04t7vJg.text: Fantastic food!  I'm from LA and know my breakfast well and BC is an awesome place for regular american breakfast.  Pancakes, Waffles and French Toast are awesome.  Eggs come out hot and cooked exactly as ordered.  Love the iced t!  Popular place with locals, so you will most likely wait for a table as it is busy.    Wait staff is great, very efficient and nice people there.    NO CRAYONS for kids tho, so just know that when bringing kids.

rB7vH4cu1EWxD7id5DlfSQ.text: I came here twice, but I have to admit that in both times the food and the service were fantastic!   The decor is really modern and fresh, and they have a coffee bar, which I love. You can sit there and order coffee while you wait for your table (if they are busy). Also, the hot regular coffee is to DIE FOR! I am usually picky about coffee but this one really hit the spot.   Both times I ordered the lean & green omelet, which came with a side of fruit and potatoes. I was able to make two changes to my omelette with no problems. Everything in that dish was SO yummy and tasty! The omelette was fabulous, and the potatoes were made with red & green pepper and I loved it!   I'm sad to read some of the other reviews, so I suppose we were lucky to get very nice waitresses both times!   I would love to go back and order some waffles or pancakes. I would totally recommend them.

3_SF81UP097KJ0Te3vm2Ig.text: I think this my favorite breakfast places in Scottsdale so far.  The Bloody Mary was super spicy and pretty dang strong. A little bit pricy though, $10 for a pint glass. I also had an iced Americano that was really good.  So I never order pancakes out because I don't usually like them but I was really in the mood. I got the sweet cream cakes just plain with butter and syrup on the side and seriously I think they're the best pancakes I've ever had. Also the presentation of all the dishes is so lovely it's almost hard to dive in to them!   I have to comment though that the service at the bar wasn't the friendliest I've ever experienced, but really that's the only negative.

7LGDD7XOU6YZrHBn9SDHaA.text: Was not impressed at all. They don't have very many alcoholic beverages and their menu is very boring. I think this place is an overrated Denny's.

dBUwI3LhFaZgKW-uzCzXag.text: Terrible made the mistake of telling them I'm waiting for a friend.. They refused to seat me at a booth or table although they had 75%!of them open.. and pointed the bar area! This was highly unprofessional, needless to say they lost their tip! I won't be coming back!

kW9aY4tOe_4rntkEMuSSRw.text: Love the Bird Omelet and the Turkey Benedict - tasty and flavorful - they are more than amazing! Nice and friendly waitress, cozy environment, plus the breeze - nothing could be better for a family brunch at this place.

OjAKbUNhutBVJBe5j3o_UA.text: The Turkey Bene was amazing! I tasted my friend's Huevos con Masa and ordered that on my return visit. Yum! Everything tastes fresh and flavorful. I especially like the fresh fruit palate cleansers and the bottomless coffee. The service is attentive but even in the middle of a week day, this place can get pretty busy.

AwLcmsPbttW_MxjOBtn7xg.text: Server was unfriendly and just plain rude. My salmon Benedict was okay but nothing special. Only plus was the iced coffee is a lot of bang for your buck. The large is LARGE. We will go to one of the many other breakfast places next time.

mTnmhdUqupS1mWCFO3qZRg.text: Another great breakfast place in Scottsdale.  Very hip and of course they serve a full bar so you can get a screwdriver or whatever you like with breakfast.  The breakfast sandwich was out of this world!   Service was good and I will return and/or recommend.

PwsKL53N1ivH9gTWALqlrA.text: Every time we come to AZ we always come here for breakfast at least once!! We love this place. Best egg sandwich EVER!

63nMsK0_-GH4xX-EZHuJig.text: I was really looking forward to eating here - close walking distance to everything in Old Town Scottsdale and Scottsdale Fashion Square, and always a big crowd - but was a bit disappointed.  With better eggs and service, this place would easily get at least four stars.  Wait: We actually scored a table really quickly, but if we had arrived five minutes later we probably would've had to wait 30 minutes.  Food: My wife got the Quick Start (2 eggs, bacon, toast, and fruit) and I got BC's B&G (jalapeno biscuits and sausage gravy with fontina, 2 eggs, and fruit.  At a breakfast place, making eggs is a huge element and The Breakfast Club failed us here.  Her eggs were undercooked (runny whites) and my eggs were overcooked (almost totally solid yolks when I ordered over-easy).  That aside, everything else was very good.  Covering jalapeno biscuits with eggs, fontina, and gravy was a very interesting combo and (aside from the egg fiasco) tasted very good - rich without being overwhelming.  I'd probably opt to have the eggs on the side or just forego them completely since they weren't really necessary.  What really impressed me was how fresh and sweet the fruit was - especially for March.  Service: While the hostess was nice, the service itself was far from good.  Our waitress seemed new, like a deer in headlights, and the place definitely seemed understaffed.  She came by very infrequently, and actually disappeared when we were ready for a check (maybe she went on a break?).  Fortunately - after waiting for some time - another waitress helped us and brought our check by.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The &#34;Quick Start&#34;
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapeno biscuits &amp; sausage gravy

rFZ4lZGmxRvdMgTwlAUxtg.text: Love this place. Everytime I'm in town this is a must stop. Nice staff & great menu. Lots of healthy options as wel

Q3BI7SHyDItnwKaoAe_zCw.text: Get something with chorizo in it! I had the Wild Hog omelet and it was great. Use Yelp to join the waitlist early, usually a size able wait.

DFnA31J4vpwbr8br8Cq9sw.text: Expect to wait at least twenty minutes or be lucky enough to grab a seat at the bar. Food was great! Amazing flavors

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros were on pointe!
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6LJOjVnU5-KavV_RysUzdw.text: Their food is beautifully plated, generously proportioned, and excellent service.  The pancakes and huevos rancheros were works of art (and tasty)!

nK8mXatufej1TJHQ5IHIRg.text: Eh! Wasn't that impressed. Maybe I set my expectations a little too high for this place. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros, and had mostly lettuce on my plate. Great presentation, but lots of lettuce under my Huevos. No guac and no sour cream, figured that was standard for Huevos Rancheros. Also, my service wasn't great. She seemed hurried and no too engaged with our table. Very bland! Although the food wasn't anything to rave about, with a little more engagement/interest from our waitress, Jessi, this could've made my experience that much better and a 4 star review.   P.s Their Orange juice was fresh and delicious!

jmdWZ6sOak7BnGgNkuN6MQ.text: Wow! Amazing breakfast place so much variety! Love the vibes lots of people and energy yet casual and fun. Enjoyed sitting at the bar if you don't want to wait for a table.   We loved the huevos con masa, the cornbread was delicious. The French toast was some of the best I have ever had! Panacake was good but French toast much better. Orange juice was a little bitter maybe due to season.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!!! So good!!

cKvZ-7rEOJRc3F4NNrldNA.text: Excellent eggs Benedict: the ham was thick, the eggs were perfectly prepared, the hollandaise sauce was buttery without too much garlic or citrus.

ghMUVSO12ymRFRD92Oj3Dw.text: We knew it was going to be good given the fact that it was a 35 minutes wait on a Monday.  Definitely worth the wait.  Seriously the best pancakes I have ever had!  Prices are reasonable and service was excellent!! We also had eggs Benedict and a bagel with lox.  Everything was delicious - we are going back tomorrow!!!

5hNG4ygpYnPYqgGYterTAA.text: Apparently you can't sit and talk without getting kicked out. We got asked to leave right after we paid our bill by the manager. Which was very rude because I didn't even finish my latte.

SKYYrsIr4TFuitQEPazIpA.text: Delicious Sunday brunch and football game what could it be more enjoyable!! Ordered steak & eggs for myself and cobb salad with extra smoked salmon for my girlfriend! grapefruit juice is really refreshing!! really good!! would've given 5 stars if we didn't have to wait 30 mins to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; eggs really good!

c0lH0wTgoiOhiqdkVOgl6Q.text: I really like the feature Of being able to put your name on a wait list. So that when you get there your table is waiting for you. Staff was very friendly and attentive.

ORBSZQg04Jb1T6FD6b016g.text: Went here for the first time on Saturday morning after having driven past it quite a few times and saying "Hey, I should try this place!". It was sort of crowded at 8 am, but we didn't have to wait, we were seated right away.  Service was certainly faster than I had anticipated! Our orders were taken quickly and our food was ready shortly after. I ordered the wild mushroom omelette with no dairy on it, and the server accommodated, confirmed I didn't want any dairy. Unfortunately the main thing, the omelette, was bad. Very disappointing, the four stars are because everything else was amazing! My omelette was drowning in butter. Like disgusting amounts of butter. I specifically asked for no dairy and instead it had like 3 times the butter it needed, not even exaggerating! Luckily the breakfast potatoes were the bomb and the fruit was fresh and delicious. My boyfriend enjoyed his food as well! He had eggs and didn't complain about his being super buttery. So if I come back I just won't get an omelette!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom omelette without cheese

z5dDfnujpDkrXHVBBGd7bw.text: The struggle was real. I came here on a Sunday around 1:00pm, thirsty, hungry and desperate for replenishment from my binge drinking fiasco the night before.  Usually, when I'm hungover food tastes extra amazing, so that doesn't bode well for this place because I left feeling underwhelmed. The omelet was just okay, nothing special, same with the potatoes it came with. I didn't even touch the fruit. 2 small glasses of OJ ran me $8 bucks!   All things considered I've had better omelets at Denny's and at a cheaper price so I probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I&#39;d give this meal a B minus :/

UxKA2UDbCDcaPvwzjlxdkQ.text: I love the Breakfast Club. I go to Spring Training in Scottsdale for a week every year and I eat at the BC every morning. I take a nice long walk along the canal to get my appetite ready (and to stave off those future calories) I am by myself so I sit at the counter. Wait has never been more than a few minutes to get a seat. Some mornings I have the "quick start" (2 eggs/bacon/fruit /toast) The pancakes are wonderful too, The yogurt with fruit and granola is excellent (and healthy!) My downfall is the biscuit with sausage gravy. (I just get the side) it's sinfully good. The wait staff are super fast and remarkably good looking (I am a 70 y.o.female) One waitress in particular (I believe her name is Alex?? No name tag) Beautiful girl and fantastic waitress. My son has joined me one morning (after hiking Camelback) and had the traditional Benedict. He loved it too,

jiu4loaU3mVATgAXiFRSNQ.text: I called ahead to arrange a table since it was Sunday brunch. I was impressed with the text notifications that was very nice!  We arrived and waited for less than 5 minutes to be seated. The service at the front desk was marvelous-the young hosts were cheerful and eager to greet my guests and I. 5 stars to the front desk.  Our server Kelsey asked what we (4 of us) would be drinking - girlfriend answered "water," 1 of my guests answered "water" and before I or my friend could say anything -server walks away. Eventually we get to order drinks when she comes back.  Shortly after, we all order our food. The wait for the food was short! Wonderful. The food comes out- server approaches the table-not to ask if we are enjoying our meal-if everything is delicious-no the server came to the table to bring us our check and ask how we're splitting it. It came across as impolite to all of us. No one asked for the check, so I asked her to take it off the table. We just receive our meals and the serve is already trying to flip the table? It ruined the experience. Server did not inquire at any point if we were enjoying things.  I had ordered the Huevos En Masa but server ordered me Huevos Rancheros instead. I'd never been there so I didn't realize and I ate it. When the check came out was when I saw.  We were visiting from across the country. We wanted to enjoy brunch and the service at the table disappointed each of us. I would come again to give the place another chance - but a very disappointing first time eating there.

_qv_o188xfPaUxzVgRcsXw.text: Innovative dishes attractively presented. Good service despite the crowds. Always eat here when in town. Well worth the usual wait.

mmtpr2zonAT3pjTVdJVsSg.text: Food is good in theory, but when it comes together it is not. The potatoes did not have any flavor what so ever. I ordered the Huevos con Masa AND was excited at first but when the tasted the mix of chorizo with the sweetness of the cornbread it was not that great . I would suggest other places in Scottsdale. Avoid this place

VdZfR524HH7GidE0vTlPkQ.text: We love this place. Service is great! But bring back the regular Tuscan Omelet! The new one is horrible!

Fndn0xJvUFKENA3Y0NRu9g.text: Hands down our favorite breakfast and lunch place.. for one they make all their juices fresh squeezed, their mimosas are very generous and delicious, their breakfast plates always come with a generous layered fresh fruit garnish that most places would sell as an add on. The staff is consistent In keeping you drink re fills  and always offer to give you a to go cup of your beverage.   You would be hard pressed to get a table right away on the weekends but trust me worth the wait. Can't beat the value and quality of food. If I could give them 10 stars I would..

Z8GO_wNmqtZZ09o9IKP2RA.text: Almost 2 hours to wait... one hour wait and one hour wait on your food... I was bored I had other things to do... the food was ok but if you wanna wait two hours of ok food be my guess... honest True

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zXNYdFREsjSlGkZxTS2fQw.text: First time here. I had finished hiking Camelback Mountain and this place came up with a good amount of reviews. I used the yelp app to add myself to the waitlist. I arrived and it was an additional 45 min wait from the time I put myself on the list. Therefore get there any time before 9 am. The wait time went by pretty quick. The best thing about this place was their service once your seated. Our waitress attended my sister and I very quick. I order the lean & green omelette with turkey sausage. Overall it's was decent. It had a ton of veggies which I enjoyed. Portion size was good. Came with potatoes and fruit. The fruit addition was different but I really enjoyed it. Overall it was a 3 for me I felt like the food could have been a little bit better in regards to my omelette. But I would recommend this place so that you can try it out for yourself and make your own decision. Some reviews were iffy but you really don't know until you come here for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lean &amp; Green with some turkey sausage

Pb-vmRL-dartHz5mIC785Q.text: I would literally fly across the country every day to have breakfast here if I could; yes it's that good. Service is efficient and the restaurant is in a great location too.

KJ4Na0yEpZ7fJqbQOCkxZg.text: I was so pleasantly surprised with the Breakfast Club.   I wanted to take my mom to a nice brunch on a Monday...and I thought the Orange Table.  We walked in there and they stopped breakfast at 11, so I knew that I never went to the Breakfast Club before, but thought hey why not.  It was such a windy day when we went and the newspapers were flying everywhere on our table.  But we still enjoyed ourselves.  Service was wonderful; very attentive.   My mom loved her pancakes and I was so thrilled to find french toast made of challah!  (There is no other way to make french toast)  I also had hash browns (wanted the carbs I guess) and they were awesome as well.  The prices were a little bit high for breakfast food, but I have to remember that I am in Old Town Scottsdale.  I would love to go back there anytime. :)

f4rxexpJSMYXQwQj99Tl8w.text: Eggs scrambled with jalapenos! Need I say more! They were spicey hot and I loved them. I had the Belgian Buckwheat waffles and they were cooked to my specs ... crispy on the outside with butter to smother and it was heaven! Coffee was nice. Sun was warming us to a crisp while we waited but it was all worth the wait. You need to go to know!

X-_Vbe2SUqNqISEJEXMiMg.text: People that are giving this place only 2 stars are absolutely insane.  This place has the best service.  I went on a sunday morning...got there and they said it was going to be a 25 minute wait...sat at the bar 1 minute there after and immediately had my order taken.  Food came out in less the 5 minutes.  My boyfriend got the quick start fully loaded for just under $8 and no play on words but it was there quickly and it was indeed fully loaded.  This place really knows how to serve a full portion meal for a great price.  I recommend trying any one of the omelets as well because they are big, fluffy, and full of great ingredients.  Everything on the menu seems to come with fruits and potatoes (which come with the best green, yellow, and red peppers ever).  Try this place out the next time you want a great breakfast in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale.

1-7Pied1r8Iu-yCnAoHM6Q.text: They serve breakfast all day, which is always a plus.    I had the tomato soup with grilled cheese.  The bread was delcious, tasted homemade.  However, there was way too much cheese, and it wasn't fully melted.    My g/f had the eggs benedict, which looked really good.  She said it was really good, and filling.    3 stars.  I've had better.  I've had worse.  La de da.

42vs8d44ILO7W4hTIxXLbQ.text: Came here after a ridiculous hang-over on a Saturday morning. The waitress took very good care of me. The meals are great too. The ambiance is light and cozy for early morning breakfast...and the offerings and pricing is in line as well. Definitely a good spot for breakfast...

L-FVSH-kARm6kjsbxKn2dQ.text: One of the more hip breakfast places around, The Breakfast Club can get crowded on weekends with a sceney bunch.  They have great eggs benedicts - about 5 different types one of which comes with steak instead of ham.    Always had a decent experience here, until recently when the Scottsdale blondie server gal was aloof the entire time and tried to stiff us on the tip.  The bill was $32, we gave her $40 and she tried to avoid coming back to face us - as if we'd leave.  Coincidentally she was within sight in the kitchen flirting with a guy server - giving him some back-scratching action.  We finally caught a busser to flag her down.  NO WAY SISTA...The customer decides what your tip should be - not YOU.  Not going back.

YUtuT4widRQoXTLBU1utyA.text: When a friend called on Saturday morning asking if I wanted to go to brunch, I suggested The Breakfast Club in Old Town since I had been wanting to go there for some time. I'm really glad I suggested it because it was delicious. I arrived around 1 pm (they close at 3 pm) on a gorgeous Saturday, so I wasn't upset when I was told I couldn't be seated until my dining companion joined me. There are chairs outside to sit in while you wait and it was so nice out, I relished the opportunity to bask in the sunshine. When I mentioned my friend had just arrived and was parking her car, the hostess sat me in a cozy booth inside. Definitely make sure everyone in your party is there so you can be seated right away. Our waitress was really nice and helpful and paid just the right amount of attention to us.  I do wish The Breakfast Club had alcohol because a mimosa on a sunny Saturday would have made the day perfect, but alas they do not have alcohol. My friend enjoyed her green iced tea and my black hot tea was fine. My friend had the Nutty Belgian Waffle (she added berries on the recommendation of our waitress), which filled the entire plate and looked quite yummy. I had the four cheese omelet which was divine! None of the four cheeses overpowered the other and when I cut into the omelet, the cheeses were hot and gooey...yum! The potatoes and peppers that came on the side were good and I left feeling contently full.  For our two drinks, two entrees, and a side of bacon, our bill came to $30 before tip which I thought was very reasonable for a breakfast establishment. I can't wait to go back to try some more items, although hopefully next time I can score a table on the patio.

lHvXYHIJdciGyPlNwgiuig.text: I have been going here for years.  One word...consistency!  So now, a few thoughts...  The waitresses:  consistantly revolving door of attractive, young, bright-eyed co-eds (or were co-eds til Financial Aid ran out)--but they can take a deliver an oder  The hostesses:  younger than the waitresses, too dumb to take more than your name, basically flunkee waitresses too pretty to toss to the curb so they have been given a "safe" job  The bussers:  diligent, tidy, always smiling and pretty much the same few guys for the past five years  The barista:  attractive, metro, fast with his hands and with smiles to the aforementioned waitresses, makes a mean BC Coffee (Iced Hazelnut infused coffee)  The patrons (as deliniated by time of year and morning...please read more):  Weekday mornings--business professionals and older retired gents in shorts and polo shirts enjoying morning coffee and the, ahem, view  Weekday lunch--biz pros who didn't eat there for breakfast but work with-in walking distance  Weekend mornings 8-9am--locals who know how good the food is and don't want to wait for it  Weekend mornings 9-10am--sun-burned tourists, especially bad during Spring Training weeks, expect kids so over their parents that their eyes may be permanently stuck in the back of their heads   Weekend mornings 10am on--Snotsdale hipsters, ASU co-eds, Affliction t-shirts, over-sized sunglasses, trucker hats, Coach bags, flip-flops  Okay, so this was more about the atmosphere than the food, which is worth putting up with the above for.  The owner (who I have surmised possibly had a baby with one of the waitresses, but there's really no way to ask for that information along with Tabasco) does what he does exceptionally well.  (PS:  Anyone with insider info on my theory, please offer clarification)  The bacon and sausage is amazing breakfast meaty goodness. Cinnamon Challah French Toast is pure bliss. Anything of the Mexican persuasion, gastronomically speaking, is fantastico. The brewed coffee is unparalleled...seriously.

qd_u0-vI_lXsxImZZtZa_w.text: Was there again this weekend - thought I'd give a shout out because this place is SO good. Haven't been since the remodel, which is amazing. The space is huge now and so warm and inviting. The traditional eggs benedict is to die for as well as their potatoes. Not to mention their fruit. I swear they have a farm out back and pick it fresh. Probably one of the best places for breakfast in AZ.

oe6Bim3fpn_QGtLuTrGwmw.text: Yummy food when you can get it. It's typically packed for brunch - especially on the weekends. Most of the girls that work there are hot and young... that doesn't make them the best waitresses, but they are usually nice.   The atmosphere isn't anything terribly special - it's basically just the place to go to be seen and people watch. It's full of the same douchebags and plastics that went out the night before - they still look like their hair gel and guyliner is holding up and their designer shirt maybe has one or two extra wrinkles. The ladies seldom look like they left the house unshowered or without makeup. Mostly pretty people anyway... I always feel like a disgusting mess when I'm there because I just roll out of bed and go dirty.  The food is fairly delicious, but I think it's pretty difficult to fuck up breakfast. It's not excessively greasy though which is nice... There are many breakfast favorites that serve greasy meals. Their standard eggs, bacon, fruit, bread, and hashbrowns is very light as well as filling. Their omlettes are slightly above average.   It can also be rather inexpensive here which is nice for the $30,000/year millionaires. It can also be fairly pricey depending on what you get... it's the drinks - that's where they get you. They are priced like mixed drinks, but it's just orange juice or coffee.   The problems with this place are that it's tough to find a seat, you have to keep your appetite while eating around douchers, and there are half a dozen other breakfast places within a few miles of it that are as good if not better. I do like this place though and I'll continue to go... food is 4 stars, ambience is 3, service is 3.5... this place really gets a 3 and a half. Go check it out.

dphUqOQbniZOFEd9XNgoUw.text: Old Town staple for breakfast...always busy, always a short wait (but with bar stools at the counter often), but well worth it. Large plates with decent-sized portions, potatoes O'brien are great addition to each item, and the fresh fruit is a refereshing change from standard breakfast fruit portions, large and full of watermelon, canteloupe, and pineapple. My personal favorite is the The Bird Omelette. Great food, service is normally decent, but not great, but always left Breakfast Club satisfied.

rIFpNy26vX3d3iYibOD-Qw.text: I was all set to order after downloading the menu two days before we went, then when we arrive on Sunday late morning, things went awry....First of all the homemade tomato soup is not exactly home made in that they use canned tomatoes for the soup which means it is filled with nickel, metal, lead and bpa...so I could not have the tomato soup as they were not able to use any fresh tomatoes for the soup, not exactly sure if they use canned tomatoes for the omelettes but this is what the waitress eluded to...Also they do not know what the ingredients is in lots of their products especially the bread since they do not make it, it is delivered from a vendor and there is no ingredient list...Very Very Bad service on their part, they should always know what the ingredients is for everything they serve especially for folks who may have allergies....The other people in our party got the build your own omelette which was very expensive, they did not have a veggie omelette on the menu you have to build your own...so the omelettes ended up being over $12.00 since they charge .75 cents to $2.50 for extra items...The orange juice is also very expensive 4.00 for what look like a 6oz glass and $7.00 for what looked like a 12 oz glass. Plus it was very very noisy, we literally had to yell at each other to hear ourselves plus ...Just the fact they did not know what the ingredients was in their bread, and many of their ingredients come pre-packaged not made from scratch....is not good....there are better places in old town,,,which have organic food offerings and they know what they are serving, unlike the breakfast club.......If you have food allergies avoid this place!!!

_fBDgGfsK7gHL1HVAt8X7A.text: Breakfast Club is a staple in every trip I make out to Scottsdale. I've tried a lot of different things on the menu and I've never been disappointed. Their portions are big, their prices are not bad for a trendy brunch restaurant, and their staff is friendly.   A few of my favorites:  *The Bird omelet: I don't get the cheese or mushrooms, you don't need it since the avocado makes it really creamy  *Turkey Benedict: a fun twist, and their turkey is like Thanksgiving turkey...delicious  *Jalapeno Biscuits & Sausage Gravy: a little kick and ends up solidifying in your stomach...in a good way  *Breakfast Burrito: PLEASE try it with the chorizo queso on top...it might have changed my life  *Bagel & Lox: really fresh and just the right amount of salty   Things I don't love (and there are just a few):  *The wait can be a biatch, especially if it's really hot outside (there are only so many shaded areas to stand)  *The coffee bar is nice because you don't have to wait until seated to get a caffeine fix, however the wait is long, the space is cramped, and it's pricey  *Their Potatoes O'Brien are delicious but have way more bell peppers than actual potatoes, and it's a pretty small serving  *The crowd can be a bit obnoxious, but it's part of the fun of the whole experience...it's fun to judge others over a yummy brunch

kjm36pP3SMxSx0Z5ZX0g9A.text: They had me at fresh squeezed pineapple juice.  We were in Scottsdale for spring training and came here on the advice of a friend.  Thank you, friend!  We enjoyed our meal so much we came back the following day.  Again, fresh squeezed pineapple juice, heavenly.

aAIqXagNAI0ay8wtnnJUog.text: After wandering around Saturday morning trying to get a feel for the city, my boyfriend and I made it over to the breakfast spot he'd been raving about all week.  The atmosphere was nice and the wait staff was friendly.  I decided to order the omelet with crab.  I'm usually very cautious about doing so in places that are not near the water (I'm from Baltimore after all) and it was surprisingly good and as was the fruit and potatoes.  My boyfriend who is self described as a tea snob loved that our looseleaf tea was served in a metal tea pot, which I seriously considered taking with us because it was so cool.    On the downside, we did feel a little out of place given we had so many curious stares from customers, but I'll chalk it up to us being clearly not from around here.    I'd definitely recommend this place to others and would probably visit every so often if I lived here.  I do really love the healthy options on menu and will plan to give it a try again.

suG3qjRsOd4xlIn-tixgaw.text: I had the best Huevos Rancheros ever this morning. Green chile pork with black beans, onion, tomatoes, etc all over scrambled eggs. AWESOME.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros

Mks_judQQltD7WLmFCTkkA.text: The decor is nice. Open and spacious.   Ordered the egg Benedict and 2 bacon egg toast breakfast. Maybe I was  expecting too much. Not the best. The hollandaise sauce was mediocre at best.  The service was lacking. Place was half empty since we went during "off hours" yet our waitress managed to ignore us.   The two stars are for the decor and location.

eEl-hd797sO93CS0A0FvJQ.text: Decided to go out for an early Sunday Breakfast, and at the recommendation of a friend chose The Breakfast Club, located in Old Town Scottsdale.  The setting was casual, with a great atmosphere. There was available seating either outdoors or inside. I ordered the steak and eggs, and just as told, the meal was awesome. The steak, was tender, and made just as ordered, alone with the side items, potatoes, etc.  In addition the staff was very attentive, from the hostest, to the servers. This is one resturant that I truly would visit again if in the area.

v_tlWMzKdpLz2iPFOq_91w.text: Good food and freindly staff. They have a nice selection on the menu. After seeing the table next to me I wish I'd of had the house specialty....blueberry pancakes. Next time........

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Y1eYejzXcYmStDJGyZDvRA.text: Stopped by this morning for eggs Benedict. Best I've had. Everything about my experience was excellent. Service food quality were all without complaint.

JceJfG8HENjUblgonOWClw.text: Not bad. I thought the cinnamon challah French toast was good - big portion covered in fresh berries and nuts. Jalapeno biscuit was pretty good. I would skip the chipotle cornbread. Hash browns had a nice mix of bell peppers and onions, which I liked.  Food was pretty good, not wow. I don't know if I'd make a special trip to eat here, but if I was in the area and the wait wasn't too bad, I wouldn't object.

Tc34iFsy01BU0GCaZG8eRw.text: Meh. My friend i was visiting in Scottsdale may have ruined it for me because she talked this place up, way too high! I was just expecting to be wowed, and i was definitely not:( I was how ever impressed with how fast the service was and how quickly our food came out but it was bland bland bland. I played it safe and went with a break fast sandwich and a side of fruit. Fruit, A-ok. Sandwich, dry english muffin, over cooked egg (i wasn't even asked how i wanted it) A LOT of cheese, which is great because i love cheese more than anything - but even i thought it was a little over kill. I can't even remember if there was meat on the sandwich now that i think about it. I'm sure there was, but like i said - not wowed, i could have made that myself at home and it probably would have tasted a hellova lot better. :-/   Fast service. Easy menu....

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Sandwich

TC1qolSxIwYJR4Ol2dWu9Q.text: Nice place in Old Town Scottsdale, I think "trendy" is the word. A friend of mine and her husband have a condo near this restaurant and a recent Saturday morning was the first visit for both of us. There's a bit of a wait but apparently you can call ahead to get your name on the list, something that shortened our wait considerably. Our coffee and fresh squeezed orange and grapefruit juices came very quickly and were a great start. I'm an Eggs Benedict fan and wasn't in a particularly adventurous mood so the Traditional Bene was perfect, with the hollandaise not too bland or too sour like some places. My friend also raved about her Quick Start Conscious breakfast. The waitress was efficient but not obtrusive. I'd definitely eat here again and am planning on trying one of the Southwestern specialties next time.

s7fml7XY50Wy5pfK6aJq_w.text: I don't like breakfast. I don't really like brunch. But Breakfast Club and a few other breakfast joints around the US are on my exceptions list; if I have a guest visiting over Saturday, I make it a point to each brunch with them here.  First off, the food is great. It's really good. The steak is always done well, the waffles slightly sweet, the fruit fresh, the ingredients, awesome. I've had most of their menu and I can honestly say, it's all good. Some better than others, but all are good. If it's your first time visiting, go with the Cinnamon Challah French Toast (the fruit is so delicious) and their Mignon Benedict Style Eggs. If you can and are willing, go for their fresh juice, a treat. Also try the Mimosa. One of the reasons I'm a fan of this place, is the ingredients are very fresh and they don't saturate everything with tons of baking soda and powder. I can taste these things, and they don't use a ton of it.  The staff isn't always nice, sometimes rude; however, I'm ok with this, as all I want is for them to come when I signal and to keep my water glass filled at all time (which if you're unlucky you might end up with someone who can't do that).  Still, I'm a fan. I'm not a fan of breakfast and brunch, but for this place, I can atleast leave feeling like I've eaten something that doesn't give me a headache. For breakfast, I'm a fan.

UlId1hRP_-gdoMDvbi8olw.text: Love this place, short wait on a Sunday. .friendly staff and great food! Not to mention they have mimosas! I came here a while back and they seemed tight and cramped for brunch...now I can tell they've done a renovation that really opens everything up and accommodates more. Well done BC!

cSMg-B3s7SuSI450xfwd7g.text: Good place to grab breakie in Scottsdale. I had the traditional Benedict and it was quite tasty. Service was fast and friendly and the wait wasn't bad at all. We grabbed a latte from the coffee bar and sat inside for a few minutes before they had a patio table ready for us. If I return I'll try to Cinnamon Challah French Toast.

2mBXtahnw1VJES-IM5SB-A.text: Really good spot for breakfast in Scottsdale. Great service and great breakfast. Nothing fancy here, just solid food. Omelets are really good and pretty large. I love that you can find really fresh and healthy options here.   The place gets really crowded on the weekends so make sure you get there early. If you're by yourself, just sit at the bar and you'll be well taken care of.

FSta1llGzE_evjKDpCzHKw.text: Nice bright lively place service was fast and friendly. However , the food was rushed omelette was good sized but veggies inside were cold and omelette under cooked. Order was wrong and coffee cold not a good performance for a usually solid place

7YAavT5L1HtIuaB8-ZBNvQ.text: if you don't know, you better ask somebodayyy!  BEST brunch ever! the steak &eggs is freaking delicious! The plate comes with fresh fruit, toast and obrien potatoes (BOMB). My friends ordered the buckwheat pancakes and LOVED them. The service is awesome too.   fyi... On weekends, prepare to wait at least half an hr before being seated. This place is packed! Parking is okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. steak &amp;eggs. (=

9lRu5cnZoCaMOMJpdDeDuQ.text: Waited 25 mins. Ok , got text table was ready. Two guys walked in ahead of us... Friends with everyone, they got our table and sadly we had to wait until they got another table ready. Ok. Then ordered decaf coffee. Not even room temp. :(  omelet with meat ... Didn't order it well done and slightly burnt.. Hold the meat. Let's just say I will be returning to the Daily Dose down the street. Not sure why we even decided why to try something new. Grass is not greener on the other side!!!! Lesson learned

dghYVSvUqv4b0Rd3hvz9ig.text: First of all, my best friend and I came here on Sunday when there were floods in Scottsdale so we thought, "holy hell we have to eat outside."   The wait was about 20 minutes, but very worth it. I had to use the process of elimination to choose my breakfast because all the options were to freakin' die for. I decided the get "The Bird" which is an omelet with Turkey, avocado, mushrooms and Boursin cheese. The plate also came with delicious potatoes and fresh fruit. The portions were huuuuge so I'm glad I didn't cave and get the side of pancakes too. Ouch, that would've been painful.   Overall, the service was great, the food was greater and the stormy weather made it all so much better. This is definitely a place to try at least once!

DHc9aL0pKRUXqgkHY-mccg.text: We had a great breakfast at the Breakfast Club. We had several in our party with specific dietary needs and the staff was most accommodating and helped us make the necessary adjustments ... the meals were delicious.  Our only complaint was the noise level of the traffic for the outside seating. We'd've tried inside but it was too warm in there and the traffic was the lesser of two evils

jgyh7pFp2rjOjFeonADyNw.text: I love this place. I have been going here for years now. They changed the interior which is more inviting and open. The bar makes it a great place to watch tv and the outside patio is looking into old town. Very bright and welcoming hosts I recommend this for your breakfast place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frozen mocha
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start loaded

Acq3VmHbcPYgXC5fuFaRQA.text: Decent food but horrible owner. I ordered a Diet coke. "We don't serve diet coke, the owner doesn't believe in it"  Doesn't believe it in? Diet soda is not the fricking Easter Bunny Diet soda is not the Lock Ness Monster. Is is a GD soft drink!!  "Why not?" I ask. "The owner hates fake sugar and refuses to support it" Says the server  " What about all this fake sugar on the table for our coffee? Every table has a bowl of sweetener on the table?!?!!" says me.  "Oh, that is for the coffee. He says it would upset too many people if we took it away. But you can go next door, and buy a diet there, then bring it over here if you like"  WTF?!?! Sure I'll go over there, next door every time I want a refill  So this guy takes his stand with diet soda? Does he have any clue what is in regular soda?!?! Hell, diet or anything else, it is all bad for you. But I want a diet and the owner won't serve it  Way to take a stance on such an important issue genius..  Never again will I support this restaurant.. Lame

zkOCFkJ8t-6S7HCTalC7zw.text: This is by far one of the best breakfast joints in Scottsdale. They've remodeled and expanded so the space is huge and there's less wait even on a Saturday or Sunday. They have a delish assortment of breakfast, brunchy and lunchy items. I love their french toast with challah bread. They also make an incredible grilled cheese. Only complaint: the tomato soup leaves something to be desired, it's over-peppered and hard to eat.  The service is always great and the staff is extremely peppy and professional. Naomi Garnice gives it four stars!

ilQgFb8WHO1PQKpsYDE8lw.text: Great, go-to brunch spot. I've been here several times. Maybe it's because my boyfriend and I get up so late on the weekend that we never have to wait for a table?   I've tried several things on the menu that are meat free-some better than others. Love their omelettes! Yum. The Bello Bene is so-so, I'm a huge fan of portabella mushrooms but I think it was the Bourdelaise sauce that threw me off. I've ordered the quick start breakfast as well, and the only thing that irks me is getting charged extra to sub out the meat for potatoes. WTH?   I like that they have a coffee bar, an option that I have not yet taken advantage of-due to it being far too much work to think of a fancy coffee drink I would like when I'm not fully awake.   Service wise, I've never had an issue. The waitstaff is always friendly and I've never waited a really long time for food.   Overall, it's a great place to grab standard breakfast fare and I predict many more visits to BC in my future.

nFjAIzWWBwB3U632yz039w.text: I'm a fan. As long as the good servers are working and the restaurant isn't packed, they do a great job. The food is always great and their coffee is awesome!

kAjoIiHg-rCTIG3B_V4GgA.text: My boyfriend is from Indiana and always gets biscuits and sausage gravy, which I had never even heard of before meeting him and am still kind of grossed out by. However, Breakfast Club's take on it (jalapeno, large chunks of real sausage instead of the bottom of the barrel gritty bits that it's usually made of) was actually good.    I had a standard 2 eggs and toast and it was as good as I'd expect 2 eggs and toast to be.  The waitresses were all wearing yoga pants, which was kind of awesome - I'm jealous that I can't wear yoga pants to work!

d4KWhlODXcQX3EsZKWbXEQ.text: Excellent breakfast. A little too posh for my taste and just a tad bit $$ for French toast but excellent quality and service.

4Id88kYVQBBB7p2I-0YiFg.text: Great breakfast. I have allergies and they accommodated me perfectly.   I went at a later time because of the comments saying they are busy (~1pm). It was a good idea, only waited a few minutes for a table.

0b4Xp993nNgLL7PXreNYYA.text: Quick and easy breakfast place.  Good food and a great value too!  Would recommended!  Outdoor seating with water misters! +++

kw2w093daQwjmSnJ0NC_Og.text: We used the waitlist and as soon as we arrived, we were seated. Great service and awesome food! The staff were very friendly and upbeat. It's always nice to go to a restaurant where the staff seems to enjoy their place of employment. No complains - just pure satisfaction!

TKfRT7b1BmUoG1wWmYIrVg.text: This is my first time here. My boyfriend has been here before and decided to bring me. I had the egg white omelette with spinach and veggies, wedge potatoes and fresh fruit. I really liked that the omelette had some size to it. (I have found that sometimes restaurants skimp on the egg whites) I was able to replace the Swiss cheese  with cottage cheese  with no additional charge. The potatoes were nicely browned and were not greasy and the fruit was sweet and tasty. My boyfriend ordered a pancake and said it was the best he's had in quite a while. (Too bad they don't have a gluten free one) I liked the atmosphere. They have a nice patio, which will be nice when it cools off. It is very clean and spacious. The wait staff was friendly and accommodating. I'm sure I will return.

qg0QjEmWDcytv35WSgTr0w.text: Awesome breakfast spot! Try the Bloody Mary it was absolutely delicious! Food was great and service was good. I would definitely go back!

LurBFBUOjYunP_bIjP51Hw.text: Came here for breakfast on a weekday.  They have sidewalk tables outside as well as indoor dining.  Our server gave us good service.  She kept checking our levels if coffee in our cups.  Our food cane to the table quickly.  My husband had a type of Mexican breakfast bowl with a blend of potatoes, eggs, shredded meat with cheese.  He loved it.  I had a egg white dish with yummy veggies and potatoes.  The plate portions were generous.  Great way to start our morning with a happy tummy.

ueTI9UPViwh5MFyunUjWaA.text: There's a lot better breakfast places out in Scottsdale. This is a nice location and to walk around old town and have a decent brunch. It's nothing that special and is over priced for the quality of the food.

1mYqbocV05LBsjhs6KpygA.text: I've been to the Cityscape Breakfast Club a couple times, but this was my first time at the Scottsdale location. I must say, I do like this location and the Breakfast Club as a whole but I do prefer their other location. This one is much louder and has more of a cafe vibe to it and is more open. It is also quite a bit more loud, seeing as you are right next to the road. Other than that, it's very nice! The wait was not too bad for 2 people in June, about 10 minutes. We had the nuts and berries waffle, eggs Benedict, and Lox and Cream cheese. The waffle was light and fluffy and had delicious, ripe berries as well as candied nuts. My partner said that the eggs Benedict was alright, but nit his favorite. He much preferred the Lox and Cream cheese and I have to say I agree. The salmon is very nice, it has a light smoky flavor that is perfect on a bagel with cream cheese and capers. Our waitress was very courteous and the rest of the wait staff was helpful, and ready to clear plates. Overall, I was satisfied with my experience here and would recommend it. But if you are able to, get yourself on the wait list as this is one of the most popular brunch spots in the Valley!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PAGw5x4tD37j3FkIFfmQ_Q.text: Loved brunch here! I went on the Monday before 4th of July. It was packed but we sat at the bar and didn't have to wait at all. The eggs Benedict was delicious and the serving size was perfectly filling. I loved the atmosphere and the customer service was excellent!

vJh8tFvWS4jFbspDKlaPiQ.text: Excellent!   Great food and atmosphere.  A must if you are in Scottsdale and enjoy a hearty breakfast.

rSmQk0yqN8g9QcADWsla7A.text: Very good good, loved the beet salad, so fresh and loaded with bursts of citrus. Loved the yogurt and berry plate.

m1-TF3bThiw7u9ISub_aTw.text: Great service and the management is very nice. This place was busy as usual but they are so pleasant and worth the wait!  I guess I did not think they would be as busy on this holiday but you know the food is good.  The waitress and staff are all very nice and accommodating with dietary needs.  Definitely will be back!!

cr4LuRtk_b1sE3m7nTRk4g.text: This place has amazing food! The French Toast is my favorite. The wait time is worth it!

SX1mvmydOVCZfSr4YxWj7A.text: Delicious breakfast in a great location!  Amazing mimosas and waffles!  Highly recommend

NNBQABqTBsxJCJfXAN3Z0w.text: SO good. If you have ever driven by here, pretty much any day in the morning, you can see that there's a huge line. You can mark your place in line on the Yelp app, so that helps to eliminate waiting outside for a while. The food here is so good. I got the turkey wrap & my boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich. Everything was amazing. The mimosas are also super good.

_NmJuVWBDY9qjhoSK2ua8A.text: 2/12/2018 1000. Two colleagues and I met this morning for a working breakfast at this restaurant. We waited for our table for 15 minutes, which was not unreasonable. When our table became available,the hostess refused to seat us, (our colleague was parking), until "she walked through the door." There were people seated in our stead, that had arrived after us.  It was too late to change this site, as we all had driven from different valley hospitals. Our colleague arrived momentarily and then we were seated. Our waitress was sweet and attentive. The food was not anything out of the ordinary, but that was not the focus of the breakfast. As we sat discussing work issues after our breakfast, a woman arrived and offered us a glass of water or ice tea for our departure. I thought , "What great customer service!"  This woman was the manager.  It was not customer service at all. The manager was "kicking us out" of the restaurant! She said there was a "90 minute time limit for having your meal with ample time for conversation."  I asked if this policy was displayed on the menu or anywhere and she said it was not.  She explained she wanted to give "everyone an opportunity to eat at this restaurant that was waiting to be seated".   In my entire life, at breakfast, lunch or dinner, have I, or my colleagues ever been asked to leave a table until we were ready to depart!!!   This is a shameful display of unprofessionalism.  Can you imagine this scenario in other place of business?  A hospital? Dentist? Dealership? I could go on and on!!!  Well, to the Breakfast Club, we are giving you our seats. We will NEVER set foot in your restaurant again. I will be glad to share my experience in the future with anyone asking my opinion.  Leadership should lead by example....   Shame on you!

LOJ8OhN7ZLry5zDDMHVtWg.text: Decent place to have breakfast. We had a great breakfast this morning. Prices are cheap with fast services. I had a Quickstart on the menu, beautiful dish with everything I need for my first meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4P2L-v35pBTeVcIk9XDGGw.text: I love everything bagels.  When the waitress said I could substitute over the English muffin......heaven.  Lots of egg bacon cheese and horseradish goodness.

nD6KdYG1FjreV-kuB1XZZQ.text: It was my first time here and I must say it was a good one. I checked in via the Yelp app (A MUST DO) got there right when it was time to be seated. Ordered our food and we got our food within 15mins of ordering it. The food was great and the service was splendid. Specially with how busy it gets on a Saturday morning. Will go again!

nxY3Q5Llo-E0XTpH6YbmNQ.text: This is a great place for breakfast. It's very busy so I love that they used a text to notify you and that you can see your place in line. They service was good and fast. The food was yummy.

CPZFzPW2VNqdzHnAgeeCRg.text: Great make up spot if your girlfriend is upset cause you ate breakfast without her and now refuses to pick a location. Signature French toast is delicious but not big enough to share to with your selfish boyfriend, maybe just a bite. Order the avocado toast, it'll make you smile. Price is low enough to consider paying for the meal for both, BUT boyfriend must pay if he wants forgiveness. PRO Tip: Don't eat without your girlfriend.

vdke3oTRvn2ZxYRuwPzuvg.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal and this place does not disappoint. Had the green goddess frittata and it was amazing. My waitress, I wish I knew her name, was over the top amazing. If you love breakfast or a great lunch salad this is your place.

oo9C8rDnxYyco6mNkzKgWw.text: This is my favorite breakfast in all of Scottsdale.  There are so many seating options from at the bar, to a round booth, a booth against the wall or outside.  You can even check in on Yelp prior to arriving to get a better waiting position for a table and they will text you when it is ready.  The mimosa's and bloody Mary's are amazing.  They actually use fresh orange juice too!  There isn't a bad breakfast on the menu.  I did the steak and eggs and it was perfectly delicious.  My wife did the eggs Benedict and she loved it.  The vibe here is excellent and the place is always filled with a fun group of people.  The service is always done with a smile and a sense of urgency.  They really do care about your experience.  You must go to this place!!!  Cheers!

ElobqHAkbsoNmF3I3_ZhqQ.text: Loved this place .... been 3 times now Jamie was our waitress both times excellent service each time. Food & Drinks where great. Fresh Squeezed orange juice!!!

sYfOKWWBy0GM_pczxx3vEQ.text: A brunch spot that lives up to its name! I had the eggs Benedict and it was delicious. It's a very popular spot with long wait times so I suggest you call in advance. We were a party of two and got to skip the line by sitting at the bar. It is, however, first come first serve. Friendly service & delicious food. Highly recommend.

olQ6s_PeWTK3W8O5oIGXWA.text: Welcoming and friendly service is probably part of the reason this place is highly rated!  Amazing portions and taste! Glad we stopped in for breakfast!   Orders: -White chocolate mocha latte has a unique flavor.  Salmon lox bene is filling. Salmon fresh. Fresh fruit and soft to cut through. -French toast in slices for the kids. Super fluffy. For the light stomach- order in slices or get the full order.  -Lean & green omelette with goat cheese.  Full coffee bar! They offer all the speciality drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast in slices
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Lox Bene
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lean green omelet with goat cheese

rN1OdiSUtE7o8To6HyJefQ.text: I ordered the Monte Cristo and let me tell you that it was HEAVEN in every bite!!! The French toast kinda tasted like a doughnut it was an explosion of yum deliciousness and a light side of cinnamon. AMAZiNG!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2XW000W9V_6GNAMibtcJ8g.text: Hardy breakfast. I get the quick start loaded but sub the breakfast potatoes for hash browns- a side of avocado really takes your breakfast to the next level. Ask for hot sauce. You think I'm full? I'm not. Get a waffle on the side to share with the table. It's literally the best tasting waffle I've ever had. And I've had a lot of waffles. Add strawberries, you won't be sorry. Beverages: tea is good (I'm a ice tea drinker so I know) mimosa is better. Fresh OJ. Average Scottsdale prices. Everything I just mentioned minus the mimosa and splitting with waffle with one person was $24 including tip. Only negative is the inside is always loud on those mornings when your nursing a hang over and outside is a lil hot. They really need to work on that. Jk they can't control the climate.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffle of champions
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quick start loaded sub with hash browns and add avocado

INH85dyvwEzmWLdNcs56oQ.text: Every time my parents come in from out of town, they are always wanting to go here for breakfast. This place does get busy very early in the morning. The wait for a table isn't bad, sometimes it goes by quick where as other times it does not. At the end it is worth the wait.   Every time I go here I get the bagel and lox here, it it is very tasty. In addition, the food does come out at a timely matter.  The service is very quick and on top of their game. They are always refilling your water/Coffee or whatever drink you got.

VLW1TdGGX-4sI-J4gtIvbA.text: On vacay!  Cool spot, great food and good customer service. I had the lean green omelette that was cooked just right and tasty mimosa. And the crowd was friendly

9YyURiTg6ILDkU7OR5AUTQ.text: We went to this location on a Friday morning, very busy, but worth the wait. The food was exceptionally satisfying and I should've gotten seconds. I ordered their Border Bowl with a side of pancakes. Had the hot sauce placed on the side. This order was the perfect combination! Can't wait to visit this location again, hopefully it's not such a long wait next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gyoywhYawCVKtHfH3tHhyg.text: Even though the name will cause you to play the iconic theme music in your head, make no mistake, this place is far from being saturday detention!  The  coffee wasn't amazing, but the food was definitely enjoyable. Maile was extremely kind and incredibly attentive. The restaurant is full of light but the outdoor seating is highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View of outdoor seating
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 order of French toast

P-NwXUtDAFNb9WLhPSFJYQ.text: Food was good, but the ability to put your name of the list ahead of time made this a good place for sunday brunch.

mgusS37RotvOfrBLtBh9Lg.text: Nothing really special about this place. Long wait lines and the food is just meh! I guess it's close to hotels so it guess that's the draw. We split an omelette that was supposed to be 3 eggs. They must use very small eggs because the omelette was small. We had to order toast because, no, that's extra! Really? Wow! The potatoes were supposed to have bell peppers in them which I couldn't find at all. Frankly this place was a huge disappointment. Maybe we hit it in a bad day? Perhaps but I won't be running back there any time soon.

lz83IqR-Ovg0DYC9Qa8OTA.text: The best breakfast in Arizona! Food is delicious. The waffle is something from heaven.  We've been at least 4 times trying something new every time. I'm keto and they will adjust accordingly. Today I found out one of the chef's is also keto. They even have Bulletproof coffee! Woot!  Now about the service; Perfect! These are some of us happiest people I have ever experienced. From the hostesses, to the waitresses, to the bus staff, everyone was amazing!

1xBIC7nsu7vcldZ4IWkuTA.text: Very trending spot.  Me and my wife decided to add this place to our collection of "We've been there"  Our list is quite long.  Service was excellent, food was very good and there was tons of it.  I'm a fairly good size guy and I barely put a dent in mine. I had the chicken fried chicken.  Very tasty.  All in all our experience was very positive.  Except for the leggings that the waitresses wear.  Very distracting and do not leave much for the imagination.  I know it's the new trend but it makes it very hard for men to concentrate.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PR750sri-AJbXMxql3m2eA.text: I've come here multiple times and always enjoy the quality of service and food. Today was no different! We waited for only 15 minutes, which on a Saturday is amazing! We were sat outside on the patio and quickly greeted by our server. She was very attentive and her whole demeanor was very easy going and friendly. I got a regular eggs Benedict which was awesome!  The only thing was that when I went to the restroom a bird came by and started picking at my food. When I came back the server apologized and was very nice. The bird issue isn't something that the restaurant can control, but a piece of advice would be to have shades on the patio area so the bird won't have as easy of access swooping in.

0VHeHZGxyA3Q75xTUX-a8w.text: Amazing OJ - freshly squeezed. I first ordered a mimosa and then had to order just OJ because it was so good. I got the lean and green omelette, it was good but needed something to elevate it. I like a little kick so even some red pepper flakes would have taken it to the next level. My husband had the Border Bowl and it was full of flavor, every bite a little different. I think it became his go to dish. The Huevos Con Masa has a lot of flavor but had only one texture, it could have used some crunch.   All the juices are fresh, the salty dog with fresh Grapefruit juice was perfectly balanced. Coffee was good. There is typically a long wait, you can put your name on the list via Yelp or in person. If you find yourself waiting you can order a drink (coffee, juice, mimosa, etc) and enjoy while you wait.

-IIVyjOSDgJX3fGKDUGRmw.text: We had a fine brunch but it was nothing to write home about. We will not be back to have breakfast or brunch here. It was nice to have some vegan options though! Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uyIaagSujWxiK3pi59n_Gg.text: The wait is long on the weekends. But worth it! Love this place. The food is always great. Good service. And something for everyone!

FtaIt5R0Q3nEicLiiKRPqQ.text: If you love breakfast, but hate fighting for a parking spot, then I say, my friend, fight the good fight. The food is worth it. I was skeptical, at first, and uncertain as to whether the food would be worth the hassle. My turkey eggs benedict with avocado: delicious. Yes, yes, and yes!

83zNsn9G51nePG7jeJcZsA.text: Go to breakfast spot in Scottsdale. Only reason not 5 stars is because their vegetarian options are pretty low. Otherwise service and food is always spot on

-MrPXbicOvXbxPtheaYbYw.text: I am an 'usual' at the BC going probably 2-3 times/week. Food is great but what makes this place special is the staff Went a couple of days ago with my 80 yo mum who's visiting from Europe and EVERYONE was so nice to her! She speak no english and still pretty much everyone stopped to say hi and introduce her/himself You guys are really really the best

X43JEuVx81fRrqsVgKcnqg.text: We really enjoyed our breakfast. Service was great and food was very good. We will be back.

Mh5G2yE-aR54szMmp7UBZA.text: Coffee and menu pricing is very reasonable. Ate here two years ago, and the bar and alcoholic brunch drinks are amazing. My Cali Benedict was super sad. My bread was over toasted and it made it hard to cut into. Other than that the flavor and everything was cooked well. The potatoes were bland but the bell peppers with my hash were seasoned and cooked well.  My friend and her fiance shared pancakes which were so good! The biscuits and gravy were way better than my eggs Benedict. They make there gravy with sausage and it was very tasty. Since the last time I've been here it was ok.
