photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IrXhOgNg6iVbs8gKt7bKbw.text: Great location, quick service and great food. Varied menu with lots of healthy options. The only thing better than the food was the service which was superb. Highly recommend and would return

UfS8Qa-TIl_8NQ0CLZpUGA.text: Food was great! Service was top notch. A bit on the pricey side - but worth it! Many options for all hunger levels!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whole Hog
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tinga Chicken

SK90nyzC4cLRJBhZfOAQMQ.text: I have been going to the Breakfast Club for years and it has pretty much always been the same. Always busy, higher priced breakfast items, subpar service and a lot of hungover and boozy patrons. I used to like it a lot more before they rebranded. Seems a little more like a club atmosphere on the weekends. Arrive early to get a seat!   The last time I visited I got the lox and cream cheese plate which was pretty good. Just what I had expected and was in the mood for that morning. My husband got the Huevos Rancheros and it was tasty but wayyyy to heavy on the beans.   There are other places I would choose over The Breakfast Club, but they must be doing something right to be as busy as they are!

F0aOK9Yv5ppwfJDn4GVBuQ.text: This is probably one of my favorite places to get breakfast/brunch at. The portions are big and you get a great deal for the price. Not many places include fruit with your meal. I had the ham and eggs which includes two slices of ham, your choice of eggs, potatoes O'Brien and your choice of toast. I had two slices of toast, but it is not shown in this picture because they forgot to give the toast. I had to ask about the toast and I asked it to go because by the time I asked about it, I was already halfway through out the meal, so I had it to go. The toast was really good. I got sourdough and one toast was really chewy and the other toast was on the toastier side as it was really crunchy. I am more a fan of chewy toast. I went here at 1pm an hour before closing. I did not have to wait at all and was seated right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Nvcc0euMYwFdcAnZNgSMfw.text: Such a great breakfast! Awesome atmosphere. Used the wait list on Yelp and was able to walk right in (around 9:15 am on a Wednesday). Waitress was great! Fresh squeezed orange juice was a hit! Can't say enough good things about the food. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buttermilk pancakes
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes

rhH_OIWV0fIG8W2qEE7urw.text: Fun atmosphere and yummy food. Waitstaff wasn't super friendly. They allow dogs on the patio and have many options for breakfast. No gluten feee pancakes or breads but plenty of GF options besides those.

_eAa2ia57xZEtvGV4UoZfA.text: Great food and service!  Reminds me of Palm Springs.  Love the people and the food.  Wild Berry smoothie is delicious.  I enjoyed the Silver Sunrise drink.  The BLT was so good.  My son had the ham and eggs with potatoes.  He loved everything! Our favorite was the French toast,  it's sweet and just the right amount of perfection.

jhdWttMD6Ccg8O73fOZftg.text: I love the breakfast club! I've been coming here since 2009 for the consistently "Scottsdale" vibe. All the hosts and servers are sweet and pleasant.   I'm not much of a breakfast person or breakfast out but I know if I bring someone here they'll like it.   Food was good. Latte with extra hot coconut milk took a long time. Server apologized before I asked about it and got it removed from the bill without me asking. Much appreciated.   They're very accommodating with special requests too.   I'm giving them a 4 rather than a 5 because I think the plates could use a garnish. Also, back in the day, before they remodeled, there was a homier feel to the place, but it still felt cool. It's a little more upscale now. If I do go out for breakfast I prefer a smaller, cozier environment...but if you go, I know you'll like it.

4JozmTEYixfPGAyhcmMGCw.text: We were planning on making an entire day of old town, Scottsdale. We had been a few times before but hadn't t properly explored in full detail. We knew we wanted breakfast but we weren't sure where we wanted to go. Of course, it was prime-time, post-church, brunch rush-hour. We were lucky enough to find the perfect parking spot, and as good karma would bring us - there was a hostess who told us there was a 35 to 45 minute wait at least, but if I could find seats at the breakfast bar they were first come, first serve. I looked over and there were two seats. I sprinted over there and put my purse down on the seat my fiance would sit in. He was still parking the car. We were greeted by our server right away. My fiance wanted lunch, so he ordered the Rueben with fries. I opted for two eggs over medium with breakfast meat and then also a blueberry pancake made with corn bread mix. We waited a pretty long time to get our food, but it was very busy so we expected that. When our food came out, my fiance's sandwich was served in a wrap. He asked, "is that the Rueben?" She said "Yes!" very confidently. He took a few bites and even though it was good, he opened up the wrap to see that it was turkey and lettuce. It was really a turkey wrap. My eggs were overcooked and the pancake was the worst thing I've ever tasted in my life. It was so dry I felt like I was eating cardboard with a few berries on top of it. Finally a different server came over and my fiance said that he ordered the Rueben. He wasn't going to have them make another one and bring it back out but he just wanted to let them know that the order came out wrong and it wasn't what he wanted. Also, my bacon was heavily under cooked so I gave it back to them to put back in. It came back out looking exactly the same. The prices are affordable and they did take the Rueben off the check which was really great.The whole thing was a mess and needless to say, my fiance and I will not be going back. There's a lot of other great breakfast spots in the area, so I would try to make a reservation at one of those.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gross  =Empty calories
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not going to happen
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Over cooked eggs, undercooked meat.

S5JeZh4iL0XxTQuMoCOG1g.text: One of our favorite breakfast places when we visit AZ. Always delicious and the portions are perfect for the hungry.

m7OcyqvYvByYOGBT_nIPjQ.text: In my first visit to the Breakfast Club I had the Traditional Eggs Benedict which was excellent! The restaurant was extremely crowded, so my two friends and I sat at the bar. The Breakfast Club Bloody Mary's were spicy as advertised. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed their meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Traditional eggs Benedict

XOUumdsS4d0-iZntS9W7Xw.text: If you ever find yourself in Scottsdale Arizona, and are looking for a good breakfast or lunch, be sure and stop by the breakfast club. Good food, Fast service given by a friendly professional waitstaff. I highly recommend it. (our servers, Shawna and Kayla were both excellent!!!)

z10clG3AjMO9NOxay5qX5Q.text: HONESTLY...... the food was amazing. The host was lovely. And it was my FIRST time here and I decided to come on my birthday. (Cause I assumed it would be cool)....... but, it sadly wasn't. The place wasn't as busy as usual, so there was NO excuse for the shitty service we got. The bartender walked by us several times and didn't check on us. Not once, other than the first drink we had. Everyone around us got checked on, except us. Overall, food was good. Service could use some MAJOR work. Seriously, idk if imma come back.

MKw2C6nVd4aKGBAKD5Tlsg.text: My friends and I always grab brunch at Breakfast Club when we visit Scottsdale. It has a trendy, youthful atmosphere. We had a big group of 8 people and they sat us within 15 mins. I always grab a coffee at the counter while I wait. Last time I ordered the cold brew and it tastes like cigarettes but I think that means it is good and strong? Regardless, I ordered an iced coffee this time around and it was delightful.   I ordered the Lean & Green Omelette to try to stay on the lighter side. It was yummy and the fruit tasted fresh, but I wouldn't say it was anything special. I think their tastiest menu items are their Mexican inspired dishes. I have also ordered the biscuits and gravy in the past and loved it... a great hangover cure as well :)!

AqiVVxjnjpD1FbGEHfyyQA.text: This was my second time going here. I got the grilled cheese breakfast sandwich. It was good but wish they would put something on the side with that. It's kind of small. But the staff was great and restaurant was really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Grilled Cheese

hw8ZVYh1rxAoe4VzF9tBdA.text: They are all so amazing!! The food was delicious and the service phenomenal!! Mark is the best and we had Jayme as our server and she was so helpful and thoughtful! We had a large group of ladies and they handled us well! Thank you Breakfast Club!! If you are ever in Scottsdale you MUST come here!!

hmTmYhyXb1yZLvlqTNhH2g.text: Amazing Food.  Best bacon ever!  Great service as well.  It's very busy so I always get in line before I leave the house.    Definitely a fav!!

6bl0Trsu0hr4bCPV4rUXkw.text: I ALWAYS want what my friend gets. He got something with the word Masa in the name and it was amazing. I got huevos rancheros and it was good not as amazing as my friend's awesome choice.   We sat outdoors on the sidewalk seating which was nice if a little chilly. It was sort of weird when people would go flying by on their bicycles.   The prices here were GREAT for the quality of food you got. I'm a huge fan of this place and want to come all the way back from Washington to get that one masa dish.

UAMigevAX4KoewQtT8OzLA.text: Oh how this once venerable breakfast place has crashed and burned.  It used to be wonderful but today, my pancake came out cold and 1/8 inch high, had to send it back   My wife's crispy waffle was uncooked.  Bacon was way undercooked.  Coffee was great, wait staff was attentive. Well they started selling tequila, etc I believe because their core business has slipped. Sorry I won't be back, my breakfast money will no longer be at the BC.

ogh6EwGdI2gHHQlwyNj6CA.text: Place rocks.  Happening, music, good vibes, good people and great food.  Customer service was superb and it was super inexpensive.  Overall good feel for a breakfast spot with lots of energy.  They accidentally put bacon on my wife's meal but she doesn't eat meat. They were super cool about redoing it and then took it off the bill. We were so surprised with the service.

_IcilHwO_HYGIwcc21jtfw.text: Great spot for breakfast! They offer the option to get in line to make the wait a little shorter and even when you are waiting you can order coffee and juice drinks from the bar! My husband and I both had omelettes (the Tuscan and the meat lovers version), we had a side of biscuits and gravy and a pancake. Way too much food but we were on vacation. All of it was excellent. The only thing I didn't care for were the potatoes but that is just a personal preference.

AOXWjHl3nNi0y9Bp3zlFEA.text: Visiting for Spring Training we stopped in for breakfast. We only waited for about 15mins.   While we waited I got a latte from the counter. It was pretty good.   Sat down to eat and ordered an omelette with mushrooms, bacon and avocado, a side of potatoes and fruit. They definitely didn't skimp on the avocado like most places! It was delicious. The potatoes were browned with slices of red and green peppers. Also very good.   The wait staff was very friendly from the time we walked in till the time we left. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qmXNvlWfn4SRm2sPVmB8vg.text: I went on a Sunday, which was unknown to me their busiest day, so the wait was a tad bit longer than I would have liked personally. They were great and offered free bottled water while we waited to be seated which was incredibly thoughtful of them to do and very polite. The got the chorizo burrito and was not disappointed by it one bit! It had a wonderful smoky flavor and was the perfect portion to silence the hunger of having just finished horse back riding for an hour and a half. Staff was thoughtful and well mannered. Worth going back when it's not so busy and see how the seating is inside instead of patio seating.

2DxbLkGpnuQMlBXZ4WslzA.text: This is by far my favorite breakfast/lunch spot EVER!  I love their lattes and how you can order them right away especially if they are on a wait it is awesome to get a latte while you wait.  Their service is always really good, but the thing I love most is the FOOD here is absolutely delicious!  It is the perfect blend of healthy, but no too healthy and the food quality is very high.  The only problem here is they are always on a big wait on the weekends, I have been using the nowait app lately and that has been AWESOME so we can come here more!  my favorite food items are the bird omlette and the club sandwhich.

o2gWJnN9iOym73xFZpkF9w.text: I ordered the Quick Start Loaded breakfast, and overall the meal was delicious. I especially enjoyed the potatoes O'Brien and applewood bacon! The only negative comment I have is the scrambled eggs were over cooked for my taste. I will definitely order the meal again, but ask for the eggs scrambled lightly. Good coffee too!

0Xv5z5AY6LW1N34MjbeW_Q.text: Eggs have no flavor, bacon is absolutely dripping in grease, & the potatoes were so dry they literally almost made me choke. The coffee was brutal, and so was the service. I don't know who the hell Janelle thought she was telling me that I couldn't have "A little milk in my Cocoa Puffs." I also paid $32.77 for this. How's that fair? Place is a fuckin scam for millennials & wealthy old people that have nothing better to do.

VJpim5rumQKn4rmZ8P65Qg.text: Great for breakfast or lunch.  We've been going to TBC for many years and have had numerous things from the menu, although we do have our usual favorites.  Good location, friendly staff, can't go wrong at TBC.

fJ1bR-XtO8rYizzts4eExw.text: Love coming here. Used to live here. Jessica at the bar likes goofing off while the others all work very hard. Orange juice very delicious love the turkey Benedict

Cd-xh75NpXGXY-zKrO851Q.text: I ordered to go the last 3 mornings, the food was excellent and ready before the promise time.  I fresh cut turkey which was seared with mild spice along with scrambled egg whites, 2 slices of 9 grain toast with a light coating of butter, it also came along with O'Brien potatoes which were seared in the skillet and very fresh.  My selection also came with a side of fruit melons.  The to go packing is very upscale and sturdy!  The quality of the food was excellent, I will be returning to this place on. My next visit to the area.  The serving was huge, I saved the other portion for a late afternoon snack.  The parking is in the rear, street parking is very touch.  There is outdoor seating with comfy modern furniture.  The interior is very tastefully decorated and has an upscale appearance.  The staff is very efficient, courteous and fast moving.

jg3BdkD70NAtqOJaEqofvg.text: We came here one morning because we had to drop my mom off in Scottsdale. We decided to sit at the bar.(even though we're nondrinkers) My fiance order the steak and eggs. He said everything was good. And actually made his steak the way he likes it. I ordered the French toast. So nice 3 huge slices I loved that it didn't come with all the extra stuff like eggs bacon .. just a side of fresh fruit. It was so yummy.. our waitress didn't bring the maple syrup. I had to ask another server to bring it over. So the only down side here is the service it seems they are so busy having their own conversations and not really paying that much attention to the customer. Im sure we Probably come back bc the food was super yummy ...we can get over the service for some bomb breakfast.

Lq3-WLH13_uAbSLbGot9Cg.text: Absolutely best eggs Benedict in scottsdale. I got the spicy one with sausage! Fantastic.

tdsZnbAWdV4a3qFao067IA.text: Breakfast is excellent, by far the best breakfast I have had here in Scottsdale. The coffee is amazing, and the staff is super friendly and attentive. I really enjoyed while waiting I could enjoy the coffee bar. Highly recommend the Breakfast Club.

t_uwpkrChh5-lmBtseM1uA.text: The food was very good but the disruptively loud music and the fact that we were quoted a substantially inaccurate wait time, ruined this breakfast for us.

IhpOGse3zbBHCnZbSlfdDw.text: Went here while staying in Scottsdale. Had the yogurt for breakfast. It was the best yogurt fruit and granola i have ever had!

rG709LUI8JIREcxTJipO9g.text: Was disappointed with the service on a Thursday late morning. Food was good but Luke warm when brought to table. Waitress was slow in every respect...bringing coffee, taking order, bringing out food, bringing check, returning credit card.  Expect more from a relatively high end breakfast place.  Won't go back.

GndN56uIDjxRbrAuACbJFA.text: Always wanted to try the Breakfast Club during Spring Training but it is usually pretty slammed. Not the case on a Saturday morning in December at 9:30 am. I like the interior and we sat at the breakfast counter. Quick food!!! It was also delicious - good coffee, and my husband had the biscuits and gravy while I had the wild mushroom omelette. Who doesn't love fresh melon on the plate in December! Also, the fresh squeezed grapefruit juice was absolutely fabulous. Served in a frozen glass made all the difference. Service was ok.....and as a tip, to really feel like you fit in, make sure to come straight from the gym still outfitted in your yoga pants/workout gear.

QcWe3_7ka2gGXGcdOx_hXg.text: Love this place and every waitress who works here is gorgeous! (no homo). Food was EXCELLENT! Great for a first time experience. Between here and the Good Egg...I am certainly returning. Prices are right and the food is excellent! I had a seriously fresh ceasar salad and crispy sweet potato fries!

Wl_VMeeARigyoO0u7zHF2w.text: Probably about the worst Bloody Mary I have ever had in my life! The "large" is a regular sized drink, it's sour and just not good at all. Skip this!

vpK3roSh0-MTtRYAmGWgiw.text: Aces to this place. Great atmosphere and they give you a run for the money. I got the ham and 4 eggs platter. The order came out right quick. But. When I asked for Greek toast. I guess she thought I said wheat. Doesn't matter. They gave me one slice and cut it in half. I had a problem with the eggs. They were cooked to perfection, but they were placed on top of each other, 2 by 2. As I only eat the yoke, they broke apart and I didn't have enough bread to slop them up. The ham was phenomenal. Nice and juicy. Portions in this town are not what I expected. We're not in Chicago anymore!

sN7Bkle0jTIbMVwnfKmgQQ.text: We were promptly seated, was given water and never saw our server again. We sat for over 20 minutes hoping we would be waited on. I told the hostess that had seated us that we were never waited on. Her only reply was "did I seat you?" The people who were seated long after we were were waited on

sJ1pF1POGMZqZNZgjAfAEA.text: Thanks to a friend for recommending this place. Perfect to start your day with a hearty breakfast. I had the whole hog omelet. This piece of art had Ham, bacon, sausage chorizo and pepper jack cheese with a drizzled creme on top. It was huge and delicious. The juice is fresh and helped wash everything down. Good service and food at reasonable prices. I will return

wzjG5kq5WOr8fTgPNktBBA.text: Great and maybe best iced coffee and latte.    Clean fast and while we only had coffee I would go back for breakfast

B2M0iswZT41sV_V9kZfdfA.text: My girlfriend and I arrived on a Saturday morning around 9:30 am, and we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait (which we were expecting). We were seated within 30 minutes at a nice large booth. Once seated, our waitress immediately introduced herself to us. She was very kind, friendly and professional. We received our food and drinks in a timely manner, and the food was absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was casual and comfortable. We will definitely be coming back!!

Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2lqWRturc5V6k5QKfhqL_A.text: The food is good but kinda reluctant to go back because I was sitting at the bar and the waitresses (3 of them)were over on one side of the bar constantly staring at me/watching me eat my food. I felt like saying "do you want to eat it for me and walking out. I consider their actions childish and bad for business .

0ugMZc9csQ2IyvkYzDvVag.text: Wear your ear protection!  I imagine having breakfast next to a jet engine at 100% power would be quieter. I literally could not hear the person I was sitting next to unless I put my ear to her mouth, and NO, I'm not hard of hearing.   Food 2 star mediocre at best but service good. Parking a challenge.

YmB7ftL35MfP4z3lF1RU2g.text: Breakfast was good... I enjoyed my breakfast grilled cheese. There definitely could have been more seasoning but a pretty standard breakfast.

cJdyEtON3xVh07NaJ6Yl-w.text: Nicole Weepy: New Manager at the Breakfast Club who treated me like a criminal seconds after seating me; telling me I have to get up from the table because my friends were not with me at the time that she sat me. I mentioned that they were across the street closing their tab and she continued to threatened me with a 5 minute window. I am a very easy going guy and completely understand policy to not sit someone if they don't have a full party, however, she made the mistake of being disrespectful to a customer in front of many other customers. A customer and a waitress (not even mine) apologized.  Note: My party of 3 waited 1 hour for a table.  Food was great  Servers were great Manager: Well you get the idea Quote of the day - "Well if your friends aren't here in 5 minutes; I'm going to have to make you leave"

JHv4rMZyW3LHBhS_vfa0sQ.text: Really good breakfast, my only advise is , if you are going on a Saturday call to reserve a table it get full..

7-NAfy008hVBpyHZir6_lg.text: The Breakfast Club usually has long lines outside the window as you are going through Scottsdale Rd in Old Town Scottsdale.  I had a visitor in town, so I wanted to see what all the hype was all about.  The place is kind of small, so it has partial explanation of why it is so busy.  We came on Presidents Day, and I forgot that many people would have the day off.  The wait wasn't horrible, as we waited about 30 minutes.  While we were waiting, we had an opportunity to buy some coffee at the coffee bar.    As we entered, the interior looked very busy.  There was a long table where we sat, and there was another couple sitting on the other edge of the table.  This is the first time I have shared seats with some one at a restaurant.  I ordered mushroom eggs benedict that came with potatoes.  My friend ordered a chocolate chip Belgian Waffle.  My food was good with decent portion, but my friend just got one small waffle for $8.  You could have gotten 6 Eggo Waffles for $4.  The quality is not comparable, but it doesn't make sense why she did not get eggs or potatoes.  We had a tough hike ahead, and it wasn't enough food.  I gave her the potatoes to fill up extra carbs and starch.    I would come here again, but I don't think it lives up to the hype or long waits.

aUw3JTvX7_PNjH0G_ijZXA.text: Me and my friend came in about 2 weeks ago, never been there before, and the food was great! Service too.  Brittney I believe was out waitresses name. Super nice! We'll definitely be back!

N8RlMUxX4mHrG69ETAsSTQ.text: Horrible. Service was not on point and very rude. Rushed food out then disappeared until check dropped.  This place has dropped standards and I will never return. Kitchenis a mess and not clean or sanitary. Done.

oL7Q5oJVM7EObenQRH7JGw.text: Great food. Great service. Beautiful upbeat staff to sling breakfast with a purpose. Love the hours!  Personal favorite is the health conscious breakfast - egg whites, fresh tomatoes, broccoli, cottage cheese and fresh fruit. It never fails.

lk1-_cXI7ixak2VZl6b35w.text: An amazing breakfast spot.   The food is off the hook.    You must come here I you are in the area.  You can not go wrong -   The Orange juice is squeezed fresh

zFfLKAXBsdvHnYLSKf6CQw.text: Must say it was a great breakfast. As stated in most reviews this place stays busy, but we were seated in less than 10 mins (on a Tuesday around 10:30am). Our waitress was friendly and service was good.   I ordered a Mimosa, it was great, more Champagne and less juice, just the way I like it. : )  I ordered a Mignon Bene (eggs Benedict with filet Mignon), every bite of it was good as was the side of potatoes (they could be an entree in their own, soooo good).   My friend had a bird omelet, it was huge, looked great. But her coffee stole the show, her cappuccino, came in a clear mug, so you could see the layers of coffee and milk and foam. It looked fabulous.

K8sjUqz9Rnd7ohYLhJNiRg.text: Omellete's are amazing; however the Mimosa's are over-priced. Also, you have to wait at a table in order to be seated. They really should serve people at the tables inside of having 6+ tables designated as waiting tables.  Basically you have to wait at a table to get a table. Sounds pretty ridiculous.

OHx2IhpwMh_RQLnW2cIWUQ.text: Hate the wait, hate the prices but I love the Breakfast Club!  The food is amazing and the menu is extensive for plain old breakfast food.  The portions are large which is great if you are starving or hung over but I wish they had some of their larger items like the omelets ala cart.  I love their a la cart breakfast sandwich, it's like an adult egg McMuffin with horseradish sauce on it.  I don't love the price.  At over $5 for just a sandwich I'll head to across the canal to Olive and Ivy's market and get a sandwich and home fries for $7.  And if you like pancakes?  O....M....G!  I have found a couple things there that aren't wallet busters if you just want a quick bite to eat.  Their 2 eggs anyway are $2, spend $0.50 to add cheese and you have a filling but cheap meal for under $3.  The portion size is more like 3-4 eggs instead of two when you get them scrambled.  If you want to look at the menu ahead of time, don't bother with their online one.  It's out dated and most of their items have risen in price $1-3.  The other bad news is they don't have an alcohol licenses so no mimosas or bloody mary's with your breakfast.  Womp Womp :(

PaJcZZD02n4FljJjFsHvUA.text: I've had decent experiences here in the past, though it always reminds me of that episode of Seinfeld where Elaine is complaining about all the waitresses at Monk's Diner looking the same. Today was pretty terrible. First of all, I ordered buckwheat pancakes, bacon, and hash browns. The butter for my pancakes had a hair in it. The bacon was good. The hash browns were the greasiest I'd ever seen. Just covered in oil. I've had better from Waffle House. I won't be back for quite a while.

MoI_DEe1_vn5xMsIk_CN3w.text: We have wanted to try this place for quite sometime but its usually so busy that we dont dare try to find a parking space.  Today didnt look so bad unfortunately :-)  Wish we had tried the Daily Dose instead.  Oh well theres always next time.  These reviews are hilarious.  Made the mistake of not reading them before hand.  The service sucked.  The waitress sucked.  She really pissed me off.  My husband had to keep reminding me the girl was young and what if that was your daughter cuz I wanted to punch her in the face.  It took forever just to be acknowledged, waited a lifetime for some water.  Asked her what was good on menu this is our first visit.  Too bad we took her advice.  My husband got the bird omelet which I tasted and YUCK.  It was completely bland.  He had to pour hot sauce all over it for flavor.  They put the eggs right on top of the fresh cold fruit so that now you cant eat it or wouldnt want to eat it.  If they just read their own reviews they would stop doing that.  Talk about dumb asses.  I got the huevos rancheros with green chili.  It comes in an open chipotle tortilla that is MINUS any taste.  Its swimming in juices which is making the tasteless tortilla into glue.  Comes with two eggs on top.  The flavors together were just not that good.  Got a $4 glass of fresh squeezed orange juice that made my face scrunch up because of the bitterness.  Waitress brought bill way too early obviously trying to get rid of us but that just pisses me off even further cuz thats her ticket to not having to do shit.  I waived that bitch down anyway.  I want water bitch.  The only reason they get 2 whole stars is because the green chili was good otherwise hate this place :-)

IlfJp0ygir5WdVt3dOwhSw.text: YUM. Packed. Service... is okay.   Coffee is great! Love the sugar selection [hate Splenda in coffee.. love Stevia in coffee!]. I ordered the turkey/boursin omelette and it was SO GOOD. I couldn't get over it.   Fast service but I don't recall anything special. In fact I do remember our waitress being pretty short with us but at least she did it with a smile!  I can't wait to return.

4GR-_-_53NVZEzDzS-vqaQ.text: This place is one of the top in the area for a reason. I got the monster burrito, and was full for most of the day. My girlfriend got the smoked salmon lox bene, which was delicious. The food is great, but the wait can be long unless you call in advance. If you think you will be coming call 30 minutes in advance, so then you will likely get a table by the time you get there. If you can't call ahead you can always go straight to the bar.

yxEXXHIubss3xWQJ5iEwAA.text: Food is okay but not worth the lengthy wait on weekends. If there were more breakfast choices around this area, TBC would be empty.   I've ordered breakfast on two occasions here and both times it came out cold, plus the order was messed up.   The outdoor patio on the side street is nice but the Scottsdale Road side gets quite noisy with the traffic.  Wait staff and hostesses are nothing fabulous, not overly friendly considering the price and the wait.   Maybe I should down a couple Malibu drinks before I come for breakfast and it would be a better experience.

DzPv6JUZCmZ0_cuxtjFPeA.text: Best place in downtown Scottsdale for breakfast. The nutty waffle, Holla for Challah French Toast, bacon, and  and eggs benedict are very good. The breakfast burrito is the best deal in downtown Scottsdale. I have never had a bad meal.   Is always crowded on Sat and Sunday AM and the wait is about 15 minutes. Good wait service and timely delivery of food.

HhGeU881OeXjCQJPvWSmtA.text: I'm a huge foodie, so once I moved to Phoenix I looked up the top spots to try. Don't get me wrong, this place is great! But there are others in old town scottsdale that are unfortunately better. I've been here 2-3x and have gotten the french toast, huevos rancheros and the biscuits and gravy. Everything was delicious and the staff is always extremely friendly. It's a good breakfast/brunch spot but for me, the hype is way more than I'd give it. Hence the 4 stars

l0MH8hYUAbAqb0xTnk2zhQ.text: Great bfast and even better coffee.  Waiting kinda stinks tho get there early or bake in the sun waiting for a table.  Need more square feet.

G_om3mPQs4R6bCM3piWhKA.text: this review is basically for the management staff that was there this morning. we usually gontonthe downtown phoenix location and have never had an issue. today we drove to scottsdale specifically to go here. first off parking is horrible so be prepared. wait time was 25 min, not to bad especially it took that long to find a place to park. we were seated on the patio the server was friendly and prompt to come get drink order. then came lady who didn't announce who she was and asked if we were still in complete since there was an open chair. I stated no we are all her and my 2 yr old was standing beside me at the table. she again stated well if your incomplete you will have to get up and wait till your party is complete. I again stated we are a family of 4 we are all here and have already ordered our beverages. with a soul on her face and a raised tobe she stated I didn't need to be so rude she was just doing her job. no apology for the misunderstanding or anything. I asu med ahe was a hostess and stated as she stormed off I would like to speak with the manager. she then turned and shouted I am the manager. our nice waitress came and she apologizes and stated there is a second manager I could speak with, again a lady came to our table and just stood there. didnt address us, tell us who she was, or even an apology for the previous misunderstanding. soni expressed to her what happened and she just dismissed it and stated the other person told her that she didn't tell us we would have to leave and wait. I asked for general manager and was told she would not give that info to me either but I could leave my info which we all know what happen to that...I will not gontonthe location again that being said the food is good and service is outstanding but dont get up off your seat or they get very upset. I will patron the downtown location from now on.

o044CLGMKtkjEfgHTSeaug.text: Hip and trendy it is, great food it is not. Coke in a bottle it has. No Diet Coke here despite the fact that in most of the country DC out sells Classic Coke. Ice tea instead?  Only if you like obnoxious flavorings. Menu description of French toast is enticing; delivery not so much.  What lands on your plate is a soggy mess with no toast attributes of any sort.  It's obvious that the cook has no idea of what French toast is supposed to be or how to prepare it. I'm sure they must get it right some days but not this day.  Suggest they visit the Landmark in the Time Warner building in NYC to have the best.

ZKQbEfnv5oHWbCWK5pJEJA.text: Went in for the first time today. Place is a work zone but clean. I had Huevos Rancheros. Little different from the usual I am used to but it was good. Really big portion, too much for me and I am a big eater. Food came quickly. Lots of waitresses for the size of the place though I was in early and I think when the outside tables fill up they are all humping. Anyway nice wait staff, good food, clean. Oh and for the men out there the waitresses are all young and attractive. Sooo.... I probably won't make the trip again but if I am in the area I would definatley eat there again.

gGrtfuBiCmc8EpYo5wZIiQ.text: Breakfast simply doesn't get better than this.  Nice place, great coffee, and their steak and eggs is the best in the Valley.  I've never needed more than my fork to cut my steak.  They have a few different 'benedicts' each of which will take you to a culinary place you'll be glad you visited.  Did I mention how good the coffee is ?      Seriously.

VxgfyJSeJEjTvk5UWsgJww.text: I admit that this was actually our second choice.  we were originally supposed to go to Matt's big breakfast, but it's closed on mondays!  really!  who closes their breakfast joint on Monday?  I mean you're only open from 6.30 am to 2.30 pm, but i guess they may have been hungover from the Cardinals' win over the Eagles.  Anyhow, back to the food.  There was a fairly long wait ~30 minutes and were we seated outside (right along scottdale ave), but it was actually worth it.  my food was ok.  I ordered the bacon and eggs and the oatmeal.  you can't really mess up bacon and eggs, but for some reason, the oatmeal was really good.  my oatmeal that i put in the microwave doesn't taste like that!    but the real highlight was what my fiancee ordered.  she had the cinnamon french toast with toasted nuts and berries.  4 nice slices of heaven with some fresh berries and toasted almonds and pecans.    I can forgive Matt's big breakfast this time, but if i'm ever back in the Phoenix area, they better be open and beat the french toast at the breakfast club.

Xriwt9am5gVWeZM41aytRQ.text: Went here to celebrate graduation and had the worst possible experience of my life.  We had a group of 5 total. We decided to go have a couple drinks at the bar before being seated.  We ordered 4 mimosas (5 but brother didn't have his ID) which came out to 50 dollars.  Three of us had seats at the bar and two were standing behind.  We were having a great time but after 15 min of sitting there the bartender/waitress comes up to us and says in a rude tone, "usually we reserve these spaces for people who are eating, would you move over to the waiting area".   I understand that it was busy and that she wanted to make more money off of new customers but we had ordered a pretty expensive round of drinks and were waiting to get our table to spend more money on food.  It was quite insulting that they would have the nerve to ask us to leave from the bar.  We did not leave and she grunted and left then proceeded to talk shit to the other bartenders only a few feet from us.   Finally we were seated.  We decided to let go of what had happened and still enjoy ourselves.  When we got our food a manager came up to us.  He rudely started telling us that it is illegal for someone without an id to drink from other peoples drinks (my brother) and that two waitresses had told him this was happening.  My brother had not taken one sip from a drink on the table, beisdes his water.  We tried to explain nicely to him that he had not taken a sip, and the manager started to become extremely rude and not listen. He then began  raising his voice and not only interrupting our breakfast but the other patrons that were sitting on the patio as well.  The food was mediocure and the service was horrendous.  Never going back again.  They did not even comp our meal which had turned into a disaster.  What happened to the customer is always right? These people teamed up against us and main my graduation breakfast a horrible experience.

wT6i9rshzyq8Wcfd5ypQtA.text: Yummy breakfast!! I am never disapointed here. The service if always friendly and the restaurant looks beautiful. The fresh squeezed juice is PERF. I highly recommend this place for any meal.

339F4Vq2ZXu3ZBrq4uonqQ.text: Consistent, quality food - we enjoy going there about once a month!  Special note to early risers, they open EARLY so you can avoid the weekend crowds.

C9L-xvm5jNL2P-D63YyHwg.text: Amazing breakfast! I loved my waitress Shannon!!! An absolute doll and always smiling when serving others! I ordered the bowl of yogurt, yum but the granola hurt my teeth when chewing

KD0iwqOR4_t9-NS_XBQM1Q.text: Food was okay. Service was bad. Plate was dirty. Waitress was unavailable anywhere. Won't return for sure!!!

qOdW1D6U2rGiTVUem9UOuQ.text: We found this place on Yelp and it was only blocks from our hotel.  The food and service was excellent.  Our server's name should be "Chipper", she was so prompt and friendly, definitely a morning person.  Our entire experience was very pleasant.  I highly recommend it.  And don't miss out on the fresh squeezed juice.

T5nCqEDOJykaA8jU56l-Rw.text: I love coming to the Breakfast Club- this was my 3rd or 4th visit, and the 1st time for my wife. The atmosphere of this place is fantastic! I recommend a table outside where the sun slowly rises and casts warmth and sunlight on the outdoor seating area. We each ordered coffee and water and we were delighted to find cucumber slices in our water- such a subtle refreshing twist on water! I don't think my coffee cup ever emptied more than half full before the waitress would return with the coffee pot to top it off. My wife ordered pancakes with a mixed fruit topping (added charge) of fresh strawberries and blueberries. I ordered a full order (3 slices) of French toast and although I'm a big eater, I must admit that I found it difficult to eat it all. Perhaps I would have been better to order a la carte and get just 2 slices. Our total bill was $29.76 which is a bit pricey for just 2 coffees and an order each of pancakes and French toast, but given the ambiance and location of the restaurant, we understand that the cost would be a little high. We hope to return again soon!

qSmCd3_C4O3aXWRyHE8ZSQ.text: Used the yelp app to make a reservation. It worked however, they only seat you when you're entire party is there. Service was super fast. Was in and out within an hour or so. Food was delicious and more upscale than a typical breakfast joint but still has all the classics.

YxXgjnbI2y772t9LWQLyxg.text: LOVED this place! Great food, great service and overall just a good time. They play really good music, the service was great and the food was delicious!   Even on a busy Saturday morning, we sat down fast and the food came out really fast. (I put us on the waitlist on Yelp. Walked in and sat down within 2 minutes)   My favorite thing on the menu - the BISCUITS AND GRAVY!!! It's a jalapeno and cheese biscuit (OMG AMAZING!) and a hearty gravy with large chunks of sausage. They have freshly squeezed juices too!   Highly recommended!

72V2OCdZ2KOo6q4Ij6bsVw.text: I loved this place because they had a large bar area with open seating as well as table seating if you want to wait. Usually does have a wait especially on the weekends. Service was fast. Food was delicious and it was reasonably priced. Will definitely return!

HVLVNVGvhV-9hFKgv7hbnw.text: High energy place for breakfast or lunch! Usually there is a waiting list to get in. I have waited ip to half an hour. There is inside and outside sitting, however the outside is literally the narrow sidewalk so you get people passing by your table all the time. Good quality food. One big inconvenience is the lack of parking. You may have to park far and walk to the restaurant.

Ez4Fanoz3MVJVwJmUDr2HA.text: Great breakfast!  French toast, blue corn pancakes and omelettes made to order all real good. May be a long wait so just use the Yelp app to put your name down.

829aX0HhrBbZbsx7Au06_Q.text: My husband and I had the morning off during the week on a Wednesday and we called in when we were in our way just to see how long the wait was and she put us on the wait list right away without us even thinking we needed to (just incase it got busy).   The parking was so bad though. But, anywhere in this area has parking problems it seems like. We walked in and got a table within 5 minutes and the waitress got us water right away.   I haven't been here in about 4 years so I didn't remember what I got. I just knew I wanted pancakes as well! We both got some amazing omelettes and a side of their potatoes and we were loving it!   I don't eat a lot of breakfast but when we go out to eat and there's good breakfast food then I never forget it!

lHDDManyTxsv10H_v0fg0A.text: We stopped into the Breakfast Club for a quick bite late morning and found it pretty delightful. It was early in the day and not too warm yet so the misters above us were a little uncomfortable, but bearable.  I'm guessing the locals like to feel cool as much as possible so we didn't say anything about it.    I ordered their Breakfast Grilled Cheese made with hash browns, eggs, bacon, fontina & cheddar cheeses on grilled sourdough bread. It was decadent and quite yummy, but a bit too greasy. Nevertheless, it tasted great and was a large enough portion to share.  My latte was served in a nice glass mug and was made perfectly. The restaurant wasn't real busy at the time and our service was attentive.  All in all, a good meal and I'd venture back to try some other options. It's walking distance from several Old Town hotels so it's a good spot to keep in mind.

_QjeQsC8bRNWSPiB9XNnvQ.text: This was favorite place for breakfast in Scottsdale. The inside is airy and fun. The pancakes were delicious.

479aqpgDKIwquxHUUQEnaw.text: Nice place, great service, tasty coffe, good food. My sandwich cold have been better but everything else was great. Will come back!

2viZdep35dIyJTRHP3i4ew.text: We went for a late brunch last Sunday. We were told it would be a 45-minute wait turns out it was only 30 minutes. NICE. I was GLAD to see such a diverse crowd.  there is a bar in the middle of the restaurant surrounded by tables and booths. there is a glass window for the kitchen so if you are interested in seeing who's preparing your meal you can. Pro's    friendly staff  good food  large portions  Con's  the seating feels tight   the noise level was very loud price for our meal for 2 was $35 before tip ****we had no problem with the hostess or our server.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Single pancake

T50SzAtC5TJzbqrSXj-v_w.text: Excellent everything!!  Service, food, atmosphere, prices--EVERYTHING IS PERFECT!!  You must try it - you will not be disappointed.  "The Breakfast Yelpers Crew"

-mMSvKB6Kwzr9HvtRldHbA.text: Pretty decent for my first visit. I'd read on here there is usually a long wait for for our party of seven we didn't have to wait long and were seated quickly. We came around noon. The place was pretty full the whole time we were there. The menu was pretty extensive, with lots of options to choose from. I had a hard time deciding on what to eat because of that. First world problems, haha. I was debating between the 'Tuscan Frittata' and the 'Whole Hog Omelet,' but settled on the latter option. I liked my food especially the fruit, which I found refreshing. For the price, the serving sizes of the meals served here are extremely worth it. I had a bite of some buttermilk pancakes that my friend ordered too and they were light and fluffy perfection w butter and syrup. Everyone at my table enjoyed their food. My boyfriend had the Breakfast Grilled Cheese, but said it was more like a sandwich than a grilled cheese. He meant that he expected it to have more melty cheese and it to be ooey gooey w cheese like most grilled cheeses are. Nonetheless, he liked his dish. Another person at our table had the Turkey Reuben and said it was yummy. Service was fine as well and the server was nice and pleasant and accommodating. I found out the previous day was BC's 15th anniversary too, so that was cool to know this spot had been around for 15 years. All-in-all, I enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I will definitely return as the breakfasts are well-worth the money w leftovers to bring home too!

-t7SwfCQXh6bqqrPRMPhDg.text: We loved the counter seating and the food was delicious! The restaurant itself was busy, but the staff was able to turn tables quickly. The server was nice and the fooddidn'tt take too long which I was surprised considering the place was full.

YIpDNl97b8WVnpScjEwX_g.text: Best breakfast I've ever had!! The service was amazing! The nutty French toast is a must. I love that they have big mimosas too.

2AEr8XnWdr_sKR8NI8RfPw.text: Whoaaa, before I dive into my review, do the women that work here have to meet a certain "good looking" quality?  I don't think I saw one woman here that was not good looking and they were efficient with our order...Welp onto the boring stuff ha.  I really enjoyed the environment, it had different types of people enjoying there tasty breakfast.  We arrived before the rush and I was well pleased with our food.   I ordered the BC Signature French Toast, the fresh  strawberries and almonds were a nice touch.  DEF COMING FOR MORE Ha.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BC Signature French Toast

yLflJHSUJ3EkjMlVth9GJA.text: This place seems super popular. It's always packed - no matter the day of the week. I'm told the owner is the same as Stax in the same building, and they used to own the now closed Upton - both of which I love. BC though . . .  nothing super exciting about the breakfast here. I'm not a fan of their bloody mix, and while a mimosa is huge, it's not that tasty. I'd rather have taste. I've tried it a few times and none of the items I had were worth writing home about. There are so many great breakfast places that I don't need to return.

6mCE40EDLK_sJatsllrn6Q.text: After going to the city scape location LITERALLY last week, I was sooo impressed not only by the food but by the customer service. Not to mention that we came to eat close to closing time the waitress we had was amazing!! Super sweet and patient since it was our first time to BC.   The Scottsdale location on the other hand is literally night and day. Food was okay, although my hash browns were a little burnt. Sitting here waiting for my mom to finish eating and our water cups have been empty for a while, yet she was able to drop off the check? Is your service done now? Like we're still here. Also we were never even asked how our meal was.   Definitely will drive that extra 10 min to go to the Phoenix city scape location.   Update: a busser refilled our water. Thank you for doing our servers job!

Nz6VOh1gSAHHYIdmKE734A.text: Unlike the movie, this place isn't about good times and making new friends and memories (actually I haven't seen the movie so my plot description may not be accurate). This is a popular contemporary diner where you can expect a wait, and correspondingly lots of noise and bustle with the people.  For food I had an omelette and chocolate chip pancake. The chocolate chip pancake was the best thing here and was loaded with chocolate chips inside and out. One on the side was a great deal and a good splurge from my attempting to avoid sugar. On the other hand, the omelette was just average. There were a decent portion of ingredients but it seemed kinda sloppily cooked and the eggs weren't fluffy but had too much of a burnt crispy texture. The side of potatoes was too oily for my taste and unfortunately a lot of oil seeped over to the side of fruit. While the portions are generous, I'd rather have quality over quantity.  Come here for the pancakes and coffee, the proteins are sadly disappointing.

2S-hJkYTDytQ-sXcNPnuWQ.text: Great breakfast place with good prices, flavorful food, and awesome drinks of teas, coffees, and mimosas.

-6f6HuMO-B5-60xwrCdarg.text: Look back at my reviews. How many 1 stars do you see? None.  And I would have written a lot more reviews lately except I'm about to give up on Yelp due to their lack of action defending businesses against political attacks. But I digress.         The Breakfast Club! Yes, that's why I'm here today.  Never again.    My girlfriend and I both saw the 'Wild mushroom' omelette at the same time and each ordered one.  I'll start with hers.         She asked for some spinach added to hers. It comes out and obviously looks different than mine. No creme fraiche, or cheese. Though she did get the potatoes O'Brien with them.  Okay,  we'll ask about that when the waitress comes back.  After I got her attention, eventually, she explained that there were no substitutions allowed so she wound up with a 'build you're own'. Which meant crimini shromms. Would have been nice to know that adding one ingredient constitutes a 'substitution'.  I'll get back to that in a minute.     My order.  I noticed a lot of water coming out from the folds, and looking inside I saw only crimini mushrooms. Hardly what I would call wild. Certainly were no oyster, shiitake, etc... that were supposed to be there.  I guess if the kitchen wants to substitute unilaterally it's acceptable.      I mentioned this to the waitress and got a blank look.  No explanation, just excuses.  No offer to take it back and fix it. No price reduction. Nothing.         The only reason I didn't walk out is because I was very hungry, so I cleaned my plate. I didn't want to cause a scene that would have embarrassed my girlfriend.     I left 'K' our waitress a dime tip tacked on my bill with a note explaining why. If you are reading this, 'K', please understand that I normally would have left 20% minimum. In cash.     Oh yeah, the coffee was old and bitter too. I can at least relate to that.

LbvmvnoyiMVwI6--hSYFpQ.text: Funny, my husband suggested the Breakfast Club,my spot he and the boys ate at during Spring Training.  Funny, because he said it was, "okay."  "Okay" did not sound like a rave review, but it was our last meal before leaving Scottsdale, my hubby doesn't ask for much, and how can you fail at breakfast?  So, we were there mid week and late in the morning. The restaurant was busy,not full, we opted to eat outside.  I could see how this spot could be popular because of the location and if the food was "okay," even more so.  I suspect that during Spring Training, the boys waited to be seated and felt the rush of people waiting .... But "okay" doesn't sound stellar, does it?  Wow. Was I ever impressed!  I ordered the Portobello Eggs Benedict.  Excellent. Hollandaise and Bordelaise sauces?  Why yes, and thank you! Plated beautifully, with fresh fruit and Potatoes O'Brien.  Delish.  The hubs ordered pancakes and they did not disappoint. Accompanying hash brown potatoes were especially yum.  He has a thing about hash browns, and these were tasty.     Our server was friendly and attentive...  Yes, I was totally impressed. So A-Okay!

QHwJCdD0EzOFS6dwYXtX1A.text: Food was great as always, and the place looks and feels clean. Our meals were ordered and delivered to us super quickly as well! Our waitress was good at filling our glasses back up and taking plates out of the way when needed, but she seemed just a little snobby. Otherwise, 5 stars for sure!

p6AoVo5MjY-o9VmeISvm0A.text: Excellent spot for breakfast.   Food is fresh and tasty. Service is excellent. Decor is bright and airy. Ideal for a breakfast business meeting or setting a family up for a day out.

k7qDcYBTmjU_rqNU5cNaug.text: This is one of my favorite brunch spots in Scottsdale. Their service is always friendly and the atmosphere is bright and cheery. Most recent visit I had ice coffee, which came out in like a jug, so I took it with me and enjoyed it all morning. The egg white omelette with veggies is light and tasty, I get it with salsa to give it some extra flavor. The fruit is always bright and a good portion. Sitting on the street is noisy, but it's worth it to enjoy the sunshine. If you are visiting town pick an off day to brunch here to avoid a big crowd.

hlFeRSQJ4SDqvfKVwKCWdw.text: Great service from our server, Briana! It was our first visit and I was really impressed. Food as delicious and was served quickly. Reasonably priced. We will be back soon.

xk9FhMaiVIpXp87BtSv77w.text: I thought this place was OK I have heard a lot of great reviews from this place from friends but I got the biscuits and gravy he and was actually a bit disappointed my dad really enjoyed his meal which was just regular bacon and eggs

oRtncAXAfH7p0prpgfSoNA.text: Overrated. Like, this place is bland. I come here frequently because of the convenient location, but every time I leave like "meh." A lot of calories and a lot of dollars for little satisfaction, imho. EXCEPTION: I got the steak and eggs the other day and drooled it was so good. But everything else I've had here is #basic.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled portobello sandwich
Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs

i-CPppgjtmqxcqbSUjuq2Q.text: I have been to this fantastic place numerous times for breakfast. The food is always great and the employees are wonderfully talented! Call ahead to get on the waiting list so you won't have too wait long. The French toast is awesome.

UwWKbyg1aptEo75bN2gntA.text: Ok, so....my husband and I go here almost EVERY weekend, so I think it's time for a review. Not really much to say other than this place is great. Hubby always gets strawberry banana pancakes or bananas foster french toast. I always get the oatmeal with the BC Burro or one of their breakfast sandwiches. Either way, I have ordered other items too, they always seem to satisfy no matter what.   Tips:call ahead to get your name on the list-it used to be no more than 10 minutes, now it's 45, because no matter what there is a wait. We live in chandler, so when we call it's usually when we are exiting because parking is sometimes a pain too. But we've learned a few tricks to get around since we go so much.   Again, no matter what you order it's great, lots of food and the OJ is fresh squeezed. Prices aren't bad either-BC Burro is $5, and it's pretty fatty-in a good way.   That is all-happy eating folks!

c4uer3snKvHJb2WMAz9Gkw.text: We had the cobb salad, we were staying away from carbs that day.  Very nice place and the salad was good, not great, but its a breakfast place.  Great atmosphere, service a little on the slow side, we were there at 1130 am.  We will return for breakfast.

cM2OVTbNKLxZtC1ZV6sFQg.text: I went with a couple co- workers. We went by at 845 and we asked if we could make a reservation. They said to call 30 min before we wanted to eat and we could get get on the list. I called at 10am, they said it would be a 45min wait. I downloaded there app to see where I was in the list. I got they're at 10:40am and told them we were there and they said we still had people in from of us. We waited and waited. 35 min later I asked when we would be seated. They said you didn't check in.  I said I spoke to you when I got there. They didn't note we arrived. We waited for another 45min after the 45 min call ahead. An hour and a half. The food was excellent. The extra long wait caused us to be late. If you have time to spare and don't mind waiting until lunch for breakfast, then this is place is you.

zOaPKQIokxNa7pMNcZWkvQ.text: I go to BC almost every morning and have probably been there 100 times.  It a nice place with a great staff and good food at a reasonable price!

P0ukSXiWtIhAmiI8-x0Wlg.text: Very complete, and tasty, breakfast menu. Lots of options depending on your appetite. The best restaurant coffee I've enjoyed outside of Hawaii. Noisy, and peak season probably spells disaster for parking, but these are minor complaints. Overall a really fine place my family dined at three times during our stay in Scottsdale. Go there!!

VPfzXNmEe6txjcBKG0GgCg.text: This place is amazing! My husband and I had the pesto buffalo omelet just was so good and tried the southwest bowl. Everything was great with this place

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto omelette

Sijg-XfT4ou0e5svc1J0MA.text: Just wanted to thank all my friends at Breakfast Club for comping our meal today on our anniversary.  Amazing what great service everyone was getting during the morning before the Super Bowl. It was swamped and handled with aplomb.  Food was excellent as always.

WuiW6xGmBRhneOgQrCVAWw.text: Awesome place! Awesome food!  We dropped in Monday mid-morning.  The best eggs benediction I've had in the USA. Their fresh squeezed V18 nice is gray (just needs some vodka). My kids had waffles and when the server brought over a free-pour bottle of syrup it made their day.  Not like other places where you get a tiny little serving of syrup that disappears into the waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Their V18 juice!

-EmTjC2baOVZ2mLDhP4vcQ.text: Good food and large portions but you'll have to WAIT a long time because this place is popular.

lyKqwzieWY0IMbifBsi_Tg.text: Really really good bloody Mary's along really good food and service.  Border Bowl with a fresh tortilla. The best!

photos.caption: Photo of Breakfast Club- Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Marry

ywmn2QJRhBiOsoEreWdGXQ.text: I am giving 2 stars only due to the waitress, who I believe tried her very best, and to the fact that my husband's experience was very different from mine. That being said, the food here made me ill, literally. My stomach is churning as I write this. I can only assume it is due to the undercooked eggs I was served. After eating half and egg, and bacon, I complained, I nicely explained to my waitress that I was rather grossed out and didn't want a replacement. She took my plate and said she'd talk to the manager. When she returned she explained that the manager had taken $2 off our bill. The manager didn't even come talk to us. I know I could have made a scene but frankly just didn't feel like it. I wasn't even going to write a bad review but now that I am laying here trying not to run to the bathroom, I have changed my mind.  My husband's food seemed fine and as I said the waitress really tried to provide good service in a bad situation that wasn't her fault. Still I will not be back.

SJpxVTXB7ls37Dth7-hb3g.text: Lived up to the positive reviews. I went with 3 other people on a Sunday at 11:30. There was a 20 minute wait, but I expected this. The food and service were great including the hostess. Two of us had  omelets, two had pancakes with a side of eggs. Everyone enjoyed their meals. I liked all of the fruit they had a a side with the omelets. The side potatoes were also good with a lo of sauteed veggies mixed in. Total bill for 4 people was about $50. I would go again next time I'm in Phoenix area.

Z4-336csKrAXogH3LsfM3w.text: Good food.  Service is OK, not outstanding.  Huevos con masa - amazing.

Beshuwksw4qhblerZGOtfg.text: Ahhh...a restaurant with a name right out of the 80s. Bestow my heart! The BC as the regs call it, caps the end of little strip of shops in Oldtown Scottsdale. It is the Hugo's (West Hollywood reference) of Scottsdale. Lots of eye candy for boys and girls. The staff is mostly women, and quite the hotties they are. The space is very uncluttered and has great views of the passersbys and cars whippin' down Scottsdale Road. The oatmeal (add blueberries) is fantastic. The breakfast burrito is muy excelente. Orange juice tastes freshly squeezed and the coffee is strong and robust. Just like my Aunt Helen. The place is packed on the weekends, so expect a wait. Truly a hot,  hip spot on boulevard I call Snottsdale.

TfEq2lXq087u3156lOZmjA.text: The pork green chilli burrito was excellent, very lean.  I customized my burrito with egg, ham and cheese, pork green chilli on the side.   We sat at the bar because the wait was about 20mins on a weekday morning around 9.45am. Hannah, who was the very busy bartender, took very good care of us and was the one who recommended the pork green chilli, which I will definetly be ordering again.   I also enjoyed the unfiltered apple juice which was a nice surprise to see on the menu.

vAFvScpBhClxbP7Aa9HiOw.text: High quality food, wonderful atmosphere. A little too busy on Saturday/Sunday AM. Great location right on Scottsdale Rd.

HGNelN7gKG2AgnHsYs224A.text: We were originally going to grab something real quick at Einstein's after our hike at Camelback, but I saw this place and asked about it.  I jumped out of the car to find that there would be a 40 minute wait, and we were up for the wait.  I hear that there can be an hour long wait or more at times.  I was already warned about the people who come here seem to be overdressed for brunch, and it was True to their word.  I love that we were there in our exercise and hiking attire.  We did get some coffee from the coffee bar area in the back.  They have excellent coffee here.  If you are a coffee snob, you could fall in love with the java here or some eye candy around you.  There was a healthy stack of papers near the coffee bar, and we waited outside until we were called in for our table.  I was told that we were lucky that we had the nice waitress.  They are all really pretty.  I decided on an eggs benedict a la crab meat style and asparagus.  It was quite delicious.  It had a orange red color sauce with a hint of spicyness to it.  If you are a crab lover like myself, this is something that you would appreciate.  It also came with a side of fruit.  They have very limited outdoor seating and our waitress was pleasant, which I hear is not usually the case.  The prices were reasonable, and I wouldn't mind coming back!

-qC-6kDp71R_W0aTySBe0Q.text: This is my favorite breakfast place ever. I've moved around a lot and never had that "neighborhood breakfast joint" that the locals go to, and now I finally do. (Smiles!) Their omlettes are absolutely delicious, you can either make your own or pick from a few that they have created... like The Bird... yum. They have tons of pancakes topped with candied nuts, fruit purees, whipped cream, and even ice cream. Is this really breakfast?! :) They also have a number of healthy options, you can order egg whites, and they have great fresh fruits, oatmeal, and yogurt. I love their toasted bagels and soy lattes. Their lunches are actually really good too... I've had their Turkey Club Wrap and it was great, breakfast is still served all day though. I recommend going early though! It gets packed after 8am on weekends and usually even weekdays.

eMmEf18b56WLvSpqQbFM6Q.text: If you go during the weekend, expect an hour wait.  You've got nothing to do so just sit in some of the lounge chairs out front and relax.  I had the turkey omelete with borsand cheese (on of my new favorite things), wife had the bagels with lox (capers, tomato, yadda yadda yadda) and my daughter had the chocolate chip pancakes.  We were all very satisfied with our meal, and from what I remember not that expensive. So whenever we're in the Scottsdale area and have some time to kill, we'll stop in for a great breakfast

cB83KuKGeW2m_KvM5blieg.text: Good place for breakfast, brunch or even lunch. The Breakfast Club is a trendy little restaurant located right in Old Town Scottsdale, so be advised that this isn't the place you come looking like crap after rolling out of bed.  Be prepared for a long wait too, especially on the weekends.  But there are plenty of guys and girls to spend your time looking at, so that might help the wait go by for your table.  I've had the breakfast burrito and the veggie omelette- both were delicious.  They serve them with potatoes and fruit, but you can rarely finish everything because the portions are pretty big.

85UK7UTuI1vKaJdlHPDQjg.text: This place is probably crowded all the time. Went here on a Monday morning and the line was insane. Good thing we decided to wait it out because BC is delicious. I wasn't too hungry so I just went with your standard 2 eggs and bacon. Let me tell you something: their bacon is out of control good, and I'm not a huge bacon guy. Fresh fruit was also delicious. Next time I'm in Scottsdale, I'm coming back.

xxUofHI5muKOzMhLXPojcQ.text: What can I say?  I LOVE this place.  I've never had a dish I didn't like here.  The energy is great, the people are fun.  I wish there were MORE room!  And I wish the misters had a little more "oomph" out on the patio during the summer, but what are you gonna do?  If you have friends in town and you're looking for a foolproof breakfast joint The Breakfast Club is it.

6Dzn6-TiXVMC09fUaPimOA.text: My family and I ate here just a few days ago. It was an experience that left me yearning for more out of a restaurant I have seen so crowded over the years and decided to try with a group of 7 of us in the family. First off we got there at 10 am and were missing only two in our party so we had to wait to be seated which was fine. Once the rest of our party showed up at 10:07 we were not seated until after 10:30. When we were seated we were all scrunched together at a medium sized table that would comfortable seat 5 adults. Well, there were 7 of us total and needless to say it was very tight! The waitress stated that we could take our water and go wait back up front for a bigger table but we were looking at roughly 40 minutes of waiting again!!! Seriously? We ordered drinks first and the waitress brought my father his tomato juice and almost spilled it on him but instead spilled it all over her hand. Then she sat the glass down in front of him with juice on table and all over glass and left! She never came back with a wet towel to clean up her mess!! We all ordered and the food arrived quickly. This was the only part of the experience that was good, sadly to say. We received our food order for 7 of us within 15-20 minutes which was excellent. My uncle and grandmother both had charred toast (it was black, not just black around the edges) . The bacon looked like dried strips of hard leather. Overall, none of us will be returning to this place! It was is so overrated. We are headed back to RANDY'S here in Scottsdale to do our next family breakfast.

BwNzEuuZGLPZhUNpw6DugA.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  Moms all over the country for years have woken up to make the meal that breaks the fast of a long nights sleep.  But after a certain age, people forget about breakfast at home and look to other venues to start their day.  A good breakfast place is hard to find.  For the most part, restaurants set a up a line that is too quick to think about quality, and only thinks only of the amount of tables that they can serve, and though that is important, the flavor and prep of the food should not suffer in the process.  The find a restaurant that can do both is rare.  The Breakfast Club is located on Scottsdale Road and Stetson Dr puts forth a valiant effort to bring back quality to an extremely busy establishment.  I've driven by before, and the line on a Sunday morning is out the door.  Upon entering the restaurant, one would see that there is a coffee bar in the back and seating for up to forty people.  There is seating available outside, but on a cold day, there are fewer people wanting the brave a brisk morning then there are fingers on a hand, but I am one of those people.  The friendly greeting from the hostess helped warm the morning, and I was seated immediately to a corner table outside.  The menu is your atypical breakfast place, with foods ranging from the simplicity of the egg to the flavorful complexity is that is a Belgium Waffle topped with just about anything a good breakfast place would offer.  It was definitely a busy morning and the waitress was running around like an organized chicken with her head cut off.  The greeting was friendly as she took my drink order, coffee, and returned quickly with it.  My palate wanted something rich and my stomach wanted something filling, so we all agreed with a Belgium waffle and a side of sausage patties.  I surfed the Internet thinking that with as busy as they are, I would have time to be nerdy and check my fantasy football team.  Oh, how I was wrong.  A vinaigrette bottle, filled with warm, rich maple syrup was brought to the table, and suddenly the food was promptly delivered.  First I took the butter and smothered it on my waffle.  A bad butter can kill a meal, but if I want to see what type of place this is, then I was going to go for it.  The people at the Breakfast Club must have known this, because the butter was fresh and whipped.  I dug into the waffle.  The rich flavors filled my mouth, and the mixture of butter, syrup and waffle brought a smile to my tongue.  Next I took a bite of the sausage patty.  Think and juicy, it was not too greasy as so many places, and was that perfect blend of fat and pork products.  Enjoying every bite, I fully expect to come back again.  The bill was reasonable, and the food lived up to the slightly more than Denny's total.  I felt like I was pay for quality.  You might not want to serve detention on a Saturday, but if you are looking for a nice breakfast with friends, then the Breakfast Club is the place you want to go.  My only recommendation would be get there early, because it will fill up.  But if you have to wait, the food will sing to just for you, "Don't you forget about me," and you won't.

69Kcrsx4jJoEbnN-SNOyeQ.text: I ate here for the first time on yesterday morning (Memorial Day) while nursing a sweet hangover from having too much fun the day before.  We arrived just a bit after 8, and only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table.  This food was great!   Being from the south I LOVE biscuits and gravy, so I was excited when I saw BC's B&G (Breakfast Club's Biscuits & Gravy) on the menu.  However I was equally as excited about the Oscar Eggs Benedict.  My server made it easy for me to decide when she told me they were out of the crab meat which is used to make the Oscar.  A few delicious cups of coffee later, my B&G arrived, looking delicious with a side of some perfectly ripe fruit and yummy potatoes.  The B&G is actually jalapeno biscuits, which taste almost doughy.  They were good, but different.  Then they are topped with melted fontina, eggs, sausage gravy and some hot sauce.  The only thing I would change is the cheese.  For some reason, the fontina just added an odd taste to an otherwise delicious meal.  I still ate about 3/4 of it, but would definitely request a different type of cheese next time.  My two dining companions each got a different type of omelet and they both enjoyed them.  With its close proximity to my house, I definitely think I will be dining here quite  a bit.

ojF-wVyO48SQZkS1HaTKLg.text: Had brunch with my friend Adriane, an aspiring Olympian here this morning before I finally left Scottsdale, and it was pretty crowded.  Lots of trendy types in here that made me feel like I was eating somewhere in Vegas.  The omlette I had was tasty and filling and I couldn't even finish the potatoes or fruit, and since Adriane paid, the price was right!

4CCRovPY_-Um6A2rJ51ftg.text: We waited over an hour for a table. The hostesses were beyond rude. The food was ok but definitely not worth the wait. Don't waste your time!

gqrSKcuCHznLs6HPbQejrg.text: Breakfast here was so great... I had the jalepeno biscuits with sausage gravy, 2 scrambled eggs, fresh fruit and home fries - soooo good. Add the chipotle hot sauce they bring to the table and it is an absoultely perfect breakfast! We may even go back again before we leave Scottsdale! This is a must for anyone wanting a tasty southwestern breakfast in Scottsdale. Food and service were great - but the creativity and execution of the menu was oustanding.

x6dOLsijIaJXPRH8pGXfNw.text: Excellent food, large portions, and great price. Highly recommended from an out of town first timer.

sDLgZNryBnTwZhZ6RZYA_g.text: Great egg white omlette. Service was awesome. Would have gone for a 5 if they had served the jalapeno cornbread HOT! Super location:)

PiVesDBhkAFVGBEb35KD0w.text: Had a great meal this morning with the family. The service was excellent.
